materials: RED HEART® Boutique Sassy Fabric™: 1 hank 9964 Skull Print
measurements: Scarf measures 4” x 42” (10 x 106.5 cm)
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com
©2014 Coats & Clark
RedHeart.com
Page 1 of 1
Get a little crazy with skulls and create a fashionable ruffled scarf for yourself or a friend. Crochet through the evenly spaced holes in the scalloped fabric strip.
Special Stitches
Ch = insert hook from front to back through next hole, draw top edge through loop on hook.
Slip st = insert hook in front loop of indicated chain or stitch and in next hole, draw top edge through chain or stitch and loop on hook.
Notes 
1. Work into the holes at the top edge of the fabric strip. Always insert hook in hole from front to back of fabric.
2. If you prefer to work from the center of the hank rather than the outer edge, slide the paper band to one end, remove the cardboard, and gently pull out the fabric.
3. Prepare the fabric for stitching by trimming the cut edge in a curve. Begin cutting at the top edge before the first hole and end at the bottom edge below the 2nd hole.
4. Always turn piece clockwise so that working fabric is behind stitches just made.
SCARF
Fold fabric so first hole is placed over 2nd hole, insert hook in hole through both thicknesses, insert hook in next hole and draw top edge through loop on hook (slip knot made), ch 4.
Row 1: Turn, working in front loops only, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—3 slip sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, working in front loops only, slip st in each st, turn.
Repeat Row 2 until at least 5 (but no more than 8) holes remain.
Place last stitch on locking stitch marker or safety pin so stitch doesn’t unravel as you prepare fabric for last row. Trim fabric so that only 5 holes remain. Cutting from outer edge, trim fabric to ¼” (6.4 mm) under last 2 holes, then continue cutting on a curve ending at the bottom edge under the 3rd hole. Remove stitch holder and place loop back on hook.
Last Row: Ch 1, working in front loops only, slip st in each st; insert hook in last hole and pull end tail through loop on hook. Tighten end tail until knot forms.
FINISHING
Weave in end.
RHC0125-018701M | LAST UPDATED: AUGUST 1, 2019

materials: RED HEART® “SUPER SAVER®”: 1 skein each 0512 Turqua A and 0886 Blue B.
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B, etc
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Scarf is 5” x 55”.
gauge: Motif = 5” across. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCARF
Motif 1 (Make 6-Color Sequence A, B)
With A, ch 4; join with a slip st into ring.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as 1st dc), 2 dc in ring, ch 2, [3 dc in ring, ch 2] 3 times; join – 12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same st and in next 2 sts, (sc, ch 3, sc) all in same corner ch-2 space, * sc in next 3 sts, (sc, ch 3, sc) all in next corner space; repeat from * around; join – 5 sc each side.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in same st, ch 3, skip next st, sc in next st, ch 3, (sc, ch 4, sc) all in next corner space, * ch 3, [skip next st, sc in next st, ch 3] 2 times; (sc, ch 4, sc) all in next corner; repeat from * around; hdc in 1st st to join and form last space, fasten off – 3 ch-3 spaces each side.
Round 4: Attach B in same space, ch 1, sc in same space, [ch 3, * sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3; repeat from * to corner; (sc, ch 4, sc) all in corner] 4 times; join with a hdc – 4 ch-3 spaces each side.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in same space, [ch 3, * sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3; repeat from * to corner; (sc, ch 4, sc) all in corner] 4 times; join with a hdc – 5 ch-3 spaces each side.
Round 6: Ch 1, (sc, ch 2, sc) all in same space, [ch 1, * (sc, ch 2, sc) all in next ch-3 space, ch 1; repeat from * to corner, (sc, ch 4, sc) all in corner] 4 times; ch 1; join with a slip st – 5 ch-2 spaces each side. Fasten off.
Motif 2 (Make 5-Color Sequence B, A)
With B, work as for Motif 1 through Round 3. Change to A, then continue working as for Motif 1 through Round 5.
Joining Round 6: Ch 1, (sc, ch 2, sc) all in same space, [ch 1, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-3 space] 4 times; ch 1, in corner, sc, ch 2, drop loop from hook, draw loop through corresponding corner of finished square, replace loop on hook, ch 2, sc) all in corner – connected corner made; * ch 1, (sc, ch 1, drop loop, draw loop through corresponding ch-2 space, replace loop, ch 1, sc) all in next ch-3 space; repeat from * to next corner, ch 1, connected corner in next corner, [ch 1, * (sc, ch 2, sc), ch 1; repeat from * to next corner, (sc, ch 4, sc) all in corner] 2 times; ch 1; join – 1 side joined. Fasten off.
For remaining Motifs, repeat directions for Motif 2, reversing colors as needed. Work a total of 11 Motifs, 6 in Color Sequence [A, B], 5 in Color Sequence [B, A].
Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m) Flamingo (0259) 2 balls
Size U.S. H/8 [5 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
measurements: Approx 7 x 90" [18 x 228 cm] excluding fringe.
gauge: 12 sts and 6 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Pat.
instructions:
Notes: Ch 3 at beg of row does not count as st.
SCARF
Ch 30.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 1 dc). 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. *Skip next 2 ch. 1 dc in next ch. Ch 3. 3 dcfp around post of dc just worked. Skip next 2 ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch] 3 times. Turn. 24 dc.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of first 3 sts. *Ch 2. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 2. Skip next 3 dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 12 dc, 3 sc, and 6 ch-2 sps.
3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of first 3 dc. *Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next sc. Ch 3. 3 dcfp around post of dc just worked. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows until work from beg measures approx 90" [228.5 cm], ending after a 2nd row. Fasten off.
Fringe: Cut lengths of yarn 12" [30.5 cm] long. Taking 3 strands tog, fold in half and knot into fringe around each end of Scarf as shown in photo.
Trim fringe evenly.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver: 1 skein each 312 Black A, 356 Amethyst B, 672 Spring Green C and 254 Pumpkin D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5 mm [US I-9]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Scarf measures 6” (15 cm) x 62” (157.5 cm). Beanie measures 20” (50.8 cm) in circumference for small and 22” (55.9 cm) in circumference for large.
gauge: 20 sts = 6” [15 cm]; 10 = rows 6” [15 cm] in pattern st. CHECK YOUR GAUGE.
instructions:
SCARF
Row 1: With A, Fdc 20 sts.
Row 2: Ch 3, turn, dc in same st, [skip next st, V-st in next st, skip next st, dc in next 2 sts] 3 times, skip next st, V-st in next st, skip next st, 2 dc in last st.
Row 3: Change to B, ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), turn, dc in same st, V-st in ch-1 space of next V-st, dc in next 2 dc, Spike V-st in base of next V-st, dc in next 2 dc, V-st in ch-1 space of next V-st, dc in next 2 dc, Spike V-st in base of next V-st, 2 dc in last st.
Row 4: Ch 3, turn, dc in same st, [V-st in ch-1 space of next V-st or Spike V-st, dc in next 2 dc] 3 times, V-st in ch-1 space of last V-st or Spike V-st, 2 dc in last st.
Row 5: Change to C, 3, turn, dc in same st, Spike V-st in base of next V-st, dc in next 2 dc, V-st in ch-1 space of next V-st, dc in next 2 dc, Spike V-st in base of next V-st, dc in next 2 dc, V-st in ch-1 space of next V-st, 2 dc in last st.
Row 6: Repeat Row 4.
Keeping in Stripe Sequence, repeat Rows 3-6 until Scarf measures 62” [157 cm] from beginning, end with second row of color in Stripe Sequence.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.
BEANIE
With A, make an adjustable loop ring.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), 11 dc in ring, slip st in top of beginning ch-3 to join – 12 dc. Tighten beginning loop.
Round 2: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch-1 here and throughout), dc in same st for first V-st, V-st in each st around, slip st to 3rd ch of beginning ch-4 – 12 V-sts.
Round 3: Slip st to first ch-1 space, change to B, ch 4, dc in same st, [dc in second dc of V-st of previous row, Spike V-st in base of next V-st, dc in second dc of V-st of previous row, V-st in ch-1 space of next V-st] 5 times, dc in second dc of V-st of previous row, Spike V-st in base of next V-st, dc in second dc of V-st of previous row, slip st to 3rd ch of beginning ch-4 – 6 V-sts, 6 Spike V-sts and 12 dc.
For Small Only
Round 4: Slip st to first ch-1 space, ch 4, dc in same st, [dc in next dc, V-st in ch-1 space of next V-st, dc in second dc of V-st of previous row, dc in next dc, V-st in ch-1 space of next V-st] 5 times, dc in next dc, V-st in ch-1 space of next V-st, dc in second dc of V-st of previous row, dc in next dc, slip st to 3rd ch of beginning ch-4 – 12 V-sts and 18 dc.
For Large Only
Round 4: Slip st to first ch-1 space, ch 4, dc in same st, [dc in second dc of V-st of previous row, dc in next dc, V-st in ch-1 space of next V-st] 11 times, dc in second dc of V-st of previous row, dc in next dc, slip st to 3rd ch of beginning ch-4 – 12 V-sts and 24 dc.
For Both Sizes
Round 5: Slip st to first ch-1 space, change to C, ch 4, dc in same st, [dc in next 1 (2) dc, Spike V-st in base of next V-st, dc in next 2 dc, V-st in ch-1 space of next V-st] 5 times, dc in next 1 (2) dc, Spike V-st in base of next V-st, dc in next 2 dc, slip st to 3rd ch of beginning ch-4 – 6 V-sts, 6 Spike V-sts and 18 (24) dc.
Round 6: Slip st to first ch-1 space, ch 4, dc in same st, [dc in next 1 (2) dc, V-st in ch-1 space of next Spike V-st, dc in next 2 dc, V-st in ch-1 space of next V-st] 5 times, dc in next 1 (2) dc, V-st in ch-1 space of next Spike V-st, dc in next 2 dc, slip st to 3rd ch of beginning ch-4 – 12 V-sts and 18 (24) dc.
Round 7: Change to D and repeat Round 5.
Round 8: Repeat Round 6.
Rounds 9-13: Keeping in Stripe Sequence, repeat Rounds 5-6 twice more, then Round 5 once.
Rounds 14-15: Using last color, sc in each dc and ch-1 space around, slip st to first st to join.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Patons® Metallic™ (3 oz/85 g; 252 yds/230 m) Metallic Green (95244) 3 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 8" x 61" [20.5 x 155 cm].
gauge: 13 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 6.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 
1 dc in each of next 2 ch. Turn – 1 block 
made.
2nd row: Ch 6. 1 dc in 4th ch from hook.  
1 dc in each of next 2 ch – beg block made. 
(Sl st. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp – block 
made. Turn – 2 blocks.
3rd row: Beg block. (Block in next ch-3 
sp) twice. Turn – 3 blocks.
4th row: Beg block. (Block in next ch-3 
sp) 3 times. Turn – 4 blocks.
5th row: Beg block. (Block in next ch-3 
sp) 4 times. Turn – 5 blocks.
6th row: Beg block. (Block in next ch-3 
sp) 5 times. Turn – 6 blocks.
7th row: Beg block. (Block in next ch-3 
sp) 6 times. Turn – 7 blocks.
Cont in this manner, inc 1 block each 
row until there are 12 blocks (12 rows are 
complete).
Work sides even as follows:
1st row: (RS). Beg block. (Block in next 
ch-3 sp) 11 times. Sl st in last ch-3 sp (do 
not make a block). Turn – 12 blocks.
2nd row: Sl st in each of first 3 dc and 
next ch-3 sp. Block in same ch-3 sp as last 
sl st. (Block in next ch-3 sp) 11 times. Turn 
– 12 blocks.
Rep last 2 rows until work from straight 
lower edge measures 61" [155 cm], 
ending on a WS row.
Beg decreasing each side as follows:
1st row: (RS). Sl st in each of first 3 dc and 
next ch-3 sp. Block in same ch-3 sp as last 
sl st. *Block in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to 
last ch-3 sp. Sl st in last ch-3 sp (do not 
make a block). Turn.
Rep last row until 1 block remains. Fasten 
off.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (Solids: 6 oz/170 g; 315 yds/288 m; Heathers: 5 oz/141.7 g; 250 yds/228 m)
Contrast A Dk Country Blue (9711) 1 ball
Contrast C Lt Country Blue (9709) 1 ball
Contrast D Lt Country Peach (9737) 1 ball
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: When working from chart, carry yarn not in use loosely across top of work. Work next row over strand of yarn which is not in use.
Scarf
Ribbing: With A, ch 8.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 7 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work, without stretching, from beg measures 8" [20.56 cm]. Do not fasten oﬀ.
Set-up row: Work 24 sc across longer side of ribbing. Turn.
Beg working Chart, (see page 2) noting 8-st rep will be worked 3 times, reading RS rows from right to left and WS rows from left to right.
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
Rep last row, and cont working Chart I until 42nd row of Chart is complete.
Break all colors but E.
With E only, proceed as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last row for pat until work from beg measures approx 51" [129.5 cm], ending on a RS row of pat.
Next row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 24 sc.
Beg working Chart in reverse, beg with 42nd row, until 1st row of Chart is complete, reading RS rows from right to left and WS rows from left to right.
Break all colors but A.
Ribbing: With A, ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 6 ch. Skip next sc of last row of Scarf. Sl st in next sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Skip next sc of last row of Scarf. Sl st in next sc. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows for ribbing across short end of Scarf, ending on 3rd row. Fasten oﬀ.

materials: Bernat® Satin™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 200 yds/182 m) Crimson (04705)  3 balls
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 7 x 65" [18 x 165 cm].
gauge: 13 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of row counts as ddc throughout. Ch 26.
Foundation row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 25 sc.
Next row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Proceed in Heart Pat as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 12 dc. Ch 1. Miss next dc. 1 sc in each of last 12 dc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 11 sc. Ch 1. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of last 12 sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 10 dc. Ch 1. Miss next dc. 1 sc in next dc. [(Yoh) twice and draw up a loop in front loop of ch-1 sp 2 rows below. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice] 5 times. Yoh and draw through all 6 loops on hook – bobble made. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 1. Miss next dc. 1 sc in each of last 10 dc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 9 sc. Ch 1. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Ch 1. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of last 10 sc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 8 dc. Ch 1. Miss next dc. 1 sc in next dc. Bobble in front loop of next ch-1 sp of 3rd row. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. Bobble in front loop of next ch-1 sp of 3rd row. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 1. Miss next dc. 1 sc in each of last 8 dc. Turn.
6th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 7 sc. Ch 1. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 7 sts. Ch 1. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of last 8 sc. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 dc. Ch 1. Miss next dc. 1 sc in next dc. Bobble in front loop of next ch-1 sp of 5th row. 1 sc in each of next 7 dc. Bobble in front loop of next ch-1 sp of 5th row. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 1. Miss next dc. 1 sc in each of last 6 dc. Turn.
8th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 5 sc. Ch 1. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 11 sts. Ch 1. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of last 6 sc. Turn.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 dc. Ch 1. Miss next dc. 1 sc in next dc. Bobble in front loop of next ch-1 sp of 7th row. 1 sc in each of next 11 dc. Bobble in front loop of next ch-1 sp of 7th row. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 1. Miss next dc. 1 sc in each of last 4 dc. Turn.
10th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 sc. Ch 1. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 15 sts. Ch 1. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of last 4 sc. Turn.
11th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. Ch 1. Miss next dc. 1 sc in next dc. Bobble in front loop of next ch-1 sp of 9th row. 1 sc in each of next 7 dc. Ch 1. Miss next dc. 1 sc in each of next 7 dc. Bobble in front loop of next ch-1 sp of 9th row. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 1. Miss next dc. 1 sc in each of last 2 dc. Turn.
12th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in next sc. (Ch 1. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 9 sts) twice. Ch 1. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
13th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. (Bobble in front loop of next ch-1 sp of 11th row. Ch 1. Miss next dc. 1 sc in each of next 7 dc. Ch 1. Miss next dc) twice. Bobble in front loop of next ch-1 sp of 11th row. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. Turn.
14th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. (Ch 1. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. Ch 1. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next sc) twice. 1 dc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
15th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. (Bobble in front loop of next ch-1 sp of 13th row. Ch 1. Miss next dc. 1 sc in each of next 5 dc. Ch 1. Miss next dc. Bobble in front loop of next ch-1 sp of 13th row. 1 sc in next dc) twice. 1 sc in each of last 2 dc. Turn.
16th row: Ch 3. (1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Ch 1. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Ch 1. Miss next ch-1 sp) twice. 1 dc in each of last 4 sts. Turn.
17th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 dc. *Bobble in front loop of next ch-1 sp of 15th row. (1 sc in next dc. Ch 1. Miss next dc) twice. 1 sc in next dc. Bobble in front loop of next ch-1 sp of 15th row. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * once more. 1 sc in last dc. Turn.
18th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 5 sts. *Ch 1. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next sc. Ch 1. Miss next ch-1 sp.* 1 dc in each of next 7 sts. Rep from * to * once more. 1 dc in each of last 6 sts. Turn.
19th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 dc. *Bobble in front loop of next ch-1 sp of 17th row. 1 sc in next dc. Bobble in front loop of next ch-1 sp of 17th row.* 1 sc in each of next 7 dc. Rep from * to * once more. 1 sc in each of last 6 dc. Turn.
20th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
21st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
22nd row: As 20th row. Rep 1st to 22nd rows for Heart Pat until Scarf measures approx 65" [165 cm], ending with 21st row. Fasten off.

materials: 3 balls of RED HEART® Boutique™ “Big & Lite™” in Rust
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 8” x 75”.
gauge: 1 semi-circular motif = 6” across. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Ch 11, join with slip st to form a ring. 
Row 1: Ch 3, 11 dc in ring; turn.
Row 2: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1), skip 1 dc, dc in next dc, [ch 1, skip 1 dc, dc in next dc] 4 times; turn.
Row 3: [Ch 4, sc in next ch-space] 5 times**, ch 5, sc into initial ring; turn.
Row 4: Ch 2, 11 dc in ch-5 space from previous round; turn—11 dc. 
Row 5: Repeat row 2.
Round 6: Repeat row 3, working last sc into the ch-5 space of preceding motif. 
Repeat rows 4-6 for pattern, until piece measures about 75”, ending at **. 
Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Heat Wave™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 198 yds/181 m) Contrast A Passport (0410) 4 balls
Red Heart® Heat Wave Prints™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 164 yds/150 m) Contrast B Wild Bloom (9755) 3 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: MB = (Make Bobble). Work 5 dc in next stitch. Drop loop from hook. Re-insert hook into first of 5 dc and draw dropped loop through
measurements: Approx 8½" x 61" [21.5 x 155 cm] excluding fringe.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.
• To join new color, work to last loops on hook of first color. Yoh with new color, draw through loops and proceed with new color.
• Carry color not in use loosely along side of work.
• In rows where both colors are used, carry color when not in use loosely across top of previous row and work sts around it to avoid stranding.
With A, ch 29.
1st row: (WS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 27 hdc.
2nd row: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in first st. With B, MB. *With A, 1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. With B, MB. Rep from * to last st. With A, 1 hdc in last st. Turn.
3rd to 5th rows: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.

6th row: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. With B, MB. *With A, 1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
7th to 9th rows: As 3rd to 5th rows.
Rep 2nd to 9th rows for pat until work from beg measures approx 60” [152.5 cm], ending on a 3rd row. Fasten off.

Edging: With RS facing, join A with sl st to top left corner. Ch 1. Work 1 row of sc along side of Scarf. Rep for other side.

Fringe: Cut strands of B 14" [35.5 cm] long. Taking 4 strands tog fold in half and knot into fringe across ends of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Bernat® Softee Cotton™ (4.2 oz/120 g; 254 yds/232 m) Fuchsia (69023)  1 ball or 125 yds/114 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops.
measurements: Approx 23" [58.5 cm] long x 3" [7.5 cm] wide.
gauge: 20 sts and 21 rows = 4" [10 cm] in sc/ch-1 (Moss st) pat.
instructions:
Ch 2. (See Diagram on page 2).
1st row: (RS). 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 3 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 4 sts - 3 sc and 1 ch-1 sp.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 5 sts – 4 sc and 1 ch-1 sp.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. 6 sts – 4 sc and 2 ch-1 sps.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Turn.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 7 sts – 5 sc and 2 ch-1 sps.
10th row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
11th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp and sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 8 sts – 5 sc and 3 ch-1 sps.
12th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
13th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 9 sts – 6 sc and 3 ch-1 sps.
14th row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 4 rows twice more, inc 1 st at end of every RS row. 13 sts at end of last row. Place marker on last row on RS of work.
Work even in Moss St Pat as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp and sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for Moss St Pat until work from marked row measures 18" [45.5 cm], ending on a WS.
Beg Dec’s:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 12 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Sc2tog. Turn. 11 sts.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 4 rows 3 times more to 5 sts, then rep 1st and 2nd rows once more. 4 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Sc2tog. Turn. 3 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn.
Next row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Sc2tog. Turn. 2 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Fasten off.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 3 skeins of 3975 Tourmaline
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses in same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Scarf measures 10.5” [26.5 cm] wide by 90” [228.5 cm] long.
gauge: 24 sts (2 ripples) = 7" (18 cm); 5 rows = 4” (10cm)
instructions:
Ch 37
Row 1 (right side): Sc in second ch from hook and ea ch across. Turn- 36 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, work in back loops only, sc in ea sc across. Turn.
Row 3: Ch 3 (counts as dc throughout), work in back loops only, dc in first st, *dc in next 3 sts [dc2tog in next 2 sts] twice, dc in next 3 sts**, 2 dc in next 2 sts; rep from * across ending at **, 2 dc in last st. Turn—3 ripples made.
Repeat row 3 until piece measures 89” [226cm].
Last 2 rows: Ch 1, work in back loops only, sc in ea st across. Turn. Fasten off
FINISHING
Weave in all ends.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Chunky (Solids: 100 g/3.5 oz; 99 m/108 yds; Ombres: 80 g/2.8 oz; 70 m/77 yds)
Size 9 mm (U.S. M or 13) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 6" x 75" [15 cm x 190.5 cm].
gauge: 7 sc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Scarf is worked lengthwise.
Ch 133. Mark every 30th ch for easier counting.
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch across. Turn.
131 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). *Work 1 hdc in horizontal bar created between stitches of previous row (bar is below loops normally worked). Rep from * across. Turn.
131 hdc.
Rep 2nd row until Scarf measures 6" [15 cm]. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Midnight®: 2 skeins of 1951 Tropical.
abbreviations: () = work directions in parentheses into same st
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Scarf Measures 5½” (14 cm) wide x 58” (147.5 cm) long
gauge: 14 sts and 9 rows in pattern = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Chain 201.
Row 1: Working in back bump of ch sts, hdc in 2nd ch from hook and in each of next 198 ch, hdc2tog in last ch, turn—200 sts.
Rows 2-12: Ch 3 (does not count as a st), hdc in first hdc2tog, hdc in back loop only of next 198 hdc, hdc2tog in both loops of last hdc, turn. 
Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Hygge™: 2 balls 8340 Sterling A and 1 ball each 8631 Aloe B and 8568 Slate Blue C
abbreviations: A, B, C = A, B, C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses in same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 8" x 70" (15 x 178 cm).
gauge: 10 hdc = 4" (10 cm); 7 rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With A, ch 20.
Row 1: Hdc in 3rd ch from hook (beginning skipped ch count as first hdc) and in each ch across, turn—19 hdc.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), working in back loops only, hdc in each hdc across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 2, working in front loops only, hdc in each hdc across, turn.
Rows 4–13: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 five times; change to B at end of Row 13.
Row 14: Ch 4 (counts as first dc and ch 1 here and throughout), skip next hdc, dc in next hdc, *ch 1, skip next hdc, dc in next hdc; repeat from * across, turn—10 dc and 9 ch-1 spaces.
Row 15: Ch 4, skip first ch-1 space, dc in next dc, *[dc in next ch-1 space, dc in next dc] 3 times, ch 1, skip next ch-1 space, dc in next dc; repeat from * across, working last dc in 3rd ch of beginning ch, turn—16 dc and 3 ch-1 spaces.
Rows 16 and 17: Ch 4, skip first ch-1 space, *dc in next 7 dc, ch 1, skip next ch-1 space; repeat from * across, dc in 3rd ch of beginning ch, turn.
Row 18: Ch 4, skip first ch-1 space, dc in next dc, *[ch 1, skip next dc, dc in next dc] 3 times, ch 1, skip next ch-1 space, dc in next dc; repeat from * across, working last dc in 3rd ch of beginning ch, turn—10 dc and 9 ch-1 spaces.
Rows 19–22: Repeat Rows 15–18; change to A at end of Row 22.
Row 23: Ch 2, hdc in each dc and ch-1 space across, turn—19 hdc.
Rows 24–35: Repeat Rows 2–13; change to C1 at end of Row 34.
Row 36: Repeat Row 14.
Row 37: Ch 4, skip first ch-1 space, shell in next ch-1 space, *skip next ch-1 space, shell in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across, ch 1, skip last ch-1 space, dc in 3rd ch of beginning ch, turn—4 shells, 2 dc, and 2 ch-1 spaces.
Rows 38–42: Ch 4, shell in ch-1 space of each shell, ch 1, dc in 3rd ch of beginning ch, turn.
Row 43: Ch 4, (dc in first dc, ch 1, dc in 3rd dc) of first shell, (ch 1, dc in first dc, ch 1, dc in 3rd dc) of each remaining shell, ch 1, dc in 3rd ch of beginning ch; change to A, turn—10 dc and 9 ch-1 spaces.
Row 44: Repeat Row 23.
Rows 45–87: Repeat Rows 2–44.
Rows 88–99: Rows 2–13.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Team Spirit™: 3 skeins 988 Red/Grey
measurements: Scarf measures 10” x 69” (25.5 x 175.3 cm), without fringe.
instructions:
Finishing
Fringe
Use both colors to make fringe. Cut 80 strands of first color and 90 strands of second color, each 10” (25.5 cm) long.
Beginning with second color, attach fringe as follows in first corner st: hold 5 strands together and fold in half. With Wrong Side facing, insert hook through first corner st on short edge of scarf and draw folded ended of strands through to form loop. Thread ends of strands through loop and pull ends to tighten. Continue attaching fringe in each ch-1 space and in opposite corner st across alternating 2 sections of second color and 2 sections of first color, ending with second color. Trim strands to even all fringe.
NOTE
Scarf is worked with one yarn. Color changes should occur at the end of row after 6 rows have been worked. But if you are off a bit, your scarf will still look fine.  
SCARF
With first color, ch 33.
Row 1: Ch 1, turn, sc in 2nd ch from hook, *skip next ch, ch 1, sc in next ch; repeat from * across to last ch, sc in last ch – 17 sc and 15 ch-1 spaces. Fasten off first color.
Cut yarn to remove current section of first color.
Row 2: Leaving 4” (10 cm) tail, join second color with slip st in first sc, ch 1, sc in first sc, *skip next sc, ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across to last st, sc in last st.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in first sc, *skip next sc, ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across to last st, sc in last st.
Repeat Row 3 for 35 stripes each 6 rows wide, ending with a stripe of second color.
Next Row: Repeat Row 3 with first color. Do not fasten off.
EDGING
Row 1: Rotate scarf to work across long edge, ch 1, sc in each row edge across, ch 1, slip st in first ch of foundation ch. Fasten off.
Repeat Row 1 for second long edge.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique™ Magical™: 1 Ball each 1101 Crystal Ball A and 1406 Hocus Pocus B.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Scarf measures 58” long.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions: With 1 strand of A and B held together, chain 10. Row 1: Single crochet in first chain to form a loop, [chain 10, single crochet in single crochet] 78 times – 79 loops. Fasten off. FINISHING: Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver Ombre™: 1 skein 3964 Anthracite
measurements: Scarf measures 7” (18 cm) wide and 72” (183 cm) long, excluding fringe.
gauge: 13 sts = 4” (10 cm); 9 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
SCARF
Ch 24.
Row 1: Hdc in 3rd ch from hook and in each ch across – 22 hdc.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), skip 1st hdc, hdc in each st across, turn.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 72” (183 cm) from beginning edge.
Fasten off.
FINISHING 
With yarn needle, weave in all loose ends.
Fringe
Cut ninety 10” (25.5 cm) lengths of yarn. Divide into 18 groups of 5 strands each.
Use waste yarn to mark the position where each fringe group should be attached to the scarf, spacing the fringe groups evenly along the short ends of the scarf.
To attach the fringe at each marked position, fold a fringe group in half to form a loop. Draw the center of a fringe group through the end of the scarf, using the crochet hook if desired. Thread fringe tails through the loop and tighten to secure. Repeat for each group of fringe.
Trim fringe ends evenly.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® Ombres™ (4 oz/113 g; 204 yds/186 m) Rosewood (08434) 2 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 30.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch. *Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 10 ch-3 sps.
2nd row: Ch 1. *(1 sc. Ch 3. 1 sc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until Scarf measures 64" [152.5 cm]. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Wavelength™ (5 oz/140 g; 223 yds/204 m)
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
5" [12.5 cm] wide piece of cardboard for tassels.
measurements: Approx 24" [61] wide x 72" [182.5 cm] long, excluding tassels.
gauge: 9 sc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
With A, ch 6. See diagram on page 2.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each of last 2 ch. Turn. 1 block made.
2nd row: Ch 6. 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch – beg block made. (Sl st. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp – block made. Turn. 2 blocks.
3rd row: Beg block. *Block in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 3 blocks.
Rep last row until side measures 24" [61 cm], ending on a WS row. Proceed as follows:
1st row: (RS). Beg block. *Block in next ch-3 sp. Sl st in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to last ch-3 sp. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: (RS). Sl st in each of first 3 dc. *Block in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to end of row.
Rep last 2 rows until work from beg along longer side measures 32" [81.5 cm], ending on a WS row. Join B. Fasten off A.
With B, rep last 2 rows until work from beg along longer side measures 64" [162.5 cm], ending on a WS row. Join C. Fasten off B.
With C, rep last 2 rows until work from beg along longer side measures 72" [182.5 cm], ending on a WS row.
Proceed as follows:
1st row: (RS). Sl st in each of first 3 dc. *Block in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to last ch-3 sp. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Rep last row until 1 block rem. Fasten off.
Tassels (make 4 each with A, B and C). Wrap yarn around a 5" [12.5 cm] piece of cardboard 10 times. Tie securely at one end. Cut across other end. Wrap yarn 6 times around tassel 1½" [4 cm] from tied end and fasten securely. Attach Tassels across one side of Shawl alternating colors and 5" [12.5 cm] apart.

abbreviations: Lch (Long Chain): Pull up a loop to height of next st.
sc2tog: [Draw up a loop in next st] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 11" [28 cm] wide x 92" [234 cm] long.
gauge: 16 sc = 4" [10 cm]; 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Foundation Row: Ch 60, Lch (does not count as a st here and throughout), (dc, sc) in first ch, dc in next ch, *sc in next ch, dc in next ch; repeat from * to last 2 ch, sc2tog in last 2 ch – 60 sts.
Row 1: Lch, turn, skip first st, *dc in next dc, sc in next sc; repeat from * to last st, (dc, sc) in last dc.
Row 2: Lch, (dc, sc) in first sc, *dc in next dc, sc in next sc; repeat from * to last 2 sts, sc2tog over last 2 sts.
Repeat Rows 1-2 until Scarf measures 92" [234 cm] along one long edge. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Simply SoftTM (Ombres: 4 oz/113 g; 204 yds/186 m; Solids: 6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Main Color (MC) Grape Purple (08315), Teal Zeal (08701), Cafe Latte Brown (08012) or Saturday Blue Jeans (08114)
Contrast A Fuchsia (39764), Chartreuse (39771), Soft Pink (39719) or White (39701)
Scarf and Headband: Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Fingerless Gloves: Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge. 4 buttons.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Scarf: Approx 7 x 60” [18 x 152.5 cm]. Headband and Fingerless Gloves: One size to fit average woman.
gauge: Scarf and Headband: 13 dc and 7 rows = 4” [10 cm] with U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook. Fingerless Gloves: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4” [10 cm] with U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook.
instructions:
SCARF
See Diagram 1 on page 3. With MC and size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) hook, ch 32.
Foundation row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Skip next 2 ch. [(1 dc. Ch 2) twice. 1 dc] all in next ch – Shell made. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of ch. Turn.
1st row: Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch 2). 1 dc in first sc. *Skip next dc and ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next dc (top of Shell). Skip next ch 2-sp and dc. Shell in next sc. Rep from * to last Shell. Skip next dc and ch-2 sp. 1 sc in top of next dc. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) all in last sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Shell in next sc. Skip next dc and ch-2 sp. 1 sc in top of next dc. Skip next dc and ch-2 sp. Rep from * to last sc. Shell in next sc. 1 sc in 2nd ch of turning ch 5. Turn.
Last 2 rows form pat.
Cont in pat until work from beg measures 60” [152.5 cm], ending with a RS row.
Fasten off.
HEADBAND
With MC and size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) hook, ch 14.
Work in pat, as given for Scarf until Headband measures 19½” [49.5 cm].
Fasten off. Sew short ends tog.
FLOWERS (make 3).
See Diagram 2 on page 3. With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: 12 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sp as sl st. Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Ch 1. 3 dc in next sc. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Rep from * around, ending with 1 sc in last sc. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
3rd rnd: *Ch 3. Sl st in back loop of next sc, keeping ch to back of work. Rep from * around.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *(1 sc. 5 dc. 1 sc) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to back loop of ch 1.
5th rnd: *Ch 5. Sl st in back loop of next ch 1, keeping ch to back of work. Rep from * around.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *(1 sc. 7 dc. 1 sc) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to back loop of ch 1. Fasten off.
Sew Flowers to Headband and Scarf as shown.
FINGERLESS GLOVES
CUFF
With MC and size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) hook, ch 2.
1st row: (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 3 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 5 sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 7 sts.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last row to 27 sts. (Straight sides measure approx 5” [12.5 cm]).
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Sc2tog over last ch-1 sp and last sc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first sc and next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows twice more.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first sc and next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Ch 1. Sc2tog over last ch-1 sp and last sc. Turn.
Rep last row until 3 sts rem.
Next row: Ch 1. Pull up a loop in first sc, next ch-1 sp and last sc. Yoh and pull through all 4 loops on hook - sc3tog made. Fasten off.
Sew side seam.
Join MC with sl st to top of cuff at side seam.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 21 sc evenly around top of cuff. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd to 4th rnds: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 27 sc at end of 4th rnd.
5th to 11th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.

materials: Caron® Colorama™ O’Go™ (6.4 oz/180 g; 228 yds/208 m)
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 8" [20.5 cm] wide x 74" [188 cm] long, excluding fringe.
gauge: 12 sts and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Notes:
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet. 
• Pull tie to remove. 
• Start crocheting!

SCARF
Ch 24.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of ch. Trun. 23 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for pat until Scarf measures 74 [188 cm]. Fasten off.
Fringe: Cut strands of rem yarn 16" [40.5 cm] long. Taking 3 strands tog, fold in half and knot into fringe evenly spaced across ends of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly.

pattern_name: ONE SKEIN DIAMOND LACE CROCHET SCARF
materials: Red Heart® Croquette™ (1.5 oz/45 g; 239 yds/219 m)
Size U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 6" [15 cm] wide x 78" [98 cm] long.
gauge: 22 dc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc. 
Ch 35. See diagram on page 2.
1st row: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook.  
1 dc in each ch to end of chain. 
Turn.  33 dc.
2nd row:  Ch 3. 1 dc in next st. 
*Ch 3. Skip next 3 sts. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Ch 3. Skip 3 sts. 1 dc in next st. Rep from * to last st. 1 dc in last st. Turn. 15 dc.
3rd row:  Ch 3. 1 dc in next st. 
Ch 2. (1 dc in ch-3 sp. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. 1 dc in ch-3 sp. Ch 5. 
Skip next dc) twice. 1 dc in ch-3 sp. 
1 dc in each of next 3 sts. 1 dc in 
ch-3 sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in each of last 2 sts. Turn. 19 dc.
4th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in next st. *Ch 3. 
Skip next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Ch 3. 1 dc in next ch-5 sp. Rep from * across finishing last rep with 1 dc in each of last 2 sts. Turn. 15 dc.
5th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in next st. *1 dc in ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next st. Ch 3. 1 dc in next ch-3 sp. 
1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last st. 1 dc in last st. Turn. 15 dc.
6th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. *1 dc in ch-3 sp. Ch 5. Skip next dc. 1 dc in ch-3 sp. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * across. 
Turn. 18 dc.
7th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. *Ch 3. 1 dc in ch-5 sp. Ch 3. Skip next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts.  Rep from * across. Turn. 15 dc.
8th row: Ch 3. 1dc in next st. *Ch 3. 
1 dc in ch-3 sp. 1 dc in next st. 1 dc 
in ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Skip next dc. 1 dc 
in next dc. Rep from * across.1 dc in last st. Turn. 15 dc.
Rep 3rd to 8th rows until work from beg measures approx 77½" [197 cm], ending on an 8th row. 
Next row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each st and ch across. Fasten off. 33 dc.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Cherry Red (0319) 1 (1-1) ball or 22 (45-107) yds/20 (41-98) m
Contrast B Soft White (0316) 1 (1-1) ball or 17 (34-81) yds/16 (31-74) m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only of next stitch
measurements: To fit pet neck circumference measurements: S 10" [25.5 cm], M 15" [38 cm], L 22" [56 cm]
gauge: 12 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions: The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). When only one number is given, it applies to all sizes. For ease in working, circle all number pertaining to your size. Notes: • Neckerchief is worked on the bias. • To join new color, work to last loops on hook of previous color. Yoh with new color, draw through rem loops and proceed with new color. • Carry color not in use loosely across top edge of work. • Customize Neckerchief fit by working until Top Edge is appropriate length to fit around pet’s neck circumference. • Ties are added in finishing for securing Neckerchief in place. Stripe Pat: With A, work 2 rows. With B, work 2 rows. These 4 rows form Stripe Pat. NECKERCHIEF: With A, ch 2. 1st row: (RS). 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each of first 2 sc. 2 scbl in last sc. Join B. Turn. 4 sc. 3rd row: With B, ch 1. 2 scbl in first sc. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn. 5 sc. 4th row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to last sc. 2 scbl in last sc. Join A. Turn. 6 sc. First 4 rows of Stripe Pat are complete. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep 3rd and 4th rows, inc 1 st each row, until Top Edge (edge where color not in use is carried across) measures approx 10 (15-22)" [25.5 (38-36) cm] or desired length, ending on a WS row. Fasten off. FINISHING: Ties: 1st row: With A, ch 20 (Tie). *With RS facing, and working along Top Edge of Neckerchief, work sc evenly across, working sts around sides of sts and strands of yarn that were carried across Top Edge to enclose them. Ch 20 (Tie). Fasten off. Fringe: Cut lengths of both A and B 5" [12.5 cm long]. Taking 2 strands of either A or B, fold in half and knot into fringe at end of corresponding color stripe along first edge of Neckerchief (as shown in photo). Repeat same fringe pattern (alternating A and B strands) as established along first edge, along second side edge of Neckerchief (as shown in photo). If desired, steam fringe lightly to relax yarn until fringe hangs freely. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball each of Wheat A, Light Grey B, Heather C
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 43" (109 cm) across top edge x 11¼" (28.5 cm) long.
gauge: 9 dc = 3" (7.5 cm); 6 rows = 3¼" (8.5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCARF 
With A, ch 4. 
Row 1 (right side): Dc in 3rd ch from hook (skipped ch do not count as a st), 2 dc in last ch, turn—3 dc. 
Row 2: Ch 2 (does not count as a st here or throughout), dc in each dc across to last dc, 2 dc in last dc; change to B, turn—4 dc. 
Row 3: Ch 2, 2 dc first dc, dc in each dc across, turn—5 dc. 
Row 4: Repeat Row 2; change to C—6 dc. 
Rows 5–34: Repeat last 2 rows 15 times; change color as in color sequence at end of every even-numbered row—36 dc. 
Rows 35 and 36: Ch 2, dc in each dc across; change to A at end of last row, turn. 
Row 37: Ch 2, dc2tog, dc in each remaining st across, turn—35 dc. 
Row 38: Ch 2, dc in each dc across to last 2 dc, dc2tog; change to B, turn—34 dc. 
Rows 39–68: Repeat last 2 rows 15 times; change color as in color sequence at end of every even-numbered row—4 dc. 
Row 69: Repeat Row 37—3 dc. Fasten off.

Edging 
Place marker at beginning of Row 35. 
Row 1 (right side): With right side facing, join B in opposite side of last foundation ch (below 2 dc), ch 1, sc in same ch; working in ends of rows, work 66 sc evenly spaced across to marked row, 3 sc in marked row, move marker to center st of 3-sc group just made, work 67 sc evenly spaced across, turn—137 sc. 
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across to marked st, 3 sc in marked st, sc in each remaining st, turn—139 sc. 
Row 3: Slip st in first sc, *skip next 2 sc, 5 dc in next sc, skip next 2 sc, slip st in next sc; repeat from * across. Fasten off. 

FINISHING 
Weave in all ends.

pattern_name: Scotch On The Rocks Crochet Plaid Scarf
materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m) Main Color (MC) Grey Heather (0400) 1 ball or 205 yds/188 m
Contrast A Denim (5851) 1 ball or 136 yds/125 m
Contrast B Aran (0313) 1 ball or 132 yds/121 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 7½" [19 cm] wide x 68" [173 cm] long, excluding fringe.
gauge: 15.5 sts and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Note:
Wind balls of the colors to be used, one for each separate area of color in the design. To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed, keeping color change to WS of work.
With A, ch 30. See diagram on page 3.
Foundation row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. (1 sc in next ch. Ch 1. Skip next ch) twice. 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. Ch 1. Skip next ch. (1 sc in next ch. Ch 1 skip next ch) 5 times. 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. (Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch) twice. 1 sc in last ch. Turn. 29 sts. 
Proceed in Plaid Pat as follows:
1st row: (RS). With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. With MC, 1 sc in next sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 6 times. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. With A, 1 sc in next sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
2nd row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) twice. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. With MC, 1 sc in next sc. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) 6 times. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. With A, 1 sc in next sc. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) twice. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd to 6th rows: Rep 1st and 2nd rows twice, joining B in last sc of 6th row.
7th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 6 times. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) twice. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) 6 times. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) twice. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Join A. Turn.
9th to 14th rows: Rep 1st and 2nd rows 3 times, joining MC in last sc of 14th row.
15th row: With MC, Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. With B, 1 sc in next sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 6 times. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. With MC, 1 sc in next sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
16th row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) twice. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. With B, 1 sc in next sc. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) 6 times. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. With MC, 1 sc in next sc. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) twice. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
17th to 20th rows: Rep 15th and 16th rows twice, joining A in last sc of 20th row.
21st row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 6 times. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
22nd row: As 8th row. Join MC in last sc of row.
23rd to 28th rows: As 15th and 16th rows 3 times, join A in last sc of 28th row. 
Rep 1st to 28th rows of Plaid Pat until work from beg measures approx 68” [173 cm], ending on a 14th row of pat. Do not join MC in last sc of very last 14th row rep.
Next row: As 21st row. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Vertical Surface Sl St Lines:
With RS facing, join B with sl st to foundation row aligned with center sc of first A section. Keeping yarn at back (WS) of work, sl st into each ch-1 sp in alternate rows above joining sp to create a straight vertical chain of surface sl sts to end of Scarf, taking care to sl st loosely to avoid buckling work as you stitch. Fasten off. Rep Vertical Surface Sl St Line in 2nd A section. With A, rep Vertical Surface Sl St Line in center of MC section. Fasten off.
Fringe: Cut lengths of MC, A and B 14" [35.5 cm] long. Taking 3 strands tog, match fringe to color in pat at ends of Scarf, having 1 fringe at each Vertical Surface Sl St Line, 2 fringes in each side of A sections, and 3 fringes in each side of MC sections. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Bernat® Forever Fleece™ (9.9 oz/280 g; 177 yds/194 m) - Bergamot (61009) or Coal (61025) - 4 balls or 610 yds/558 m
Size U.S. M/13 (9 mm) Susan Bates® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
8" [20.5 cm] wide piece of cardboard for fringe.
measurements: Approx 11" x 90" [28 x 228.5 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 11 sts and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm] in sc and ch-1 pattern.
instructions:
USING THIS GUIDE
Click on the underlined words throughout the pattern to access our library of helpful tools.

1. Make a slip knot and place on hook.
   Slip Knot: Make a loop with yarn and fold it on itself to make a pretzel shape. Then pull through to make slip knot.

2. Chain (ch) 32.
   Chain: Yarn over hook (Yoh). Pull yarn through loop on hook - Chain made.

3. 1st row: 1 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook.
   Single crochet: Insert hook in 2nd ch from hook and draw up a loop. Yarn over hook (Yoh) and draw through 2 loops on hook - 1 sc made.

4. *Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Repeat (rep) from * to end of chain. Turn. 31 stitches (sts). Count sc and ch-1 spaces as sts. 1st row complete.

5. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 space (sp). *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 2nd row complete.

6. 3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 3rd row complete.

7. Rep 2nd and 3rd rows for pattern (pat) until Scarf measures 90" [228.5 cm]. Fasten off.

Fringe: Wrap yarn around 8" [20.5 cm] piece of cardboard and cut across 1 end as shown to create 16" [40.5 cm] total lengths. Taking 2 strands tog (together), fold in half and knot into fringe evenly across each end of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly.

measurements: Scarf measures 3¼” x 51”.
gauge: 3 rounds = 3¼”, 7 rows in pattern = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE: Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
NOTE: Beginning ch-3 counts as first double crochet. Join round with a slip stitch unless otherwise stated. Do not join or turn round unless otherwise stated. Mark first stitch of each round.
SCARF
Ch 4.
Round 1: 11 dc in 4th ch from hook, slip st in top of beginning ch-4 (12 dc).
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in same st, 2 dc in each of next 11 dc, slip st in top of beginning ch-3 (24 dc).
Round 3: Ch 3, 2 dc in next st, *dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * 11 times, slip st in top of beginning ch-3 (36 dc).
Row 4: Ch 3, dc in next 8 dc, leave remaining sts of circle unworked (9 dc).
Row 5: Ch 3, turn, dc in next 8 dc (9 dc).
Row 6: Ch 3, turn, 2 dc in same dc, 3 dc in each of next 8 dc (27 dc).
Row 7: Ch 3, turn, 2 dc in same dc, 3 dc in each of next 26 dc (81 dc).
Row 8: Ch 1, turn, slip st in next 37 dc, ch 3, dc in next 8 dc, leave remaining 36 dc unworked (9 dc).
Rows 9-72: Repeat Rows 4-8 until piece measures approximately 49”. Finish with a Row 7. Fasten off.
End Circle: Ch 4.
Round 1: 11 dc in 4th ch from hook, slip st in top of beginning ch-4 (12 dc).
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in same st, 2 dc in each of next 11 dc, slip st in top of beginning ch-3 (24 dc).
Round 3: Ch 3, 2 dc in next st, *dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * 11 times, slip st in top of beginning ch-3 (36 dc). Fasten off.
Whipstitch circle onto finished end of scarf between stitches 37 and 46. Weave in ends.

materials: Stitch Nation by Debbie Stoller™, “Full o’ Sheep™”: 2 balls 2529 Mediterranean.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 5” x 63”.
gauge: In pattern, 5 puff sts = 5”; 9 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Chain 21.
Row 1 (Right Side):  2 dc in 2nd ch from hook, *skip next 2 ch, Puff in next ch; repeat from * across to last 3 ch, skip 2 ch, sc in last ch; turn.
Row 2:  Ch 1, 2 dc in first st, * skip 2 dc, Puff in next sc; repeat from * across, skip last 2 dc, sc in turning ch; turn.
Repeat Row 2 for pattern until piece measures 63” or desired length. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Colorama™ O’Go™ (6.4 oz/180 g; 228 yds/208 m)
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 11 x 96" [28 x 244 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 10 dc and 5 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull tie to remove. Before Starting Scarf Reserve Yarn for Fringe: Cut 56 lengths each of Contrast A and Contrast C, 20" [51 cm] long. Set asida for Fringe.
Note: Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc throughout.
SCARF
With Contrast A, ch 50.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in next ch. (Ch 3. Sl st in next ch. Skip next 3 ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch) twice. Skip next 2 ch. Sl st in next ch. Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. Skip next 2 ch. Sl st in next ch. Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. Ch 3. Sl st in next ch. Skip next 3 ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. Ch 3. Sl st in next ch. Skip next 3 ch. (1 dc in each of next 2 ch. Skip next 2 ch. Sl st in next ch. Ch 3) twice. 1 dc in each of last 3 ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. *(Ch 3. Sl st in top of next ch 3 from prev row. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc) twice. (Sl st in top of next ch 3 from prev row. Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc) twice. Rep from * once more. 1 dc in top of next ch 3 from prev row. Turn.
Rep last row until all of A yarn has been used, ending with a complete row and joining Contrast B to last st.
Rep last row until all of Contrast B yarn has been used, ending with a complete row and joining Contrast C to last st.
Rep last row until all of Contrast C yarn has been used, ending with a WS row. Fasten off.
Fringe: Taking 2 strands of reserved lengths of Contrast C tog, knot into fringe into each st at last row of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly.
Taking 2 strands of reserved lengths of Contrast A tog, knot into fringe into each st at foundation chain of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® O’Go™ (Prints: 5 oz/141 g; 236 yds/215 m) Rainbow (7192) 2 O’Gos
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdchb = Work 1 hdc into horizontal bar created below in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked on WS).
measurements: Approx 8" x 68" [20.5 x 198 cm].
gauge: 11 hdc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull tie to remove.
• Start crocheting! 
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as stitch.

Ch 206. (Scarf is worked lengthwise).
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 204 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdchb in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 2½" [6 cm], ending on a WS row.
**Next row: (RS - Keyhole). Ch 2. 1 hdchb in each of first 60 hdc. Ch 12. Skip next 12 hdc. 1 hdchb in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdchb in each hdc to next ch-12 sp. 1 hdc in each of next 12 ch. 1 hdchb in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdchb in each hdc to end of row. Turn.**
Rep last row until work from Keyhole row measures 3" [7.5 cm], ending on a WS row.
Rep from ** to ** once.
Rep last row until work from last Keyhole row measures 2½" [6 cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Roving™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Size U.S. L/11 [8 mm] crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Bobble = Work 5 dc into same stitch or space. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook from front to back into first dc of 5 dc group. Pull dropped loop through st. Ch 1 to secure Bobble.
measurements: Approx 10" x 110" [25.5 x 279.5 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 9 dc and 6 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Bobble Pat.
instructions:
With A, ch 23. (See diagram on page 2).
1st row: (WS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 21 dc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 dc. Bobble in next dc. *1 sc in each of next 3 dc. Bobble in next dc. Rep from * to last 2 dc. 1 sc in each of last 2 dc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows for Bobble Pat until work from beg measures 30" [76 cm], ending on a WS row. Break A.
With B, cont in pat as established until work from beg measures 90" [228.5 cm], ending on a WS row. Break B.
With C, cont in pat as established until work from beg measures 110" [279.5 cm], ending on a WS row. Turn. Do not fasten off.
Edging
1st rnd: (RS). Beg with C, work sc evenly around entire outer edge of Scarf having 3 sc in each corner and matching color changes along side edges. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Fringe
Cut strands of A and C 20" [51 cm] long. Taking 2 strands tog, fold in half and knot into fringe across ends of Scarf, matching fringe to color of each end. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Bernat® Super Value Harvest Colors (197 g / 7 oz) 1 ball each of:
Size 6 mm (U.S. J or 10) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp= Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. - Double crochet around back post made.
Dcfp= Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. - Double crochet around front post made.
measurements: Approx 7 x 60 ins [18 x 152.5 cm] excluding fringe.
gauge: 12 dc and 6½ rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw loop of next color through 2 loops on hook to complete st and proceed in next color. When joining and breaking yarn, leave a 6 ins [15 cm] end to be used for the fringe.

Stripe Pat
Work 2 rows of each color in following sequence: A, B, C, D, E, F, MC. These 14 rows form Stripe Pat.

With A, ch 185.
Foundation row: (WS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 183 dc.
1st row:Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dcbp in each of next 2 sts. *1 dcfp in each of next 3 sts. 1 dcbp in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
2nd row:Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dcfp in each of next 2 sts. *1 dcbp in each of next 3 sts. 1 dcfp in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
First 2 rows of Stripe Pat are complete.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last 2 rows for Rib Pat until Stripe Pat is complete.
Next row: With MC, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each st to end of row.
Fasten off.
Fringe: Cut yarn 12 ins [30.5 cm] long. Take 2 strands of appropriate color tog, fold in half and knot into fringe taking yarn from Stripe Pat into fringe across ends of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver Pooling™: 2 skeins 8302 Carnival Pooling
Extra hooks in neighboring sizes (see notes)
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 7½ x 80" (19 x 203 cm)
gauge: 3 full sc sts per each length of one color in Moss st. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
MOSS STITCH
Ch an even number of sts.
Row 1: Sk 3 ch, sc in next ch, * ch 1, sk 1 foundation ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * to end, turn.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as a stitch now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end finishing with a sc in last ch-3 space, turn.
Row 3: Ch 2 (counts as a stitch now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end finishing with a sc in last ch-2 space, turn.
Repeat Row 3 only for Moss st.
SCARF
Ch through 1 full color sequence, with the last loop on hook being the first loop of a new color just after a color change in the yarn.
Row 1 (right side): Sk 2 ch (counts as a sc), sc in the 4th ch from hook, * ch 1, sc around the foundation ch (instead of going into a ch st); repeat from * until 1 full color sequence has been completed. The number of sc made in each individual color in the sequence should be 3. Leave remaining ch sts unworked. Undo one st repeat (sc, ch 1), turn.
Note: If at this point you are NOT getting 3 sc per color, then redo the row with a different hook size. Getting 3 sc per color with this yarn is essential to making this technique work.
Row 2 (wrong side): Ch 2 (counts as a sc now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end finishing with a sc in last ch-2 space, turn.
Note: As you work this row and all remaining rows, you MUST get the correct number of sc in each color in order to maintain the planned color pooling. Change hook sizes, or actual st used, to get the correct color in place.
Row 3 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as a sc now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in the next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end, finishing with a sc in last ch-2 space, turn.
Note: The color of the sts on this row will shift to the left or right by 1 st from the previous right side row depending on the colorway and if you are right or left handed. It doesn’t matter which direction the stitch shifts as long as it is off-set by 1.
Row 4 (wrong side): Ch 2 (counts as a sc now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in the next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end, finishing with a sc in last ch-2 space, turn.
Note: The color of the sts on this row will shift to the left or right by 1 st from the previous wrong side row depending on the colorway and if you are right or left handed. It doesn’t matter which direction the stitch shifts as long as it is off-set by 1.
Repeat Rows 3 and 4 until Scarf measures 80" (203 cm).
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Squish or stretch the sts on foundation chain to match the width of the rest of the scarf. You can slide the sts around along the foundation chain, as with an adjustable ring. Unravel unused foundation ch sts and weave in yarn tail to secure foundation.
Weave in remaining loose ends.
Fringe
Attach fringes at each ch-1 sp at each short end of Scarf as follows:
Cut 2 strands of yarn, 12" (30.5 cm) each. Fold strands at center. Use hook to pull center of strands through edge st, then pull ends of strands through the resulting loop and pull tight.
Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft (6 oz /170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Contrast D Dark Country Blue (39711) 1 ball
Caron® Simply Soft Speckle (5 oz/141 g; 235 yds/215 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 10” [25.5 cm] wide x 100” [254 cm] long, excluding tassels.
gauge: 13 dc and 7 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rows counts as dc.
Scarf is worked in Chart Pat in 6 Sections. Change colors in each Section as shown below:
Chart Pat
Section 1: A as Color 1; B as Color 2; C as Color 3; D as Color 4; E as Color 5; F as Color 6.
Section 2: B as Color 1; E as Color 2; D as Color 3; A as Color 4; C as Color 5; F as Color 6.
Section 3: E as Color 1; C as Color 2; A as Color 3; B as Color 4; D as Color 5; F as Color 6.
Section 4: C as Color 1; D as Color 2; B as Color 3; E as Color 4; A as Color 5; F as Color 6.
Section 5: D as Color 1; A as Color 2; E as Color 3; C as Color 4; B as Color 5; F as Color 6.
Section 6: Work only 1st to 16th rows of Chart - D as Color 1; C as Color 2; B as Color 3; A as Color 4.
With F, ch 44.
1st row: (RS) 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 42 dc.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row twice more. Break F. Join A.
Proceed in Chart Pat (Section 1), noting that each square of chart is equal to 2 dc, reading RS rows from right to left and WS rows from left to right. Carry color not in use loosely across top of work and work sts around it. Change colors by drawing contrast color through last 2 loops on hook and proceed with new color.
Cont working Chart Pat (all rows are worked in dc) until all 6 Sections of Chart Pat are complete. Break A. Join F.
Next 4 rows: With F, ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off at end of 4th row.
Tassels (make 10 with F) Cut a piece of cardboard 6” [15 cm] wide. Wind yarn around cardboard 60 times. Break yarn leaving a long end and thread end through needle. Slip needle through all loops and tie tightly. Remove cardboard and wind yarn tightly around loops 1” [2.5 cm] below fold. Fasten securely. Cut through rem loops and trim ends evenly. Sew 5 Tassels evenly spaced to each end of Scarf.

materials: Bernat® Fluffee™ (9.8 oz/280 g; 415 yds/380 m)
Contrast A Ocean Depths (11008) 2 balls or 830 yds/760 m
Contrast B Amethyst Awe (11012) 1 ball or 63 yds/57.5 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: Approx 12" [30.5 cm] wide x 100" [254 cm] long, excluding hood.
gauge: 10 hdc and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Ridge Pat.
instructions:
Notes: 
• Hooded Scarf is worked lengthwise into both sides of foundation chain.
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc.
HOODED SCARF
With A, ch 156.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 29 ch. Ch 127. Turn.
2nd row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 124 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 29 sc. 2 hdc in next sc. Working into opposite side of foundation ch, 2 hdc in next ch. 1 hdc in each of next 29 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 125 ch. Turn. 312 hdc.
3rd row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in horizontal bar created below next hdc (below loops normally worked – see diagram). Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep 3rd row for Ridge Pat until width of Scarf measures 11" [28 cm].
Fasten off.
Edging
Join B with sl st at center back of Hooded Scarf. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. Work sc evenly around Hooded Scarf, working 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® satin sparkle (80 g/2.8 oz: 146 m/160 yds)
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 42" [106.5 cm] wide x 19" [48 cm] deep (excluding fringe).
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
note: Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc throughout.
Ch 4.
1st row: 2 dc in 4th ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3. 2 dc in first dc. Ch 1. Miss next dc. 3 dc in top of ch 3. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. 2 dc in first dc. Ch 1. Miss next 2 dc. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next 2 dc. 3 dc in top of ch 3. Turn.
4th row: Ch 3. 2 dc in first dc. Ch 1. Miss next 2 dc. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) twice. Miss next 2 dc. 3 dc in top of ch 3. Turn.
5th row: Ch 3. 2 dc in first dc. Ch 1. Miss next 2 dc. *3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next 3 dc. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next 2 dc. 3 dc in top of ch 3. Turn.
Rep last row until top edge measures approx 42" [106.5 cm] wide.
Fasten off.
Fringe
Cut lengths of yarn 36" [91.5 cm] long. Taking 2 strands tog, fold in half and knot into fringe evenly across 2 shorter sides of Shawl. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: RED HEART® Chic Sheep™: 1 ball each of 5312 Stiletto A, 5640 Platinum B, 5360 Suede C, 5311 Lace D
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses in same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Project measures 7” [18 cm] in width, 60” [152.5 cm] in length.
gauge: 2 shells = 5.5" (14 cm); 11 rows = 7” (18 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Ch 313, with A.
Row 1 (RS):  Dc in 5th ch from hook, *skip 2 ch, v-st in next ch, skip 2 ch, shell in next ch, skip 2 ch, v-st in next ch, skip 2 ch, dc2tog over next 3 ch skipping middle ch; rep from * across, fasten off A. Turn- 22 shells.
Row 2: Join B, ch 3, dc in ch-1 sp of first v-st, *v-st in next ch-1 sp of shell, shell in middle ch-1 sp of same shell, v-st in next ch-1 sp of same shell, dc2tog in ch-1 sp of next 2 v-st (skipping dc2tog); rep from * across ending at **, dc2tog in ch-1 sp of last v-st and last dc, fasten off B. Turn.
Rows 3 – 11: Repeat Row 2 changing colors in the following order: A, C, A, D, A, C, A, B, A.
FINISHING: Weave in all loose ends. Pin to schematic size, spray with water to block. Allow to dry. Cut 4 strands of yarn 14” (35.5 cm) long. Fold yarn in half. Thread loop through end of row, tuck yarn ends through loop. Pull tight to form fringe. Repeat for each row in each color on both sides.

materials: Patons® Cobbles™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 41 yds/37 m) Mustard Seed (85608) 3 balls
Size U.S. P (15 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 8" x 62" [20.5 x 157.5 cm] (excluding fringe).
gauge: 5 sc and 6 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Scarf is worked lengthwise.
Ch 4.
1st row: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. *Ch 3. 
1 dc in base of ch 3 just worked. Rep 
from * until row measures approx 62" 
[157.5 cm]. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 3. 1 sc 
in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * across, 
ending with 1 sc in last ch-3 sp. 1 dc in 
same ch as first dc at beg of 1st row. 
Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. Miss first dc. *(1 sc. Ch 3.
1 dc) in next sc. Rep from * across, 
ending with 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 3. 1 sc
in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * across, 
ending with 1 sc in last ch-3 sp. 1 dc in 
first ch of ch 3. Turn.
5th to 7th rows: Rep 3rd and 4th rows 
once more, then rep 3rd row once. 
Fasten off.
Fringe: Cut 16" [40.5 cm] lengths of 
yarn. Taking 3 strands tog, knot into 
fringe evenly across ends of Scarf. 
Trim fringe evenly.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein each 387 Soft Navy A and 319 Cherry Red B.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Scarf measures 6” wide x 60” long.
gauge: 20 sts = 6”; 8 rows = 4” in stripe pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With A, ch 21.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 20 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across changing to B in last sc; turn. Do not cut A, but carry it across the next row.
Row 3: With B, ch 3, skip first sc, dc in next 3 sc, [sc in next 4 sts, dc in next 4 sts] twice changing to A in last dc; turn. Do not cut B, but carry it across the next row.
Row 4: With A, ch 1, sc in first dc, sc in next 3 dc, [tr in next 4 sc, sc in next 4 dc] twice working last sc in top of ch-3 AND changing to B in last sc; turn. Do not cut A, but carry it across the next row.
Repeat Rows 3 and 4 for stripe pattern until 59½” from beginning, end by working Row 3. Cut B.
Next 2 Rows: With A, ch 1, sc in each st across. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: 1 ball 7959 Bicycle of RED HEART® Hopscotch
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 4” (10 cm) wide and 84” (213 cm) long.
gauge: 4 sts = 4” (10 cm); 7 rows = 4” (10 cm) in pattern.
instructions:
Ch 10.
Row 1: Skip 3 ch, GS into next ch, *skip 2 ch, GS into next ch; repeat from * once more, ch 2, turn.
Row 2: *GS in space between the next 2 GS of previous row; repeat from * once more, GS in space between the last GS of previous row and turning ch; ch 2, turn.
Repeat Row 2 until scarf measures 84” (213 cm) long.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
With yarn needle, weave in all loose ends.

materials: Bernat® Roving™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dc2(3-5)tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 2 (3-5) times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 7½" x 70" [19 x 178 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 8 dc and 5 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Stripe Pat 1
With A, work 2 rows.
With MC, work 2 rows.
With B, work 2 rows.
With MC, work 2 rows.
With C, work 2 rows.
With MC, work 2 rows.
With D, work 2 rows.
These 14 rows form Stripe Pat 1.
Stripe Pat 2
With D, work 2 rows.
With MC, work 2 rows.
With C, work 2 rows.
With MC, work 2 rows.
With B, work 2 rows.
With MC, work 2 rows.
With A, work 2 rows.
With MC, work 2 rows.
These 16 rows form Stripe Pat 2.
With MC, ch 21.
1st row: (RS). Skip first 3 ch. 
Dc2tog over next 2 ch (skipped ch-3 and dc2tog count as dc3tog). 
1 dc in next ch.  5 dc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. Dc5tog over 
next 5 ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. 5 dc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. 
Dc3tog over last 3 ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3. Dc2tog (beg ch-3 and dc2tog counts as dc3tog). 1 dc 
in next dc. 5 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Dc5tog. 1 dc in 
each of next 2 dc.  5 dc in next dc. 
1 dc in next dc. Dc3tog. Turn.
Rep last row for Chevron Pat. 
Keeping cont of Chevron Pat, work 14 rows of Stripe Pat 1.
With MC only, cont in Chevron Pat until work from beg measures 45" [114.5 cm], ending on a WS row.
Keeping cont of Chevron Pat, work 16 rows of Stripe Pat 2.
Fasten off.
FRINGE
Cut lengths of MC 20" [51 cm] long. 
Taking 2 strands tog, fold in half and knot into fringe across each end of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Susan Bates Crochet Hook®: 5 mm [US H-8]
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 6” (15 cm) x 60” (152.5 cm)
gauge: 16 sts = 4” [10 cm]; 6 rows in pattern = 3.75” [9.5 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Ch 26.
Row 1 (Right side): 2 dc in 6th ch from hook (beginning ch counts as ch-2, dc), ch 5, 2 dc in next ch, *skip 2 ch, dc in next 2 ch, skip 2 ch, 2 dc in next ch, ch 5, 2 dc in next ch; repeat from * once; skip 2 ch, dc in last ch, turn – 18 dc, 3 ch-5 loops.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc), dc in next 2 dc, 2 sc in ch-5 loop, *dc in next 6 dc, 2 sc in ch-5 loop; repeat from * once; dc in next 2 dc and top of ch-3, turn – 24 sts.
Row 3: Ch 3 (counts as dc), *skip 2 dc, 2 dc in next sc, ch 5, 2 dc in next sc, skip 2 dc**, dc in next 2 dc; repeat from * across, ending last repeat at **; dc in top of ch-3, turn – 18 dc, 3 ch-5 loops.
Rows 4-82: Repeat Rows 2-3 for pattern, ending with Row 2. Fasten off.
EDGING (2)
Work Edging across top and bottom ends of Scarf.
Row 1: With wrong side facing, join with sc, sc in each st across, turn – 24 sc.
