Row 2: (Ch 7, skip 7 sc, sc in next sc) 3 times, turn.
Row 3: Slip stitch in first loop, (ch 3, 3 dc, ch 2, 4 dc) in same loop, (4 dc, ch 2, 4 dc) in each of next 2 loops, turn.

Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 Skein each 4315 Neon Fleck A, 3862 Jade B, 256 Carrot C, and 316 Soft White D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5.5 mm [US I-9], 5 mm [US H-8] and 3.75 mm [US F-5]
Susan Bates® split lock stitch markers, yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Scarf measures 4¾ x 62" (12 x 157.5 cm) including puppets.
gauge: 14 hdc = 4" (10 cm); 9 hdc rows = 4" (10 cm) with largest hook, 16 sc = 4" (10 cm); 20 sc rows = 4" (10 cm) with medium hook.
instructions:
NOTES
1. Scarf has tapered ends designed to fit inside of the puppet neck.
2. Puppets are worked in un-joined rounds, except for the half double crochet rounds at the neck. Instead of joining, the first stitch of the round is marked to help keep track.
SPECIAL STITCHES
Hdc2tog = Half double crochet 2 together: [Yo, pull up a loop in next st] twice, yo and draw through all 5 loops on hook.
Sc2tog = Single crochet 2 together: [Pull up a loop in next st] twice, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
SCARF
With larger hook and A, ch 9.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end, turn – 8 sc. 
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc to end, turn. 
Row 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each sc to last sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn – 10 sc. 
Rows 4 and 5: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 – 12 sc.
Row 6: Ch 2, 2 hdc in first sc, hdc in each sc to last sc, 2 hdc in last sc, turn – 14 hdc.
Row 7: Ch 2, hdc in each hdc across, turn.
Repeat Row 7 until scarf measures 46" (117 cm) from beginning, ending with a wrong side row.
Next 5 rows:
Row 1 (right side): Ch 2, skip first hdc, hdc in each of next 11 hdc, hdc2tog over last 2 hdc, turn – 12 hdc.
Row 2: Ch 1, skip first hdc, sc in each of next 9 hdc, sc2tog over last 2 hdc, turn – 10 sc.
Rows 3 and 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc to end, turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in each sc to last 2 sc, sc2tog over last 2 sc – 8 sc. 
Fasten off.
Edging
With right side facing and largest hook, join A with a slip st in any st along Scarf edge.
Round 1: Ch 1, work in sc evenly around entire scarf, join with slip st in first sc. 
Fasten off.
PUPPETS (make 2, 1 with color B and 1 with color C)
Lower Jaw
With medium hook, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: 2 sc in each st around – 12 sts. 
Round 3: * Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, repeat from * around – 18 sts. 
Rounds 4-8: Sc in each st around. 
Round 9: * Sc in each of next 8 sts, 2 sc in next st, repeat from * once more – 20 sts,
Rounds 10-12:  Sc in each st around. 
Round 13: * Sc in each of next 9 sts, 2 sc in next st, repeat from * once more – 22 sts.
Fasten off.
Weave in loose ends of lower jaw.
Nose and Upper Jaw
With medium hook and A, ch 2.
Round 1: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: * Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, repeat from * twice more, sc in last st – 10 sts.
Round 3: * Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, repeat from * twice more, sc in last st – 10 sts.
Round 4: * Sc in each of next 2 sts, sc2tog over next 2 sts, repeat from * once more, sc in each of last 2 sts, changing to main color (B or C) on last pull-through of final st – 8 sts.
Cut A, leaving a 10" (25.5 cm) tail.
Round 5:  With main color, * sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, repeat from * around – 12 sts.
Stuff nose with a small amount of color A yarn. Weave yarn tail through sts from round 4 and pull tightly to hold stuffing and shape nose. Weave in end of yarn.
Round 6: * Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, repeat from * around – 18 sts.
Round 7: * Sc in each of next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st, repeat from * around – 24 sts.
Rounds 8-17: Sc in each st around for 10 rounds.
Round 18: * Sc in each of next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st, repeat from * around – 30 sts.
Round 19: Sc in each st around.
Join Jaws
Flatten upper jaw with first st of round placed at side edge. Flatten lower jaw in a similar fashion and hold it in front of upper jaw.
Round 1: Working in the back row of sts from of lower jaw and the front row of sts of upper jaw, (as viewed when pieces are laid flat on a table), slip st in first st of both pieces together, ch 1 and sc in same pair of sts, working through both layers sc in each of next 10 pairs of sts to create the mouth join, sc in remaining 19 sts of upper jaw only – 30 sts.
Head
Next 10 rounds:
Round 1: * Sc in each of next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st, repeat from * around – 36 sts.
Rounds 2-5: Sc in each st around.
Mark Round 4 for later ear placement.
Round 6: * Sc in each of next 4 sts, sc2tog over next 2 sts, repeat from * around – 30 sts.
Rounds 7-9: Sc in each st around.
Round 10: * Sc in each of next 3 sts, sc2tog over next 2 sts, repeat from * around – 24 sts.
Fasten off.
Neck
With medium hook, rejoin main color yarn with slip st to center st on the bottom side of the puppet.
Round 1: Ch 2, hdc in same st as joining slip st and in each st around, join with slip st in top of beginning ch 2 – 24 hdc.
Rounds 2-7: Ch 2, hdc in each st around, join with slip st in top of beginning ch 2.
Fasten off.
Edging
With right side facing and largest hook, join A in any st at Puppet neck opening.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in each st around, join with slip st in first sc – 24 sc.
Round 2: * Ch 3, slip st in next sc; repeat from * around.
Fasten off.
EARS (make 4, 2 with color B and 2 with color C)
With medium hook, ch 2.
Round 1: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: [2 sc in next sc] 5 times – 10 sc.
Round 3: [2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 4 sc] twice – 12 sc.
Round 4: [2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 5 sc] twice – 14 sc.
Round 5: Sc in each sc around.
Round 6: [Sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in each of next 5 sc] twice – 12 sc.
Round 7: [Sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in each of next 4 sc] twice – 10 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a 10" (25.5 cm) tail. Use yarn tails to sew ears in place at Round 4 of head (marked round), about 4 sts apart.
EYES (Make 4)
With smallest hook and D, ch 2.
Round 1: 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: 2 sc in in each sc around – 8 sc.
Round 3: * 2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 3 sc; repeat from * once more – 10 sc.
Round 4: Sc in each sc around.
Round 5: * Sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in each of next 3 sc; repeat from * once more – 8 sc.
Slip st in next sc and fasten off, leaving a 10" (25.5 cm) tail.
Stuff eye with a small amount of color D yarn.
Embroider pupil with yarn needle and A. Weave yarn tail through sts from Round 5 and pull tightly to hold stuffing and shape eye. Weave in end of yarn.
Sew eyes in place just under ears.
FINISHING
Lay the scarf flat, place a puppet at either end of the scarf with the opening towards the tapered scarf end and the nose facing away.
Insert tapered end of scarf into the puppet opening about 2" (5 cm) in, pin scarf to the upper part of the puppet neck only.
Use yarn needle to sew the top layer of puppet with matching yarn color to the tapered scarf ends, being careful not to sew the opening closed.
Weave in any remaining loose ends.

abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
measurements: Scarf measures 7" [18 cm] wide x 72" [183 cm] long.
gauge: 12 sc = 4" [10 cm]; 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
NOTES: Ch 1 at beginning of each row does NOT count as a st. When changing colors, work last step of last st of previous color with new color. Carry colors not in use loosely along side of work.

SCARF: With A, loosely ch 21. Row 1: Sc in second ch and each ch across – 20 sts. Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in every st across – 20 sts. Rows 3-4: Change to B and repeat Row 2. Rows 5-6: Change to A and repeat Row 2. Rows 7-40: Repeat Rows 3-6, end with Row 4. Cut B. Rows 41-72: With A only, repeat Row 2. Repeat Rows 3-72 twice more, then Rows 3-41 once. Last Row: With A, slip st in each st across. Fasten off.

FINISHING: Weave in ends.

Fringe: With A, cut 2 strands of yarn, each 18" [46 cm] long, for each fringe. Hold 2 strands of yarn together and fold in half. Use crochet hook to draw fold through first st along one short edge, forming a loop. Pull ends of fringe through loop. Pull to tighten. Repeat to add Fringe in each st along each short edge. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® Brushed™ (5 oz/141 g; 253 yds/231 m)
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 11 dc and 5 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Notes:
• To change color, work to last 2 
loops on hook and draw new 
color through last 2 loops, then 
proceed in new color.
• Scarf is reversible, there is no 
RS or WS. 
SCARF
With A, ch 6. See diagram on 
page 2.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from 
hook. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. 
Turn.  1 block made.
2nd row: Ch 6. 1 dc in 4th ch from 
hook. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch – beg 
block made. (Sl st. Ch 3. 3 dc) in 
next ch-3 sp – block made. Turn. 
2 blocks.
3rd row: Beg block. (Block in next 
ch-3 sp) twice. Turn. 3 blocks. 
4th row: Beg block. (Block in next 
ch-3 sp) 3 times. Turn. 4 blocks. 
5th row: Beg block. (Block in next 
ch-3 sp) 4 times. Turn. 5 blocks. 
6th row: Beg block. (Block in next 
ch-3 sp) 5 times. Turn. 6 blocks. 
7th row: Beg block. (Block in next 
ch-3 sp) 6 times. Turn. 7 blocks. 
Cont in this manner, increasing 
1 block each row until there are 
10 blocks (10 rows are complete). 
Work sides even as follows:

**1st row: (RS). With A, beg block. 
(Block in next ch-3 sp) 9 times. 
Sl st in last ch-3 sp (do not make 
a block). Turn. 10 blocks.
2nd row: Sl st in each of first 3 dc 
and next ch-3 sp. Block in same 
ch-3 sp as last sl st. (Block in next 
ch-3 sp) 10 times. Turn. 10 blocks.
Rep last 2 rows until work down 
longer side edge measures 10" 
[25.5 cm], ending on a WS row. 
Break A. Join B. 
With B, rep last 2 rows for a further 
10" [25.5 cm], ending on a WS row. 
Break B. Join C.
With C, rep last 2 rows for a further 
10" [25.5 cm], ending on a WS row. 
Break C. Join D.
With D, rep last 2 rows for a further 
10" [25.5 cm], ending on a WS 
row.** Break D. Join A.
Rep from ** to ** once more. 
Break D at end of last rep.
Beg decreasing each side as 
follows:
1st row: (RS). Skip first 3 dc. Join A 
with sl st to next ch-3 sp. Beg block 
in same ch-3 sp as sl st. *Block in 
next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to last 
ch-3 sp. Sl st in last ch-3 sp (do not
make a block). Turn. 
2nd row: Sl st across first 3 dc. 
Sl st in next ch-3 sp.  Beg block in 
same ch-3 sp as sl st. *Block in next 
ch-3 sp. Rep from * to last ch-3 sp. 
Sl st in last ch-3 sp (do not make a 
block). Turn. 
Rep last row until 1 block rem. 
Fasten oﬀ.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Ribbons™: 1 ball 1939 Marble or 1937 Fire.
measurements: Scarf Measures 50” long x 3” wide.
gauge: Gauge not essential for this project.
instructions:
Beginning 6” from the raw edge, insert hook into the top hole of the ribbon. (Skip the next hole, ch1) 5 times. 
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook. Place a marker on the first sc. Sc in each of next 3 ch. Ch1. Turn.
Row 2: Sc in each sc across. Place marker on first sc. Ch1, turn.
Repeat Row 2 for desired length, leaving a 6” tail.
FiNiSHiNG
Thread the sewing needle and stitch through the last loop of the last row, securing it in place. Tuck the loose end between the nearest two ruffles and sew it in place. Repeat for other end, securing first loop and beginning end.

materials: Red Heart® Boutique Rigoletto Sequins™: 1 hank 3515 Jade
Red Heart® Boutique™ Rigoletto™, Art E804 available in Prints 2 oz (56 g), 11 yd (10.5 m), Sequins 2 oz (56 g), 8 yd (7.3 m) and Meltallic 2 oz (56 g), 10.5 yd (9.6 m) hanks
measurements: The technique used to make this scarf does not allow us to give exact measurements.
instructions:
Ch 3.
Row 1: Slip st in second ch from hook and each chain across.
Ch 1 and turn.
Repeat Row 1 until you have 3 to 4 inches of yarn remaining.
FINISHING
Turn under remaining end of yarn. Sew with needle and thread to secure. Repeat for beginning yarn end.

materials: Bernat® Pop!™ (5 oz/140 g; 280 yds/256 m) - Blue Chambray (84017) 3 balls
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 9" [23 cm] wide x 90" [228.5 cm] long, excluding tassels.
gauge: 12 hdc and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc.
Ch 29.
1st row: 2 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to last 2 ch. Hdc2tog. Turn. 27 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until work from beg measures 90" [228.5 cm].
Fasten off.
Tassels (make 4): Cut a piece of cardboard 6" [15 cm] wide. Wind yarn around cardboard 80 times. Break yarn leaving a long end and thread end through needle. Slip needle through all loops and tie tightly. Remove cardboard and wind yarn tightly around loops 1" [2.5 cm] below fold. Fasten securely. Cut through rem loops and trim ends evenly. Sew 1 Tassel to each corner of Scarf.

materials: Bernat® Wool-Up Bulky™ (6 oz/170 g; 121 yds/110 m)
Size U.S. Q (15 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 6½" x 70" [16.5 x 178 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 6 sc and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 10. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *1 tr in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 9 sts.
2nd row: Ch 4 (counts as tr). *1 sc in next tr. 1 tr in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first tr. *1 tr in next sc. 1 sc in next tr. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows until work from beg measures 70" [178 cm].
Fasten off.
Fringe
Cut 12" [30.5 cm] lengths of yarn. Taking 2 strands tog, knot into fringe spaced evenly between along Scarf ends. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: RED HEART® “SuperSaver™” 1 skein each in 319 Cherry Red A
abbreviations: A, B, etc = color A, B, etc
measurements: Scarf is 6” wide x 58” long.
gauge: 10 hdc = 4”; 8 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
instructions:
SCARF
Colorway #1
With A, ch 16.
Row 1: Hdc in 3rd ch from hook (counts as first hdc), hdc in each ch across – 15 hdc.  
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), turn, skip first hdc, hdc in each st across – 15 hdc.  
Cut A and change to B and repeat Row 2 for 2 rows.  
Working as established, repeat 2 rows with A, 2 rows with B until piece measures 58” from beginning, end with 2 rows of A.
Fasten off.
Colorway #2:
Work as for Colorway #1, beginning and ending with C, repeat 2 rows C and 2 rows B.
Colorway #3:
Work as for Colorway #1, beginning and ending with C, repeat 2 rows with C, 2 rows with B, 2 rows with A, 2 rows with B.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Swerve™: 1 ball 9946 Fizzy
RED HEART® Boutique Swerve™, Art. E792 available in 3.5 oz. (100 g), 11 yd. (10 m) balls
measurements: Scarf Measures 2½” wide X 40” long (6.4 x 101.6 cm)
gauge: Gauge is not important for this project.
instructions: Unwind the ball of yarn and lay it flat on the floor or table. Take one end of the yarn and match up with the opposite end, doubling your yarn. Using your hand and doubled yarn, make a slip knot leaving a 5” (12.7 cm) tail and adjust loop to width of your hand. Pull yarn through the loop to form a chain. Using the palm of your hand to adjust the size of chain. Continue to pull yarn through each chain formed until you reach 40” (101.6 cm). Tie off. Knot each end three times and trim remaining yarn.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique™ “Doodle™”: 1 ball 1114 Cream B.
measurements: Scarf measures 2½” wide x 84” long.
gauge: Gauge is not important for this project.
instructions:
NOTES
Stretch one end of the Sashay open for several inches and lay it flat, placing the edge with the metallic thread along the bottom. Notice that the Sashay yarn is a mesh of holes. You will be working in the top row of the mesh and leaving the metallic edge loose to form the ruffle. You are using the top channel of holes as if it is yarn. With A you will alternate an over under chain stitch around one strand of B forming a ruffly wrap.

SCARF
Cut 3 strands of B 108” (3 yds) each. A is worked while still in the ball.

Ruffle Wrap
Place one strand of A below one strand of B with ends even. *Insert hook into first hole at top of A. While wrapping around the top of B insert hook in the third hole of A and pull through making a chain stitch. Going under B, skip two holes of A and insert hook in the third hole, pull through making second chain stitch. Repeat from * alternating going over and under B to make Ruffle wrap until you reach the end of yarn. Cut A leaving 2” to fasten off.

Braid
With two strands of B and one strand of wrapped B/A tie a knot at one end. Braid the three strands together until you reach 5” from the end. Tie off in a knot. 
Trim ends even.

RED HEART® Boutique™ “Doodle™” Art. E785, Available in solid color 5.29 oz (150g), 12 yd (11m) balls.
RED HEART® Boutique™ “Sashay™” Art. E782, available in multi color 3.5 oz (100g), 30 yd (27m) balls.
This scarf looks so great, no one has to know how quick it was to do. One strand of the braid is first encircled as you crochet a chain of the pretty ruffled yarn—then it’s braided with two plain strands of yarn.

materials: RED HEART® 'Shimmer™': 1 Skein each 1810 Royal A, 1715 Hot Pink B, and 1625 Lime C.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Scarf is 5” x 65”.
gauge: Motif = 5” across. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Motif 1
With A, ch 4; join with a slip st into a ring.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as 1st dc), 2 dc in ring, ch 2, [3 dc in ring, ch 2] 3 times; join – 12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same st and in next 2 sts, (sc, ch 3, sc) all in same corner ch-2 space, * sc in next 3 sts, (sc, ch 3, sc) all in next corner space; repeat from * around; join – 5 sc each side.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in same st, ch 3, skip next st, sc in next st, ch 3, (sc, ch 4, sc) all in next corner space, * ch 3, [skip next st, sc in next st, ch 3] 2 times; (sc, ch 4, sc) all in next corner; repeat from * around; hdc in 1st st to join and form last space – 3 ch-3 spaces each side.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in same space, [ch 3, * sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3; repeat from * to corner; (sc, ch 4, sc) all in corner] 4 times; join with a hdc – 4 ch-3 spaces each side.
Round 5: Repeat Round 4 – 5 ch-3 spaces each side.
Round 6: Ch 1, (sc, ch 2, sc) all in same space, [ch 1, * (sc, ch 2, sc) all in next ch-3 space, ch 1; repeat from * to corner, (sc, ch 4, sc) all in corner] 4 times; ch 1; join with a slip st – 5 ch-2 spaces each side. Fasten off.
Motif 2
With B, work as for Motif 1 through Round 5.
Joining Round 6: Ch 1, (sc, ch 2, sc) all in same space, [ch 1, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-3 space] 4 times; ch 1, in corner, sc, ch 2, drop loop from hook, draw loop through corresponding corner of finished square, replace loop on hook, ch 2, sc) all in corner – connected corner made; * ch 1, (sc, ch 1, drop loop, draw loop through corresponding ch-2 space, replace loop, ch 1, sc) all in next ch-3 space; repeat from * to next corner, ch 1, connected corner in next corner, [ch 1, * (sc, ch 2, sc), ch 1; repeat from * to next corner, (sc, ch 4, sc) all in corner] 2 times; ch 1; join – 1 side joined. Fasten off.
For remaining Motifs, repeat directions for Motif 2, working Color Sequence [A, B, C] 4 times, then A one more time.
Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® Tweeds™ (5 oz/141 g; 250 yds/228 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 9" x 90" [23 x 228.5 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 13 hdc and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm] in hdc.
instructions:
Chain (ch) 32.
1st row: [Right Side (RS)]. 1 half double crochet (hdc) in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 30 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Repeat (rep) 2nd row until work measures approximately (approx) 90" [228.5 cm] long, ending on a Wrong Side (WS) row. Fasten off.
Fringe: Cut strands of yarn 16" [40.5 cm] long. Taking 2 strands together (tog), fold in half and knot into fringe across both ends of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly.
Fringe: Cut yarn 10 to 14 ins [25.5 to 35.5 cm] long. Taking 2 or 3 strands together for each fringe knot into fringe across cast on and cast off edges. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Bernat ® Plentiful™ (10.6 oz/300 g; 952 yds/871 m) Blood Orange (19005) 1 ball
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 65" [165 cm] around x 20" [51 cm] deep.
gauge: 10 sc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc.
Ch 53 (multiple of 5 ch + 8).
1st row: (1 dc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in 6th ch from hook. *Skip next 4 ch. (1 dc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in next ch. Rep from * to last 2 ch. Skip next ch. 1 dc in last ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3. *5 dc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to last st. 1 dc in top of beg ch 3. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. Skip next 2 dc. *(1 dc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in next dc. Skip next 4 dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in top of beg ch 3. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows until work from beg measures 65" [165 cm].
Fasten off. Sew short ends tog to form loop.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Contrast A: Optimistic, Clear Headed, Positive Neon Pink (39775) 1 ball
Contrast B: Cheerful, Relaxed, Cozy Neon Coral (39772) 1 ball
Contrast C: Excited, Energetic, Passionate Neon Orange (39774) 1 ball
Contrast D: Creative, Witty, Silly Neon Yellow (39773) 1 ball
Contrast E: Strong, Confident, Bold Neon Green (39777) 1 ball
Contrast F: Peaceful, Healthy, Content Blue Mint (B9608) 1 ball
Contrast G: Calm, Balanced, Neutral Black (39727) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 7" x 70" [18 x 178 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 17 stitches and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pattern.
instructions:
Notes: To join new color, work to last loops on hook of first color. Yarn over hook (Yoh) with new color, draw through loops and proceed with new color. Always change color at beginning (beg) of right side (RS) rows. Mark RS of Scarf with safety pin for easy recognition.
With color of choice, chain (ch) 34.
Foundation Row: [Right Side (RS)]. 1 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook. *Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Repeat (rep) from * to end of chain. Turn. 33 stitches (sts).
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 space (sp). *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last st. 1 sc in last st. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last st. Ch 1. 1 sc in last st. Turn.
Rep 1st and 2nd rows to form pattern (pat) working 2½" [6 cm] in chosen shade for each day of the 28 day challenge. Fasten off.
Fringe: Cut strands of all shades 16" [40.5 cm] long. Taking 2 strands together (tog), fold in half and knot into fringe across ends of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly.

abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
measurements: Scarf measures 5” x 54”, excluding fringe.
gauge: 11 dc = 4”; 7 rows = 4. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCARF
Longer Section
With A, ch 150.
Row 1: Dc in 3rd ch from hook and in each ch across – 148 dc.
Row 2: Change to B, ch 1 (counts as sc here and throughout), turn, sc in each dc across – 148 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 4: Change to C, ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), turn, dc in each sc across.
Row 5: Change to D, ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 6: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 7: Change to A, ch 3, turn, dc in each sc across.
Fasten off.
Shorter Section
With C, ch 120.
Row 1: Dc in 3rd ch from hook and in each ch across–118 dc.
Row 2: Change to B, ch 3, turn, dc in each dc across.
Row 3: Change to A, ch 3, turn, dc in each dc across.
FINISHING
Joining Sections
With wrong sides facing, position last row of Shorter Section centered along last row of Larger Section. Mark center 12”.
Working through both layers, join A in first st in marked center section, sc in each st in marked 12” section to join sections together.
Fasten off. 
Weave in ends.
Fringe
Holding 1 strand of A, B, C and D together, cut 16 sets of Fringe, each 15” long.
Fold 1 Fringe set in half. Pull folded loop through edge of Row 1 on Shorter Section. Pull ends of Fringe through loop and pull to tighten.
Repeat to add 3 Fringes to each end of Shorter Sections and 5 Fringes to each end of Longer Sections.

materials: Caron® Sprinkle Cakes™ (8 oz/227 g; 193 yds/176 m) Red Velvet (23003) 3 balls
Size U.S. L11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
4" [10 cm] wide piece of cardboard for Tassels.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = (Draw up a loop in next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook)
measurements: Approx 10" x 90" [25.5 x 228.5 cm], excluding tassels
gauge: 7 sc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm]. 2 Wedges = Approx 5" x 10" [12.5 x 25.5 cm].
instructions:
Note: To maintain consistent color changes, join new ball of yarn to match last color change of previous ball. This will help to ensure stripe repeat will match as closely as possible.
Ch 21 (multiple of 4 ch + 1).
Foundation row: (WS). Working into horizontal "bump" at back of each ch, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. 20 sc.
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to last 4 sc. Turn, leaving rem sts unworked. 16 sc.
2nd and alt rows: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: As 1st row. 12 sc. 
5th row: As 1st row. 8 sc. 
7th row: As 1st row. 4 sc.
9th row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. (Sc2tog, working into side of last st of previous row and back loop only of next st 2 rows below. 1 sc in back loop only of each of next 3 sc) 4 times. Turn. 20 sc.
First Wedge complete.
Rep 1st to 9th rows until Scarf measures approx 90" [228.5 cm], ending on 9th row of an even numbered Wedge.
Next row: As 2nd row.
Fasten off.
Tassels (make 10): Cut a piece of cardboard 4" [10 cm] wide. Wind yarn around cardboard 30 times. Break yarn leaving a long end and thread end through needle. Slip needle through all loops and tie tightly. Remove cardboard and wind yarn tightly around loops 1" [2.5 cm] below fold. Fasten securely. Cut through rem loops and trim ends evenly. Sew 5 Tassels evenly spaced to each end of Scarf.

materials: Bernat® Super Value™ (7 oz/197 g/; 426 yds/389 m/) Clay (53041) 1 ball
Sizes U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 6" x 50" [15 x 127 cm].
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
SCARF
Ch 20.
**1st row: (WS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook (counts as 2 hdc). 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 19 sts.
2nd row: Sl st in first hdc. *1 dc in next hdc. Sl st in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.**
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows for pat until work from beg measures approx 50" [127 cm], ending on a 3rd row. Fasten off.
BOW
Ch 20. 
Work from ** to ** as given for Scarf. Rep 2nd and 3rd rows until work from beg measures approx 24" [61 cm], ending on a 3rd row. Fasten off. 
Sew first row and last row tog to form loop.
BOW CENTER
Ch 9.
Work from ** to ** as given for Scarf. Rep 2nd and 3rd rows until work from beg measures approx 5" [12.5 cm], ending on a 3rd row. Fasten off. 
SCARF LOOP
Ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 7 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 6" [15 cm]. Fasten off.
Sew first row and last row tog to form loop.
FINISHING
Sew Bow Center around Bow as shown in picture. Sew Scarf Loop to back of Bow. Slide Scarf ends into Scarf Loop to form closure as shown in picture.

materials: RED HEART® Team Spirit™: 1 skein 940 Red/Blue
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.5 mm [US K-10.5]
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 6” (15 cm) x 50” (127 cm)
gauge: 10 sts = 4” [10 cm]; 11 rows = 4” [10 cm] in pattern.
instructions: Ch 17. Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, *dc in next ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * across to last ch; dc in last ch; turn – 16 sts. Rows 2-138: Ch 1, *sc in next dc, dc in next sc; repeat from * across – 16 sts. At end of last row, fasten off. Weave in ends. FINISHING Fringe (optional) Use both colors to make fringe. Cut 50 strands of each color, each 10” (25.5 cm) long. Beginning with second color, attach fringe as follows in first corner st: hold 5 strands together and fold in half. With Wrong Side facing, insert hook through first corner st on short edge of scarf and draw folded end of strands through to form loop. Thread ends of strands through loop and pull ends to tighten. Continue attaching fringe in each ch-1 space and in opposite corner st across alternating 2 sections of second color and 2 sections of first color, ending with second color. Trim strands to even all fringe.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Chunky™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 108 yds/99 m)
Striped Version: Contrast A True Grey (28044) 1 ball
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 6" x 60" [15 x 152.5 cm].
gauge: 8 sc and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
SOLID VERSION
**Chain (ch) 11.
1st row: 1 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch 
from hook. 1 double crochet (dc) in 
next ch. (1 sc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch) 
4 times. Turn. 10 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. 1 dc in 
next sc. (1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc) 
4 times. Turn. 10 sts.**
Rep 2nd row until work from beg 
measures 60" [152.5 cm]. Fasten off.
STRIPED VERSION
With Color A, work from ** to ** as 
given for Solid Version.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg 
measures 4" [10 cm]. Break Color A.
Change to Color B.
Note: To change color, work to last 2
loops on hook of first color. Draw new
color through last 2 loops and proceed.
Alternate stripe colors every 4" [10 cm], 
until Scarf from beg measures 60" 
[152.5 cm].
Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver Pooling™: 2 skeins 8635 Party
RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein 1546 Iris
Susan Bates® Easy Pom Pon Maker™, 2" (5 cm) diameter
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 7½ x 80" (19 x 203 cm)
gauge: 3 full sc sts per each length of one color in Moss st. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
LACE Planned Pooling Pompom Scarf
Use this yarn to create a plaid scarf without having to add a new skein of yarn for each color change. The yarn does the color changing for an amazing look! Pompoms add a modern fun finishing touch!

NOTES
1. This yarn has been specially designed to get 3 sc in each color in the sequence when worked in Moss st.
2. Each color length, or 3 repeats, should measure about 1½" (4 cm) across in Moss st. However, it is more important that you follow the per-color gauge than the per-inch gauge.

MOSS STITCH
Ch an even number of sts.
Row 1: Sk 3 ch, sc in next ch, * ch 1, sk 1 foundation ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * to end, turn.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as a stitch now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end finishing with a sc in last ch-3 space, turn.
Row 3: Ch 2 (counts as a stitch now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end finishing with a sc in last ch-2 space, turn.
Repeat Row 3 only for Moss st.

SCARF
Ch through 1 full color sequence, with the last loop on hook being the first loop of a new color just after a color change in the yarn.
Row 1 (right side): Sk 2 ch (counts as a sc), sc in the 4th ch from hook, * ch 1, sc around the foundation ch (instead of going into a ch st); repeat from * until 1 full color sequence has been completed. The number of sc made in each individual color in the sequence should be 3. Leave remaining ch sts unworked. Undo one st repeat (sc, ch 1), turn.
Note: If at this point you are NOT getting 3 sc per color, then redo the row with a different hook size. Getting 3 sc per color with this yarn is essential to making this technique work.
Row 2 (wrong side): Ch 2 (counts as a sc now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end finishing with a sc in last ch-2 space, turn.
Note: As you work this row and all remaining rows, you MUST get the correct number of sc in each color in order to maintain the planned color pooling. Change hook sizes, or actual st used, to get the correct color in place.
Row 3 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as a sc now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in the next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end, finishing with a sc in last ch-2 space, turn.
Note: The color of the sts on this row will shift to the left or right by 1 st from the previous right side row depending on the colorway and if you are right or left handed. It doesn’t matter which direction the stitch shifts as long as it is off-set by 1.
Row 4 (wrong side): Ch 2 (counts as a sc now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in the next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end, finishing with a sc in last ch-2 space, turn.
Note: The color of the sts on this row will shift to the left or right by 1 st from the previous wrong side row depending on the colorway and if you are right or left handed. It doesn’t matter which direction the stitch shifts as long as it is off-set by 1.
Repeat Rows 3 and 4 until Scarf measures 80" (203 cm).
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Squish or stretch the sts on foundation chain to match the width of the rest of the scarf. You can slide the sts around along the foundation chain, as with an adjustable ring. Unravel unused foundation ch sts and weave in yarn tail to secure foundation.

Edging
With right side facing and working across foundation edge, join B with slip st in foundation ch st under last sc of Row 1.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as a st now and throughout), sc once more in same ch, * ch 1, sc in next space between sc of Row 1; repeat from * to ch-3 corner space, (ch 1, sc) 3 times in corner space, rotate scarf to work along long side edge, (ch 1, sc) in each ch space at edge of every other row to corner sc, (ch 1, sc) twice around corner sc, rotate scarf to work along top edge, (ch 1, sc) in each ch-1 space to corner ch-2 space, (ch 1, sc) 3 times in corner space, rotate scarf to work along long side edge, (ch 1, sc) in each ch space at edge of every other row to corner sc, (ch 1, sc) twice around corner sc, ch 1, join with slip st in beginning ch 2, do not turn.
Round 2 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as a sc now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end finishing with a slip st in last ch-2 space. Fasten off.
Pompom
With B, make pompom and attach securely to corners of scarf.
Weave in remaining loose ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 979 Mistletoe A, and 311 White B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6 mm [US J-10]
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Scarf measures 4½ x 68" (11.5 x 172.5 cm)
gauge: 13 sts (including ch sts) = 4" (10 cm); 13 rows = 4"
instructions:
MOSS STITCH
Ch an even number of sts.
Row 1: Sk 3 ch, sc in next ch, * ch 1, skip 1 foundation ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * to end, turn.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as a stitch now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end finishing with a sc in last ch-3 space, turn.
Row 3: Ch 2 (counts as a stitch now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end finishing with a sc in last ch-2 space, turn.
Repeat Row 3 only for Moss st.
SCARF
With A, ch through one full color sequence, with the last loop on hook being the first loop of a new color just after a color change in the yarn. 
Row 1 (right side): Skip 3 ch (counts as a st), sc in the 4th ch from hook, * ch 1, sc around the foundation ch (instead of going into a ch st); repeat from * until 1 full color sequence has been completed on this row. Count the number of sc made in each individual color in the colorway and note it down. Undo half the st repeats (sc, ch 1), rounded down, then undo one more repeat. Turn.
Row 2 (wrong side): Ch 2 (counts as a st now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end finishing with a sc in last ch-3 space, turn.
Note: As you work this row and all remaining rows, you MUST get the same number of sc in each color as you did in row 1 before pulling them out in order to maintain the planned color pooling. Each row will go through one half of a full color sequence, and so every 2 rows will go through one full color sequence. Change hook sizes, or actual st used, to get the correct color in place. If you use the same number of sts per color that you counted on Row 1 over the course of 2 rows, it will work out.
Row 3 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as a st now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in the next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end, finishing with a sc in last ch-2 space, turn.
Note: The color of the sts on this row will shift to the left or right by 1 st from the previous right side row depending on the colorway and if you are right or left handed. It doesn’t matter which direction the stitch shifts as long as it is off-set by 1.
Row 4 (wrong side): Ch 2 (counts as a st now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in the next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end, finishing with a sc in last ch-2 space, turn.
Note: The color of the sts on this row will shift to the left or right by 1 st from the previous wrong side row depending on the colorway and if you are right or left handed. It doesn’t matter which direction the stitch shifts as long as it is off-set by 1.
Repeat Rows 3 and 4 until scarf measures 68" (172.5 cm) or to desired length, ending on a Row 4 (wrong side row).
FINISHIING
Squish or stretch the sts on foundation chain to match the width of the rest of the Scarf. You can slide the sts around along the foundation chain, as with an adjustable ring. Unravel unused foundation ch sts and weave in yarn tail to secure foundation.
Edging
With right side facing and working across foundation edge, join B with slip st in foundation ch st under last sc of Row 1.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as a st now and throughout), sc once more in same ch, * ch 1, sc in next space between sc of Row 1; repeat from * to ch-3 corner space, (ch 1, sc) 3 times in corner space, rotate Cowl to work along long side edge, (ch 1, sc) in each ch space at edge of every other row to corner sc, (ch 1, sc) twice around corner sc, rotate Cowl to work along top edge, (ch 1, sc) in each ch-1 space to corner ch-2 space, (ch 1, sc) 3 times in corner space, rotate Cowl to work along long side edge, (ch 1, sc) in each ch space at edge of every other row to corner sc, (ch 1, sc) twice around corner sc, ch 1, join with sl st in beginning ch 2. Fasten off. 
Weave in all loose ends.

pattern_name: Special Olympics Rib Crochet Striped Scarf
materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein each of 886 Blue A and 512 Turqua B.
measurements: Scarf measures 5¾” x 54”.
gauge: 14 sts = 4”; 10 rows = 4” in pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCARF
With A, Ch 192.
Row 1 (Right Side): Hdc in 3rd ch from hook and each ch across. Fasten off A; turn – 190 sts.
Row 2: Attach B, ch 2, hdc in back loop of each hdc across. Fasten off B; turn.
Rows 3-13: Continue working as for Row 2, alternating colors on each row, ending with Color A. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 7” x 54”.
gauge: 13 sts = 4”; 7 rows = 4” in double crochet.
instructions:
SCARF
Ch 78.
Round 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook and in each ch to last ch; 5 dc in last ch, then working along opposite edge of starting ch, dc in each ch to last ch; 4 dc in last ch; join with a slip st in top of ch-3.
Round 2: Ch 3, * working in back loops only, dc in each dc to 5-dc group at end; working through both loops, dc in next dc, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in next dc, 2 dc in next dc, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in next dc **, dc in next dc; repeat from * around noting that the first ch-3 of Round 1 counts as the 5th dc of the 2nd 5-dc group, end at **; join.
Rounds 3-6: Ch 3, working in back loops only, dc in each dc and work (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in each corner ch-2 space around; join. Fasten off at end of Round 6.
Bow-tie Fan
Row 1: With right side facing, join yarn in the ch-2 space at the right-hand side of one short edge; ch 3, dc in each dc across, dc in next ch-2 space; turn – 24 sts.
Row 2: Ch 3, skip first dc, 2 dc in next dc, dc in next dc, ch 2, skip 2 dc, dc in next 4 dc, ch 6, skip 6 dc, dc in next 4 dc, ch 2, skip 2 dc, dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc, dc in top of ch-3; turn.
Rows 3 and 5: Ch 3, skip first dc, dc in each dc to ch-2 space, ch 2, dc in next 4 dc, ch 6, dc in next 4 dc, ch 2, dc in each dc across and in top of ch-3; turn.
Row 4: Ch 3, skip first dc, 2 dc in next dc, dc in each dc to ch-2 space, ch 2, dc in next 4 dc, ch 6, dc in next 4 dc, ch 2, dc in each dc to last 2 sts; 2 dc in next dc, dc in top of ch-3; turn.
Row 6: Ch 3, skip first dc, 2 dc in next dc, dc in each dc to ch-2 space, ch 2, dc in next 4 dc, ch 4, insert hook from front to back under the 4 ch-6 chains and work sc to secure those chains and form a bow, ch 4, dc in next 4 dc, ch 2, dc in each dc to last 2 sts; 2 dc in next dc, dc in top of ch-3; turn.
Rows 7 and 9: Repeat Row 3.
Rows 8 and 10: Repeat Row 4.
Row 11: Ch 3, skip first dc, dc in each dc to ch-2 space, ch 2, dc in next 4 dc, ch 4, insert hook from front to back under the 4 ch-6 chains and work sc to secure those chains and form a bow, ch 4, dc in next 4 dc, ch 2, dc in each dc across and in top of ch-3; turn.
Rows 12 and 14: Repeat Row 4.
Rows 13 and 15: Repeat Row 3.
Row 16: Repeat Row 6.
Who said a scarf has to be a straight rectangle? This creatively designed crochet scarf is narrower in the center and fans out at the ends, making it less bulky around the neck. Make it in a new shaded tone, as shown, or in any shade that you like to wear.

Rows 17-21: Repeat Rows 7-11. Fasten off. Repeat Bow-tie Fan at opposite short edge.
Edging
With right side facing, join yarn to first dc immediately after ch-2 space on left side of fan; ch 2, work 1 row Reverse sc evenly to corner, then along side edge and around to opposite ch-2 space. Fasten off.
Repeat Edging on other side of scarf.

materials: Caron® x Pantone™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 127 yds/116 m)
Size U.S. 9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in back loop only of each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 8” x 78” [20 x 198 cm]
gauge: 15.5 sctbl and 17 rows = 4”  [10 cm].
instructions:
Stripe Pat
With A, work 33 rows. 
With B, work 18 rows.
With C, work 12 rows.
With D, work 12 rows.
With E, work 12 rows.
With F, work 12 rows.
With G, work 12 rows.
With H, work 12 rows.
With I, work 12 rows.
With J, work 12 rows.
With K, work 12 rows.
With L, work 12 rows.
With M, work 12 rows.
With N, work 18 rows.
With O, work 32 rows.
These 233 rows form Stripe Pat. 
Section One (Increase)
With A, ch 4.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
1 sc in each of next 2 ch. Turn.  
3 sts.
2nd row:  Ch 1. 2 scbl in first st. 
Sc2tog. Turn. 3 sts. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to 
last st. 2 scbl in last sc. Turn. 4 sts.
4th row:  Ch 1. 2 scbl in first sc.  
1 scbl in each st to last 2 sts. 
Sc2tog. 4 sts.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to 
last st. 2 scbl in last sc. Turn. 5 sts. 

First 5 rows of Stripe Pat are now complete. Maintaining cont of Stripe Pat, rep 2nd and 3rd rows 29 times more. 34 sts. 
Section Two (Work Even)
1st row:  Ch 1. 2 scbl in first st.  
1 scbl in each st to last 2 sts. 
Sc2tog. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn. 
Rep 1st and 2nd rows 53 times more.
Section Three (Decrease)
1st row:  Ch 1. 2 scbl in first st.  
1 scbl in each st to last 2 sts. 
Sc2tog. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn. 33 sts. 
Rep 1st and 2nd rows 30 times more. 3 sts. 
Fasten off.

materials: Patons® grace™ (50 g/1.75 oz; 125 m/136 yds)
Size 5.5 mm (U.S. I/9) crochet hook or size needed to obtain tension.
abbreviations: Dtr = (Yoh) 3 times. Yoh and draw up a loop in indicated space. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times.
triple loop = Sl st in next sc. (Ch 7. Sl st) 3 times in same sc.
measurements: Approx 8" x 56" [20.5 x 142 cm].
gauge: 17 sc and 20 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 34.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 33 sc.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 6. Miss next 3 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
6th row: Ch 8 (counts as 1 dtr and ch 3). 1 sc in first ch-6 sp. *Ch 6. 1 sc in next ch-6 sp. Rep from * to last sc. Ch 3. 1 dtr in last sc. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dtr. *Ch 6. 1 sc in next ch-6 sp. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
6th and 7th rows form pat.
Cont in pat until Scarf measures approx 50" [127 cm], ending with 7th row.
next row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *3 sc in next ch-6 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. 33 sc.
next 3 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
top edging: 1st row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. *Ch 9. Miss next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * to last 6 sc. Ch 9. Miss next 3 sc. 1 sc in next 3 sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-9 sp. *Ch 5. Miss next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Ch 5. Rep from * to last 3 sc. Miss next sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 5. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 5. Triple loop in next sc. Ch 5. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off.
Bottom edging: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to right corner of foundation ch. Ch 1. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, work 34 sc evenly across. Turn.
Rep 1st to 4th rows of Top edging.

materials: RED HEART® Team Spirit Chunky™: 4 balls 9988 Red/Grey
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Scarf measures: 7" x 70” (18 x 178 cm)
gauge: 8 hdc = 4" [10 cm]; 5½ rows = 4" [10 cm] in half double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCARF
Ch 14. 
Row 1: Hdc in third ch from hook (skipped chs do NOT count as a st), hdc in each ch across – 12 hdc.
Row 2: Ch 2 (does NOT count as a hdc here and throughout), turn, hdc into each st across – 12 hdc.
Repeat Row 2 until Scarf measures 70" [178 cm] from beginning.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Make four pompoms, each with 3½" [9 cm] diameter, using pompom maker. Sew one pompom to each corner of Scarf.
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Wool-Up Bulky™ (6 oz/170 g; 121 yds/110 m)
Size U.S. N/15 (10 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dec Cluster = Yoh and draw up a loop in next ch or st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Skip next 3 ch or sts. Yoh and draw up a loop in next ch or st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 5½" x 60" [14 x 152.5 cm].
gauge: 7 dc and 4 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 17.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 5th ch from hook (skipped ch 4 counts as 1 dc and ch 1). Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 dc in next ch. Ch 1. Skip next ch. Dec Cluster. Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 dc in next ch. Ch 1. Skip next ch. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in last ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in first dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. Dec Cluster. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 3 dc in 3rd ch of ch-4. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch 1). 1 dc in first dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc. Dec Cluster. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in top of ch 3. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until all yarn is used, ending on a WS row.
Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Unforgettable®: 3 balls 3952 Tealberry
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 3.75mm [US F-5] and 6.0mm [US J-10]
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses in same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Shawl measures 17” wide x 60” long (43 x 152.5 cm).
gauge: 2 pattern repeats = 4” (10 cm) (one pattern repeat consists of one herringbone half double crochet and one chain); 14 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SHAWL
Center Panel
With larger hook, ch 164.
Row 1 (right side): Hhdc in 3rd ch from hook (beginning ch count as first hhdc), *ch 1, skip next ch, hhdc in next ch; repeat from * across to last ch, hhdc in last ch, turn—83 hhdc and 80 ch-1 spaces.
Rows 2–40: Ch 2 (counts as first hhdc here and throughout), hhdc in next st, *ch 1, skip next hhdc, hhdc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across to beginning ch, hhdc in top of beginning ch, turn. Do not fasten off or turn at end of last row.
First Side Panel
Row 1: Ch 3 (counts as hhdc, ch 1 here and throughout), working across ends of rows, hhdc in next row, [ch 1, hhdc in next row] 3 times, *skip next row, [ch 1, hhdc in next row] 4 times; repeat from * across, turn—33 hhdc and 32 ch-1 spaces.
Rows 2–20: Ch 2, hhdc in first ch-1 space, (ch 1, hhdc) in each ch-1 space across, turn.
2nd Side Panel
Row 1: Hold center panel with wrong side facing, join yarn with slip st in unworked end of first row, ch 3, working across ends of rows, hhdc in next row, [ch 1, hhdc in next row] 3 times, *skip next row, [ch 1, hhdc in next row] 4 times; repeat from * across, turn—33 hhdc and 32 ch-1 spaces.
Rows 2–20: Repeat Rows 2–20 of first side panel. Do not fasten off. Change to smaller hook.
Edging
Row 1 (right side): Ch 5 (counts as sc, ch 4 here and throughout), sc in first st, *ch 6, skip next 3 ch-1 spaces, (sc, ch 4, sc) in next ch-1 space*; repeat from * to * 7 times; working in ends of rows across bottom edge of 2nd side panel, [ch 10, skip next 5 rows, (sc, ch 4, sc) in next row] 3 times; working across center panel, ch 10, skip next 4 ch-1 spaces, (sc, ch 4, sc) in next ch-1 space, [ch 10, skip next 5 ch-1 spaces, (sc, ch 4, sc) in next ch-1 space] 13 times; working in ends of rows across first side panel, [ch 10, skip next 5 rows, (sc, ch 4, sc) in next row] 3 times; working across short edge of first side panel; repeat from * to * 8 times, turn—37 ch-4 spaces.
Rows 2 and 3: Ch 1, slip st in first ch-4 space, (ch 5, sc) in same space, [ch 6, (sc, ch 4, sc) in next ch-4 space] 8 times, [ch 10, (sc, ch 4, sc) in next ch-4 space] 20 times, [ch 6, (sc, ch 4, sc) in next ch-4 space] 8 times, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, slip st in first ch-4 space, (ch 5, sc) in same space, [ch 6, (sc, ch 4, sc) in next ch-4 space] 7 times, [(sc, ch 4, sc)] 3 times in next ch-4 space, [ch 10, (sc, ch 4, sc) in next ch-4 space] 19 times, [(sc, ch 4, sc)] 3 times in next ch-4 space, [ch 6, (sc, ch 4, sc) in next ch-4 space] 8 times, turn—41 ch-4 spaces. 
Round 5: Sl st in first ch-4 space, (beg 3-tr Cl, [ch 3, 3-tr Cl] twice) in same space (counts as first fan), fan in next 7 ch-4 spaces, *ch 3, 3-tr Cl in next ch-4 space, fan in next ch-4 space, ch 3, 3-tr Cl in next ch-4 space*, fan in next 19 ch-4 spaces; repeat from * to * once, fan in last 7 ch-4 spaces, [slip st in vertical bar of last tr made] twice; working in ends of rows across first side panel, 2 sc in next 4 ch-4 spaces, 2 sc in next row, [skip next row, 2 sc in next row] 9 times; working in center panel, 2 sc in each ch-1 space across; working in ends of rows across 2nd side panel, 2 sc in first 2 rows, [skip next row, 2 sc in next row] 8 times, skip next row, 2 sc in last 4 ch-4 spaces, do not join or turn—37 fans, four 3-tr Cls, and 222 sc.
Last Row: Ch 1, reverse sc in first sc, *skip next sc, reverse sc in next sc; repeat from * across—111 sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Contrast A: Optimistic, Clear Headed, Positive Burgundy (39762) 1 ball
Contrast B: Cheerful, Relaxed, Cozy Fuchsia (39764) 1 ball
Contrast C: Excited, Energetic, Passionate Pumpkin (39765) 1 ball
Contrast D: Creative, Witty, Silly Chartreuse (39771) 1 ball
Contrast E: Strong, Confident, Bold Cool Green (39770) 1 ball
Contrast F: Peaceful, Healthy, Content Pagoda (COL0014) 1 ball
Contrast G: Calm, Balanced, Neutral Cobalt Blue (39784) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from left to right. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
measurements: Approx 7" x 70" [18 x 178 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 16 sts and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Rib Pat.
instructions:
Notes: To join new color, work to last loops on hook of first color. Yoh with new color, draw through loops and proceed with new color. Always change color at beg of RS rows. Mark RS of Scarf with safety pin for easy recognition.
With color of choice, ch 34.
1st row: (WS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (skipped ch-3 counts as dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. 32 dc. Turn.
2nd row: (RS). Ch 3 (counts as dc). *Dcfp around next dc. Dcbp around next dc. Rep from * to last st. 1 dc in top of ch-3. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *Dcfp around next st. Dcbp around next st. Rep from * to last st. 1 dc in top of ch-3. Turn.
Rep last row for Rib pat. 
Cont in pat working 2½" [6 cm] in chosen shade for each day of the 28 day challenge. 
Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 Ball 330 Linen B
measurements: Scarf measures 4½” wide x 47”.
gauge: 9 sts = 5” in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size needles/hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
SCARF
With larger hook and B, ch 9.
Fasten off.
Row 1: With smaller hook, join A in first ch with sc, sc in next 8 ch – 9 sc.
Row 2: Ch 2, turn, sc in each st to end.
Repeat Row 2 until yarn is finished, end at end of row.
Fasten off.
Weave in ends.
Note: When using Pomp-a-Doodle, work sc with yarn between pompoms. Do not pull pompoms through stitches.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver Stripes™: 2 skeins 4967 Cool Stripe
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 8½” (22 cm) wide and 72” (183 cm) long.
gauge: 13 sts = 4” (10 cm); 8 rows = 4” (10 cm) in pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SPECIAL STITCHES
V-st = (dc, ch 1, dc) in indicated st or space
SCARF
Setup row: Ch 28, V-st in 5th ch from hook, skip 2 ch, 3 dc in next ch, *skip 2 ch, V-st in next ch, skip 2 ch, 3 dc in next ch; rep from * to last 2 ch, skip 1 ch, dc in last ch, turn—4 V-sts, four 3-dc groups, 2 dc.
Pattern row: Ch 3 (counts as 1 dc), *V-st in second dc of first 3-dc group, 3 dc in ch-1 space of next V-st; rep from * to end, dc in top of turning ch, turn.
Repeat pattern row until scarf is 72” (183 cm) long. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With yarn needle, weave in loose ends.

abbreviations: dc5tog: [Yarn over, insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops] 5 times, yarn over, draw through all 6 loops on hook.
measurements: Scarf measures 8½" x 72" (21.5 x 183 cm) excluding fringe.
gauge: 5 dc = 3" (7.5 cm); 4 rows = 5" (12.5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCARF
With larger crochet hook, ch 16.
Row 1 (right side): Work 2 dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch count as first dc), skip next 2 ch, sc in next ch, skip next 2 ch, 5 dc in next ch, skip next 2 ch, sc in next ch, skip next 2 ch, 3 dc in last ch, turn—11 dc and 2 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first dc, ch 2, dc5tog in next 2 dc, sc, and 2 dc, ch 2, sc in next dc, ch 2, dc5tog in next 2 dc, sc, and 2 dc, ch 2, sc in top of beginning ch, turn—2 dc5tog and 3 sc.
Row 3: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), 2 dc in first sc, sc in next dc5tog, 5 dc in next sc, sc in next dc5tog, 3 dc in last sc, turn—11 dc and 2 sc.
Row 4: Repeat Row 2.
Repeat Rows 3 and 4 until piece measures 72" (183 cm) or desired length. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Fringe
Cut 44 strands, each 25" (63.5 cm) long. Hold 2 strands together and fold in half to form a loop. Working in opposite side of foundation ch, insert large crochet hook from right side through 2nd ch. Place fold on hook and draw fold through, forming a large loop. Thread ends of strands through loop and pull to tighten. Repeat to attach fringe in next 10 ch of Row 1, then repeat to attach 11 fringes centered across sts and ch of last row. Trim ends evenly.
With small crochet hook, weave in ends.

materials: Two stitch markers, sewing needle and thread.
measurements: Scarf measures 4½” wide x 36” long.
gauge: 5 sts = 4½”. Gauge is not important to this project.
instructions:
Beginning 6” from the raw edge, insert hook through the top of the mesh and pick up a loop. Chain 1, insert and close a stitch marker under both top loops of the ch st, marking the first st. Ch 5 going into every other hole in the mesh., turn.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, marking the sc with a stitch pin. Sc in next 4 ch, removing the stitch marker at the end of the row. Ch 1, turn.
Row 2: Sc in each sc across, marking 1st sc in row. Ch 1, turn. 
Repeat Row 2 to desired length.
FINISHING
At each end of the scarf, trim the yarn to 6” and tuck the loose end between the nearest two ruffle layers. Using sewing needle and matching thread, tack the end firmly in place.

materials: RED HEART® Celebration™: 1 ball each 9340 Aqua/Silver A, Purple/Silver 9540 B, 9740 Pink/Silver C, 9840 Blue/Silver D, 9640 Gold/Silver E, and 9240 Lime/Silver F
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 5” x 48” (12.5 x 122 cm), not including fringe.
gauge: 5 V-sts = 4” (10cm)
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2013 Coats & Clark
RedHeart.com
Page 1 of 1
Bright festive colors are perfect for the 
holidays! Crochet this easy scarf as shown or 
in any colors you desire!
Special Stitch
V-st = (sc, ch 2, sc) in indicated st or ch-space.
Notes
1. All rows are worked with right side facing.
2. Begin and end each row with an 8”
(20.5 cm) tail to tie into fringe.
3. There is enough yarn in the six skeins to
make 4 scarves.
SCARF
With A, ch 152.
Row 1 (right side): Working in back bars, V-st 
in 2nd ch from hook, *ch 1, skip next 2 chs, 
V-st in next ch; repeat from * across—50
V-sts. Fasten off.
Row 2: With right side facing, join B with sc
in ch-2 space of first V-st, (ch 2, sc) in same
ch-2 space, *ch 1, V-st in next ch-2 space;
repeat from * across. Fasten off.
Rows 3–6: Repeat Row 2 working 1 row each
with C, D, E, and F.
Row 7 (right side): With right side of Row 1
facing and working across opposite side of
foundation ch, join A with sc to first ch, (ch 2,
sc) in same ch, *skip next 2 ch, V-st in next
ch; repeat from * across.
Rows 8–12: Repeat Rows 2–6.
Fringe
Cut two 16” (40.5 cm) lengths of each color 
to match tails at ends of rows. Thread yarn 
through sc at end of each row and tie in an 
overhand knot. Cut and thread an additional 
length of A through end of row with no 
beginning tail. Comb out and cut fringe to 
desired length, then tie a tight knot at end of 
each fringe to prevent fraying. If desired, do 
not tie a knot at end of fringe; instead, apply 
fabric sealant to each end.
CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Fur™: 4 balls 9701 Azalea A, 2 balls 9012 Slate B
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Finished Size: 8” [20.5 cm] wide x 56” [142 cm] long
gauge: 3 dc = 4” [10 cm]; 2 rows = 4” [10 cm] in pattern stitch. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: With A, ch 14. Foundation Row: Dc in 6th ch from hook (5 skipped ch count as dc and ch 1), *skip next ch, ch 1, dc in next ch; repeat from * across. Row 1: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch-1 here and throughout), turn, dc in next dc, *ch 1, dc in next dc; repeat from * across – 6 dc and 5 ch-1 spaces. Rows 2-4: Repeat Row 1. Cut A and join B. With B, repeat Row 1 for 4 rows. Cut B and join A. With A, repeat Row 1 for 4 rows. Cut A and join B. Repeat last 8 rows until piece measures 56” [142 cm] or desired length. Fasten off. FINISHING Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver Ombre™: 2 skeins 3985 Deep Teal
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 10" [25.5 cm] wide x 90" [229 cm] long.
gauge: 5 stitch repeats = 4" [10 cm]; 10 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pattern stitch. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PATTERN STITCH
Pattern Stitch (multiple of 3 ch + 2)
Foundation Row: Work (sc, ch 2, sc) in 3rd ch from hook, *skip next 2 ch, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch; repeat from * across to last ch, hdc in last ch.
Row 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), turn, *3 dc in next ch-2 space (Shell made); repeat from * across, dcin top of turning ch.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), turn, *(sc, ch 2, sc) in 2nd dc of next Shell; repeat from * across, hdc in top of turning ch.
Repeat Rows 1-2 for Pattern st.
SCARF
Ch 41.
Beginning with Foundation Row, work in Pattern st until piece measures 90" [229 cm] from beginning.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique™ Treasure™: 2 balls 1901 Mosaic.
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Scarf measures 6½” wide and 66” long, not including edging.
gauge: 18 sts = 4” in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCARF
First Half
Ch 31.
Foundation Row: Dc in 5th ch from hook (beginning ch counts as first dc), ch 1, skip next ch, dc in next ch, ch 1, skip next ch, (dc, ch 3, dc) in next ch, [ch 1, skip next ch, dc in next ch] 3 times, ch 1, skip next ch, 2 dc in next ch, [ch 1, skip next ch, dc in next ch] 3 times, ch 1, skip next ch, (dc, ch 3, dc) in next ch, [ch 1, skip next ch, dc in next ch] 2 times, skip next ch, dc in last ch, turn—18 dc, 2 ch-3 spaces, and 12 ch-1 spaces.
Row 1: Ch 3, skip first 2 dc, skip next ch-1 space, dc in next dc, dc in next ch-1 space, dc in next dc, (2 dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in next ch-3 space, [dc in next dc, dc in next ch-1 space] 3 times, dc in next dc, skip next ch-1 space, skip next 2 dc, skip next ch-1 space, [dc in next dc, dc in next ch-1 space] 3 times, dc in next dc, (2 dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in next ch-3 space, dc in next dc, dc in next ch-1 space, dc in next dc, skip next ch-1 space, skip next dc, dc in top of beginning ch, turn—30 dc, and 2 ch-3 spaces.
Row 2: Ch 3, skip first 3 dc, dc in next dc, ch 1, skip next dc, dc in next dc, ch 1, (dc, ch 3, dc) in next ch-3 space, ch 1, [dc in next dc, ch 1, skip next dc] 3 times, dc in next dc, skip next 4 dc, [dc in next dc, ch 1, skip next dc] 3 times, dc in next dc, ch 1, (dc, ch 3, dc) in next ch-3 space, ch 1, dc in next dc, ch 1, skip next dc, dc in next dc, skip next 2 dc, dc in top of beginning ch, turn—18 dc, 2 ch-3 spaces, and 12 ch-1 spaces.
Repeat last 2 rows until piece measures about 33” from beginning, end with a Row 2. Do not fasten off.
Second Half
Row 1: Work Row 1 of first half.
Row 2: Work Row 2 of first half.
Rows 3–6: Ch 3, skip first 2 dc, skip next ch-1 space, dc in next dc, ch 1, skip next ch-1 space, dc in next dc, ch 1, (dc, ch 3, dc) in next ch-3 space, ch 1, [dc in next dc, ch 1, skip next ch-1 space] 3 times, dc in next dc, skip next ch-1 space, skip next 2 dc, skip next ch-1 space, [dc in next dc, ch 1, skip next ch-1 space] 3 times, dc in next dc, ch 1, (dc, ch 3, dc) in next ch-3 space, ch 1, dc in next dc, ch 1, skip next ch-1 space, dc in next dc, skip next ch-1 space, skip next dc, dc in top of beginning ch, turn.
Repeat last 6 rows until piece measures about 66” from beginning, end with a Row 2. Do not fasten off.
FINISHING
Edging: [Ch 10, sc in next dc, ch 10, sc in next ch-1 space] 2 times, ch 10, sc in next dc, ch 10, (sc, ch 10, sc) in next ch-3 space, [ch 10, sc in next dc, ch 10, sc in next ch-1 space] 4 times, [ch 10, sc in next dc] 2 times, [ch 10, sc in next ch-1 space, ch 10, sc in next dc] 4 times, ch 10, (sc, ch 10, sc) in next ch-3 space, [ch 10, sc in next dc, ch 10, sc in next ch-1 space] 2 times, ch 10, sc in next dc, ch 10, sc in top of beginning ch. Fasten off. Working across opposite side of foundation ch, join yarn with sc in first ch, *ch 10, sc in next ch; repeat from * across foundation ch. Fasten off.
Weave in ends.

abbreviations: [] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Scarf measures 6” wide x 56” long.
gauge: Gauge is unimportant for this project and varies depending on which section of yarn is in use.
instructions:
first Half
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 14; sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 13 sc.
Row 2: Beg shell in first sc, [ch 3, skip next 5 sc, shell in next sc] twice; turn – 3 shells.
Rows 3 and 4: Ch 1, skip first dc, slip st in next dc and into ch-2 space, beg shell in same space, [ch 3, shell in ch-2 space of next shell] twice; turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, skip first dc, slip st in next dc and into ch-2 space, beg shell in same space, ch 3, 6 dc in ch-2 space of next shell, ch 3, shell in ch-2 space of last shell; turn.
Row 6: Ch 1, skip first dc, slip st in next dc and into ch-2 space, beg shell in same space, ch 3, dc in next dc, [ch 1, dc in next dc] 5 times, ch 3, shell in ch-2 space of last shell; turn.
Row 7: Ch 1, skip first dc, slip st in next dc and into ch-2 space, beg shell in same space, ch 3, [sc in next dc, ch 3] 6 times, shell in ch-2 space of last shell; turn.
Row 8: Ch 1, skip first dc, slip st in next dc and into ch-2 space, beg shell in same space, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, [sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3] 5 times, shell in ch-2 space of last shell; turn.
Row 9: Ch 1, skip first dc, slip st in next dc and into ch-2 space, beg shell in same space, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, [sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3] 4 times, shell in ch-2 space of last shell; turn.
Row 10: Ch 1, skip first dc, slip st in next dc and into ch-2 space, beg shell in same space, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, [sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3] 3 times, shell in ch-2 space of last shell; turn.
Row 11: Ch 1, skip first dc, slip st in next dc and into ch-2 space, beg shell in same space, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, [sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3] twice, shell in ch-2 space of last shell; turn.
Row 12: Ch 1, skip first dc, slip st in next dc and into ch-2 space, beg shell in same space, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, shell in next ch-3 space, ch-3, shell in ch-2 space of last shell; turn.
Rows 13-32: Repeat Rows 3-12 twice more.
Rows 33 and 34: Repeat Rows 3 and 4 once more. Fasten off.
Second Half
Rows 1-33: Work same as Rows 1-33 of First Half.
Joining Row 34: Ch 1, skip first dc, slip st in next dc and into ch-2 space, joining beg shell in same space, [ch 3, joining shell in next shell] twice. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: Patons® Lace™ (3 oz/85 g; 498 yds/455 m) Dove Grey (33044) 2 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Puff st = (Yoh and draw up a long loop) 3 times in next chain or space. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 9" x 120" [23 x 305 cm].
gauge: 16 sc and 18 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
INSTRUCTIONS
Note: First round of Scarf (Foundation rnd) is worked in the rnd. Remainder of scarf is worked in rows.
Ch 43.
Foundation rnd: [(Puff st. Ch 3) twice. Puff st] in 7th ch from hook. Ch 1. Skip next 3 ch.
*1 dc in next ch. Ch 1. Skip next 3 ch. [(Puff st. Ch 3) twice. Puff st] in next ch. Ch 1.
Skip next 3 ch. Rep from * to last ch. Ch 3. Sl st in last ch. Working across opposite side of foundation ch, ch 3. *Skip next 3 ch.
[(Puff st. Ch 3) twice. Puff st] in next ch. Ch 1. Skip next 3 ch. 1 dc in next ch. Rep from *, ending last rep with 1 dc in 3rd ch of beg ch 7. Turn.
Beg working in rows as follows:
1st row: (WS). Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch 1). 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. 1 dc in next dc. *Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. 1 dc in next d. Rep from * to end of row, working last dc in top of ch-3. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). *[(Puff st. Ch 3) twice. Puff st] in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Rep from *, ending last rep with 1 dc in 3rd ch of ch 4. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for pat until work from beg measures 120" [305 cm], ending with a RS row.
Fasten off.

materials: 1 skein 1621 Evergreen of RED HEART® With Love®
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 8” (20 cm) x 72” (183 cm).
gauge: 4 pattern repeats = 8” [20 cm]. Exact gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Ch 26.
Row 1: (Right Side) Sc in 2nd ch from hook, * ch 1, skip 3 ch, shell in next ch, ch 1, skip 3 ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * across, turn.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in first sc, * ch 2, skip 2 ch-1 spaces, (sc, ch 1, sc) in center ch-1 space of shell, ch 2, skip next 2 ch-1 spaces, v-st in next sc; repeat from * across to last shell, ch 2, skip 2 ch-1 spaces, (sc, ch 1, sc) in center ch-1 space of shell, ch 2, skip next 2 ch-1 spaces, 2 dc in last sc, turn.
Row 3: Ch 3, (dc, ch 1, dc) in 1st dc, ch 1, * skip ch-2 space, sc in center of next (sc, ch 1, sc) space, ch 1, skip ch-2 space, shell in center of next v-st, ch 1; repeat from * across to last (sc, ch 1, sc) group, sc in center of last (sc, ch 1, sc) group, ch 1, skip ch-2 space, (dc, ch 1, 2 dc) in top of turning ch, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, 2 sc in 1st dc, * ch 2, skip next 2 ch-1 spaces, v-st in next sc, ch 2, skip next 2 ch-1 spaces, (sc, ch 1, sc) in center ch-1 space of shell; repeat from * across to last sc, v-st in last sc, ch 2, skip next 2 ch-1 spaces, 2 sc in top of turning ch, turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in 1st sc, * ch 1, skip next ch-2 space, shell in center of next v-st, ch 1, skip next ch-2 space, sc in center ch-1 space of next (sc, ch 1, sc) group; repeat from * across to last v-st, ch 1, shell in center of v-st, ch 1, skip next ch-2 space, sc in last sc, turn.
Repeat Rows 2-5 until piece measures 72” (183 cm) or desired length, ending with a Row 2.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in all loose ends. Wash and lay flat to block.

materials: RED HEART® With Love Chunky™: 3 skeins 1803 Blue Hawaii
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5 mm [US I-9]
4" [10 cm] x 7" [18 cm] piece of cardboard
measurements: Scarf measures 7½" [19 cm] x 74" [188 cm] long, excluding fringe.
gauge: 9 sts = 4" [10 cm]; 6 rows = 4" [10 cm] in rib st. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCARF
Ch 166.
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook (skipped 3 ch count as first dc), dc in each ch across – 164 sts.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first st here and throughout), turn, working in horizontal bar of each st across, dc in horizontal bar of each dc across.
Rows 3-12: Repeat Row 2.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.
Tassel Fringe (make 8)
Cut 16 lengths of yarn, each 10" [26 cm] long, and set aside for Ties. Wrap yarn around 7" [18 cm] cardboard 14 times. Slip one Tie around all strands at upper edge of cardboard. Pull tightly and knot securely near strands. Cut yarn loops at lower edge of cardboard. Wrap second Tie tightly around loops 1" [2.5 cm] below top knot to form Tassel neck. Knot securely; thread ends onto needle and weave ends to center of Tassel. Trim Tassel ends evenly.
Repeat to make 8 Tassels. Tie four Tassels evenly spaced along each short end of Scarf.

materials: Patons® Classic Wool Worsted™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 210 yds/192 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 8" [20.5 cm] wide x 59" [150 cm] long, excluding fringe.
gauge: Motif = 3½" [9 cm] square.
instructions:
Motif
With Color 1, chain (ch) 4. Join with slip stitch (sl st) to first ch to form ring.
1st round (rnd): Ch 3 [counts as double crochet (dc)]. 2 dc in ring. (Ch 1. 3 dc) 3 times in ring. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off.
2nd rnd: Join Color 2 with sl st to any ch-1 space (sp). Ch 3 (counts as dc). (2 dc. Ch 1. 3 dc) in same ch-1 sp as last sl st. [(Ch 1. 3 dc. Ch 1. 3 dc) in next ch-1 sp] 3 times. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off.
3rd rnd: Join Color 3 with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). (2 dc. Ch 1. 3 dc) in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 1. 3 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * twice more. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off.
Make 17 Motifs using A as Color 1, C as Color 2 and B as Color 3.
Make 17 Motifs, using B as Color 1, C as Color 2 and A as Color 3.
Join Motifs into 2 strips of 17 Motifs per strip, alternating colors as shown in picture.
FINISHING
Join C with sl st to any corner ch-1 sp of Scarf. Ch 1. Work 1 single crochet (sc) in each dc and ch-1 sp around outer edge, working 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Fringe: Cut 18" [45.5 cm] lengths of each color. Taking 2 strands of each color together (tog), knot into fringe evenly spaced along top and bottom of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Sashay Mini™: 1 ball 2725 Sorbet
measurements: Scarf measures 60” x 2” (152.4 x 5.1) cm
gauge: GAUGE is not important for this project
instructions:
You will be using the edge with the larger mesh holes and inserting your crochet hook through the holes. The edge with the smaller holes becomes the ruffle.
Step 1: Starting 3” (7.6 cm) from end, insert hook through 1st hole from back to front; skip 2 holes and insert hook again. Repeat for 3rd and 4th holes skipping 2 holes each time. You now have 4 holes on the hook.
Step 2: Pinching together all four holes on the hook with left forefinger and thumb, insert hook from front to back into 5th hole and pull through all holes on hook.
Repeat Steps 1 and 2 with each group of 5 holes. If you put your work down, be sure to put a stitch holder or safety pin on the working stitch. This holder needs to be larger than the hole so that your work will not fall apart.
Continue until 60” (152.4 cm) long or length desired; cut 3” (7.6 cm) from hook. Pull end through last stitch and tighten. Turn under ends and sew with needle and thread to secure to inside of ruffle. Shake out your scarf so that ruffles spiral.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft Stripes™ (4 oz/113 g; 194 yds/177 m) Main Color (MC) Martha’s Vineyard (14008) 1 ball
Caron® Simply Soft™ (6 oz/170 g; 315 yds/288 m) Contrast A Off White (39702) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 10" [25.5 cm] wide x 66" [167.5 cm] long.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st. 
With MC, ch 39. 
1st row: 2 dc in 3rd ch from hook. *1 dc in 
each of next 4 ch. Yoh and draw up a loop 
in next ch. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on 
hook. Skip next ch or st. Yoh and draw up a 
loop in next ch. Yoh and draw through 2 loops 
on hook. Yoh and draw through all loops on 
hook – cluster made. 1 dc in each of next  
4 ch. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in nex t ch. Rep from * 
once more. 1 dc in each of next 4 ch. Cluster 
over next 3 ch. 1 dc in each of next 4 ch. 2 dc 
in last ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 2 dc in first dc. *1 dc in each 
of next 4 dc. Cluster over next 3 sts. 1 dc in 
each of next 4 dc. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next 
ch-1 sp. Rep from * once more. 1 dc in each 
of next 4 dc. Cluster over next 3 sts. 1 dc in 
each of next 4 dc. 2 dc in last dc. Turn.
3rd and 4th rows: Rep 2nd row. Change to A. 
5th to 10th rows: With A, rep 2nd row.
11th to 14th rows: With MC, rep 2nd row.
Rep 5th to 14th rows for Chevron Stripe Pat 
until Scarf measures approx 66" [167.5 cm], 
ending on a 14th row. Fasten off.

abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Scarf measures 16.5 cm [6½”] x 68.5 cm [27”].
gauge: cm [4”]; 16 rows = 10 cm [4”] in double crochet. CHECK YOUR TENSION/GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the tension/gauge.
instructions:
Ch 26.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Dc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 25 dc.
Row 2 (Right Side): Ch 1, dc in first 3 dc, [ch 5, skip next 3 dc, dc in next 5 dc] twice, ch 5, skip next 3 dc, dc in last 3 dc; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, dc in first 2 dc, [ch 3, dc in next ch-5 space, ch 3, skip next dc, dc in next 3 dc] twice, ch 3, dc in ch-5 space, ch 3, skip next dc, dc in last 2 dc; turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, dc in first dc, [ch 3, dc in next ch-3 space, dc in next dc, dc in next space, ch 3, skip next dc, dc in next dc] 3 times; turn.
Row 5: Ch 5 (counts as tr and ch 2), dc in next space, dc in next 3 dc, dc in space, [ch 5, dc in next space, dc in next 3 dc, dc in next space] twice, ch 2, tr in last dc; turn.
Row 6: Ch 1, dc in tr, ch 3, skip next dc, dc in next 3 dc, [ch 3, dc in next space, ch 3, skip next dc, dc in next 3 dc] twice, ch 3, dc in 3rd ch of ch-5; turn.
Row 7: Ch 1, dc in first dc, dc in space, ch 3, skip next dc, dc in next dc, [ch 3, dc in next space, dc in next dc, dc in next space, ch 3, skip next dc, dc in next dc] twice, ch 3, dc in space, dc in last dc; turn.
Row 8: Ch 1, dc in first 2 dc, [dc in next space, ch 5, dc in next space, dc in next 3 dc] twice, d in next space, ch 5, dc in next space, dc in last 2 dc; turn.
Repeat Rows 3-8 eleven times more or to desired length.
Next Row: Ch 1, dc in each st across and work 3 dc in each ch-5 space; turn – 25 dc.
Edging
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, dc in each st across; turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, dc in first dc, * ch 3, skip next dc, dc in next dc; repeat from * across. Fasten off.
With right side facing, attach yarn on opposite side and repeat Rows 1 and 2 of edging. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Sew on button to desired location, using ch-space as buttonhole.

materials: 2 skeins 4147 Calm Stripe of RED HEART® Super Saver®
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
