measurements: Scarf measures 7” (17.75 cm) wide x 72” (183 cm) long, excluding fringe
gauge: 13 sts = 4” [10 cm]; 9 rows = 4” [10 cm] in half double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
SCARF
Ch 24.
Row 1: Hdc in 3nd ch from hook and in each ch across – 22 hdc.
Row 2 (Right Side): Ch 2 (counts as hdc), skip 1st hdc, hdc in next hdc and in each hdc across, turn.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 72” (183 cm) from beginning edge.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
With yarn needle, weave in all loose ends.
Fringe 
Cut ninety 10” (25.5 cm) lengths of yarn. Divide into 18 groups of 5 strands each.
Using waste yarn, mark the position where each fringe group should be attached to the scarf, spacing the fringe groups evenly along the short ends of the scarf. 
*Fold one group of strands in half, forming a loop. Draw the center of a fringe group through the end of the scarf at a marked position, using the crochet hook if desired. Thread fringe tails through the loop and tighten to secure. Repeat from * until you have nine groups of fringe on each end of the scarf. Trim fringe ends evenly.
Steam lightly to block if desired.

materials: Patons® Peak™ (3.2 oz/90 g; 190 yds/174 m) Imperial Blue (21007) 1 ball
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 7" x 60" [18 x 152.5 cm] including fringe.
gauge: 11 sc and 13 rows= 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Scarf is worked lengthwise.
Ch 165. Mark every 50th ch for easier count -ing.
1st row: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 19 ch. Ch 2 (does not count as st). *1 dc in each of next 4 ch. Ch 16. Skip next 16 ch. Rep from * to last 4 ch. 1 dc in each of last 4 ch. Ch 21. Turn.
2nd row: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 19 ch. Ch 2 (does not count as st). *1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Ch 16. Skip next 16-ch sp. Rep from * to last 4 dc. 1 dc in each of last 4 dc. Ch 21. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 7" [18 cm].
Next row: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 19 ch. Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Boutique Filigree™: 1 ball 9935 Bordeaux
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5 mm (US I-9)
measurements: Scarf Measures 36” x 4” (94.4 x 10 cm)
gauge: Gauge is not important to this project.
instructions:
SCARF 
Leaving a 6” (15 cm) end, chain 150 going into every other loop. Turn.
Row 1: Slip st into 2nd ch from hook. Continue to slip st until you reach the end of the row. Turn.
Repeat Row 1. 
FINISHING
At the end of the scarf, trim the yarn to 6” (15 cm) and tuck the loose end between the ruffles. Using sewing needle and matching thread, tack the end of scarf in place. Repeat for the beginning of scarf.

materials: RED HEART® Chunky Soft™: 2 balls each 9520 Seafoam A and 4929 Chianti D and 1 ball each 4601 Off White B and 4405 Steel C
Large eye plastic or yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
measurements: Scarf measures 9½” x 72½” (24 x 184 cm), excluding fringe.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
What you will need:
If you are learning to crochet or just want to relax while you crochet a new scarf, this is the perfect pattern. The slightly thicker weight of this yarn makes it quicker to make and has a modern look.

Note:
To change color, work last stitch of old color to last yarn over. Yarn over with new color and draw through all loops on hook to complete stitch. Proceed with new color. Cut old color.

SCARF
With A, ch 152.
Row 1 (right side): Dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch count as first dc) and in each ch across, turn—150 sts.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in each st across; change to B, turn.
Row 3: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), hdc in each st across; change to C, turn.
Rows 4 and 5: Repeat Row 3; change to D at end of Row 5.
Rows 6–8: Repeat Row 2; change to B at end of Row 8.
Row 9: Repeat Row 3; change to A.
Row 10 and 11: Repeat Row 2; change to C at end of Row 11.
Row 12: Repeat Row 3; change to B.
Row 13 and 14: Repeat Row 3; change to D at end of Row 14.
Row 15 and 16: Repeat Row 2; change to A at end of Row 16.
Row 17: Repeat Row 2; change to C.
Rows 18 and 19: Repeat Row 3.
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Weave in ends.

Fringe
Cut 38 strands of each color, each 13” (33 cm) long. Hold 1 strand of each color together and fold in half to form a loop. Insert crochet hook from wrong side through end of first row. Place fold on hook and draw fold through, forming a loop. Thread ends of strands through loop and pull to tighten. Repeat to attach fringe in end of every row across both short edges of scarf. Trim ends evenly.

materials: RED HEART® “Curly Q™”: 3 balls 7958 Totally Teal
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Scarf measures 8 wide x 60” long
gauge: 10 sts and 4 rows = 4” in pattern st
instructions:
SCARF
Ch 23.
Row 1: (2 tr, ch 1, dc) in 4th ch from hook; *skip next 3 ch, (2 tr, ch 1, dc) in next ch; repeat from * across to last 3 ch, skip next 2 ch, tr in last ch; turn – 5 shells.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc), (2 tr, ch 1, dc) in each ch-1 space across, skip next 2 tr, tr in beginning ch-3, turn.
Repeat row 2 until scarf measures 60” long. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. For fringe, locate 6 spaces between clusters along beginning edge. Cut 3 strands of yarn, 24” long. Fold strands in half and pull through first space from front to back; bring cut ends through fold and tighten to form fringe. Repeat for other 5 spaces. Trim ends of fringe even. Repeat for other end of scarf.

materials: Red Heart™ Heat Wave™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 198 yds/181 m)
Sizes U.S. H/8 (5 mm) and U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook).
Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
measurements: Approx 10" [25.5 cm] wide x 80" [203.5 cm] long, excluding fringe.
gauge: 14 sts and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook in Seed St Pat.
instructions:
With smaller hook and A, ch 37.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 35 dc.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). Dcfp around next st. *Dcbp around next st. Dcfp around next st. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). Dcbp around next st. *Dcfp around next st. Dcbp around next st. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows Ribbing until work from beg measures 4" [10 cm], ending on a WS row and joining B to last st. Break A.
Change to larger hook. Next row: (RS). With B, ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 1. Skip next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for Seed St Pat until work from beg measures 10" [25.5 cm], ending on a WS row and joining C to last st. Break B.
With C, cont in Seed St Pat until work from beg measures 12" [30.5 cm], ending on a WS row and joining A to last st. Break C.
With A, cont in Seed St Pat until work from beg measures 20" [51 cm], ending on a WS row and joining C to last st. Break A.
With C, cont in Seed St Pat until work from beg measures 22" [56 cm], ending on a WS row and joining B to last st. Break C.
With B, cont in Seed St Pat until work from beg measures 58" [147.5 cm], ending on a WS row and joining C to last st. Break B.
With C, cont in Seed St Pat until work from beg measures 60" [152.5 cm], ending on a WS row and joining A to last st. Break C.
With A, cont in Seed St Pat until work from beg measures 68" [173 cm], ending on a WS row and joining C to last st. Break A.
With C, cont in Seed St Pat until work from beg measures 70" [178 cm], ending on a WS row and joining B to last st. Break C.
With B, cont in Seed St Pat until work from beg measures 76" [193 cm], ending on a WS row and joining A to last st. Break B.
Change to smaller hook.
Next row: (RS). With A, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each sc and ch-1 sp to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). Dcfp around next st. *Dcbp around next st. Dcfp around next st. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). Dcbp around next st. *Dcfp around next st. Dcbp around next st. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows Ribbing until work from beg measures 80" [203.5 cm], ending on a WS row.
Fasten off.
Fringe
Cut strands of all shades 16" [40.5 cm] long. Taking 1 strand of A, B and C tog, fold in half and knot into fringe evenly spaced across ends of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m) Mango (9605) 2 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 8½" x 70" [21.5 x 178 cm], (excluding fringe).
gauge: 13 single crochet (sc) and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Chain 31.
1st row: (Right side). 2 double crochet (2 dc) in 5th chain (ch) from hook (turning chain 3 counts as dc). *Skip next chain. 2 double crochet in next chain. Repeat from * to last 2 chains. Skip next chain. 1 double crochet in last chain. Turn.
2nd row: Chain 3 (counts as dc). *2 double crochet in space (sp) between next group of 2 double crochet. Repeat from * across, ending with 1 double crochet in top of turning chain 3. Turn.
Repeat last row until Scarf measures 70" [178 cm]. Fasten off.
Fringe: Cut 16" [40.5 cm] lengths of yarn. Taking 3 strands together, fold strands in half and knot into 10 fringes evenly spaced across each end of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein 319 Cherry Red
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 7” (18 cm) wide x 60” (152.5 cm) long.
gauge: 12 sts = 4” (10 cm); 10 rows = 4” (10 cm) in pattern.
instructions:
Ch 22.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, *dc in next ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * across – 21 sts.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc), turn, *sc in next dc, dc in next sc; repeat from * across.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in first dc, *dc in next sc, sc in next dc; repeat from * across (working the last sc in the top of the turning ch-3).
Repeat Rows 2 and 3 until piece measures about 60” (152.5 cm) from beginning, or desired length.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in all ends.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Fleecy™: 1 ball 9933 Berry Graphic
measurements: Scarf Measures: 50” (127 cm) long X 3” (7.6 cm) wide
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com
©2014 Coats & Clark
RedHeart.com
Page 1 of 1
Add a little fleece and glamor to your look with this amazing ruffling yarn. You just need one ball to crochet this fabulous scarf!
Note
This scarf is very easy to unravel. To save yourself from disappointment, have a safety pin at hand. Whenever you want to put down your project, pin the last stitch so it will not unravel next time you pick it up.
SCARF
Beginning 6” (15 cm) from the raw edge, insert hook into the top hole of the ribbon. (Skip the next hole, ch1) 5 times. 
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook. Place a marker on the first sc. Sc in each of next 3 ch. Ch1. Turn.
Row 2: Sc in each sc across. Place marker on first sc. Ch1, turn.
Repeat row 2 for desired length, leaving a 6” (15 cm) tail.
Finishing
Thread the sewing needle and stitch through the last loop of the last row, securing it in place. Tuck the loose end between the nearest two ruffles and sew it in place. Repeat for other end, securing first loop and beginning end.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Contrast B Dark Country Blue (9711) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 9" x 66" [23 x 167.5 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 13 hdc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.
To join colors, work to last 3 loops on hook at end of row. Draw new color through rem loops and proceed with new color.
With B, ch 32.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 30 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row working in Stripe Pat as follows: 
3rd to 6th rows: With B, joining C at end of last row.
7th row: With C, joining B at end of row.
8th to 13th rows: With B, joining C at end of last row.
14th to 34th rows: Rep 7th to 13th rows 3 times more. 
35th row: With C, joining A at end of row.
36th to 41st rows: With A, joining C at end of last row.
42nd row: With C, joining A at end of row.
Rep 36th to 42nd rows until work from beg measures approx 66" [167.5 cm], ending on a C row.
Next 6 rows: With B, joining C at end of last row.
Next row: With C, joining B at end of row.
Rep last 7 rows 4 times more.
Next 6 rows: With B. 
Fasten off.
Fringe: Cut strands of A and C 16" [40.5 cm] long. Taking 2 strands of each tog (4 strands total) fold in half and knot into fringe across both ends of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® Color Block™ (10 oz/283 g; 482 yds/440 m) Liquid Teal (9501) 1 ball
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Split sc = Split single crochet: work sc between ‘legs’ of stitch (splitting stitch) instead of through top loops
measurements: Approx 10" [25.5 cm] deep x 24" [61 cm] around.
gauge: 9 split sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Ch 58. Join in rnd with sl st in first ch, taking care not to twist chain.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 split sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 10" [25.5 cm]. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Dreamy Stripes™: 3 balls 9378 Ethereal
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6 mm [US J-10].
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 16" x 75", including Border.
gauge: 4 pattern repeats = 3" (10 cm) (one pattern repeat consists of 2 double crochet and 1 chain-2 space); 8 rows = 5" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
LACE
If you look closely you can see the little hearts in the stitch pattern. This makes it the perfect scarf to make when you want to include a subtle expression of love along with your hand-crocheted gift.

SCARF
First Half
Ch 55.
Row 1 (right side): Dc in 4th ch from hook and in next ch, *ch 2, skip next 2 ch, dc in next ch; repeat from * across to last 2 ch, dc in last 2 ch, turn—21 dc and 16 ch-2 spaces.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in next 2 dc, *ch 2, dc in next dc, 4 dc in next dc, dc in next dc; repeat from * across to last 3 dc, ch 2, d in next 2 dc, dc in top of beginning ch, turn—36 dc.
Row 3: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, *ch 2, dc in next 6 dc; repeat from * across to last 3 dc, ch 2, dc in next 2 dc, dc in top of beginning ch, turn.
Row 4: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, *ch 2, dc3tog, ch 3, dc3tog; repeat from * across to last 3 dc, ch 2, dc in next 2 dc, dc in top of beginning ch, turn—16 dc, 6 ch-2 spaces, and 5 ch-3 spaces.
Row 5: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, *ch 2, dc in next dc, ch 2, dc in ch-3 space, ch 2, dc in next dc; repeat from * across to last 3 dc, ch 2, dc in next 2 dc, dc in top of beginning ch, turn—21 dc and 16 ch-2 spaces.
Rows 6–61: Repeat Rows 2–5.
Fasten off.

2nd Half
Row 1: With right side of First Half facing and working in opposite side of foundation ch, join yarn with slip st, ch 3, dc in next 2 ch, *ch 2, dc in next ch, 4 dc in next ch, dc in next ch; repeat from * across to last 3 ch, ch 2, dc in next 3 ch,
turn—36 dc.
Rows 2–4: Repeat Rows 3–5 of First Half.
Rows 5–60: Repeat Rows 2–5 of First Half.
Fasten off.

Border
Round 1: With right side of either long edge facing and working in ends of rows, join yarn in first row, ch 5 (counts as dc, ch 2), dc in same row (corner made), *(ch 2, dc) in each row across to last row, (dc, ch 2, dc) in last row (corner made), working across short edge, (ch 2, dc) in each ch-2 space across; working in other long edge, repeat from * around; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch—4 corner ch-2 spaces.
Round 2: Slip st in first corner ch-2 space, ch 1, *3 sc in same space, (2 sc, picot) in each ch-2 space around to next corner ch-2 space; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Lightly block to finished measurements.

materials: STITCH NATION by Debbie Stoller™ “ Alpaca Love™”: 2 balls 3620 Fern A, 1 ball each 3520 Peacock Feather B, 3920 Ruby C, 3580 Dusk D, and 3650 Lotus E.
abbreviations: A, B, etc. = color A, B. etc.
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Scarf measures 68” long.
gauge: Gauge is not important for this project.
instructions:
MSL (Small Leaf)
Row 1: With A, ch 8; slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, hdc in next ch, dc in next 2 ch, hdc in next ch, slip st in last ch; turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, skip slip st, sc in next 5 sts, 3 sc in tip, 5 sc on opposite side of ch, slip st in last ch.
MLL (Make Large Leaf)
Rows 1 and 2: Make same as Small Leaf; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, skip slip st, sc in next 6 sts, 3 sc in next st, sc in next 6 sts, slip st in next st; turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in next 7 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 8 sts.
GarlaNd
With A ch 243.
Round 1: Slip st in 2nd ch from hook, * MSL, at end of Row 2 of leaf, slip st in next 10 ch of original ch, MSL, slip st in next 10 ch, MLL **, slip st in next 10 ch; repeat from * to last ch; (MSL, MLL) all in last ch, working on opposite side of ch, slip st in next 5 ch; repeat from * across opposite side of ch to last 6 ch, end at **; slip st in next 5 ch, MLL in last ch. Fasten off.
Flower (Make 5 each B and E, and 4 each C and D)
Round 1: Ch 10, 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each rem ch to last ch; 6 sc in last ch; working behind curl, join with a slip st to first of the 6 sc at end of Round 1 – 6 sc upon which remainder of flower will be worked. Free “curl” becomes the flower center.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in same ch as joining and in each of the next 5 sc; join with a slip st in front loop of first sc -12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 2, 2 dc in same loop as joining, * (2 dc, ch 2, slip st) all in next front loop **, (slip st, ch 2, 2 dc) all in next front loop; repeat from * around, end at **; slip st in first slip st – 6 petals.
Round 4: Ch 2, keeping flower to front, slip st in first back loop, ch 1, sc in same loop, 2 sc in next back loop, * sc in next back loop, 2 sc in next back loop; repeat from * around; join to first sc – 18 sc.
Round 5: * Ch 2, [2 dc in next sc] twice, ch 2, slip st in next sc; repeat from * around, ending slip st in first slip st. Fasten off.
FiNishiNG
Sew flowers to garland in random order. Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Chic Sheep by Marly Bird™: 2 balls 5316 Linen A, and 1 ball each 5327 Mai Tai B, 5693 Poolside C, 5687 VIP D, 5254 Sunset E, and 5681 Suite F
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Scarf measures 11 x 81" (28 x 206 cm)
gauge: 2 repeats and 9 rows = 4" (10 cm) in Scarf pattern, after blocking. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With A, ch 44 (multiple of 8 plus 4).
Row 1 (right side): Skip 3 ch (counts as 1 dc), 2 dc in 4th ch from hook, skip 3 ch, sc in next ch, * skip next 3 ch, 5 dc in next ch, skip next 3 ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * to last 4 ch, skip next 3 ch, 3 dc in last ch, turn.
Change to B.
Row 2: Ch 1, * sc in first dc, ch 3, dc5tog over next 5 sts, ch 3, sc in next dc; repeat from * to end, turn.
Row 3: Ch 3 (counts as 1 dc here and throughout), 2 dc in first sc, sc in next dc5tog, * 5 dc in next sc, sc in next dc5tog; repeat from * to last sc, 3 dc in last sc, turn.
Change to A, and repeat Rows 2 and 3 alternately, working 2 rows each in the following color sequence:
[A, C, A, D, A, E, A, F, A, B] 4 times, [A, C] twice, [A, B, A, F, A, E, A, D, A, C] 4 times, A, B.
Work 1 more row with A - 180 total rows in scarf.
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Border
With right side facing and join A with a slip st anywhere along edge.
Round 1: Work in sc evenly around, placing 3 sc in each corner st, join with slip st in first sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, work in Crab st around, join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off.
Weave in all loose ends.

materials: Red Heart ® Roll with It Sparkle™ (5.29 oz/150 g; 561 yds/513 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dc2(3)tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 2 (3) times. Yoh and draw through all 3(4) loops on hook
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 7 x 80" [18 x 203 cm]
gauge: 13 sts and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc. Ch 4.
1st row: (RS). 2 dc in 4th ch from hook. Turn. 3 dc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first dc. 1 sc in next dc. 2 sc in last dc. Turn. 5 sc.
3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first sc. 1 dc in each sc to last sc. 2 dc in last sc. Turn. 7 dc.
4th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first dc. 1 sc in each dc to last dc. 2 sc in last dc. Turn. 9 sc.
Rep 3rd and 4th rows 7 times more. 37 sc.
Proceed as follows:
Next row: (RS). Ch 3. 1 dc in first sc. 1 dc in each sc to last 2 sc. Dc2tog. Turn. 37 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each dc to last dc. 2 sc in last dc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until scarf from beg along longest edge measures approx 80" [203 cm], ending on a WS row.
Proceed as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 3. Dc2tog. 1 dc in each sc to last 2 sts. Dc2tog. Turn. 35 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 33 sts.
Rep last 2 rows until 3 sts rem. Next row: Dc3tog. Fasten off.

abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Scarf measures 5½” x 60”.
gauge: 16 sts = 5”; 4 rows = 2½”: in pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
foundation-Row: Ch 165; sc in 5th ch from hook, [ch 3, skip next 3 ch, sc in next ch] 40 times – 41 loops. Turn.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc), (2 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) all in first ch-3 loop, * [ch 1, 3 dc in next loop] 40 times **, [ch 3, 3 dc] twice all in last loop; work on opposite side of Foundation Row, repeat from * to **; ch 3; join with a slip st in top of ch-3 – 84 groups of 3-dc.
Round 2: Slip st to next ch-3 space, (ch 3, 2 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) all in same space, ch 1, * 3 dc in next ch-1 space, ch 1; repeat from * to next ch-3 space; [(3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in next ch-3 space, ch 1] twice; repeat from * to last ch-3 space; (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in last ch-3 space, ch 1; join.
Rounds 3 and 4: Slip st to next ch-3 space, (ch 3, 2 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) all in same space, ch 1, * 3 dc in next ch-1 space, ch 1 **; repeat from * to next ch-3 space; (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in ch-3 space, ch 1; repeat from * around, end at **; join.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, sc in each dc, 5 sc in each ch-3 space, and sc in each ch-1 space around; join. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: Crochet Hook: Size I-9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook
abbreviations: FPdc (Front Post double crochet) = Yo, insert hook from front to back to front around post of indicated stitch; yo and draw up lp, [yo and draw through 2 lps on hook] twice. Skip stitch behind FPdc.

FPtr (Front Post treble crochet) = Yo twice, insert hook from front to back to front around post of indicated st; yo and draw up lp, [yo and draw through 2 lps on hook] 3 times. Skip stitch behind FPtr.
popcorn = Work 4 FPdc around indicated st; drop lp from hook, insert hook into top of first FPdc of popcorn and into dropped lp, draw dropped lp through first FPdc.
sc3tog (sc 3 sts together) = [Insert hook in next st, yo and draw up a lp] 3 times, yo and draw through all 4 lps on hook.
measurements: Finished Measurements: 6” wide x 60” long
gauge: 12 hdc and 10 rows = 4” square using size I-9 (5.5mm) crochet hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCARF
Ch 20.
Foundation Row: Hdc in 3rd ch from hook and each ch across - 18 hdc.
Row 1 (wrong side): and all odd rows Ch 2, turn, hdc in each st across.
Row 2 (right side): Ch 2, turn, hdc in first 2 hdc, FPdc around next hdc 2 rows below; hdc in next 4 hdc, sk 2 hdc, FPtr around next 2 hdc 2 rows below; working in front of previous 2 FPtr, FPtr around 2 skipped hdc 2 rows below, hdc in next 4 hdc; FPdc around next hdc 2 rows below, hdc in last 2 hdc.
Row 4: Ch 2, turn, hdc in first 2 hdc, FPdc around FPdc 2 rows below; hdc in next 3 hdc, FPtr around next 2 FPtr 2 rows below (slanted FPtr), hdc in next 2 hdc, FPtr around next 2 FPtr 2 rows below (slanted FPtr), hdc in next 3 hdc; FPdc around next FPdc 2 rows below, hdc in last 2 hdc.
Row 6: Ch 2, turn, hdc in first 2 hdc, FPdc around next FPdc 2 rows below; hdc in next 2 hdc, FPtr around next 2 FPtr 2 rows below, hdc in next 4 hdc, FPtr around next 2 FPtr 2 rows below, hdc in next 2 hdc; FPdc around next FPdc 2 rows below, hdc in last 2 hdc.
Row 8: Repeat Row 4.
Row 10: Ch 2, turn, hdc in first 2 hdc, FPdc around next FPdc 2 rows below; hdc in next 4 hdc, sk 2 FPtr 2 rows below, FPtr around next 2 FPtr 2 rows below; working in front of previous 2 FPtr, FPtr around 2 sked FPtr 2 rows below, hdc in next 4 hdc; FPdc around next FPdc 2 rows below, hdc in last 2 hdc.
Rows 11-146: Repeat Rows 3-10 seventeen times.
Row 147: Ch 2, turn, hdc in each st across.
Fasten off.
Finishing
Weave in all ends.

abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 6” wide by 64” long, blocked.
gauge: GAUGE: 13 sc = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCARF
Ch 201.
Row 1: Sc in third ch from hook and each ch across, turn – 199 sc.
Row 2: First Fan – Ch 1, sc in first 4 sc, ch 3, skip next 2 sc, sc in next sc, turn, ch 3 (counts as dc), work 6 dc in ch-3 space, slip st in sc to the left of ch-3 sp, ch 1, turn, sc in first dc, ch 3, [sc in next dc, ch 3] across next 5 dc of Fan, sc in top of beginning ch-3, ch 1, slip st in next sc after the ch-3 sp – 6 ch-3 spaces; First Fan made, *work sc in next 6 sc, Second Fan – ch 3, skip next 2 sc, sc in next sc, turn, ch 3 (counts as dc), work 6 dc in ch-3 space, slip st in sc to the left of ch-3 sp, ch 1, turn, sc in first dc, ch 3, [sc in next dc, ch 3] across next 5 dc of Fan, sc in top of beginning ch-3, ch 1, slip st in next sc after the ch-3 sp; repeat from * across, sc in each of next 3 sc, slip st in end of last sc – 22 Fans across row.
Row 3: Turn to work along opposite edge of foundation ch, ch 1, sc in each of first 4 ch sts, First Fan – ch 3, skip next 2 ch, sc in next ch, turn, ch 3 (counts as dc), work 6 dc in ch-3 space, slip st in sc to the left of ch-3 sp, ch 1, turn, sc in first dc, ch 3, [sc in next dc, ch 3] across next 5 dc of Fan, sc in top of beginning ch-3, ch 1, slip st in next sc after the ch-3 sp – 6 ch-3 spaces; First Fan made, *work sc in next 6 ch, Second Fan – ch 3, skip next 2 ch, sc in next ch, turn, ch 3 (counts as dc), work 6 dc in ch-3 space, slip st in sc to the left of ch-3 sp, ch 1, turn, sc in first dc, ch 3, [sc in next dc, ch 3] across next 5 dc of Fan, sc in top of beginning ch-3, ch 1, slip st in next sc after the ch-3 sp; repeat from * across, sc in each of last 3 ch, slip st in first st along opposite side to join – 22 Fans along opposite edge of ch; 44 Fans total.
Picot Round: Beginning in First Fan of Row 2, *ch 3, sc in first ch-3 space of Fan, (ch 5, slip st in 3rd ch from hook – first picot made, [ch 3, slip st in 3rd ch from hook] twice, slip st in same ch of first picot, ch 2 – trident picot made), [sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, work trident picot] twice, sc in last ch-3 space of Fan, ch 3, skip next 2 sc in Row 1, sc in next sc*; repeat from * to * across to last st, turn to work along opposite side; repeat from * to * across opposite side, slip st to first st to join.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Block Scarf so trident picots lie flat.

materials: Bernat® Super Value™ Ombres (5 oz/142 g; 275 yds/251 m) Main Color (MC) Indigo Go (28116) 1 ball
Bernat® Super Value™ (7 oz/197 g; 426 yds/389 m) Contrast A Teal Heather (53203) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Approx 3 yards (2.8 m) of Bernat® Super Value™ in Natural (07414) for Eyes.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left.  (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Picot = (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 sc) all in indicated stitch or space
measurements: Approx 5½" x 50" [14 x 127 cm].
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Scarf (See Chart I on page 2).
With MC, ch 23. 
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook 
(counts as 2 dc). *Skip next 3 ch. (3 dc. Ch 2. 
3 dc) in next ch. Skip next 3 ch.* 1 dc in 
each of next 3 ch. Rep from * to * once 
more. 1 dc in each of last 2 ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in next 
dc. *Ch 3. Picot in next ch-2 sp. Ch 3.* Skip 
next 3 dc. 1 dc in next dc. 1 dcbp around 
next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to * 
once more. Skip next 3 dc. 1 dc in each of 
last 2 dc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in next 
dc. *(3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in ch-3 sp of next 
picot.* 1 dc in next dc. 1 dcfp around next 
dcbp. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to * once 
more. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows for pat until Scarf 
from beg measures approx 50" [127 cm], 
ending on a 2nd row. Fasten off.
Owl (make 2). (See Chart II on page 2). 
With A, ch 4.
1st rnd: 11 dc in 4th ch from hook. Join with 
sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in same 
sp as last sl st. 2 dc in each dc around. 
Break A. Join B with sl st to top of ch 3. 
24 dc.
3rd rnd: With B, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in 
same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc
in next dc. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last 
dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 36 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 4. 1 tr in same sp as last sl st. 2 tr
in each of next 2 dc. Skip next dc. Sl st in
next dc. Skip next dc. 2 tr in each of next
2 dc. 1 tr in next dc. Ch 4. Sl st in same dc as
last tr. Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 27 dc. Join
with sl st in base of ch-4 sp.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 4 sc in side of ch-4 sp. Ch 4.
Sl st in same ch-4 sp as last sc. 1 sc in each
of next 5 tr. 1 sc in next sl st. 1 sc in each of
next 5 tr. Sl st in next ch-4 sp. Ch 4. Sl st
in same sp as last sl st. 4 sc in side of next
ch-4 sp. Join with sl st to next sc. Leave
rem sts unworked. Fasten off.
Eyes (make 4).
With A, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join 
length of Natural yarn with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: With Natural, ch 1. 2 sc in each sc 
around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Attach Eyes to Owl as shown in picture. 
With B, embroider beak using straight stitch.
Attach 1 Owl to each end of Scarf.

abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Scarf measures about 7" [18 cm] wide and 70" [178 cm] long.
gauge: 19 sts (one pattern repeat) = about 3½" [9 cm]; 15 rows = about 7" [18 cm] in pattern. GAUGE IS NOT CRITICAL FOR THIS PROJECT. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCARF
Ch 39.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across—38 sc.
Row 2: Ch 4 (counts as tr), turn, 4 tr in first st, tr in next st, [skip next st, tr in next st] 8 times, 5 tr in each of next 2 sts, tr in next st, [skip next st, tr in next st] 8 times, 5 tr in last st—38 tr (2 pattern repeats).
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across—38 sc.
Repeat Rows 2 and 3 until piece measures about 70" [178 cm].
Do not fasten off.
Side Edging
Do not turn, working along side edge, work 1 sc in end of each sc row and 4 sc in end of each tr row all the way along side edge. Fasten off.
Draw up a loop of yarn in corner at beginning of other side edge and work 1 sc in end of each sc row and 4 sc in end of each tr row all the way along side edge. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Block scarf to size.

materials: Caron® Colorama™ O’Go™ (6.4 oz/180 g; 228 yds/208 m) Baja (68013) 1 O’Go
Size U.S. J/10 [6 mm] crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
6" [15 cm] piece of cardboard for tassels.
abbreviations: Hhdc = Herringbone Half Double Crochet = Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch and through first loop on hook. Yoh and draw through last 2 loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 8" x 70" [20.5 x 178 cm] excluding tassels.
gauge: 10 hhdc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet. 
• Pull tie to remove. 
• Colors can be easily separated by gently pulling apart and cutting at the color transition. Each color is ready to use.
• Start crocheting!
CROCHET  I  SKILL LEVEL: EASY
Designate each color A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J as indicated in Materials.
Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st. 
Stripe Pat
With G, work 6 rows.
With D, work 4 rows.
With J, work 2 rows.
With I, work 6 rows.
With E, work 6 rows.
With B, Work 4 rows.
With H, work 2 rows. 
With C, work 6 rows.
With J, work 2 rows.
With F, work 4 rows.
With A, work 8 rows.
With J, work 2 rows.
With D, work 2 rows.
With E, work 8 rows.
With G, work 2 rows.
With H, work 4 rows.
With I, work 2 rows.
With F, work 6 rows.
With D, work 4 rows.
With H, work 4 rows.
With A, work 6 rows.
With I, work 4 rows.
With J, work 2 rows.
With C, work 6 rows.
With F, work 2 rows.
With H, work 4 rows.
With D, work 2 rows.
With J, work 2 rows.
With G, work 6 rows.
With I, work 2 rows.
With B, work 10 rows. 
With C, work 2 rows.
With F, work 2 rows.
With J, work 4 rows.
With D, work 2 rows.
These 140 rows complete Stripe Pat.
SCARF
With G, ch 22. 
1st row: (RS). 1 hhdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hhdc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 20 hhdc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 hhdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
First 2 rows of Stripe Pat are now complete. 
Rep 2nd row until all 140 rows of Stripe Pat are complete. Fasten off.  
Edging
1st row: (RS). Join F with sl st to any corner of Scarf. Ch 1. Work 1 row of sc evenly down long edge of Scarf. Fasten off.
Rep for opposite edge of Scarf.
Tassel (make 4)
With 1 strand of each shade held tog (10 shades total), wrap yarn around 6" [15 cm] piece of cardboard 3 times. Tie securely at one end. Cut across other end. Wrap 1 strand of C 6 times around Tassel 1½" [4 cm] from tied end. Fasten securely. Sew 1 Tassel to each corner of Scarf.

materials: RED HEART® With Love™: 1 skein each 1909 Holly Berry A, 1703 Hot Pink B, and 1907 Boysenberry C.
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 5½” x 60”.
gauge: Heart motif 5½” wide x 5” long. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCARF
Heart (Make 6 Holly Berry, 4 Boysenberry, 4 Hot Pink)
Ch 17.
Round 1: 3 Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 6 ch, skip next 2 ch, sc in next 6 ch, 3 sc in last ch; pivot to work in unused loops of beginning ch, skip first loop, sc in next 6 ch, (sc, ch 2, sc) in ch-2 space, sc in next 6 ch, skip last unused loop – 32 sc, 1 ch-2 corner space. Do not join. Mark first st of round and move up as work progresses.
Round 2: [2 Sc in next sc] 3 times, sc in next 5 sc, skip next 2 sc, sc in next 5 sc, [2 sc in next sc] 3 times, sc in next 7 sc, (sc, ch 2, sc) in ch-2 space, sc in last 7 sc – 38 sc, 1 ch-2 corner space.
Round 3: [2 Sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 3 times, sc in next 4 sc, skip next 2 sc, sc in next 5 sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 3 times, sc in next 7 sc, (sc, ch 2, sc) in ch-2 space, sc in last 8 sc – 44 sc, 1 ch-2 corner space.
Round 4: Sc in next sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 3 times, sc in next 2 sc, skip next 2 sc, sc in next 4 sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 3 times, sc in next 8 sc, (sc, ch 2, sc) in ch-2 space, sc in last 9 sc – 50 sc, 1 ch-2 corner space.
Round 5: Sc in next 2 sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc] 3 times, skip next 2 sc, sc in next 3 sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc] 3 times, sc in next 9 sc, (sc, ch 2, sc) in ch-2 space, sc in last 10 sc; slip st in next sc – 56 sc, 1 ch-2 corner space.
Fasten off. Weave in ends.
FiNiSHiNG
Make two strips of hearts of the following color sequence: Holly Berry, Boysenberry, Hot Pink, Holly Berry, Boysenberry, Hot Pink, Holly Berry. With yarn needle, working thru back loops sew lower point of one heart to center of upper heart. Then sew the two strips together by sewing top most Holly Berry Heart of each strip together at upper edges for center back neck.
RED HEART® With Love™, Art.E400 available in solid color 7 oz (198 g), 390 yd (357 m) and multi color 5 oz (141 g), 230 yd (211 m) skeins.

materials: Red Heart® With Love Stripes™ (5 oz/141 g; 223 yds/204 m) Sandbar Stripe (1975) 7 balls
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Hdcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 20" [51 cm] wide x 55" [140 cm] long (excluding fringe).
gauge: 12 sts and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pattern.
instructions:
Notes: 
• Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc.
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.
SHAWL
Ch 50. See diagram on page 2.
**1st row:  (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 49 sc.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 3. *1 dcfp around dc 2 rows below. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
5th row: As 3rd row.
6th row:  Ch 3. *1 dc in next st. 1 dcfp around dc 2 rows below. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dc in each of last 2 sts. Turn.**
Rep 3rd to 6th rows for pat until work from beg measures 55" [140 cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.

Edging
With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to bottom right corner. 
1st row:  (RS). Ch 1. Work 164 sc evenly along side edge. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd and 4th rows:  Ch 2. *1 dcfp around each st to last st. 1 hdc in last st. Turn.
5th row: Ch 2. *1 hdcbp around each st to last st. 1 hdc in last st. Fasten off.
Rep for other side.

POCKETS (make 2)
Ch 30. 
Work from ** to ** as given for Shawl.
Rep 3rd to 6th rows for pat until work from beg measures 10" [25.5 cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
Sew Pockets to either side of bottom of Shawl as shown in picture.
Fringe: Cut lengths of yarn 20" [51 cm] long. Taking 3 strands tog, knot into fringe in every other st across both ends of Shawl. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Caron® x Pantone™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 127 yds/116 m)
Size U.S. K/101/2 (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 7" x 69" [19 x 176 cm].
gauge: 11 sts and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Notes:
• Before working with Caron® x Pantone™ multi-shade yarn braid, separate each color link and wind into 5 separate balls for each braid.
• Each color link will be referenced by its Pantone™ number (see label).
• Due to finite amount of yarn in each shade, pattern gauge must be matched to ensure successful results.
• To join new color, work to last loops on hook of first color. Yoh with new color, draw through loops and proceed with new color.
Referring to Table in Materials section, with Color 1 (shown at top of left column of Table), ch 21.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 19 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sl st in first dc. *1 dc in next dc. Sl st in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. Join Color 2 (shown in right column of Table).
3rd row: With Color 2, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th row: As 2nd row.
5th row: With Color 1, as 3rd row.
6th to 8th rows: As 2nd to 4th rows.
9th to 16th rows: Rep 5th to 8th rows twice more.
These 16 rows establish pat.
**Rep these 16 rows using next pair of Color 1 and Color 2 as shown on Table, reading Table from top to bottom.**
Rep from ** to ** 5 times more. (112 rows total)
Fasten off.
Fringe: Using rem color link, cut strands of yarn 16" [40.5 cm] long. Taking 3 strands tog, fold in half and knot into fringe across ends of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 Skein 319 Cherry Red.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 4” wide x 55” long.
gauge: 16 sc = 4’ 24 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCARF
Ch 15.
Row 1: Dc in 6th ch from hook, 4 dc in same st, ch 1, skip 2 sts, dc in next st, ch 1, skip 2 sts, 5 dc in next st, ch 1, skip 2 sts, dc in last st.
Row 2: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1), turn, skip 3 dc, 5 dc in next st, ch 1, skip 2 dc, dc in next dc, ch 1, skip 2 dc, 5 dc in next dc, ch 1, dc in top of ch.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 55” from beginning. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Border
With right side facing, join yarn in edge of first row along one long edge, *[sc, ch 3, sc] in each row along long edge, turn to work along short edge, work [sc, ch 3, sc] 6 times to corner; repeat from * once more, slip st to first st to join. Fasten off.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique™ “Eclipse™”: 1 ball 9851 Tidal Wave.
Yarn needle, one 1” diameter button, sewing needle and thread.
abbreviations: *or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 6¾” x 35”.
gauge: One repeat = 3” across; 7 rows – 4” in pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Ch 24.
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook, * dc in next 3 ch, dc3tog, dc in next 3 ch **, 3 dc in next ch; repeat from * to last ch, end at **; 2 dc in last ch; turn – 2 ripples.
Row 2: Ch 3, dc in first dc, * dc in next 3 dc, dc3tog, dc in next 3 dc **, 3 dc in next dc; repeat from * to last st, end at **; 2 dc in top of ch-3; turn.
Repeat Row 2 for pattern until scarf is desired length. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew button in place about 7½” from one end and centered, or where desired. Button will slip through crocheted yarn on opposite end.

abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 9” wide x 72” long (24 x 76 cm), excluding fringe.
gauge: 7 sts = 3” (7.5 cm); 5 rows = 4” (10 cm) in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE.
instructions:
Ch 23.
Row 1 (right side): Dc in 4th ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—21 dc.
Rows 2–6: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in each dc across, turn.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in each dc across, turn—21 sc.
Row 8: Ch 4 (counts as dc, ch 1), skip next sc, dc in next sc, *ch 1, skip next sc, dc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—11 dc and 10 ch-1 spaces.
Row 9: Ch 1, sc in each dc and ch-1 space across working last sc in 3rd ch of beginning ch, turn—21 sc.
Rows 10–15: Repeat Rows 8 and 9 three times.
Rows 16–20: Repeat Rows 2–6.
Rows 21–104: Repeat Rows 7–20 six times.
Row 105: Repeat Row 2. Do not fasten off.
Edging Round: Ch 1, *working in ends of rows of long edge, sc evenly spaced across*; working in opposite side of foundation ch, 3 sc in first ch, sc in each ch across, 3 sc in last ch; repeat from * to * once; 3 sc in first dc, sc in each dc across, 3 sc in last dc; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Fringe
Wind yarn around cardboard 92 times. Cut across one end. Hold 2 strands together and fold in half to form a loop. Insert crochet hook from right side through center stitch of first 3-sc group on either short edge. Place loop on hook and draw through stitch. Thread ends of strands through loop and pull to tighten. Repeat to attach fringe in every stitch across ending in center stitch of last 3-sc group. Repeat across other edge. Trim ends evenly.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball each of 9523 Dark Leaf A, 3729 Grape B, and 9518 Teal C.
RED HEART® Unforgettable®: 2 balls 3943 Stained Glass D.
abbreviations: A, B, C, etc. = Color A, Color B, Color C etc
() = work directions in parentheses into same st
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures about 6½" [16.5 cm] wide and 72" [183 cm] long, not including fringe.
gauge: One Granny Square measures about 6½ x 6½" [16.5 x 16.5 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Notes
1. Scarf is made from 11 Granny Squares, arranged into a strip and sewn together.
2. Each Granny Square is worked in joined rounds with right side always facing. The yarn color is changed every round (except the last round) by fastening off the old color and joining the new color.
GRANNY SQUARE I (make 3)
With A, ch 5; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), work 11 dc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—12 dc.
Fasten off.
Round 2: With right side facing, draw up a loop of D in any space between sts, ch 3, dc in same space, *ch 1, 2 dc in next space between sts; repeat from * around, ch 1; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—24 dc and 12 ch-1 spaces.
Fasten off.
Round 3: With right side facing, draw up a loop of B in any ch-1 space, ch 3, 2 dc in same ch-1 space, *ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around, ch 1; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—36 dc and 12 ch-1 spaces.
Fasten off.
Round 4: With right side facing, draw up a loop of D in any ch-1 space, ch 3, 2 dc in same ch-1 space, *ch 2, 3 dc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around, ch 2; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—36 dc and 12 ch-2 spaces.
Fasten off.
Round 5: With right side facing, draw up a loop of C in any ch-2 space, ch 3, 3 dc in same ch-2 space, ch 1, 4 dc in next ch-2 space, *ch 1, (2 dc, 2 tr, ch 2, 2 tr, 2 dc) in next ch-2 space (corner made), [ch 1, 4 dc in next ch-2 space] twice; repeat from * 2 more times, ch 1, (2 dc, 2 tr, ch 2, 2 tr, 2 dc) in next ch-2 space, ch 1; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—4 corners with two 4-dc groups along each of 4 sides between corners.
Fasten off.
Round 6: With right side facing, join A with slip st in any corner ch-2 space, *[skip next st, sc in next 3 sts, sc in next ch-1 space] 3 times, skip next st, sc in next 3 sts, 3 sc in corner ch-2 space; repeat from * 3 more times; join with slip st in first sc—72 sc (15 sc along each of 4 sides between 3-sc corners).
Do not fasten off.
Round 7: Continuing with A, ch 1, *sc in each st to next 3-sc corner, 2 sc in each of next 3 sc; repeat from * 3 more times; join with slip st in first sc—84 sc.
Fasten off.
GRANNY SQUARE II (make 3)
Make same as Granny Square I using B for Round 1, D for Round 2, C for Round 3, D for Round 4, B for Round 5, and A for Rounds 6 and 7.
GRANNY SQUARE III (make 3)
Make same as Granny Square I using C for Round 1, A for Round 2, D for Round 3, B for Round 4, D for Round 5, and A for Rounds 6 and 7.
GRANNY SQUARE IV (make 2)
Make same as Granny Square I using D for Round 1, C for Round 2, B for Round 3, A for Round 4, D for Round 5, and A for Rounds 6 and 7.
FINISHING
Arrange the Granny Squares into a strip, in any order desired. With A, sew the squares together.
Weave in ends.
Fringe
Cut lengths of A, B, C, D, E, and F, each about 24" [61 cm] long. Holding 1 strand of each color together, fold lengths in half. Using crochet hook, pull fold through any stitch of one short edge of scarf, forming a loop. Thread ends through loop and pull to tighten. Attach a total of 7 fringes evenly spaced along both short ends of scarf. Trim fringe to even.

materials: RED HEART® Luster Sheen®: 2 balls 620 Lime.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Scarf measures 4½” x 54” (12cm x 144 cm)
gauge: Gauge is not essential for this project.
instructions:
Bottom Border
With RS facing working along opposite side of foundation ch, join yarn with a slip st in remaining loop of first ch, ch 1, sc in same ch, * (2 dc, [picot] twice, 2 dc) in next ch **, skip next 2 ch; repeat from * 3 times, ending last repeat at **, sc in last ch; fasten off.
Weave in ends.
SPECIAL STITCHES
Picot: Ch 3, sl st in third ch from hook.
Shell: 5 dc in specified st.
SCARF
Ch 26.
Row 1 (RS): Sc in second ch from hook, *ch 3, skip next 2 ch, dc in next ch, ch 3, skip next 2 ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * across; turn.
Row 2: Ch 3, 2 dc in first sc, sc in next dc, ch 3, dc in next sc, ch 3, sc in next dc, shell in next sc, sc in next dc, ch 3, dc in next sc, ch 3, sc in next dc, 3 dc in last sc; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first dc, ch 3, dc in next sc, ch 3, sc in next dc, ch 3, dc in next sc, ch 3, sc in center dc of shell, ch 3, dc in next sc, ch 3, sc in next dc, ch 3, dc in next sc, ch 3, skip next 2 dc, sc in top of ch-3; turn
Row 4: Ch 6, sc in next dc, shell in next sc, sc in next dc, ch 3, dc in next sc, ch 3, sc in next d, shell in next sc, sc in next dc, ch 3, dc in last sc; turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, [sc in next dc, ch 3, dc in next sc, ch 3, sc in center dc of shell, ch 3, dc in next sc, ch 3] twice, sc in third ch of ch-6; turn.
Repeat Rows 2-5 until piece measures 53” (135cm) from beginning; repeat Row 2 once more.
Last Row: Sc in first dc, ch 2, hdc in next sc, ch 2, sc in next dc, ch 2, hdc in next sc, ch 2, sc in center dc of shell, ch 2, hdc in next sc, ch 2, sc in next dc, ch 2, hdc in next sc, ch 2, skip next 2 dc, sc in top of ch-3; fasten off.
Top Border
With RS facing, join yarn with a slip st in first sc, ch 1, sc in first sc, *(2 dc, [picot] twice, 2 dc) in next dc, sc in next sc; repeat from * 3 times. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Chunky™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 108 yds/99 m) Linen (28021) 3 balls
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 18" [45.5 cm] deep x 52" [132 cm] wide.
gauge: 8 sc and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Beg at bottom point, ch 4.
1st row: (RS). 2 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 3 dc). Turn.
2nd row: Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch 2 here and throughout). 1 sc in center dc. Ch 2. 1 dc in top of ch 3. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout). 2 dc in first dc. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. 3 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. 3 dc in 3rd ch of ch 5. Turn.
4th row: Ch 5. (1 sc in center dc of next 3 dc. Ch 3) twice. 1 sc in center dc of next 3 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc in top of ch 3. Turn.
5th row: Ch 3. 2 dc in first dc. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. (3 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp) twice. 3 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. 3 dc in 3rd ch of ch 5. Turn.
6th row: Ch 5. *1 sc in center dc of next 3 dc. Ch 3. Rep from * to last group of 3 dc. 1 sc in center dc of last 3 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc in top of ch 3. Turn.
7th row: Ch 3. 2 dc in first dc. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. *3 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to last sc. 3 dc in last sc. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. 3 dc in 3rd ch of ch 5. Turn.
Rep 6th and 7th rows 9 times more. 43 groups of 3 dc. Do not turn or fasten off. Edging: (RS). Working along left side edge of Scarf down to point, ch 3. *1 sc in side of dc or turning ch at end of next row. Ch 3. Rep from * to point. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 sc) in point. Working up right side edge of Scarf, **Ch 3. 1 sc in side of dc or turning ch at end of next row. Rep from ** to last row. Fasten off. Leave top edge of Scarf free.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 Skein each 932 Zebra A
measurements: Scarf measures 5” wide x 55” long.
gauge: 10 sc = 4”; 12 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Triangle Motif (Make 16 total; 8 with A, 4 each with B and C)
Ch 13.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across –12 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 10 sc – 11 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 9 sc – 10 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 8 sc – 9 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 7 sc – 8 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 6 sc – 7 sc. 
Row 7: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 5 sc – 6 sc. 
Row 8: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 4 sc – 5 sc. 
Row 9: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 3 sc – 4 sc. 
Row 10: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc – 3 sc. 
Row 11: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next sc – 2 sc. 
Row 12: Ch1, turn, sc2tog – 1 sc.
Edging Round: Ch 1, turn, 3 sc in next sc, turn to work along side edge, sc 10 sts evenly space along edges of rows, work 3 sc in last row, turn to work opposite foundation ch, sc 10 sts evenly space along lower edge, turn to work along opposite side edge, 3 sc in first row, sc 10 sts evenly spaced along side edge, slip st in first sc to join. 
Fasten off. 
FINISHING: With right sides facing, side edges aligned and alternating direction of points, arrange Motifs in following order: A, B, A, C, A, B, A, C, A, B, A, C, A, B, A, C. 
Joining Row: With wrong side together and working through both layers, join C in center sc of corresponding corners, work 14 sc along side edges to center sc of next point. 
Fasten off. 
Repeat to join all Motifs. 
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Soft Yarn”: 1 ball each 4604 Navy A, 4601 Off-White B, 9522 Leaf C and 9925 Really Red D.
abbreviations: A, B, C, D = Color A, B, C, D
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Scarf: 6” x 65” excluding pompoms
gauge: 14 hdc = 4”; 12 rows = 4” in hdc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size needles to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HEART (make 4) 
With D, ch 17.
Round 1: 3 sc in 2nd chain from hook, sc in next 6 ch, skip 2 ch, sc in next 6 ch, 3 sc in next ch; continuing to work along underside of ch, sc in next 6 ch, (sc, ch 2, sc) in ch-2 space, sc in next 6 ch, place marker to indicate beginning of round. 
Round 2: Inc in next 3 sc, sc in next 5 sc, skip 2 sc, sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next 3 sc, sc in next 7 sc, (sc, ch 2, sc) in ch-2 space, sc in next 7 sc.
Round 3: [Inc, sc in next sc] 3 times, sc in next 4 sc, skip 2 sc, sc in next 5 sc, [inc, sc in next sc] 3 times, sc in next 7 sc, (sc, ch 2, sc) in ch-2 space, sc in next 8 sc.
Round 4: Sc in next sc, [inc, sc in next 2 sc] 3 times, sc in next 2 sc, skip 2 sc, sc in next 4 sc, [inc, sc in next 2 sc] 3 times, sc in next 8 sc, (sc, ch 2, sc) in ch-2 space, sc in next 9 sc.
Round 5: Sc in next 2 sc, [inc, sc in next 3 sc] 3 times, skip 2 sc, sc in next 3 sc, [inc, sc in next 3 sc] 3 times, sc in next 9 sc, (sc, ch 2, sc) in ch-2 space, sc in next 10 sc. 
Fasten off.
SCARF
With A, ch 212. 
Row 1: Hdc in 3rd ch from hook and in each ch across.
Row 2: Change to B, Ch 2 (counts as hdc), hdc across.
Change to C and continue in this manner, working in color sequence A, B, C, until 18 rows are complete. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Gather one end of scarf. Sandwich scarf ends between 2 hearts and sew together, using overcast stitches around edges of heart and sewing through all layers to secure ends of scarf. Repeat for other end of scarf.
Make two 1 1/4” pompoms each in A, B and C. *Cut a 24” long piece of A, fold in half, insert hook into tip of heart, pull up center for starting chain; ch 10. Fasten off, then attach to A pompoms. Repeat from * with B and C for B and C pompoms. Repeat for 3 pompoms at other end of scarf. Weave in ends.
Make this scarf for someone you love as a Valentine’s Day gift...or anytime you want someone to feel they are special.

materials: Red Heart® Super Easy™ (7 oz/198 g; 189 yds/173 m) Garden Party (0001) 2 balls or 345 yds/315 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approximately (approx) 8" [ 20.5 cm] wide x 70" [178 cm] long, excluding fringe.
gauge: 8 double crochet (dc) and 5 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Chain (ch) 3 at beginning (beg) of row counts as double dc.
Ch 17.
1st row: 1 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 16 sc
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout). 1 dc in next stitch (st). 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Repeat (rep) 2nd row until Scarf measures 70" [178 cm].
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc to end of row. Fasten off.
Weave in ends.
Fringe
Cut 14" [35.5 cm] lengths of yarn. Taking 3 strands together (tog), knot into fringe evenly across ends of Scarf.
Trim fringe evenly.
Fringe: Cut yarn 10 to 14 ins [25.5 to 35.5 cm] long. Taking 2 or 3 strands together for each fringe knot into fringe across cast on and cast off edges. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Red Heart® Gemstone™ (7 oz/200 g; 312 yds/285 m) Agate (2139) 3 balls
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Beg Popcorn = Work 3 dc into same stitch as sl st. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook from front to back into top of beg ch-3. Pull dropped loop through st. Ch 1 to secure popcorn.
Popcorn = Work 4 dc into same stitch or space. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook from front to back into first dc of 4 dc group. Pull dropped loop through st. Ch 1 to secure popcorn.
measurements: Approx 10½" x 90" [26.5 x 228.5 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 11 hdc and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Motif = 10" [25.5 cm] square.
instructions:
MOTIF (make 2):
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc throughout.
Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
Ch 4. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: 11 dc in 4th ch from hook (skipped ch-3 counts as dc). Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. Beg Popcorn in same sp as sl st. (Ch 1. Popcorn in next dc) twice. *Ch 5. (Popcorn in next dc. Ch 1) twice. Popcorn in next dc. Rep from * twice more. Ch 5. Join.
3rd rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. Beg Popcorn in same sp as sl st. Ch 1. Popcorn in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 2. 5 dc in ch-5 corner sp. Ch 2. Popcorn in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * twice more. Ch 2. 5 dc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 2. Join.
4th rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. Beg Popcorn in same sp as sl st. *Ch 2. 1 dc in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 5 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dc in next ch-2 sp. Ch 2. Popcorn in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 2. 1 dc in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 5 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dc in next ch-2 sp. Ch 2. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 3. *2 dc in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Ch 3. Skip next dc. Popcorn in next dc. Ch 3. Skip next dc. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. 2 dc in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next Popcorn. Rep from * twice more. 2 dc in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Ch 3. Skip next dc. Popcorn in next dc. Ch 3. Skip next dc. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. 2 dc in next ch-2 sp. Join.
6th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. *Ch 2. Popcorn in next ch-3 sp. Ch 5. Popcorn in next ch-3 sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 13 dc. Rep from * twice more. Ch 2. Popcorn in next ch-3 sp. Ch 5. Popcorn in next ch-3 sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in each of last 6 dc. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in each of next 6 dc. *1 hdc in each st to corner ch-5 sp. (4 hdc. Ch 1. 4 hdc) all in next ch-5 sp. Rep from * 3 times more. 1 hdc in each st to end of rnd. Join.
Fasten off.
CENTER SECTION
Ch 29.
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 27 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 70" [178 cm].
Fasten off.
Sew 1 Motif to each end of Center Section of Scarf.
Edging: Join yarn with sl st to top left corner of long edge of Scarf. Ch 1. Work sc evenly across long edge of Scarf.
Fasten off.
Rep along opposite side of Scarf.
Fringe: Cut lengths of yarn 14" [35.5 cm] long. Taking 3 strands tog, knot in half and knot into fringe evenly across Scarf ends. Trim fringe evenly.
Fringe: Cut yarn 10 to 14 ins [25.5 to 35.5 cm] long. Taking 2 or 3 strands together for each fringe knot into fringe across cast on and cast off edges. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Chunky (Solids: 100 g/3.5 oz; 99 m/108 yds)
Size 9 mm (U.S. M or 13) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 7" x 64" [18 x 162.5 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 3 pat reps and 5 rows = 5" [12.5 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Ch 18. 
1st row: (RS). (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times in 5th ch from hook. Yoh and draw through all 4 loops on hook – cluster made. Ch 1. Miss next 2 ch. 1 sc in next ch.  (Ch 3. Cluster in next ch. Ch 1. Miss next 2 ch. 1 sc in next ch) twice. Ch 2. Miss next ch. 1 dc in last ch. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). Cluster in first ch-2 sp. Ch 1. [(1 sc. Ch 3. Cluster) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1] twice. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in 3rd ch of turning ch. Turn.
Rep last row until Scarf from beg measures 64" [162.5 cm]. Fasten off.
Fringe: Cut 16" [40.5 cm] lengths of yarn. Taking 3 strands tog, knot into fringe evenly across each end of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: RED HEART® “Soft Yarn”: 1 ball each 9518 Teal A, 3729 Grape B, and 9779 Berry C.
SUSAN BATES® Adjustable Hairpin Lace Loom.
abbreviations: P3 (picot 3) = ch 3, slip st in 3rd ch from hook.
P5 (picot 5) = ch 5, slip st in 5th ch from hook.
measurements: Scarf measures 6” wide x 96” long.
gauge: Strips measure 2” wide before joining. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
first Strip
Adjust loom for 2” strips. With A, following instructions that accompany the loom, make 1 strip of hairpin lace with 200 loops on each side of loom. Do not fasten off or remove loops from loom.
Note: Work into 2 loops at a time or 3 loops at a time as directed, maintaining the natural twist of the loops.
first Strip Edging Round (Right Side): Before removing loops from loom, ch 1, sc in center st, ch 5, remove all loops from loom, 2 sc in first 3 loops, * ch 3, 2 sc in next 2 loops **, ch 3, 2 sc in next 3 loops; repeat from * across, end at **; ch 5 (mark this ch-5 loop), sc in center st of strip, ch 5, 2 sc in first 3 loops; repeat from * across opposite side of strip, end at **; ch 5; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Second Strip
With A, make 1 strip of hairpin lace with 200 loops on each side of loom. Do not fasten off or remove loops from loom.
Second Strip Edging and Joining Round: Before removing loops from loom, ch 1, sc in center st, ch 3, remove all loops from loom, with right side facing sc in the marked ch-5 loop of First Strip, ch 2, 2 sc in first 3 loops of 2nd Strip, ch 1, sc in next ch-3 space of First Strip, * ch 1, 2 sc in next 2 loops of 2nd Strip **, ch 1, sc in next ch-3 space of First Strip, ch 1, 2 sc in next 3 loops of 2nd Strip; repeat from * across, end at **; ch 2, sc in ch-5 loop of First Strip – strips joined, ch 3, sc in center st of 2nd Strip, ch 5, 2 sc in first 3 loops, † ch 3, 2 sc in next 2 loops ††, ch 3, 2 sc in next 3 loops; repeat from † across, end at ††; ch 5; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Border
With right side facing, join A in any corner ch-5 space; (ch 3, 4 dc, P5, 5 dc, P5) all in same space, * 3 dc in next ch-3 space, P3; repeat from * to next corner **; (5 dc, P5, 5 dc, P3) all in corner ch-5 space; repeat from * around, end at **; join with a slip st in top of ch-3. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Small flower (Make 2 each with B and C)
Ch 18, 2 dc in 3rd ch from hook, * 3 dc in next ch; repeat from * across. Fasten off leaving an 8” end. Weave yarn end through the foundation chain, coil and gather the sts to form flower; fasten securely.
Medium flower (Make 2 with B)
Ch 5; join with a slip st to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 12 sc in ring; join with a slip st in first sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, ch 3, skip next sc, [sc in next sc, ch 3, skip next sc] 5 times; join in first sc.
Round 3: * (Sc, hdc, dc, 3 tr, dc, hdc, sc) all in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around; join in first sc – 6 petals.
Round 4: Working behind the petals, ch 1, [sc in next free sc of Round 1, ch 4] 6 times; join.
Round 5: * (Sc, hdc, dc, 5 tr, dc, hdc, sc) all in next ch-4 space; join. Fasten off.
Make 2 more Medium Flowers, working Round 1 with B and Rounds 2-5 with C.
Make 2 more Medium Flowers, working Rounds 1-3 with C and Rounds 4 and 5 with B.
fiNiSHiNG
Place one of each style of flower randomly at each end of the scarf; sew in place with A.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®” Chunky™: 1 Ball each 905 Magenta A, 656 Real Teal B and 776 Dark Orchid C.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Hat circumference at bottom edge: 21”
gauge: 11 dc = 4”; 5 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
With A, ch 56, slip st in first ch to join, taking care not to twist sts. Place marker for beginning of round.
Rounds 1-2: Ch 1 (counts as sc here and throughout), sc in each ch around, slip st in first st to join – 56 sc.
Rounds 3-6: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), hdc in each sc around, slip st in top of beginning ch to join.
Rounds 7-8: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in each hdc around, slip st in top of beginning ch to join.
Round 9: Ch 3, working in back loops only, dc in each dc around, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 10: Ch 3, working in back loops only, dc in next 5 dc, skip next dc, [dc in next 6 dc, skip next dc] 7 times around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 48 dc.
Round 11: Ch 2, hdc in next dc, skip next dc, [hdc in next 2 dc, skip next dc] 15 times, slip st in top of beginning ch – 32 hdc.
Rounds 12-13: Ch 2, hdc in each hdc around, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 14: Ch 2, [skip next hdc, hdc in next hdc] around, skip last hdc, slip st in top of beginning ch – 16 hdc.
Round 15: Ch 1, [skip next hdc, sc in next hdc] around, skip last hdc, slip st in top of beginning ch – 8 sc.
Round 16: Work in continuous rounds. [sc in next sc, skip next sc] around until 1 st remains.
Fasten off.
Right Scarf
Row 1: With right side facing, count 5 sts to left of first st on Round 1, join A and ch 3, dc in next 12 sc – 13 dc.
Rows 2-3: Ch 3, turn, dc in each dc across.
Row 4: Ch 3, turn, [dc in next dc, ch 1, skip next dc] 5 times, dc in last 2 dc.
Row 5: Ch 3, turn, dc in next dc, dc in next ch-1 space, [ch 1, dc in next ch-1 space] 4 times, dc in last 2 dc.
Row 6: Ch 3, turn, dc in next dc, [ch 1, dc in next ch-1 space] 4 times, ch 1, skip next dc, dc in last 2 dc.
Rows 7-24: Repeat Rows 5-6.
Row 25: Ch 3, turn, dc in each dc and ch-1 space across – 13 dc.
Row 26: Ch 4 (counts as tr here and throughout), turn, tr in next dc, [ch 1, skip next st, tr in next st] 5 times, tr in last st.
Rows 27-39: Ch 4, turn, [tr in next tr, ch 1] 5 times, tr in last 2 tr.
Row 40: Change to B, ch 3, turn, in each tr and ch-1 space across, turn – 13 dc.
Row 41: Change to C, ch 3, turn, working in back loops only, dc in each dc across – 13 dc.
Row 42: Change to A, ch 3, turn, working in front loops only, dc in each dc across.
Fasten off.
Left Scarf
Row 1: With right side facing, count 18 sts to right of first st on Round 1, join A and ch 3, dc in next 12 sc – 13 dc.
Repeat Rows 2-42 as for Right Scarf.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Trim
With right side facing, join B in last st on Hat before beginning of one Scarf, sc evenly spaced along each edge of Scarf and Hat, slip st in first st to join.
Fasten off.
Weave in ends

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Main Color (MC) Aran (0313) 2 balls or 622 yds/565 m
Contrast A Carrot (0256) 1 ball or 255 yds/230 m
Contrast B Pale Plum (0579) 1 ball or 215 yds/195 m
Contrast C Light Periwinkle (0347) 1 ball or 150 yds/135 m
Contrast D Gold (0321) 1 ball or 205 yds/185 m
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Hdchb = Work 1 hdc into horizontal bar created below in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked on WS – see diagram)
Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
Trfp = (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times.
Trbp = (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times.
gauge: 11.5 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Scarf is made in Sections designed in steps that build onto each other with minimal seams. Each Section will begin with stitches worked onto sides or top edges of previous Sections.
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as stitch. 
• Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc.
SCARF
With A, ch 22. 
Foundation row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 21 sc.
Section 1-1 
See Diagram 1.
***1st row: (RS). With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 21 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 hdc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 hdc. 1 sc in each of next 2 hdc. (Ch 2. Skip next 2 hdc. 1 sc in next hdc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 2 hdc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 hdc. 1 sc in each of last 2 hdc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 1dcfp around post of each of next 2 sts 2 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Skip next 3 sts 2 rows below. 1 trfp around post of each of next 3 sts 2 rows below. Working in front of 3 trfp just made, 1 trfp around post of each of 3 skipped sts 2 rows below. 1 dcfp around post of each of next 3 sts 2 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 dcfp around post of each of next 2 sts 2 rows below. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn. 
4th and alt rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (Ch 2. Skip next 2 sts. 1 sc in next st) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 1 dcfp around post of each of next 2 dcfp 2 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 dcfp around post of each of next 6 trfp 2 rows below. 1 dcfp around post of each of next 3 dcfp 2 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 dcfp around post of each of next 2 dcfp 2 rows below. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 1 dcfp around post of each of next 2 dcfp 2 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 dcfp around post of each post of next 3 dcfp 2 rows below. Skip next 3 dcfp. (1 trfp around post of next 3 dcfp 2 rows below. Working behind 3 trfp just made, 1 trfp around post of each of 3 skipped dcfp 2 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp 2 rows below. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 1 dcfp around post of each of next dcfp 2 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 dcfp around post of each of next 3 dcfp 2 rows below. 1 dcfp around post of each of next 6 trfp 2 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 dcfp around post of each of next 2 dcfp 2 rows below. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
10th row: As 4th row.
Rep 3rd to 10th rows of Braided Cable Pat for 12" [30.5 cm], ending on 5th or 9th row.***
Turn work sideways.
Next row: (RS). With A, ch 2. Work 38 hdc evenly down left side of Section 1-1. Join B. Break A.

Section 2-1
See Diagram 2.
**1st row: With B, ch 2. 1 hdchb in previous row of each st to last hdc. (Bar is below loops normally worked on WS – see diagram on page 1). 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn. Rep last row for approx 7¼" [19 cm] from color change edge,** ending on a WS row. Turn work sideways. 
Next row: (WS). With B, ch 1. Work 21 sc evenly across top side edge of Section 2-1 ONLY. Join D. Break B. Turn. 21 sc.

Section 3-1
See Diagram 3.
*****1st row: (RS). With D, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. 21 sc. Turn.
2nd row:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 sc. 1 dcbp around next sc. *1 hdc in each of next 3 sc. 1 dcbp around next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 hdc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 hdc. 1 dcfp around next dcbp. *1 dcbp around each of next 3 hdc. 1 dcfp around next dcbp. Rep from * to last 2 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 2 hdc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 hdc. 1 dcbp around next dcfp. *1 hdc in each of next 3 dcbp. 1 dcbp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last 2 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 2 hdc. Turn.
Rep 3rd and 4th rows for Waffle Pat until work from color change measures 12" [30.5 cm],**** ending on WS row. Turn work sideways. 
Next row: (WS). With D, ch 2. Work 38 hdc evenly down right side of Section 3-1. Join C. Break D.

Section 4-1
With C, work from ** to ** as given for Section 2-1, ending on a RS row. Turn work sideways.
Next row: (RS). With C, ch 1. Work 22 sc evenly across top side edge of Section 4-1. Join MC. Break C. Turn. 22 sc.

Section 5-1
See Diagram 4.
****1st row: (WS). With MC, ch 2. 1 hdc in each sc to end of row. 22 hdc. Turn.
2nd row:  Ch 2. 1 dc in first hdc. *Skip next 2 hdc. 1 trfp around each of next 2 hdc. Working in front of just worked sts, 1 trfp around each of 2 skipped hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 dc in last hdc. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 dc in first dc. 1 trbp around each of next 2 sts. *Skip next 2 sts. 1 trbp around each of next 2 sts. Working behind just worked sts, 1 trbp around each of 2 skipped sts. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 trbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2. 1 dc in first dc. *Skip next 2 sts. 1 trfp around each of next 2 sts. Working in front of just worked sts, 1 trfp around each of 2 skipped sts. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. 
Rep 3rd and 4th rows for Celtic Texture Pat until work from color change measures 12" [30.5 cm],**** ending on RS row. Turn work sideways. 
Next row: (RS). With MC, ch 2. Work 38 hdc evenly down left side of Section 5-1. Join A. Break MC.

Section 2-2
With A, work from ** to ** as given for Section 2-1, ending on a WS row. Turn work sideways.
Next row: (WS). With A, ch 1. Work 21 sc evenly across top side edge of Section 2-2 ONLY. Join C. Break A. Turn. 21 sc.

Section 6-1
See Diagram 5.
1st row: (RS). With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 21 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. PM around post of last sc made. *1 sc in each of next 5 sts. PM around post of last sc made. 1 sc in next st. PM around post of last sc made. Rep from * to last 7 sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. PM around post of last sc made. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
3rd and 4th rows:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. 1 trfp around first marked sc 3 rows below. 1 trfp around next marked sc 3 rows below. Working in top of 4th row, skip next 2 sc. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. (1 trfp around next marked sc 3 rows below) twice. Working in top of 4th row, skip next 2 sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sts. *PM around post of last sc made. 1 sc in next st. PM around post of last sc made. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from *, ending last rep with 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Turn.
7th and 8th rows:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 1 trfp around first marked sc 3 rows below (6th row). Working in top of 8th row, skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. *(1 trfp around next marked sc 3 rows below) twice. Working in top of 8th row, skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 trfp around next marked sc 3 rows below. Working in top of 8th row, skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 
Rep 2nd to 9th rows for Lattice Pat until work from color change measures 12" [30.5 cm], ending on WS row. 
Turn work sideways. 
Next row: (WS). With C, ch 2. Work 38 hdc evenly down right side of Section 6-1. Join B. Break C. 

Section 4-2
With B, work from ** to ** as given for Section 2-1, ending on a RS row. 
Turn work sideways.
Next row: (RS). With B, ch 1. Work 21 sc evenly across top side edge of Section 4-2. Join A. Break B. Turn. 21 sc.

Section 1-2
Set up row: (WS). With A, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. 
With A, work from *** to *** as given for Section 1-1.
Turn work sideways. 
Next row: (RS). With A, ch 2. Work 38 hdc evenly down left side of Section 1-2. Join D. Break A.

Section 2-3
With D, work from ** to ** as given for Section 2-1, ending on a WS row. Turn work sideways.
Next row: (WS). With D, ch 1. Work 22 sc evenly across top side edge of Section 2-3 ONLY. Join MC. Break D. 
Turn. 22 sc.

Section 5-2
Set up row: (RS). With MC, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. 
Work from **** to **** as given for Section 5-1, ending on a WS row.
Turn work sideways. 
Next row:  (WS). With MC, ch 2. 
Work 38 hdc evenly down right side of Section 5-2. Join B. Break MC.

Section 4-3
With B, work from ** to ** as given for Section 2-1, ending on a RS row. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew any sections that were not attached "as you go" using matching color and whip stitch. 
Pin Scarf on a flat surface to measurements (Approx 15" x 72" [38 x 183 cm]). Cover with a damp cloth leaving cloth to dry. 
Edging: 1st rnd: (RS). Join D with sl st to top right corner. Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. Work 21 sc evenly across top side edge of Section 4-3. 
Work 21 sc evenly across top edge of Section 5-2. 3 sc in corner. Work 38 sc across each of next 6 Sections down left side of Scarf. 3 sc in corner. Work 21 sc evenly across bottom side edge of Section 2-1. 
Work 21 sc evenly across bottom edge of Section 1-1. 3 sc in corner. Work 38 sc evenly across each of next 6 Sections up right side of Scarf. 1 sc in same sp as first 2 sc. 
Break D. Join MC with sl st to first sc. 
2nd and 3rd rnds: With MC, ch 1. 
1 scbl in each sc around working 3 scbl in each corner sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Fasten off at end of 3rd rnd.

materials: Patons® Metallic™ (85 g/3 oz; 230 m/252 yds) Pewter (95044) 1 ball
Size 5 mm (U.S. H/8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain tension
gauge: 13 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 23.
1st row: (WS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. *Ch 2. Miss next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. Rep from * to last ch. 1 dc in last ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). Miss next dc. [(Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – bobble made. Ch 3. Bobble] in next dc. *Miss next (dc, ch-2 sp, dc). (Bobble. Ch 3. Bobble) in next dc. Rep from * to last 2 dc. Miss next dc. 1 dc in top of ch 3. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 3 dc in first ch-3 sp. *Ch 2. 3 dc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Miss next bobble. 1 dc in top of ch 3. Turn.
