Rep 2nd and 3rd rows until Scarf measures approx 35" [89 cm], ending with a 3rd row. Do not break yarn. Turn.
edging
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 dc. 2 sc in next dc. 1 sc in next dc. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. *1 sc in each of next 3 dc. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp.* 2 sc in each of next 3 dc. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * to * once more. 1 sc in next dc. 2 sc in next dc. 1 sc in next dc. 1 sc in top of ch 3. Turn. 26 sc.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). Miss first sc. 1 dc in next sc. *Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). Miss first dc. 1 dc in each dc and ch-1 sp across. 1 dc in top of ch 3. Turn. 26 dc.
4th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). Miss first 2 dc. *2 dc in next dc. Ch 2. 2 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Miss next 3 dc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Miss next dc. 1 dc in top of ch 3. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. Miss next 2 dc. *7 dc in next ch-2 sp. Miss next (2 dc, ch 1, 2 dc). 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. Miss next (2 dc, ch 1, 2 dc). Rep from * to last ch-2 sp. 7 dc in last ch-2 sp. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in top of ch 3. Fasten off.
With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to bottom left corner.
Work in rem loops of foundation ch as follows:
1st row: (RS). Join yarn with sl st to first rem loop of foundation ch. Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 ch. 2 sc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. *1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp.* 2 sc in each of next 3 ch. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to * once more. 1 sc in next ch. 2 sc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. 1 sc in last ch. 26 sc.
Rep from ** to ** as given above.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver: 1 skein each 947 Marrakesh A and 360 Cafe Latte B.
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 5” (13 cm) x 48” (122 cm). One size fits most.
gauge: 12 sts = 4” (10 cm); 6 rows = 5” (13 cm) in pattern st.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2012 Coats & Clark
The colors say fall, but you can change them to suit your favorite time of the year. The scarf is crocheted lengthwise to add interest and style.
Special Abbreviations
dtr (double treble crochet): Yarn over 3 times, insert hook in st, draw up a loop (5 loops on hook), [yarn over and draw through 2 loops] 4 times.
WP: *(Ch 6, sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next ch, dc in next ch, tr in next ch, dtr in next ch).
SCARF
With A, ch 146.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, *WP, skip next 5 ch along foundation ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * across.
Row 2: Ch 5, turn, *working opposite edge of ch of WP, sc in first 2 chs, hdc in next ch, dc in next ch, tr in next ch, dtr in next ch, skip next sc; repeat from * across, dtr in last sc.
Fasten off.
Row 3: Turn, join B in first st, ch 1, sc in first sc, *WP, skip next 5 sts, sc in next st; repeat from * across.
Row 4: Repeat Row 2.
Fasten off.
Rows 5-6: With A, repeat Rows 3-4.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.
NOTE: Scarf is worked lengthwise.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Soft White (316) 1 ball or 139 yds/127 m
Contrast B Blue (0886) 1 ball or 81 yds/74 m
Contrast C Pretty ‘n Pink (0722) 1 ball or 81 yds/74 m
Contrast D Gold (0321) 1 ball or 85 yds/78 m
Contrast E Pale Plum (0579) 1 ball or 150 yds/137 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
4" [10 cm] piece of cardboard for tassels
measurements: Approx 8½" [21.5 cm] wide x 70½" [179 cm] long, excluding tassels.
gauge: 12 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
SCARF
Checked Section:
Notes:
• When working from chart and 
joining new color, work to last 
2 loops on hook of last st. Draw 
new color through 2 loops, then 
proceed in new color.
• Carry color not in use across 
top of entire previous row and 
work sts around it. This will 
ensure even gauge as all sts 
will be worked around an extra 
strand of yarn held across top of 
previous row.
• Carry both colors up side of work. 
With A, ch 25.
Work Chart, reading RS rows from 
right to left and WS rows from left 
to right and noting 6-st rep will be 
worked 4 times, as follows:  
Note: Each square of chart is equal 
to 1 sc.
1st row: (RS). Ch 1, 1 sc in 2nd ch 
from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end 
of chain. Turn. 24 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to 
end of row. Turn.
First 2 rows of Chart complete.
Rep 2nd row and cont working 
Chart until work from beg measures 
approx 20" [51 cm], ending with 
3rd row of Chart. 
Break B, cont with A.

Striped Section
Note: Do not carry color not in use, 
break yarn at each color change.
Stripe Pat
**With A, work 2 rows.
With C, work 13 rows.
With A, work 2 rows.
With D, work 13 rows.**
Rep from ** to ** 3 times more.
With A, work 2 rows.
These 122 rows complete Stripe 
Pat.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep 2nd 
row until 122 rows of Stripe Pat are 
complete.
Break A. Join E.
Solid Section
With E, rep 2nd row until work from 
beg measures 70" [178 cm]. Fasten 
off.
Border
1st row: (RS). Join A with sl st to top 
right corner. Ch 1. Work sc evenly 
around Scarf, having (1 sc. Ch 1. 
1 sc) in corners. Join with sl st to 
first sc. Fasten off.
Tassels (Make 4).
Wrap 1 strand each of B, C, D, 
and E around 4" [10 cm] piece of 
cardboard 20 times. Tie securely 
at one end. Cut across other end. 
Wrap yarn 6 times around tassel 
1½" [4 cm] from tied end and fasten 
securely. Trim ends evenly. 
Attach 1 Tassel in each ch-1 
corner sp.
CHART

materials: Caron® Cotton Cakes™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 530 yds/485 m)
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dtr = (Yoh) 3 times and draw up a loop in indicated space. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times.
measurements: Approx 8' [20.5 cm] wide x 70" [178 cm] long.
gauge: 13 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 4 at beg of rnd counts as tr.
Join Motifs as you go. Do not break yarn at end of Motifs.
Full Motif
See diagram on page 3.
Ch 12. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd:  Ch 4. 23 tr in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch 4. 24 tr.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Ch 6. Skip next tr. 1 sc in next tr. Rep from * to last tr. Ch 3. Skip last tr. Join with 1 dc in first sc. 12 ch-6 sps.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in top of last dc. *Ch 4. 1 sc in next ch-6 sp. Rep from * around. Ch 4. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd:  Sl st in next ch-4 sp.  Ch 4. 6 tr in same sp as last sl st. *Skip next sc. 7 tr in next ch-4 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-4. Turn. Do not fasten off.
Half Motif
Set-up row: Sl st in each of first 7 tr. Ch 8. Skip next 2 tr of previous Motif. Sl st in next tr. Ch 4 (counts as tr). Skip next 3 tr of previous Motif. Sl st in next tr. Turn.
1st row: 15 tr in ch-8 sp. Skip next 3 tr of previous Motif. Sl st in next tr. Turn.
2nd row: (Ch 6. Skip next tr. 1 sc in next tr) 7 times. Ch 3. Skip last 2 tr of working Motif and next 2 tr of previous Motif. 1 sl st in next tr. Turn.
3rd row: (Ch 4. 1 sc in next ch-6 sp) 7 times. Skip next 2 tr of previous Motif. Sl st in next joining sp. Ch 4. Skip next 3 tr of previous Motif. Sl st in next tr. Turn.
4th row: (7 tr in next ch-4 sp. Skip next sc) 7 times. Skip next 3 tr of previous Motif. Sl st in next tr. Turn. Do not fasten off.
Rep Half Motif to create Scarf approx 66" [166.5 cm] long. Turn. Do not fasten off.
Edging: 1st rnd: Ch 6 (counts as dtr and ch 1). Skip next tr. 1 tr in next tr. Ch 1. (Skip next tr. 1 dc in next tr. Ch 1) twice. (Skip next tr. 1 hdc in next tr. Ch 1) 18 times. *(Skip next tr. 1 dc in next tr. Ch 1) twice. Skip next tr. 1 tr in next tr. Ch 1.*** (1 dtr. Ch 1) twice in next join sp. Skip next tr. 1 tr in next tr. Ch 1. (Skip next tr. 1 dc in next tr. Ch 1) twice.** (Skip next tr. 1 hdc in next tr. Ch 1) 5 times.* Rep from * to * to first join sp of Full Motif, ending at **. (Skip next tr. 1 hdc in next tr. Ch 1) 21 times. Rep from * to * around, ending at ***. (1 dtr. Ch 1) in first sp. Skip last 2 tr. Join with sl st to 5th ch of ch 6.
2nd rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp.  Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. *Ch 1. Skip next st. 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Ch 1. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® “Shimmer™”: Scarf: 2 balls Red 1929; Wristlets: 1 ball Red 1929.
Crochet Hooks: Scarf: 6mm [US J-10]; Wristlets: 4mm [US G-6].
Yarn needle, Scarf: 3” x 7” piece of cardboard.
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Scarf measures 6½” x 74”. Wristlets measure 8¼” long.
gauge: Gauge: Scarf: 13 sts = 4”; 14 rows = 4” in pattern with 6mm hook. Wristlets: 16 sts = 4”; 14 rows = 4” in pattern with 4mm hook.
instructions:
SCARF
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 241; sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn—240 sc.
Now work in back loops throughout, unless instructed otherwise.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, Cl in next sc, * sc in next 2 sc, Cl in next sc; repeat from * to last sc; sc in last sc; turn—80 Cl.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn—240 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, * ch 2, skip 2 sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * to last sc; sc in last sc; turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, * sc in back loops only of next 2 ch, sc in next sc; repeat from * to last sc; sc in last sc; turn.
Repeat Rows 2-5 for pattern 4 times more, and then repeat Rows 2 and 3 once more. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Tassel (make 10)
Cut a piece of yarn approximately 6” long to be used to tie tassel at the top. Place at top of cardboard. Wrap yarn lengthwise around cardboard 20 times, keeping 6” piece on top of cardboard. Tie the 6” piece around the wrapped yarn at the top edge of the cardboard to secure. Cut wraps at bottom edge of the cardboard. Wrap another length of yarn around the tassel approximately one-inch down from the first tie. Trim bottom of tassel evenly. Using the original 6” piece at top of tassel, attach 5 tassels evenly spaced across each short edge of scarf.

WRISTLETS (make 2)
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 34; sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn—33 sc.
Now work in back loops throughout, unless instructed otherwise.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, Cl in next sc, * sc in next 2 sc, Cl in next sc; repeat from * to last sc; sc in last sc; turn—11 Cl.
Rows 3-5: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn—33 sc.
Repeat Rows 2-5 for pattern 5 times more, and then repeat Rows 2-4 once more. Fasten off, leaving a 15” strand. With yarn needle and strand, sew top of last row to beginning ch, matching stitch for stitch. Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Wavelength™ (5 oz/140 g; 223 yds/204 m) Orange Sodalite (07015) 5 balls
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 20" x 66" [50.5 x 167.5 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 10 sc and 11 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg or row does not count as hdc.
Ch 59 loosely (multiple of 10 ch + 9).
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 10th ch from hook (counts as tr and ch 3). 1 hdc in each of next 6 ch. *Ch 6. Skip next 3 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 7 ch. Rep from * to last 3 ch. Ch 3. Skip next 2 ch. 1 tr in last ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first tr. Ch 4. *Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Ch 4. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-6 sp. Ch 4. Rep from * ending with 1 hdc in 5th ch of turning ch 9. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 4. *Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Ch 4. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-4 sp. 1 hdc in next hdc. ** 1 hdc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 4.* Rep from * to * 3 times more, then from * to ** once. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 4. *Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Ch 4. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-4 sp.** 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 4. * Rep from * to * 3 times more, then from * to ** once. 1 hdc in each of last 2 hdc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 3 hdc. *1 hdc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 6. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-4 sp.** 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc.* Rep from * to * 3 times more, then from * to ** once. 1 hdc in each of last 3 hdc. Turn.
6th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 3 hdc. *Ch 4. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-6 sp. Ch 4. Skip next hdc.** 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc.* Rep from * to * 3 times more, then from * to ** once. 1 hdc in each of last 3 hdc. Turn
7th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 hdc. *Ch 4. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-4 sp. 1 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 4. Skip next hdc.** 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc.* Rep from * to * 3 times more, then from * to ** once. 1 hdc in each of last 2 hdc. Turn
8th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *Ch 4. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-4 sp. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 4. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
9th row: Ch 7 (counts as tr and ch 3). *1 hdc in next ch-4 sp. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-4 sp.** Ch 6. Skip next hdc.* Rep from * to* 3 times more, then from * to ** once. Ch 3. 1 tr in last hdc. Turn.
10th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first tr. Ch 4. *Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Ch 4. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-6 sp. Ch 4. Rep from * ending with 1 hdc in 3rd ch of turning ch 7. Turn.
Rep 3rd to 10th rows for pat until work from beg measures approx 70" [177.5 cm], ending on a 9th row. Do not fasten off. 
Fringe: Working across last row of Scarf, proceed as follows:
1st row: *Ch 15. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 13 ch. Sl st in next st. Rep from * to last st. Ch 15. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 13 ch. Fasten off. Join yarn with sl st in first rem ch of foundation row and rep across opposite side of Scarf.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Sassy Lace™: 1 hank 9703 Rose Dust
Yarn needle, locking stitch marker or safety pin
measurements: Scarf measures 4” x 49” (10 x 124.5 cm)
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Fold lace so first hole is placed over 2nd hole, insert hook in hole through both thicknesses, insert hook in next hole and draw top edge through loop on hook (slip knot made), ch 4. 
Row 1: Turn, working in front loops only, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—3 slip sts. 
Row 2: Ch 1, working in front loops only, slip st in each st, turn. 
Repeat Row 2 until at least 5 (but no more than 8) holes remain. 
Place last stitch on locking stitch marker or safety pin so stitch doesn’t unravel as you prepare lace for last row. Trim lace so that only 5 holes remain. Cutting from outer edge, trim lace to ¼” (6.4 mm) under last 2 holes, then continue cutting on a curve ending at the bottom edge under the 3rd hole. Remove stitch holder and place loop back on hook. 
Last Row: Ch 1, working in front loops only, slip st in each st; insert hook in last hole and pull end tail through loop on hook. Tighten end tail until knot forms. 
FINISHING: Weave in end.

materials: Caron® Cakes™ (7.1 oz/200 g; 383 yds/350 m) Rainbow Sprinkles (17006) 2 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx. 7" x 70" [18 x 178 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 17 sts and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pattern.
instructions:
Chain (ch) 36.
Foundation row:  [Right Side (RS)]. 1 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook. *Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Repeat (rep) from * to end of chain. Turn.
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 space (sp). *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last st. 1 sc in last st. Turn.
2nd row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last st. Ch 1. 1 sc in last st. Turn.
Rep 1st and 2nd rows for pattern (pat) until work from beginning (beg) measures 70" [178 cm].
Fasten off.
Fringe
Cut strands of yarn 18" [45.5 cm] long. Taking 2 strands together (tog), fold in half and knot into fringe across ends of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly.
Fringe: Cut yarn 10 to 14 ins [25.5 to 35.5 cm] long. Taking 2 or 3 strands together for each fringe knot into fringe across cast on and cast off edges. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Patons® Norse™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 211 yds/193 m) Main Color (MC) Gray Pearl (91002) 1 ball
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Fdc (Foundation double crochet) = Ch 3 (counts as first st). Yoh. Insert hook in 3rd ch from hook and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through one loop on hook (ch made). (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice (1 dce made). *Yoh. Insert hook into ch stitch and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through one loop on hook (ch made). (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice (1 dc made). Rep from * for as many fdc as called for in pattern.
Picot = Ch 3. Sl st in back bump of ch furthest from hook.
measurements: Approx 24" [61 cm] in circumference x 18" [45.5 cm] long.
gauge: 9 dc and 6 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc. 
• All rnds are joined with sl st to to first st.
1st rnd: With MC, fdc 55. Join with sl st in first fdc. 55 fdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. (1 dc. Picot. 1 dc) all in first st. *Skip next 4 sts. Work (2 dc. Picot. Ch 1. 1 dc. Picot. 1 dc) all in next st. Rep from * until 4 sts rem. Skip next 4 sts. Work (2 dc. Picot) in first st of previous rnd. Join with A. 45 dc.
3rd rnd: With A, ch 3. 1 dc in first st. Ch 2. *(1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Ch 2. Rep from * around. 1 dc in first st of previous rnd. Join with MC. 23 dc.
4th rnd: With MC, ch 3. *Work (2 dc. Picot. Ch 1. 1 dc. Picot. 1 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Skip next 2 dc. Rep from * around. Join with A. 45 dc.
5th rnd: With A, ch 4. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Ch 2. Rep from * around, ending last rep with a ch 1. Join with MC. 23 dc.
6th rnd: With MC, ch 3. (1 dc. Picot. 1 dc) in first st. *Skip next 2 dc. (2 dc. Picot. Ch 1. 1 dc. Picot. 1 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * to last 2 dc. Skip next 2 dc. (2 dc. Picot) in first st of previous rnd. Join with A. 45 dc.
Rep 3rd to 6th rnds until 19 total rnds have been worked, ending on a 3rd rnd. Fasten off Contrast A. 
20th rnd: With MC, ch 3. *(2 dc. Ch 1. 2dc) in next ch-2 sp. Skip next 2 dc. Rep from * around. Skip final ch 3. Join with sl st to top of first dc. 45 dc.
21st rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each rem st and ch-1 sp around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off MC. 55 dc.
FINISHING
When weaving in first end of yarn, use yarn needle to sew base of first and last sts of 1st rnd tog.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Treasure™: 3 balls 1923 Tapestry
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Scarf measures 7½” x 60” (19cm x 152cm)
gauge: 13 pattern sts = 4” [10cm]; 8 pattern rows = 4”
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2013 Coats & Clark

This mitered design is perfect for showing off the beautiful shadings in the yarn. No one but you will know how easy it was to crochet this gorgeous scarf! It’s perfect for an impressive gift.

NOTES
1. All dc will be “pushed” to the wrong side of the row.
2. Do not work into the last stitch of rows.
Ch-3 turns counts as first dc.

SCARF
Ch 31.
Row 1 (Right Side): Slip st in 4th ch from hook, *dc in next ch, slip st in next ch*, repeat from * to * 5 times, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch, **slip st in next ch, dc in next ch**, repeat from ** to ** 6 times. Ch 1, turn.

Rows 2–127: Slip st in next sl st, ch 3, slip st in next dc, *dc in next slip st, sl st in next dc*, repeat from * to * 5 times, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch-1 space, **slip st in next dc, dc in next slip st**, repeat from * to * 6 times. Ch 1, turn.

Row 128: Slip st in next dc, ch 3, *slip st in next dc, dc in next slip st*, repeat from * to * 5 times, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch-1 space, **slip st in next dc, dc in next slip st**, repeat from ** to ** 6 times. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: 6 mm [US J-10] Susan Bates® Crochet Hook
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 10” [25.5 cm] x 96” [244 cm]
gauge: 3 repeats = 5” [12.5 cm], 8 Rows = 4” [10 cm]
instructions:
Ch 38.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, *skip 2 ch, 5 dc in next ch (Scallop made), skip 2 ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * 5 times; turn—7 sc, 6 5-dc Scallops.
Row 2: Ch 5 (counts as first dc, ch 2), *skip 2 dc, sc in 3rd dc, ch 2, skip 2 dc, dc in sc, ch 2; repeat from * across, ending dc in last sc; turn—7 dc, 6 sc, 12 ch-2 loops.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in dc, *skip 2 ch, 5 dc in sc, skip 2 ch, sc in dc; repeat from * across, ending sc in 3rd ch of last ch-5; turn—7 sc, 6 5-dc Scallops.
Repeat Rows 2-3 until Scarf measures 96” [244 cm]. Fasten off; weave in ends. Block to shape using water (not heat).

materials: Patons® Lace™ (3 oz/85 g; 498 yds/455 m)
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dc2(3)tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 2(3) times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 55" [139.5 cm] square.
gauge: 16 dc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Scarf is worked from corner to corner.
First Half: With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st row: (RS). Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc. Ch 1). (3 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in ring. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc. Ch 1). 3 dc in first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in last ch-1 sp. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc. Ch 1). 3 dc in first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in last ch-1 sp. Turn.
4th row: Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc. Ch 1). 3 dc in first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. *3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. (3 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in last ch-1 sp. Turn.
Rep last row until piece along straight side edge measures 55" [139.5 cm], ending on a WS row. Break A. Join B at end of last row.
Second Half: Beg decs: 1st row: (RS). With B, ch 2. Yoh and draw up a loop in first ch-1 sp. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – beg dec made. Dc2tog. 1 dc in each dc and ch-1 sp to last 4 sts. (Dc2tog) twice. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – beg dctog made. Dc2tog. 1 dc in each dc to last 4 dc. (Dc2tog) twice. Turn.
Rep last row to 7 sts.
Next row: Beg dc2tog. Dc2tog. Dc3tog. 3 sts. Turn.
Next row: Ch 2. (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook. Fasten off.

materials: Patons® Classic Wool (100 g/3.5 oz; 205 m/223 yds) Main Color (MC) (77044 Mercury) 2 balls
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain tension.
measurements: Approx 10 x 76 ins [25.5 x 193 cm].
gauge: 14 sc and 16 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Scarf is worked lengthwise.
With MC, ch 260.
1st row: (WS).1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 259 sc.
2nd to 5th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 3. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Join A. Turn. 86 ch-3 sps.
7th row: With A, ch 3 (counts as dc). *Miss next sc. 3 dc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to last sc. 1 dc in last sc. Join MC. Turn.
8th row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 3. Miss next 3 dc. 1 sc between 3rd and 4th dc. Rep from * to last 4 dc. Ch 3. 1 sc in last dc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for pat, substituting A in the following sequence: B, C, D, E, A, B, C, D, E and ending with 8th row of pat.
Next row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *2 sc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. 259 sc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 3 times more.
Fasten off.
Edging: 1st row: (RS). Join MC with sl st to top right corner of Scarf. Ch 1. Work 32 sc evenly down side edge of Scarf. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn. 
Rep last row 3 times more. Fasten off. 
Rep for opposite side.

materials: 1 ball each of: MC: (#04431 Wine Mist Heather)
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice - Double crochet around front post made.
measurements: Approx 6 x 60 ins [15 x 152.5 cm].
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Scarf is made lengthwise. With MC, ch 190.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 188 dc.
2nd row: Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdc in first dc. 1 dcfp around each dc to turning ch 3. 1 hdc in top of turning ch 3. Turn. Join A.
3rd row: With A, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows, changing colors in following sequence: With A – 1 row. With B – 2 rows. With C – 2 rows. With D – 2 rows. With E – 2 rows. With F – 2 rows. Fasten off.
Fringe: Cut yarn 6 ins [15 cm] long. Taking 3 strands tog, fold in half and knot into fringe across side edges of scarf, coordinating color of fringe with color of stripes. Trim fringe evenly.

pattern_name: Pump Up The Volume Crochet Super Scarf
materials: Bernat® Softee® Chunky™ Twist™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 316 yds/289 m) Burgundy (10014) 2 balls
Size U.S. M/13 (9 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Cluster = (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times in indicated space. Yoh and draw through all 4 loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 10" [25.5 cm] wide x 84" [213.5 cm] long, excluding tassels.
gauge: 3 pat reps and 5 rows = 5" [12.5 cm]
instructions:
Ch 30.
1st row: (RS). (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times in 5th ch from hook. Yoh and draw through all 4 loops on hook – beg cluster made. Ch 1. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in next ch. (Ch 3. Cluster in next ch. Ch 1. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in next ch) 5 times. Ch 2. Skip next ch. 1 dc in last ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). Cluster in first ch-2 sp. Ch 1. [(1 sc. Ch 3. Cluster) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1] 5 times. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in 3rd ch of turning ch. Turn.
Rep last row until Scarf from beg measures 84” [213.5 cm]. Fasten off.
Tassels (make 4)
Cut a piece of cardboard 8" [20.5 cm] wide. Wind yarn around cardboard 50 times. Break yarn leaving a long end and thread end through needle. Slip needle through all loops and tie tightly. Remove cardboard and wind yarn tightly around loops 1" [2.5 cm] below fold. Fasten securely. Cut through rem loops and trim ends evenly. Sew Tassels to each corner of Scarf.

materials: Bernat® Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Note: Yarn quantity will make 2 Scarves.
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 13" [33 cm] wide x 79" [226 cm] long.
gauge: 10 sc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• To change colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed with new color.
• Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc.
• Scarf is worked lengthwise.
With MC, ch 179. See diagram on page 3.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 178 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc and each sc to end of row. Join A. Do not break MC. Turn.
3rd row: With A, ch 3. Skip first st. 1 dc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 sc in next st. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 sts. 1 sc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 1 tr in each of next 2 sts. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to last 6 sts. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sts. 1 sc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 dc in each of last 2 sts. Turn.
4th row: Ch 3. Skip first st. 1 dc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 sc in next st. *Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 1 tr in each of next 2 sts. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to last 6 sts. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 dc in each of last 2 sts. Join MC. Break A. Turn.
5th row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sts. *Working over ch-2 sp, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc 3 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 10 sts. Rep from * to last 6 sts. Working over ch-2 sp, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc 3 rows below. 1 sc in each of last 4 sts. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Join B. Do not break MC. Turn.
7th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in first st. 1 hdc in next st. *1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 1 tr in each of next 2 sts. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sts. 1 sc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. Rep from * to last 8 sts. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 1 tr in each of next 2 sts. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in next st. 1 sc in last st. Turn.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. 1 hdc in next st. *1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 1 tr in each of next 2 sts. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. Rep from * to last 8 sts. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 1 tr in each of next 2 sts. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in next st. 1 sc in last st. Join MC. Break B. Turn.
9th row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in first st. 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. *Working over ch-2 sp, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc 3 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 10 sts. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Join C. Do not break MC. Turn.
11th and 12th rows: With C, as 3rd and 4th rows. Join MC. Break C.
13th and 14th rows: With MC, as 5th and 6th rows. Join D. Do not break MC.
15th and 16th rows: With D, as 7th and 8th rows. Join MC. Break D.
17th and 18th rows: With MC, as 9th and 10th rows. Join A. Do not break MC.
19th and 20th rows: With A, as 3rd and 4th rows. Join MC. Break A.
21st and 22nd rows: With MC, as 5th and 6th rows. Join B. Do not break MC.
23rd and 24th rows: With B, as 7th and 8th rows. Join MC. Break B.
25th and 26th rows: With MC as 9th and 10th rows. Join C. Do not break MC.
27th and 28th rows: With C, as 3rd and 4th rows. Join MC. Break C.
29th and 30th rows: With MC, as 5th and 6th rows. Fasten off.

materials: Caron® Cakes™ (7.1 oz/200 g; 383 yds/350 m) Rum Raisin (17034) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 12 dc and 5 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 33.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. *Skip next 2 ch. 1 dc in each of next 4 ch. Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 4 ch. Rep from * once more. Skip next 2 ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. 2 dc in last ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * once more. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in top of turning ch. Turn.
Rep last row for pat until work from beg measures 62" [157.5 cm]. Fasten off.

materials: Caron® x Pantone™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 127 yds/116 m)
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 9" [23 cm] wide x 78" [198 cm] long.
gauge: 12 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• Before working with  
Caron® x Pantone™ multi-
shade yarn braid, separate 
each color link and wind into  
5 separate balls for each braid.
• Each color link will be 
referenced by its Pantone™ 
color # (see label).
• Designate each yarn ball 
Contrast, A, B, C, D and E as 
noted in Materials section (or 
as desired). 
• Due to finite amount of yarn 
in each shade, pattern gauge 
must be matched to ensure 
successful results.
SCARF
Note:  When working from charts, 
use separate balls for each area 
of color in the design. To change 
colors, work to last 2 loops on 
hook of first color, draw new 
color through last 2 loops and 
proceed. Do not carry color not 
in use across top of work. Color 
changes are worked using Intarsia 
technique.
With A, ch 28.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from 
hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of 
chain. Turn. 27 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to 
end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 24 times more, 
ending on a WS row (26 rows 
total). Break A. Join B. See chart 
on page 3.
Work Chart I in sc to end of chart, 
reading RS rows from right to left 
and WS rows from left to right. 
Break B, C and D. Join MC.
With MC, cont even in sc until Scarf 
from beg measures 63" [160 cm], 
ending on a WS row. Break MC. 
Join C.
Work Chart II in sc to end of chart. 
Break C, D and E. Join A.
With A, work 26 rows even in sc. 
Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® 'Foxy™': Art E724, 3 Balls for each scarf.
measurements: Scarves measure approximately 15 cm (6") wide by 152 cm (60") long.
gauge: Crochet: 4 sts = 10 cm (4"); 4 rows = 9 cm (3 1/2") in sc with 3 strands held together.
instructions:
Holding 3 strands of yarn together as one, ch 7.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 6 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn. Rep Row 2 until 152 cm (60") from beginning. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® “Soft Yarn”: 1 ball each 9925 Really Red A and 4604 Navy B
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Scarf measures 6” x 50”
gauge: 16 sts = 4”; 13 rows = 4” in pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With A, ch 200.
Row 1 (Right Side): (Sc, hdc, dc) all in 2nd ch from hook, * skip 2 ch, (sc, hdc, dc) all in next ch; repeat from * across to last 3 ch; skip 2 ch, sc in last ch changing to B; turn – 199 sts.
Rows 2 and 3: Ch 1, (sc, hdc, dc) all in first sc, * skip 2 sts, (sc, hdc, dc) all in next sc; repeat from * to last 3 sts; skip 2 sts, sc in last sc changing to A; turn.
Rows 4-18: Repeating Row 2 for pattern and changing colors as required, work in the following color sequence: 2 rows A, 1 row B, 3 rows A, 3 rows B, 1 row A, 2 rows B, 2 rows A, 1 row B. Fasten off at end of Row 18. Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Contrast A Vintage White (10006) 1 ball or 138 yds/126 m
Bernat® Super Value™ (7 oz/197 g; 440 yds/402 m) Contrast B Bright Yellow (00608) 1 ball or 35 yds/32 m
Sizes U.S. J/10 (6 mm) and U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
Small amount of black worsted weight yarn for Eye embroidery.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 7" [18 cm] wide x 52" [132 cm] long.
gauge: Bernat® Blanket™: 7 hdc and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook. Bernat® Super Value™: 10 sc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm] on smaller hook with 2 strands of yarn held together.
instructions:
Notes:  
• You may find it helpful to place a marker on RS of work to help keep track of RS and WS.
• Ch 1 at beg of row does not count as stitch.
SCARF
See diagram on page 3.
With larger hook and A, ch 6.
1st row: (RS). 2 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 6 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 8 hdc.
3rd and 4th rows: As 2nd row. 12 hdc at end of 4th row.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Scarf measures 35" [89 cm], ending on a WS row.
Neck and Head Shaping
1st row: (Dec row): (RS). Ch 1. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. Turn. 10 sts.
2nd and 3rd rows: As 1st row. 6 sts at end of 3rd row.
4th and 5th rows: Ch 1. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
6th row: (Inc row): Ch 1. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 8 hdc.
7th and 8th rows: As 6th row. 12 hdc at end of 8th row.
9th to 12th rows: Ch 1. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
13th row: Ch 1. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. Turn. 10 sts.
14th and 15th rows: As 13th row. 6 sts at end of 15th row.
Fasten off.
BEAK (make 2)
With 2 strands of B held tog and smaller hook, ch 9.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 8 sc.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 6 sts.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
7th row: As 5th row. 4 sts.
8th to 10th rows: As 6th row.
Fasten off at end of 10th row.
With WS of Beak pieces tog and smaller hook, join 2 strands of B with sl st to bottom right corner. Working through both thicknesses to join, work sc evenly up side edge, across top and down left side edge, leaving bottom edge open.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail to sew Beak to Head.
Using long tail, sew Beak to end of Head of Scarf, slightly sandwiching Scarf between Beak pieces. Sew one end of Beak to RS of Scarf and other end along WS of Scarf.
LEGS (make 2)
With 2 strands of B held tog and smaller hook, ch 7.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Do not turn.
Make toes: (Ch 3. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Sl st in next ch. Join with sl st in side of last sc worked of Leg) twice. Ch 3. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Sl st in next ch. Join with sl st to rem loop of last ch of beg ch. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 5 ch. Fasten off, leaving a long tail to sew Leg to Scarf.
Sew Legs to end of Scarf as shown in photo.
FINISHING
Closure Loop
With larger hook and A, ch 10.
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. 8 hdc. Fasten off.
Try on Scarf to locate perfect Loop placement, approx 12" [30.5 cm] from end of Scarf, on a slight downward diagonal. Sew ends of Loop in position.
Using black worsted weight yarn, embroider Eye in same place on both RS and WS of Scarf.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® “Bamboo Crochet Thread, 100% Viscose from Bamboo” Size 10, Art. 148 available in 300 yd (276 m) balls.
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Scarf measures 6” x 55”.
gauge: 7 Shells = 4”; 12 rows = 4” in pattern slightly stretched. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCARF
Ch 46.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Dc in 4th ch from hook, ch 1, skip next ch, * V-Stitch in next ch, ch 1 **, skip next 3 ch; repeat from * to last 4 ch, end at **; skip next 2 ch, dc in last 2 ch; turn – 10 V-Sts, 4 dc.
Row 2 (Right Side): Ch 3, skip first dc, dc in next dc, [Shell in ch-3 space of next V-Stitch] 10 times, skip next dc of V-Stitch, dc in next dc, dc in top of ch-3; turn – 10 Shells, 4 dc.
Row 3: Ch 3, skip first dc, dc in next dc, ch 1, [V-St in ch-1 space of next Shell, ch 1] 10 times, skip next 3 dc of Shell, dc in next dc, dc in top of ch-3; turn.
Repeat Rows 2 through 3 until piece measures 53” from beginning, end by working Row 3. Do not fasten off, but turn to work edging.
Edging
Ch 1, [Edging Shell in corner, and in each ch-3 space across short side, Edging Shell in next corner and around each end st of every even row across long side] twice; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat ® Satin (100 g/3.5 oz; 182 m /200 yds)
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 8 x 60 ins [20.5 x 152.5 cm].
gauge: 14 dc and 8 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions: Ch 34. 1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). *1 dc in each of next 3 ch. (Yoh and draw up a loop in next ch. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – dc3tog made. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. 3 dc in next ch. Rep from *, ending with 2 dc in last ch. Turn. 2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in first dc. *1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Dc3tog. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 3 dc in next dc. Rep from *, ending with 2 dc in last dc. Turn. Rep last row until work from beg measures 60 ins [152.5 cm]. Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Heat Wave™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 198 yds/181 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 6 x 72” [15 x 183 cm], excluding pompoms
gauge: 13 hdc and 8 rows = 4” [10 cm]
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc. 
With A, ch 26.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 24 hdc. 
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row twice more. 
With B, rep 2nd row 4 times more.
With C, rep 2nd row 4 times more.
With D, rep 2nd row 4 times more.
These 16 rows form Stripe Pat. 
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep 2nd row until work from beg measures approx 72” [183 cm], ending with 4 rows of A. Fasten oﬀ. 
Pompom: (make 6). Wind A around 3 /f_i ngers 100 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Scarf. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. Sew securely 3 pompoms evenly spaced along each end of Scarf. 
Optional: Using pompom maker, make 6 pompoms with A, each 3” [7.5 cm] diameter.
Sew 3 pompoms securely evenly spaced along each end of Scarf.

pattern_name: STITCH CLUB POCKET GRANNY CROCHET SCARF
materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (Solids: 6 oz /170.1g; 315 yds/288 m; Heathers: 5 oz/141.7 g; 250 yds/228 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
Motif I - Granny Square (make 4) 
See diagram on page 3. 
With C, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. 
1st rnd:  Ch 3. 11 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 12 dc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 2 dc in each of next 11 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 24 dc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. Skip next dc. 3 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last dc. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
4th rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 2. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around to last 3 dc. Ch 2. Join B with sl st to top of ch 3. 
5th rnd: Ch 4 (counts as tr). 2 tr in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch 2 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. *(3 tr. Ch 3. 3 tr) in next ch-2 sp. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-2 sp) twice. Ch 1. Rep from * to last ch-2 sp. 3 tr in last ch-2 sp. Ch 3. Join with sl st to top of beg ch 4. 
6th rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. (Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp to next corner ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in corner ch-3 sp. (Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp to next corner ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch 3 sp. Ch 2. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 
7th rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. (Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp to next corner ch-2 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in corner ch-2 sp. (Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp to next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch 2 sp. Ch 2. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 
8th rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. (Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp to next corner ch-2 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in corner ch-2 sp. (Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp to next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-2 sp. Ch 2. Join C with sl st to top of ch 3. 
9th and 10th rnds:  With C, ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. (Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp to next corner ch-2 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in corner ch-2 sp. (Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp to next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-2 sp. Ch 2. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off. 
Motif II (make 2)
Work as given for Motif I, working colors as follows:
1st to 4th rnds: With A.
5th to 8th rnds: With C. 
9th rnd: With A. 
10th rnd: With C. 
Motif III (make 2)
With C, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd:  Ch 3. 2 dc in ring. (Ch 2. 3 dc) 3 times in ring. Ch 1. 1 sc in top of ch 3. 
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc around post of last sc. *1 dc in each of next 3 dc. (2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in same sp as first dc. Ch 1. 1 sc in top of ch 3. 
3rd rnd:  Ch 3. 1 dc around post of last sc. *1 dc in each dc to next ch-2 sp. (2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more. 1 dc in each dc to end of rnd. 2 dc in same sp as first dc. Ch 1. 1 sc in top of ch 3. 
Rep last rnd 7 times more. 
Fasten off. 
Motif IV – Pocket (make 2)
Work 1st to 8th rnds as given for Motif I, working colors as follows: 
1st to 4th rnds: With A. 
5th and 6th rnds: With B. 
7th rnd: With A. 
8th rnd: With C. 
FINISHING
Following assembly diagram, 
with WS tog and C, crochet motifs 
into Scarf.
Sew Motifs IV over Motifs III around 
3 sides to form pockets.
Key
Motif I
Motif II
Motif III
Motif IV
Assembly Diagram

materials: RED HEART® Soft®:  1 ball each 9010 Charcoal A, 2515 Turquoise B, and 4601 Off White C
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Finished measurements: 5” x 72” (12.5 x 183 cm)
gauge: GAUGE: 19 sts = 5” (12.5 cm); 21 rows = 5” (12.5 cm) in Scarf pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE.
instructions:
SCARF
With A, ch 20.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, * ch 1, sk next st, sc in next st; repeat from * to end, turn – 19 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc in first ch-1 space, * ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to last sc, sc in last sc, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, * ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to last 2 sc, ch 1, skip next sc, sc in last sc, turn.
Repeat rows 2 and 3 until scarf measures 72” (183 cm) long. Fasten off A.
Pop of Color Edging
Join B with slip st in any corner of scarf, being ready to work along one long side edge.
Row 1: Ch 1, sc in first row edge st, * ch 1, skip 1 row, sc in next row edge st; repeat from * to end of long scarf edge, turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc in first ch-1 space, * ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to last sc, sc in last sc, turn.
Change to C.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, * ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to last 2 sc, ch 1, skip next sc, sc in last sc, turn.
Row 4: Repeat Row 2.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Patons Lace (85 g / 3 oz; 455 m / 498 yds)
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain tension
measurements: Approx 4 x 55 ins [10 x 139.5 cm] (when folded along foundation chain)
gauge: 16½ dc and 9 rows = 4 ins [10 cm]
instructions: With A, ch 222. (Note: Place marker on every 50th ch for easier counting). 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 221 sc. 2nd row: Ch 4 (counts as tr). Working in back loop only of each st, work 2 tr in each sc to end of row. Turn. **3rd row: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each tr to end of row. Turn. 4th row: Ch 4 (counts as tr). 1 tr in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep last 2 rows until work from foundation ch measures approx 4 ins [10 cm], ending with 4th row. Fasten off.** With RS facing, join B with sl st to first rem loop of sc from 1st row. Ch 4 (counts as tr). Working in rem loop only of each sc, work 2 tr in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep from ** to ** as given above.

abbreviations: ( ) = work all directions in parentheses in the indicated stitch or space
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Scarf measures 10" x 86" [25.5 x 218.5 cm]
gauge: Rows 2–8 = 6" [15 cm]. Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
SCARF
Ch 20.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, [ch 3, skip next 2 ch, sc in next ch] across; turn—7 sc and 6 ch-3 spaces.
Row 2 (Right Side): Ch 1, sc in first sc, ch 1, sc in next ch-3 space, [ch 3, skip next sc, sc in next ch-3 space] across, ch 1, sc in last sc; turn—8 sc, 2 ch-1 spaces and 5 ch-3 spaces.
Row 3: Ch 4 (counts as first dc and ch-1 here and throughout), skip first ch-1 space, [skip next sc, 3 dc in next ch-3 space] across, skip next sc and ch-1 space, ch 1, dc in last sc; turn—17 dc and 2 ch-1 spaces.
Row 4: Ch 5 (counts as first dc and ch-2 here and throughout), skip next ch-1 space, fp tri st, [ch 3, fp tri st] 4 times, ch 2, dc in 3rd ch of beginning ch-4; turn—2 dc, 2 ch-2 spaces, 5 fp tri sts and 4 ch-3 spaces.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first dc, ch 3, skip next ch-2 space, sc in first fp tri st, [ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, sc in next fp tri st] 4 times, ch 3, sc in 3rd ch of beginning ch-5; turn—7 sc and 6 ch-3 spaces.
Row 6: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), 2 dc in first ch-3 space, [skip next sc, 3 dc in next ch-3 space] 4 times, skip next sc, 2 dc in next ch-3 space, dc in last sc; turn—18 dc.
Row 7: Beg fp tri st; [ch 3, fp tri st] across, working last “leg” of last fp tri st in top of beginning ch-3; turn—1 beg fp tri st, 5 ch-3 spaces and 5 fp tri sts.
Row 8: Ch 1, sc in first fp tri st, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, [ch 3, skip next fp tri st, sc in next ch-3 space] across, ch 3, sc in top of beginning ch of beg fp tri st; turn—7 sc and 6 ch-3 spaces.
Rows 9-99: Repeat Rows 2–8 thirteen times or until scarf measures desired length.
Row 100: Repeat Row 2. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Sassy Lace™: 1 hank 9501 Bora Bora
measurements: Scarf measures 86” long
gauge: GAUGE is not important for this pattern
instructions:
Step 1: Insert hook through 1st hole from back to front; repeat for 2nd, 3rd and 4th holes. You now have 4 holes on the hook.
Step 2: Pinching together all four holes on the hook with left forefinger and thumb, insert hook from front to back into 5th hole and pull through all holes on hook.
Repeat Steps 1 and 2 with each group of 5 holes. If you put your work down, be sure to put a stitch holder or safety pin on the working stitch. This holder needs to be larger than the hole so that your work will not fall apart.
Continue until 4 or less holes remain; pull end through last stitch and pull tight. Trim beginning and ending fabric strip points so that they blend in with the ruffles. Shake out your scarf so that ruffles spiral.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170 g; 315 yds/288 m) Main Color (MC) Country Blue (9710) 2 balls
Contrast A Dark Country Blue (9711) 1 ball
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 8" x 70" [20.5 x 178 cm], excluding pompoms.
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: Scarf is worked lengthwise.
Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.
With MC, ch 212. 
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 210 sts. 
2nd row: Ch 2. Work in horizontal bar only at front of work, created by hdc (see diagram above), 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 8" [20.5 cm]. Fasten off.
Pompoms: (Make 4). Wind 1 strand each of A and B around 2 fingers 40 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Scarf. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. 
Cord: With B, make chain 20" [51 cm] long. 
1st row: Sl st in each back bump of 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. Fasten off. 
Fold Scarf in half with short ends and WS tog. On RS and beg at center of one end, approx 4" [10 cm] above short edge of Scarf, thread cord through sts as shown in picture. Work to side of first end, across RS of other end, and back to center of first end. Pull tightly to gather fabric of Scarf. Tie ends in a bow. Sew pompom to each end of cord.

abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 3” wide x 61” long (7.6 x 155 cm)
gauge: Gauge is not important for this project.
instructions:
SCARF
Row 1: Ch 6, slip st in 6th ch from hook, [ch 5, slip st in same ch] 4 times— 5 ch-5 loops.
Row 2: Ch 4, dc in 4th ch from hook, turn—1 dc.
Row 3: [Ch 5, slip st in dc] 5 times—5 ch-5 loops.
Rows 4–85 (or until desired length is reached): Repeat Rows 2–3, ending last repeat with Row 3. Fasten off.
Weave in yarn ends.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein 1803 Blue Hawaii
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 7” x 55” (18 x 139.5 cm).
gauge: 5 rounds = 7” (18 cm) in pattern; 8 rows = 5” (12.5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Center Granny Square
Ch 3; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), 2 dc in ring, [ch 3, 3 dc in ring] 3 times, ch 3; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—12 dc (four 3-dc groups) and 4 ch-3 spaces.
Slip st across to ch-3 space.
Round 2: Slip st in next 2 dc, (slip st, ch 3, 2 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in first ch-3 space (first corner made), *ch 1, (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in next ch-3 space (corner made); repeat from * twice, ch 1; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—4 corners.
Round 3: Slip st in next 2 dc, (slip st, ch 3, 2 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in first ch-3 space (first corner made), ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-1 space, *ch 1, (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in next corner ch-3 space (corner made), ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * twice, ch 1; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—4 corners and four 3-dc groups (one 3-dc group on each side between corners).
Round 4: Slip st in next 2 dc, (slip st, ch 3, 2 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in first corner ch-3 space, *ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-1 sp; repeat from * to next corner ch-3 space, [ch 1, (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in next corner ch-3 space, ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-1 space; repeat from ** to next corner ch-3 sp] 3 times, ch 1; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—4 corners and two 3-dc groups on each side between corners.
End Granny Square and Extension (make 2)
Work same as center granny square but do not fasten off.
Row 1: Slip st in next 2 dc, (slip st, ch 3, 2 dc) in first ch-3 space, *ch 1, skip next 3 dc, 3 dc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across to last ch-3 space, ch 1, 3 dc in last ch-3 space, turn—six 3-dc groups and 5 ch-1 spaces.
Row 2: Ch 4 (counts as first dc, ch 1), ch 1, skip first 3 dc, 3 dc in next ch-1 space, *ch 1, skip next 3 dc, 3 dc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across to last 3 dc, ch 1, skip next 2 dc, dc in top of beginning ch, turn—five 3-dc groups, 2 dc, and 6 ch-1 spaces.
Row 3: Ch 3, 2 dc in first ch-1 space, *ch 1, skip next 3 dc, 3 dc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across, turn—six 3-dc groups and 5 ch-1 spaces.
Rows 4–27: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 twelve times. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Sew each extension to opposite sides of center granny square. Weave in ends.
Notes
1. Granny squares are worked in joined rounds with right side facing.
2. Rows are worked back and forth off the last round of each end square. Last rows are sewn to opposite sides of center square to complete the scarf.

materials: RED HEART® Team Spirit™: 2 skeins 947 Royal/White
abbreviations: ( ) = work all directions in parentheses in the indicated stitch or space
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Finished Size (not including Fringe): 7” x 75” (18 cm x 190.5 cm)
gauge: 12 dc and 8 rows worked in pattern = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCARF
Ch 21.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Sc in second ch from hook (skipped ch does not count as a sc, here and throughout), sc in each ch across; turn—20 sc.
Row 2 (Right Side): Ch 2 (does not count as a dc, here and throughout), dc in each sc across; turn—20 dc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each dc across; turn—20 sc.
Rows 4-150: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 until 149 rows are completed; repeat Row 3 once. At end of last row, fasten off and weave in ends.
Finishing
Cut 40 pieces of yarn, each 10” (25.5 cm) long. Hold 2 strands together and fold in half. Referring to photograph, insert hook through spaces on edge of Row 1 and draw folded ends of strands through to form loop. Thread ends of strands through loop and pull ends to tighten. Repeat for edge of Row 150. Trim ends evenly.

materials: Red Heart® Heat Wave™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 198 yds/181 m)
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 21" x 72" [53.5 x 183 cm], excluding fringe
gauge: 14 sts and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Note: Wind balls of the colors to be used, one for each separate area of color in the design. To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed, keeping color change to WS of work. 
With A, ch 72. See chart on page 3.
1st row: (RS). With A, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. (Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch) 5 times, joining B in last sc. *With B, 1 sc in next ch. (Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch) 3 times, joining A in last sc. With A, 1 sc in next ch. (Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch) 5 times, joining C in last sc.* With C, 1 sc in next ch. (Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch) 6 times, joining A in last sc. With A, 1 sc in next ch. (Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch) 5 times, joining B in last sc. Rep from * to * once more. Do not join C at end of row. 71 sts. Turn. 
2nd row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) 4 times. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc, joining B in last sc. *With B, 1 sc in next sc. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) twice. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc, joining A in last sc. With A, 1 sc in next sc. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) 4 times. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc, joining C in last sc.* With C, 1 sc in next sc. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) 5 times. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc, joining A in last sc. With A, 1 sc in next sc. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) 4 times. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc, joining B in last sc. Rep from * to * once more. Do not join C in last sc. Turn. 
3rd row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 4 times. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc, joining B in last sc. *With B, 1 sc in next sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc, joining A in last sc. With A, 1 sc in next sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 4 times. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc, joining C in last sc.* With C, 1 sc in next sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 5 times. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc, joining A in last sc. With A, 1 sc in next sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 4 times. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc, joining B in last sc. Rep from * to * once more. Do not join C in last sc. Turn. 
4th row: As 2nd row. 
5th to 10th rows: Rep 3rd and 4th rows 3 times more, joining B in last sc of 10th row. 
11th row: (RS). With B, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 4 times. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc, joining D in last sc. *With D, 1 sc in next sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc, joining B in last sc. With B, 1 sc in next sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 4 times. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc, joining A in last sc.* With A, 1 sc in next sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 5 times. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc, joining B in last sc. With B, 1 sc in next sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 4 times. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc, joining D in last sc. Rep from * to * once more. Do not join A in last sc. Turn. 
12th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) 4 times. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc, joining D in last sc. *With D, 1 sc in next sc. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) twice. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc, joining B in last sc. With B, 1 sc in next sc. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) 4 times. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc, joining A in last sc.* With A, 1 sc in next sc. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) 5 times. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc, joining B in last sc. With B, 1 sc in next sc. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) 4 times. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc, joining D in last sc. Rep from * to * once more. Do not join A in last sc. Turn. 
13th and 14th rows: As 11th and 12th rows, joining C at end of 14th row. Leave A, B and D yarn in position. 
15th row: (RS). With C, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 4 times. Ch 1. Skip next sc. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 4 times. Ch 1. Skip next sc.* 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 5 times. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 4 times. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to * once more. 1 sc in last sc. Fasten off. Do not turn. 
16th row: (RS). As 12th row. 
17th row: As 11th row. 
18th and 19th rows: As 12th and 11th rows, joining C at end of 19th row. Leave A, B and D yarn in position. 
20th row: (RS). With C, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *(1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) 4 times. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) twice. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) 4 times. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp.* 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) 5 times. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to * once more. 1 sc in last sc. Fasten off. Do not turn. 
21st to 24th rows: As 11th and 12th rows twice more, joining A at end of 24th row.
25th row: As 3rd row. 
Rep 2nd to 25th rows for Tartan Pat until work from beg measures approx 72" [183 cm], ending on a 10th row of pat. Fasten off. 
Vertical Surface Sl St Lines:
With RS facing, join C with sl st to center ch-1 sp at foundation row of C section. Keeping yarn at back (WS) of work, sl st into each ch-1 sp in alternate rows above joining sp to create a straight vertical line of surface sl sts to opposite end of Scarf, taking care to sl st loosely to avoid pulling in work as you stitch. Fasten off. Rep Vertical Sl St Line in both D sections as shown in photo. 
Fringe: Cut lengths of A, B and C 15" [38 cm] long. Taking 4 strands tog, match fringe to color in pat at each end of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly. 
Fringe: Cut yarn 10 to 14 ins [25.5 to 35.5 cm] long. Taking 2 or 3 strands together for each fringe knot into fringe across cast on and cast off edges. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Caron® Tea Cakes™ (8.5 oz/240 g; 204 yds/186 m) Oolong (20008) 2 balls
Size U.S. M/13 (9 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: V Puff-st = *(Yoh and draw up a loop) twice in indicated space. Yoh and draw through all 5 loops on hook.* Ch 1. Rep from * to * once more in same space.
measurements: Approx. 9" x 74" [23 x 188 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 6 sc and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc.
Ch 22.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Skip next ch. *V Puff-st in next ch. Skip next 2 ch. Rep from * to last 3 ch. V Puff-st in next ch. Skip next ch. 1 hdc in last ch. Turn. 6 V Puff-sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *V Puff-st in ch-1 sp of next V Puff-st. Rep from * across, ending with 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
Rep last row for pat until work from beg measures 74" [188 cm]. Fasten off.
Fringe
Cut lengths of yarn 12" [30.5 cm] long. Taking 3 strands tog, knot into fringe evenly across each end of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly.
Fringe: Cut yarn 10 to 14 ins [25.5 to 35.5 cm] long. Taking 2 or 3 strands together for each fringe knot into fringe across cast on and cast off edges. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Sashay Sequins™: 2 balls 1948 Mediterranean
Yarn needle, sewing needle, matching sewing thread
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Scarf (before ruffle) measures 5” (12.5 cm) wide x 70” (178 cm) long
gauge: 15 sc = 4” (10 cm). In pattern, 10 rows = 4” (10 cm).
instructions:
Row 1: Work 19 Fsc (see Special Stitches).
Row 2 (Right side): Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in each of the next 18 sts; turn—19 dc.
Row 3: Ch 1 (does not count as a st), sc in each of the next 18 dc, sc in top of beginning ch-3; turn—19 sc.
Row 4: Ch 3, dc in each of the next 2 sc,* Fptr around next dc 2 rows below, BR (see Special Stitches) over next 3 dc 2 rows below, Fptr around next dc 2 rows below, dc in each of the next 3 sc; repeat from * once; turn—9 dc, 10 Fptr.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each of the next 18 sts and in the top of beginning ch-3; turn—19 sc.
Row 6: Ch 3, dc in each of the next 2 sc,* Fptr around next Fptr 2 rows below, BR over next 3 BR sts 2 rows below, Fptr around next dc 2 rows below, dc in each of the next 3 sc; repeat from * once; turn—9 dc, 10 Fptr.
Repeat Rows 5-6 until piece measures 70” (178 cm), ending on a Row 5. Fasten off, weave in ends.
EDGING
Note: Open up the Sashay Sequins to smooth it out, and work into the top edge without the sequins. Start 4” (10 cm) from the end, and work into every other loop on the top edge to create the ruffle.
Hold Sashay Sequins and long side of Scarf with Right sides together. Insert hook into corner st of Scarf and through first loop of Sashay Sequins, draw loop up to join; *working evenly along first side of Scarf, insert hook into next st on Scarf and pull up another loop of Sashay Sequins and make a slip st; repeat from * across. Do not fasten off. Trim the Sashay Sequins, leaving a 4” (10 cm) end, and use sewing needle and thread to sew the last loop of Sashay Sequins to the Scarf to secure it. Fold under the corner of the ruffle and tack it to the Wrong side to finish the end; repeat for other end. Repeat for second side.
Special Stitches
Fsc = foundation single crochet.
First stitch: Chain 2, insert hook into second chain from hook, yarn over, draw up a loop, yarn over, draw through 1 loop (chain portion of stitch completed), yarn over, draw through both loops on hook (single crochet portion of stitch completed).
Remaining stitches: Insert hook under 2 loops of chain portion of previous stitch, yarn over, draw up a loop, yarn over, draw through 1 loop (chain portion of stitch completed), yarn over, draw through both loops on hook (single crochet portion of stitch completed).
Fptr = front post treble crochet. Yarn over twice, insert hook from front to back and to front again around the vertical post of indicated stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, [yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook] 3 times.
BR = braid. Worked over the next 3 stitches 2 rows below as indicated: skip first stitch 2 rows below, Fptr around each of the next 2 stitches 2 rows below, Fptr around first skipped stitch 2 rows below.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein 358 Lavender
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 6.5mm [US K-10.5] and 8mm [US L-11]
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 5” (13cm) x 60” (152 cm)
gauge: 12 sts = 4” [10 cm]; 4 rows = 4” [10 cm] in treble
instructions:
With smaller hook, loosely ch 198.
Row 1: Tr in 5th ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 195 sts.
Rows 2, 4 and 6: Ch 3 (counts as 1 hdc and ch-1), * skip next tr, hdc in next tr, ch 1; repeat from * to last 2 sts; skip next tr, hdc in top of ch-4; turn – 97 ch-1 spaces.
Rows 3 and 5: Ch 4, skip first hdc, * tr in next space, tr in next hdc; repeat from * across working last tr in 2nd ch of ch-3; turn.
Row 7: Repeat Row 3. Fasten off.

Form Pockets
Fold each short edge at 15th tr to form 2 pockets (each approximately 5” [13 cm] deep) and pin or baste loosely in position, lining up the 7 ch-1 spaces of front and back.

Picot Edging
With pocket opening facing you and smaller hook, join yarn to corner of pocket (the 15th tr) and work across long edge working through 2 layers to secure pocket as follows: ch 3, * skip 1 st, hdc in next st, ch 3, sc around post of hdc to form picot, ch 1; repeat from * across, end ch 1, hdc in corner (the 15th tr). Fasten off.
In same way, work Edging across opposite long edge. Weave in ends.

Trim (Make 2)
With larger hook, make a ch 20” [51 cm] long; slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Reflective™: 1 ball each of 8429 Grey A, and 8671 Neon Green B
abbreviations: A and B = Color A and Color B
measurements: Scarf measures about 4” (10 cm) wide and 70” (178 cm) long.
gauge: 10 sts = 4” (10cm); 6 rows = 4” (10 cm) in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With A, ch 177 loosely.
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch counts as first dc) and in each ch to end of row, change to B when completing last dc—175 dc.
Row 2: With B, ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), turn, skip first st, dc in each st to end of row, work last dc in top of beginning ch and change to A.
Row 3: With A, ch 3, turn, skip first st, dc in each st to end of row, work last dc in top of beginning ch and change to B.
Rows 4–6: Repeat Rows 2 and 3, then repeat Row 2.
Fasten off.
FINISHING: Weave in ends.

abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Scarf measures 6” wide x 56” long.
gauge: Gauge is not important for this project and varies depending on which section of yarn is in use.
instructions:
Row 1: Ch 16; sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 15 sc.
Row 2: Ch 4 (counts as tr), skip first sc, dc in next sc, ch 3, cl over post of dc just made, [skip next 2 sc, dc in next sc, ch 3, cl over post of dc just made] 4 times, tr in last sc; turn.
Rows 3-41: Ch 4, [dc in ch-3 space, ch 3, cl over post of dc just made] 5 times, tr in top of ch-4; turn.
Row 42: Ch 1, sc in tr, 2 sc in next ch-3 space, [3 sc in next ch-3 space] 3 times, 2 sc in next ch-3 space, sc in top of ch-4. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Soft™”: 1 skein each 9344 Chocolate A and 9518 Teal B.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Scarf measures 9” wide x 54 (64)” long.
gauge: 12 sts = 4”; 8 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions: NOTE: Scarf is worked lengthwise from the center out. SCARF With A, ch 146 (174) loosely. Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook and each st across. Turn 144 (172) dc. Row 2 (Right Side): Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in each st across. Turn. Row 3: Ch 3, dc in same st, 2 dc in each st across. Turn. 288 (344) dc. Row 4: Repeat row 2. Row 5: Ch 3, dc in next st, 2 dc in next st, * dc in next st, 2 dc in next st; Repeat from * across. Turn. 432 (516) dc. Row 6: Repeat row 2. Row 7: Ch 3, dc in next 2 sts, 2 dc in next st, * dc in next 2 sts, 2 dc in next st. Turn. 576 (688) dc. Row 8: Repeat row 2. Fasten off. With Right Side facing, join B to opposite side of foundation chain. Row 1: Ch 3, dc in each ch across. Turn. Rows 2-8: Repeat rows 2-8 from previous side. Fasten off. FINISHING Weave in all ends. RED HEART® “Super Soft™”, Art E777, available in solid color 10oz (283g), 515 yd (471m) skeins.

materials: Caron® One Pound™ (16. oz/454 g; 812 yds/742 m) Soft Sage (0580) 1 ball
Size N/15 (10 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Fsc = Foundation single crochet (This technique creates a foundation chain and a row of single crochet stitches in one)
measurements: Approx. 17" [43 cm] wide x 60" [152.5 cm] long.
gauge: In pattern stitch, 1 pattern repeat = 21/2" [6.5 cm] and 6 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
If a wider wrap is desired, add 7 chains or Fsc for each additional repeat desired. For a narrower wrap, subtract 7 chains or Fsc for each repeat to be reduced. WRAP Note: The wrap can begin with a familiar foundation chain (ch 46) or with a row of foundation single crochet (Fsc).

Beginning with foundation chain: Ch 49, (dc, ch 1, dc) in 4th ch from hook, then continue with 1st row.

Beginning with row of foundation single crochet: Fsc 46, ch 3, (dc, ch 1, dc) in first Fsc, then continue with 1st row.

1st row: (RS). Sk next 2 chs or sts, sc in next ch or st, *ch 3, sk next 3 chs or sts, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch or st (V-st made), sk next 2 chs or sts, sc in next ch or st; repeat from * across, turn—7 sc, 7 V-sts, and 7 ch-3 sps.

2nd to 90th rows: Ch 3, (dc, ch 1, dc) in first sc, *sc in next ch-3 sp, ch 3, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next sc; repeat from * across, sc in top of turning ch, turn.

91st row: Ch 1, work 1 sc in each sc, dc, and ch across, do not turn—46 sc.

Border
1st rnd: Working in ends of rows across side edge, *(sc, ch 1, sc) around turning ch of next row, ch 1, sk next sc row; repeat from * across side edge, sc in side of last row of side edge, ch 1; working along opposite side of first row (short edge), **sc in next ch or st, ch 1; repeat from ** across; work across opposite side edge in same manner as first side edge; work across sts of last row (91st row) in same manner as opposite short edge; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Using yarn needle, weave in all ends.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® Ombre™ (10 oz/283 g; 482 yds/440 m) Sea Coral (3967) 2 balls
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 9" x 71" [23 x 181 cm], excluding pompoms.
gauge: 11 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Notes:
• Scarf is worked lengthwise in 2 Halves. After First Half is completed, Second Half is worked along foundation chain of First Half.
• Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc.
Ch 200 loosely. See diagram on page 2. 
First Half: 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Skip next 2 ch. 5 dc in next ch. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 33 groups of 5-dc.
**2nd row: Ch 3. 2 dc in first sc. *Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Skip next 2 dc. 5 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last 5 dc. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Skip next 2 dc. 3 dc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Skip next 2 dc. 5 dc in next sc. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last sc and 3 dc. Skip next 2 dc. 5 dc in next sc. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in last dc. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows for Shell Stitch Pattern until work from beg measures approx 4½" [11.5 cm], ending on a 3rd row. Fasten off.

Second Half: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to first rem loop of foundation ch of First Half.
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Skip next 2 ch. 5 dc in next ch. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 33 groups of 5-dc.
Rep from ** to ** as given for First Half.
Pompom (make 2)
Wind yarn around 4 fingers 120 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Scarf. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. Gather ends of Scarf. Sew securely to each end of Scarf.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver Chunky®: 1 skein each 776 Dark Orchid A and 378 Claret B.
measurements: Scarf measures 90” (229 cm).
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions: Using 1 strand of A and B held together, chain 135, slip stitch in first chain to form a circle, taking care not to twist stitches. Round 1: *Chain 25, slip stitch in next 2 chain; repeat from * around, slip stitch in first st to join. Fasten off. FINISHING: Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Soft Essentials Stripes™: 6 balls 7940 Maritime Stripe
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 9” (23 cm) wide and 86” (218 cm) long, including fringe.
gauge: 13 dc = 4” (10 cm); 6 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
Ch 33.
Row 1: Dc in 4th chain from hook, 1 dc in next ch, * ch 1, skip 1 ch, 1 dc in each of next 3 ch; repeat from * to end of row – 24 dc, 7 ch-1 spaces.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc), 1 dc in each of next 2 sts, * ch 1, skip 1, 1 dc in each of next 3 sts; repeat from * to last 3 sts, 2 dc, 1 dc in top of ch-3 of previous row.
Row 3: Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and 1 ch), skip 1, 1 dc in 3rd dc of previous row, 1 edc, 1 dc in the next st, * ch 1, skip 1, 1 dc, 1 edc, 1 dc; repeat from * to last 2 sts, ch1, skip 1, 1 dc in top of ch-3 of previous row – 16 dc, 7 edc, 8 ch-1 spaces.
Row 4: Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and 1 ch), skip ch-1 space, 3 dc, * ch 1, skip ch-1 space, 3 dc; repeat from * to last ch 4 from previous row, ch 1, dc in top of 3rd ch of previous row – 23 dc, 8 ch-1 spaces.
Row 5: Ch 3, 1 edc, 1 dc, * ch 1, skip 1, 1 dc, 1 edc, 1 dc; repeat from * to last 2 sts, ch 1, skip 1, 1 edc, dc in top of 3rd ch of previous row – 16 dc, 8 edc, 8 ch-1 spaces.
Repeat rows 2-5 until piece measures 76” (193 cm).
FINISHING
Fringe
Cut thirty-six 11” (28 cm) lengths of yarn. Hold 2 strands of yarn together; fold in half to form a loop at the top. Pull loop through the first ch 1 space, then pull ends of fringe through loop. Continue to add fringe in each ch-1 space across the edge for a total of 7 fringe bundles. Add additional fringe bundles to beginning of row and end of row. Repeat for opposite end of scarf.
Weave in all loose ends.

materials: STITCH NATION by Debbie Stoller™ “Bamboo Ewe™”: 1 Ball Each 5910 Lipstick A, 5705 Snapdragon B, 5280 Geranium C and 5625 Sprout D.
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Scarf is 6” x 85”.
gauge: 12 sts = 4” in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Note: Scarf is worked lengthwise. Leave 6” tail when beginning and ending every row to add to Fringe.
SCARF
With A, ch 256
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across – 255 sc.
Cut A, leaving 6” tail.
Row 2: Leaving a 6” tail, change to B, ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 3: Leaving a 6” tail, change to C, ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 4: Leaving a 6” tail, change to D, ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 5: Leaving a 6” tail, change to A, ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 6: Leaving a 6” tail, change to B, ch 4 (counts as tr), turn, *skip 1 st, tr in next st, tr in skipped st; repeat from * across to last st, tr in last st.
Row 7: Leaving a 6” tail, change to B, ch 1, turn, sc in each st across, sc in top of ch-4.
Rows 8-9: Leaving a 6” tail, change to C and repeat Rows 6-7.
Rows 10-11: Leaving a 6” tail, change to D and repeat Rows 6-7.
Row 12: Leaving a 6” tail, change to A, ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Rows 13-14: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Rows 15-16: Leaving a 6” tail, change to B, ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Cut 12” lengths of different colors of yarn to add to long tails. Matching colors with row tails, fold lengths in half. Each Fringe should have 6 strands. Pull folded end of lengths through each row end. Pull ends of lengths and long tails through folded end. Weave in ends.

materials: 1 skein RED HEART® Super Saver® 706 Perfect Pink
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Scarf measures 7” x 63” excluding fringe
gauge: 12 sts = 4”; 12 rows = 7” in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Ch 212.
foundation Row: Dc in 4th ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 210 dc.
