Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, * work arch over first set of 10 sts as follows: skip first 5 dc, work 9 tr in between 5th and 6th dc, skip 5 more dc (the 6th through the 10th) and work 1 sc in between 10th and first dc of next set; in same way, repeat from * across, working 1 arch over each set of 10 sts (9 tr after every 5th st, then 1 sc in between 10th and first dc of next set), ending 1 sc in top of ch-3; turn – 21 arches.
Row 2: Ch 4, tr in first sc, ch 5, * (tr, ch 3, tr) all in next sc, ch 5; repeat from * to last st; (tr, ch 1, tr) all in space between last tr and ch-1; turn.
Row 3: Ch 3, 4 tr in ch-1 space, * sc into 5th (middle) st of 9-tr arch from Row 1 (catching ch-5 from Row 2 in the process) **, 9 tr into ch-3 space; repeat from * to last 2 sts, end at **; 5 tr in space in between last tr and ch-4; turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first tr, ch 2, * (tr, ch 3, tr) all in next sc **, ch 5; repeat from * to last st, end at **; ch 2, sc in top of ch-3; turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, * 9 tr in ch-3 space **, sc into 5th (middle) st of 9-tr arch from Row 3 (catching ch-5 in the process); repeat from * to last sc, end at **; sc in last sc. Fasten off.
With right side facing, join yarn to opposite end of Foundation Row, ch 1 and work Row 1 as before, working 9 tr into same space opposite first arch, then skip 5 sts and work sc, and so on across row, end sc in final st. Repeat Rows 2-5 as before. Fasten off.
fringe
Cut 10” strands of yarn. Holding 5 strands together, knot 5 fringes evenly along center of scarf as shown. Trim yarn ends.

materials: Caron® Colorama™ O’Go™ (6.4 oz/180 g; 228 yds/208 m)
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 9" [23 cm] wide x 80" [203 cm] long, excluding fringe.
gauge: 10 sts and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Notes:
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plas-
tic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet. 
• Start crocheting!
• Pull tie to remove. 
• Use colors as they appear from each O’Go, using Contrast A O’Go for 2 rows and Contrast B O’Go for 2 rows to create random Stripe Pat as shown.
• To join new color, work to last loops on hook of first color. Yoh (Yarn over hook) with new color, draw through loops and pro-
ceed with new color.
• Carry color not in use up side of work.
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc.

SCARF (worked lengthwise)
With A, chain (ch) 202.
1st row:  1 half double crochet (hdc) in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 200 hdc.
2nd row:  Ch 2. Working in back loops only,  1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. Join B.
First 2 rows of Stripe Pat are complete. 
Continue (Cont) in Stripe Pat, repeat (rep) 2nd row until work from beginning (beg) measures approx 9" [23 cm], ending with 2 rows of B.
Fasten off.
Fringe: Cut strands of Contrast B leftover shades 16" [40.5 cm] long. Taking 3 strands together (tog), fold in half and knot into fringe across ends of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Changes®: 2 balls 9403 Granite
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Scarf measures approximately 6” x 84” (15 x 213.5 cm), unblocked
gauge: Gauge is not critical to this project.
instructions:
Ch 164 loosely.
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from the hook (beginning ch count as first dc), (dc, ch 1, 2 dc) in same ch (first shell made), *skip next 3 ch, shell in next st; repeat from * across, turn—40 shells.
Row 2: Ch 1, slip st in each dc and ch of first shell, ch 3 (counts as first dc), (dc, ch 1, 2 dc) in space between first 2 shells, *shell in space between next 2 shells; repeat from * across, turn—39 shells.
Repeat Row 2 twelve times or until desired length is reached. Each row will have 1 less shell than the previous row. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Wet block, if desired.

materials: Bernat ® Plentiful™ (10.6 oz/300 g; 952 yds/871 m) Lavender Fog (19018) 1 ball
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook.
Hdcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook.
measurements: Cowl: Approx 26" [66 cm] around x 20" [51 cm] deep. Hat: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 10 hdc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
Hat is worked side to side.
Ch 2 at beg of rnds does not count as hdc.
Join each rnd of Cowl with sl st.
HAT
Ch 38.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 27 ch. 1 sc in each of last 8 ch. Turn. 36 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in each of first 8 sc. *Work 1 hdc into horizontal bar created below st in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked – see diagram). Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. *Work 1 hdc into horizontal bar created below st in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked). Rep from * 27 times more. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in each of last 8 sc. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows until Hat (at widest point) measures approx 19" [48 cm], ending on a 2nd row. Fasten off leaving a long end.
FINISHING
Using long end, sew center back seam. Weave yarn through short side of Hat (sc rows) and gather top of Hat tog securely. Turn back cuff as shown in photo.
COWL
Ch 66. Join with sl st to first ch making sure not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each ch around. Join. 66 hdc.
2nd to 5th rnds: Ch 1. *1 hdcfp around next st. 1 hdcbp around next st. Rep from * around. Join.
Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st around. Join.
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 18" [45.5 cm].
Next 4 rnds: Ch 1. *1 hdcfp around next st. 1 hdcbp around next st. Rep from * around. Join.
Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st around. Join.
Fasten off.

abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Scarf measures 5½” wide x 74” long.
gauge: 7 sts = 4”; 6 rows = 4” in pattern st using 2 strands of yarn held together. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCARF
Holding 2 strands of yarn together throughout, ch 132
Row 1: Dc in 3rd ch from hook and each ch across – 130 sts. 
Rows 2, 4 and 6: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), 
turn, hdc in next 12 dc, [ch 6, skip next 5 dc, hdc in next 6 dc] 
9 times, ch 6, skip next 5 dc, hdc in last 13 dc. 
Rows 3, 5 and 7: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), 
turn, dc in next 12 hdc, [5 dc in next ch-6 space, dc in next 6 
hdc] 9 times, 5 dc in next ch-6 space, dc in next 13 hdc.
Row 8: Ch 1, turn, sc in each dc across. 
Fasten off.
Trim Row: With right side facing and working across 
opposite edge of foundation ch, join yarn in first st, ch 1, sc 
in each ch across. 
Fasten off. 
FINISHING
Weave in ends. 
Fringes
Cut 64 strands of yarn, each 22” long. Holding 4 strands 
together, fold lengths in half. With right side facing, insert 
hook from wrong side to right side along one short edge 
of Scarf and pull loop through. Pull ends through loop and 
pull to tighten. Work 32 fringes across each short edge. 
Trim ends evenly.

materials: RED HEART® Reflective™: 2 balls 8251 Neon Orange E, and 1 ball each 8242 Neon Yellow A, 8671 Neon Green B, 8704 Neon Pink C, 8012 Black D, and 8429 Grey F
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 6mm [US J-10] and 8mm [US L-11]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 8” x 70” (20.5 x 178 cm), not including fringe
gauge: 12 sts = 4” (10 cm); 11 rows = 4” (10 cm) in pattern with larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Row 1 (right side): With larger hook and A, Fsc 23, turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, *ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * to last sc, sc in last sc, turn—13 sc and 10 ch-1 spaces.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to last 2 sc, ch 1, skip next sc, sc in last sc, turn—12 sc and 11 ch-1 spaces.
Rows 4: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc in next ch-1 space, *ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to last sc, sc in last sc, turn—13 sc and 10 ch-1 spaces.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to last 2 sc, ch 1, skip next sc, sc in last sc, turn—12 sc and 11 ch-1 spaces.
Rows 6–19: Repeat Rows 4 and 5 seven times. Change to B in last st of Row 19.
Row 20: Ch 1, sc in first sc, dc in next ch-1 space, *sc in next sc, dc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across to last sc, sc in last sc, turn—12 sc and 11 dc.
Row 21: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *ch 1, skip next dc, sc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—12 sc and 11 ch-1 spaces.
Rows 22–35: Repeat Rows 20 and 21 seven times. Change to C in last st of Row 35.
Rows 36–55: Repeat Rows 4 and 5 ten times. Change to D in last st of Row 55.
Rows 56–69: Repeat Rows 20 and 21 seven times. Change to E in last st of Row 69.
Rows 70–83: Repeat Rows 4 and 5 seven times. Change to F in last st of Row 83.
Rows 84–103: Repeat Rows 20 and 21 ten times. Change to E in last st of Row 103.
Rows 104–117: Repeat Rows 4 and 5 seven times. Change to D in last st of Row 117.
Rows 118–131: Repeat Rows 20 and 21 seven times. Change to C in last st of Row 131.
Rows 132–151: Repeat Rows 4 and 5 ten times. Change to B in last st of Row 151.
Rows 152–167: Repeat Rows 20 and 21 eight times. Change to A in last st of Row 167.
Rows 168–185: Repeat Rows 4 and 5 nine times.
Row 186: Ch 1, sc in each sc and ch-1 space across. Fasten off.
Fringe
With right side of one end facing and smaller hook, join E with slip st to 2nd sc, ch 45, slip st in first sc, *ch 45, skip next unworked sc, slip st in next sc, ch 45, slip st in skipped sc; repeat from * across. Fasten off. Repeat for other end.
FINISHING
Wet block fringe by stretching each loop to 7”/18cm length, pin in place, and spray with water.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein 1620 Clover
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Scarf measures 6” [15cm] x 60” [152.5cm]
gauge: Pattern st = 6” [15cm]; 14 rows = 6” [15cm] in Pattern
instructions:
Ch 18.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, *ch 1, skip next 3 chs, (Puff st, ch 2, Puff st, ch 2, Puff st) in next st, ch 1, skip 3 chs, sc in next ch; repeat from * once more, turn.
Row 2: Ch 3, dc in sc, ch 2, (skip ch-1 space, Puff st and ch-2 space), sc in top of Puff st, ch 2, (skip ch-2 space, Puff st and ch-1 space), 3 dc in sc, ch 2, (skip ch-1 space, Puff st and ch-2 space), sc in top of Puff st, ch 2, (skip ch-2 space, Puff st and ch-1 space), 2 dc in sc, turn.
Row 3: Ch 3, (Half Puff st, ch 2, Puff st) in first dc, ch 1, skip dc and ch-2 space, sc in sc, ch 1, skip ch-2 space and dc, (Puff st, ch 2, Puff st, ch 2, Puff st) in next dc, ch 1, skip dc and ch-2 space, sc in sc, ch 1, skip ch-2 space and dc, (Puff st, ch 2, Half Puff st) in top of ch 3, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in Half Puff st, ch 2, (skip ch-2 space, Puff st and ch-1 space), 3 dc in sc, ch 2, (skip ch-1 space, Puff st and ch-2 space), sc in Puff st, ch 2, (skip ch-2 space, Puff st and ch-1 space), 3 dc in sc, ch 2, (skip ch-1 space, Puff st and ch-2 space), sc in Half Puff st, turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in sc, ch 1, skip ch-2 space and dc, (Puff st, ch 2, Puff st, ch 2, Puff st) in next dc, ch 1, skip dc and ch-2 space, sc in sc, ch 1, skip ch-2 space and dc, (Puff st, ch 2, Puff st, ch 2, Puff st) in next dc, ch 1, skip dc and ch-2 space, sc in sc.
Edging: Work Reverse Single Crochet evenly spaced around edges of Scarf. Fasten off.
FINISHING: Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® All in One™ Granny Square™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 417 yds/381 m)
Contrast A: Warm Wheat (2010) 1 ball (12 Granny Squares)
Contrast B: Soft Sky (2011) 1 ball (12 Granny Squares)
Contrast C: Lily Pad (2014) 1 ball (12 Granny Squares)
Contrast A: Moody Cherry (2019) 1 ball (12 Granny Squares)
Contrast B: Dove (2016) 1 ball (12 Granny Squares)
Contrast C: Carnation Code (2020) 1 ball (12 Granny Squares)
Contrast A: Pink Punch (2001) 1 ball (12 Granny Squares)
Contrast B: Frigid (2004) 1 ball (12 Granny Squares)
Contrast C: Amethyst (2005) 1 ball (12 Granny Squares)
Contrast A: Hot Stuff (2000) 1 ball (12 Granny Squares)
Contrast B: Pink Punch (2001) 1 ball (12 Granny Squares)
Contrast C: Citrus Twist (2002) 1 ball (12 Granny Squares)
Contrast A: Carnation Code (2020) 1 ball (12 Granny Squares)
Contrast B: Cyber Leaf (2021) 1 ball (12 Granny Squares)
Contrast C: Hyper Violet (2022) 1 ball (12 Granny Squares)
Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Version 1: Contrast D Aran (0313) 1 ball or 93 yds/85 m
Versions 2 & 5: Contrast D Black (0312) 1 ball or 93 yds/85 m
Versions 3 & 4: Contrast D Soft White (0316) 1 ball or 93 yds/85 m
measurements: Approx 18" [45.5 cm] wide x 72" [183 cm] long, excluding fringe.
gauge: Motif = Approx 6" [15 cm] square.
instructions:
MOTIFS (make 12 each with A, B and C)
Notes:
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as double crochet (dc).
• Ch 6 at beg of rnds counts as dc and ch-3 sp.
• Join all rnds with slip stitch (sl st) to 3rd ch of ch-6 unless otherwise indicated.
With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 6. (3 dc. Ch 3) 3 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
3rd rnd: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
4th and 5th rnds: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *(Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp to next ch-3 sp. Ch 1.** (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. 
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Seaming with Flat Sl St Join: (RS). With D, sl st Motifs tog, working through back loops only and keeping working yarn to WS of work to create a flat sl st chain detail on RS of work (see diagram). Follow Assembly Guide to join Motifs into 12 horizontal Strips, having 3 Motifs in each Strip. Join 12 Strips tog.
Note: Keep working yarn to WS of work so only flat sl st chain is visible on RS.
Fringe
Cut strands of D 16" [40.5 cm] long. Taking 3 strands together (tog), fold in half and knot into fringe across both ends of Scarf, working each fringe into ch-1 sps and ch-3 sps. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver Color Block™ (10 oz/283 g; 482 yds/440 m) Iris Bouquet (9559), or Liquid Teal (9501), or Party Time (9525) 1 ball
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 7" [18 cm] x 72"  [183 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 12 hdc and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Chain (Ch) 24.
1st row: 1 half double crochet (hdc) in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 22 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). Skip 1st hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Repeat (Rep) 2nd row until Scarf measures 72" [183 cm].
Fasten oﬀ.
Fringe
Cut lengths of yarn 10" [25.5 cm] long. Taking 5 strands together (tog), fold in half and knot into fringe along both ends of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly.

Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Trfp = (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times
measurements: Scarf: Approx 6" x 80" [15 x 203 cm], excluding fringe. Hood: Approx 10" [25.5 cm] deep. Total Length: Approx 52" [132 cm] after sewing hood seam.
gauge: 14 hdc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions: Notes: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st. Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc. SCARF With MC, ch 12. 1st row: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 10 dc. 2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. Skip next 3 dc. 1 trfp around each of next 3 dc. Working around skipped dc, 1 trfp around each of next 3 dc. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Turn. 10 sts. 3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. 1 dcbp around each of next 6 sts. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Turn. Rep 2nd and 3rd rows for pat until work from beg measures approx 80" [203 cm], ending on 2nd row. Turn work sidewise and with WS facing, work 322 sc across long edge of Scarf. Proceed as follows: 1st row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. Rep last row 8 times more. Fasten off. Hood: With RS facing, skip first 121 hdc. Join MC with sl st to next hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st and each of next 79 hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. Rep last row 8 times more. Fasten off. Scarf edging: With RS facing join MC with sl st at corner of foundation ch. 1st row: Ch 1. Work 322 sc across foundation ch. Turn. 2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off. FINISHING Pin to measurements. Cover with a damp cloth, leaving cloth to dry. Sew hood seam. Fringe: Cut strands of A 16" [40.5 cm] long. Taking 4 strands tog, fold in half and knot into fringe across both ends of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly. Pompom: Wind A around 3 fingers 100 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Hood. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. Sew securely to top of Hood. Fringe: Cut yarn 10 to 14 ins [25.5 to 35.5 cm] long. Taking 2 or 3 strands together for each fringe knot into fringe across cast on and cast off edges. Trim fringe evenly.

abbreviations: A, B, C, D, E = Colors A, B, C, D, E
measurements: Scarf measures 7" (17.8 cm) wide x 99" (251.5 cm) long.
gauge: 13 dc = 4" (10 cm); 9 dc rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
With A, ch 24. Row 1 (Right Side): Dc in 3rd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn – 23 dc. Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in each dc across, turn. Row 3: Repeat Row 2. Fasten off. Break A, leaving a 6" (15.25 cm) tail.

Stripe Sequence
Work the following color sequence, breaking yarn and leaving a 6" (15.25 cm) tail before changing to the next color:

Rows 46-48: With C, repeat Row 2.
Rows 49-50: With A, repeat Row 2.
Rows 51-56: With B, repeat Row 2.
Rows 57-60: With E, repeat Row 2.
Row 61: With A, repeat Row 2.
Rows 62-73: With D, repeat Row 2.
Rows 74-78: With C, repeat Row 2.
Rows 79-80: With B, repeat Row 2.
Rows 81-90: With A, repeat Row 2.
Rows 91-93: With D, repeat Row 2. 
Rows 94-105: With E, repeat Row 2. 
Rows 106-109: With B, repeat Row 2. 
Rows 110-111: With D, repeat Row 2. 
Rows 112-119: With C, repeat Row 2.

Rows 123-124: With A, repeat Row 2. 
Rows 125-130: With D, repeat Row 2. 
Rows 131-140: With E, repeat Row 2. 
Row 141: With C, repeat Row 2.
Rows 142-148: With B, repeat Row 2. 
Rows 149-162: With A, repeat Row 2. 
Rows 163-165: With D, repeat Row 2. 
Rows 166-170: With C, repeat Row 2. 
Row 171: With D, repeat Row 2.
Rows 172-174: With E, repeat Row 2. 
Rows 175-179: With A, repeat Row 2. 
Rows 180-186: With B, repeat Row 2. 
Rows 187-188: With A, repeat Row 2. 
Rows 189-192: With C, repeat Row 2. 
Rows 193-201: With D, repeat Row 2. 
Row 202: With E, repeat Row 2. 
Rows 203-204: With C, repeat Row 2. 
Rows 205-210: With A, repeat Row 2. 
Rows 211-213: With E, repeat Row 2. 
Rows 214-221: With B, repeat Row 2.

FINISHING
Weave in all yarn ends. Block lightly as desired.

pattern_name: Broomstick Lace Scarf, Stole or Throw
materials: One each size US J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook, or size to obtain gauge.
One size 50 (25mm) jumbo knitting needle or 1"/2.5cm diameter dowel or rod.
measurements: Width: Scarf 8"/20.5 cm, Stole 18 1/2"/47 cm, Throw 45"/114.5 cm; Length: Scarf 60"/152.5 cm, Stole 60"/152.5 cm, Throw 60"/152.5 cm
gauge: 13 Fsc = 4"/10cm; in single crochet, 13 sts = 4"/10cm; in broomstick and blocks pattern, 15 sts (3 groups of 5 loops) and 6 rows = 4"/10cm. Note: Piece will lengthen and narrow when blocked and worn.
instructions:
SPECIAL TERMS
Fsc: Foundation single crochet (This technique creates a foundation chain and a row of single crochet stitches in one) –Step 1: Place a slip knot on hook, ch 2, insert hook in 2nd ch from hook and draw up a loop; yarn over and draw through one loop on hook (the "chain"); yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook (the "single crochet").Step 2: The following stitch is worked under the forward 2 loops of the stem of the previous stitch (into the "chain"). Insert hook into the face of the "chain" and under the nub at the back of the "chain", draw up a loop, yarn over and draw through one loop on hook (the "chain"), yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook (the "single crochet"). Repeat for the length of foundation.
SPECIAL TECHNIQUE
Broomstick Lace—Broomstick lace is made with the use of a large gauge knitting needle (stick) to hold all the loops in a row. Then, using a crochet hook, the loops are held together in groups and worked off the stick with regular crochet stitches. This pattern uses groups of 5 loops, with 5 sc worked into each group. For this particular method of Broomstick technique, the stick is held to the left (for right-handed crocheters), and the two steps of this technique are made with RS facing. In the first step you may need to snug up each loop after slipping it to the stick in order to keep all the loops as even as possible, but do not tighten the loops too much. The row of loops on the stick should slide freely in order to be more easily worked off in the second step.
Note: To slip a loop from the crochet hook to the stick, keep the loop seated in the same direction. That is, bring the hook to the tip of the stick, transfer the loop from the hook to the stick without twisting, so the strand that lies to the front of the hook ends up at the front of the stick.Loop Pass (RS): At the end of a regular crochet row, do not turn. With the stick to the left and the last row of crochet to the right, slip the last loop on hook onto the stick (counts as first loop). Moving from left to right, backwards across the row of regular crochet, skip first sc, *insert empty hook through back loop only of next sc, yarn over and draw up a loop long enough to fit over the stick. Slip the loop onto the stick as described above, without twisting; repeat from * across the row as directed, do not turn.Return Pass (RS): Insert empty hook from right to left in the first 5 loops on stick, keeping loops seated in same direction. Holding the 5 loops in a group and working the group as one, slide the group off the stick (5 loops on hook). Pick up the feeder yarn from the back of the row, bring yarn loosely up to the level of the hook, yarn over and draw a loop through the group of 5 loops on hook (one loop on hook), ch 1 to lock the edge (one loop on hook). This is the only place you will need to ch 1 before making a stitch. Working the group as one, work 5 sc in the same group. *Insert hook in next 5 loops on stick, slide group off the stick, 5 sc in group; repeat from * across row.
SCARF
Note: If you prefer to begin scarf (stole, throw) with a traditional foundation chain, work as follows: Ch 31 (71,171). Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—30 (70, 170) sc. Then proceed to Row 2 of instructions.Fsc 30 (70, 170). Turn foundation over so sc edge is on top, begin work across the sc edge.Row 1 (WS): Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), sk first sc, dc in next sc, *ch 2, sk next 2 sc, dc in next 2 sc; repeat from * across, turn—7 (17, 42) ch-2 sp.Row 2 (RS): Ch 3, sk first dc, dc in next dc, 2 dc in next ch-2 sp, *ch 2, sk next 2 dc, 2 dc in next ch-2 sp; repeat from * across to last 2 dc, dc in next dc, dc in last dc (top of turning ch), turn—6 (16, 41) ch-2 sp.Row 3 (WS): Ch 3, sk first dc, dc in next dc, *ch 2, sk next 2 dc, 2 dc in next ch-2 sp; repeat from * across to last 4 dc, ch 2, sk next 2 dc, dc in last 2 dc, turn—7 (17, 42) ch-2 sp.Row 4 (RS): Ch 1, sc in first dc, sc in next dc, 2 sc in next ch-2 sp, *sc in next 2 dc, 2 sc in next ch-2 sp; repeat from * across to last 2 dc, sc in last 2 dc, DO NOT TURN—30 (70, 170) sc.Row 5 (RS): Work Loop Pass (See Special Technique–Broomstick Lace, above)—30 (70, 170) loops on stick.Row 6 (RS): Work Return Pass, DO NOT TURN—30 sc in 6 groups of 5 sc (70 sc in 14 groups of 5 sc, 170 sc in 34 groups of 5 sc).Rows 7 and 8 (RS): Repeat Rows 5 and 6, TURN at the end of Row 8.Rows 9–88: Repeat Rows 1–8 for 10 times, or as many times for length desired.Rows 89–92: Repeat Rows 1–4, TURN at the end of Row 92.Finishing Edge: Sk first sc, sl st in each sc across. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Using yarn needle, weave in all ends. Wet block piece for best results.

abbreviations: *or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 5” wide x 52½” long.
gauge: 6 sts = 1½”; 2 rows = 1” in dc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCARF
Side (Make 2)
Row 1: Ch 21; sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 20 sc.
Row 2: Ch 4, working in back loops only, 2 tr in first sc, 3 tr in each sc across; turn – 60 tr.
Row 3: Ch 3, skip first tr, dc in each tr across and in top of ch-4; slip st down side edge of dc and tr rows, then slip st in first front loop unworked on sc row; turn.
Row 4: Ch 3, skip first front loop, dc in each front loop across; turn – 20 dc.
Rows 5 and 6: Ch 3, skip first dc, dc in each dc across and in top of ch-3; turn.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in each dc across and in top of ch-3; turn.
Row 8: Ch 4, working in back loops only, tr in first sc, 2 tr in each sc across; turn – 40 tr.
Rows 9-77: Repeat Rows 3-8, then repeat Rows 3 and 4 again. You will have 13 ruffles. Fasten off. Seam 2 sides together at center back neck.
Edging
With right side facing, join yarn with a slip st in first dc of first Row 3, * skip next dc, 5 dc in next dc **, skip next dc, slip st in next dc; repeat from * to last 3 dc, end at **; slip st in last dc. Fasten off. Weave in ends. Repeat Edging on opposite end.

materials: Red Heart® Boutique Midnight®: 3 balls 1945 Shadow
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Scarf Measures 6½” x 70” [16.5cm x 178cm], after blocking
gauge: 4” [10 cm]; 15 rows = 4” [10 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain your gauge.
instructions:
SCARF
Ch 33. Row 1 (foundation): Working in back bumps, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across—32 sc.
Row 2 (Bottom Edging): Ch 3, turn piece 90 degrees, slip st in end of Row 1, turn piece to work along chain side (bottom) of Row 1, ch 1, [skip 1 st, (sc, hdc, sc) next st, skip 1 st, slip st in next st] 8 times, ch 3, slip st in end of Row 1.
Row 3: Ch 2, working across Row 1, *skip 1 st, sc in next st, ch 1*, repeat from * to * 14 times, skip 1 st, sc in last st of row, turn—16 sc, 15 ch-1 spaces, 1 ch-2 space.
Row 4: Ch 2, *skip 1 st, sc in next ch-1 space, ch 1*, repeat from * to * across to last sc and ch-2 space, sc in last ch-2 space, turn—16 sc, 15 ch-1 spaces, 1 ch-2 space.
Row 5: Ch 2, *skip 1 st, sc in next ch-1 space, ch 1*, repeat from * to * across to last ch-1 space, sc in last ch-1 space, turn—15 sc, 14 ch-1 spaces, 1 ch-2 space.
Rows 6–33: [Repeat Rows 4 and 5] 14 times—1 sc, 1 ch-2 space at end of last row.
Row 34: Ch 2, sc in ch-2 space.
Row 35: Ch 1, turn to work along the short edge of triangle, sc in end of next 32 rows, turn—32 sc.
Row 36: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn—32 sc.
[Repeat Rows 3–36] 6 times.
[Repeat Rows 3–35] once.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m) Main Color (MC) Light Gray (0341) 1 ball
Red Heart® Super Saver Ombre™ (10 oz/283 g; 482 yds/440 m) Contrast A Sweet Treat (4975) 1 ball
Size U.S. I/9 [5.5 mm] crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Mosaic Dc = Working in front of chain spaces, work 1 dc in skipped sc 3 rows below
measurements: Approx 9½" x 62½" [24 x 159 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 12 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• When working dc in rows 3 rows below, work in front of ch-2 spaces, not around. 
• Each skipped sc has ch-2 worked above it for 2 rows. 
This establishes the ‘gap’ where Mosaic Dc will later be worked
• Mosaic Dc always replaces sc directly behind it on working row 
• WS of your work maintains alternating 2-row striped pattern because you are working in front of chain-spaces each time you work Mosaic Dc - you are never working around chain-spaces. The chain-spaces are positioned behind Mosaic Dc.
SCARF
With MC, ch 29.
Set-up rows:
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 28 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.

1st row: (RS). With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each st across. Turn. 28 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Join A. Turn.
3rd row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. *(Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. Rep from * to last 3 sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join MC. Turn.
5th row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *Ch 2. Skip next sc. Working in front of A, 1 dc in next sc 3 rows below (2nd row). Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in next sc. Working in front of A, 1 dc in next sc 3 rows below (2nd row). Skip next 2 ch. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *1 sc in next sc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join A. Turn.
7th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. * Working in front of MC, 1 dc in next sc 3 rows below (4th row). Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Working in front of MC, 1 dc in next sc 3 rows below (4th row). Skip next 2 ch. Ch 2. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * to last ch 2. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in last sc. Join MC. Turn.
9th row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Working in front of A, 1 dc in next sc 3 rows below (6th row). Skip next 2 ch. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Working in front of A, 1 dc in next sc 3 rows below (6th row). Skip next 2 ch. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. Rep from * to last 4 sts. 1 sc in each of last 4 sts. Join A. Turn.
11th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. *Ch 2. Skip next sc. Working in front of MC, 1 dc in next sc 3 rows below (8th row). Skip next 2 ch. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
12th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in next st. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. Rep from * to last 3 sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join MC. Turn.
Cont working into sc 3 rows below as established, rep 5th to 12th rows for Zig-Zag Mosaic Pat until work from beg measures approx 62" [157.5 cm], ending on a 12th row.
Next row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. * Working in front of A, 1 dc in next sc 3 rows below (10th row rep). Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in next sc. Working in front of A, 1 dc in next sc 3 rows below (10th row rep). Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Break A. Turn.
Next 3 rows: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each st across. Turn.
Fasten off. 
Fringe
Cut strands of MC 16" [40.5 cm] long. Taking 3 strands tog, fold in half and knot into fringe evenly along each end of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Patons® Classic Wool Roving™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 120 yds/109 m) Aran (77008) 3 balls
Size U.S. J/10 (5.75-6mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdcfl = Half double crochet in front loop only
Hdcf2l = Yoh and draw up a loop in horizontal bar created by hdc at front of work and front loop in next st. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
Hdcf2lCluster = (Yoh and draw up a loop in horizontal bar created by hdc at front of work and front loop) twice in next st. Yoh and draw through all 5 loops on hook.
Scf2l = Draw up a loop in horizontal bar created by hdc at front of work and front loop in next st. Yoh and draw through
measurements: Approx 7" [18 cm] wide x 70" [178 cm] long.
gauge: 10 sc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc. Ch 184.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 182 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdcf2l in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. *1 hdcf2lCluster in next st. 1 scf2l in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2. *1 hdcfl in next st. 1 hdcf2l in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 2. 1 hdcf2l in each st to end of row. Turn.
6th row: As 5th row. Rep 3rd-6th rows twice more. Fasten off.
Fringe: Cut strands 8" [20.5 cm] long. Taking 3 strands tog, fold in half and knot into fringe 18 fringes across each end of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Patons ® Lace (85 g / 3 oz; 455 m / 498 yds) 33008 (Vintage) 1 ball
Size 3.75 mm (U.S. F or 5) crochet hook or size needed to obtain tension.
measurements: Approx 8 x 60 ins [20.5 x 152.5 cm].
gauge: 17 dc and 9 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 50. (See Chart below).
1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Ch 1. Miss next 3 ch. [(1 dc. Ch 1) twice. 1 dc] all in next ch. Ch 1. Miss next 3 ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 6 (counts as dc and ch 3). Miss next dc. 1 sc in next dc. *Ch 3. 4 dc in next sc. Drop loop from hook, insert hook in first dc of 4 dc group and pull dropped loop through. Ch 1 – Popcorn made. Ch 3. Miss next dc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * across, ending with 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 1. [(1 dc. Ch 1) twice. 1 dc] all in next sc. Ch 1.** 1 sc in top of next Popcorn. Rep from * 4 times more, then from * to ** once. 1 sc in 3rd ch of ch 6. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for pat until Scarf measures approx 60 ins [152.5 cm], ending on a 3rd row. Fasten off.
Edging: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to bottom right corner. Ch 1. Work 1 row of sc evenly along side edge. Fasten off. Rep for other side.

materials: Patons® Lincoln Fog™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 190 yds/174 m)
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dc3tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
measurements: Approx 11 x 110" [28 x 279.5 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 11.5 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
SMALL MOTIF SECTION 1
Small Motif (make 9)
Make 3 with C as Color 1, B as Color 2 and A as Color 3.
Make 4 with A as Color 1, C as Color 2 and B as Color 3.
Make 2 with B as Color 1, A as Color 2 and C as Color 3.
With Color 1, ch 4. 1st rnd: 11 dc in 4th ch from hook. Join Color 2 with sl st to top of ch-4. Break Color 1. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: With Color 2, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *(1 hdc. Ch 1.1 dc. Ch 1. 1 hdc) in next dc. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * around, omitting last sc of last rep. Join Color 3 with sl st to first sc. Break color 2.
3rd rnd: With Color 3, ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 dc in next hdc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 3 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next hdc. 1 dc in each of each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around, omitting last d c of last rep. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off. Sew Motifs tog into square of 9 as seen in diagram.

BASKETWEAVE SECTION 1
With RS facing, join C with sl st to top right corner of Small Motif Section 1.
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Work 32 sc evenly across top edge Small Motif Section 1. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd to 6th rows: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. *1 dcbp around each of next 4 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 4 sts. Rep from * to last 4 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. 1 hdc in last st. Turn.
7th to 10th rows: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. *1 dcfp around each of next 4 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 4 sts. Rep from * to last 4 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. 1 hdc in last st. Turn.
Rep 3rd to 10th rows until Basketweave Section 1 measures approx 11" [28 cm], ending on a 6th or 10th row. Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Fasten off.

LARGE MOTIF SECTION 1
Make with A as Color 1 and B as Color 2. Note: Carry color not on use loosely up WS of work.
With Color 1, ch 5. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch-1 sp). (3 dc. Ch 1) 3 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-4.
2nd rnd: Join Color 2 with sl st in 1st ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 sc) in same sp as last sl st. Ch 3. *(1 sc. Ch 3. 1 sc) in next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. Rep from * twice more. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Join Color 1 with sl st in first corner ch-3 sp. Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch-1 sp). 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. 3 dc in next ch-3 sp. *(3 dc. Ch 1. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. 3 dc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch 4.
4th rnd: Join Color 2 with sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 sc) in same sp as last sl st - Corner. Ch 3. (1 sc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Ch 3) twice. *(1 sc. Ch 3. 1 sc) in next ch-1 sp - Corner. Ch 3. (1 sc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Ch 3) twice. Rep from * twice more. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Join Color 1 with sl st in first corner ch-3 sp. Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch-1 sp). 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. 3 dc in each ch-3 sp to next Corner. *(3 dc. Ch 1. 3 dc) in next Corner ch-3 sp. 3 dc in each ch-3 sp to next Corner. Rep from * twice more. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch-4.
6th rnd: Join Color 2 with sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 sc) in same sp as last sl st - Corner. Ch 3. (1 sc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Ch 3) 4 times. *(1 sc. Ch 3. 1 sc) in next ch-1 sp - Corner. Ch 3. (1 sc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Ch 3) 4 times. Rep from * twice more. Join with sl st to first sc.
7th rnd: As 5th rnd.
8th rnd: Join Color 2 with sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 sc) in same sp as last sl st - Corner. Ch 3. (1 sc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Ch 3) 6 times. *(1 sc. Ch 3. 1 sc) in next ch-1 sp - Corner. Ch 3. (1 sc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Ch 3) 6 times. Rep from * twice more. Join with sl st to first sc. Break Color 2.
9th rnd: As 5th rnd.
10th rnd: With Color 1, sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Beg in same sp as last sl st, *3 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 13 dc. 2 sc in next dc. 1 sc in each of next 13 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Sew Large Motif Section 1 to top of Basketweave Section 1.

EYELET TEXTURE SECTION 1
With RS facing, join B with sl st to top right corner sc of Large Motif Section 1.
1st row: (RS). Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 31 sc. 32 dc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch-2). Dc3tog. *Ch 3. Dc3tog. Rep from * to last sc. Ch 2. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. *Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to last ch-5 sp. Ch 3. 1 sc in last ch-5 sp. 1 sc in top of 3rd ch of ch-5 sp. Turn. 
5th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 3 dc in each ch-3 sp to last sc. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 1st to 6th rows until Eyelet Texture Section measures approx 11" [28 cm] ending on a 1st row. Fasten off.

CLUSTER SECTION 1
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnds counts as dc throughout. Carry color not in use loosely up side of work.
With RS facing, join C with sl st to first st of Eyelet Texture Section 1. 
1st row: (RS). Ch 3 (counts as dc). Skip next 2 sts. 5 dc in next st. *Skip next 4 sts. 5 dc in next st. Rep from * to last 3 sts. Skip next 2 sts. 1 dc in last st. Join B. Turn.
2nd row: With B, ch 3. 2 dc in first dc. *5 dc in sp between next two 5-dc clusters. Rep from * to last dc. 3 dc in last dc. Join A. Turn.
3rd row: With A, ch 3. *5 dc in sp between next two 5-dc clusters. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Join C. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for pat, changing colors each row in C, B, A sequence until Cluster Section 1 measures approx 11" [28 cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.

BASKETWEAVE SECTION 2
With RS facing, join A with sl st to first st of Cluster Section 1. 
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc to end of row. 32 sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in next sc. 1 dc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Work 3rd to 10th rows as given for Basketweave Section 1 until Basketweave Section 2 measures approx 11" [28 cm], ending on a 6th or 10th row. Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Fasten off.

SMALL MOTIF SECTION 2
Work as given for Small Motif Section 1.
Sew Small Motif Section 2 to last row of Basketweave Section 2. 

EYELET TEXTURE SECTION 2
With RS facing, join C with sl st to top right corner sc of Small Motif Section 2.
1st row: (RS). Ch 3 (counts as dc). Work 31 dc evenly across top of Small Motif Section 2. 32 dc. Turn.
Beg with a 2nd row, work as given for Eyelet Texture Section 1.

LARGE MOTIF SECTION 2
Work as given for Large Motif Section 1, with B as Color 1, and C as Color 2.
Sew Large Motif Section 2 to top of Eyelet Texture Section 2.

CLUSTER SECTION 2
With RS facing, join C with sl st to top right corner sc of Large Motif Section 2.
Work as given for Cluster Section 1.

Border
With RS facing, join B with sl st to any corner of Scarf.
Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around Scarf, having 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 

Fringe
Cut lengths of A, B and C 20" [51 cm] long. Taking 3 strands tog, knot into fringe at each end of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Sassy Fabric: 1 hank 9936 Pink Dot
measurements: Scarf measures 52” long (132 cm).
gauge: GAUGE is not important for this pattern.
instructions:
Step 1: Insert hook through 1st hole from back to front; repeat for 2nd, 3rd and 4th holes. You now have 4 holes on the hook.
Step 2: Pinching together all four holes on the hook with left forefinger and thumb, insert hook from front to back into 5th hole and pull through all holes on hook.
Repeat Steps 1 and 2 with each group of 5 holes. Note: If you put your work down, be sure to put a stitch holder or safety pin on the working stitch. This holder needs to be larger than the hole so that your work will not fall apart.
Continue until scarf is desired length; cut leaving 3” (7.6 cm) end. Pull end through last stitch and pull tight. Trim beginning and ending fabric strip points so that they blend in with the ruffles. With sewing needle and thread, secure last stitch so scarf will not unravel. Shake out your scarf so that ruffles spiral.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver™: 3 skeins of 400 Grey Heather
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses in same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 10.5” [26.5 cm] wide by 90” [228.5 cm] long.
gauge: 24 sts (2 ripples) = 7” (18 cm); 5 rows = 4” (10cm)
instructions:
Ch 37
Row 1 (right side): Sc in second ch from hook and ea ch across. Turn- 36 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, work in back loops only, sc in ea sc across. Turn.
Row 3: Ch 3 (counts as dc throughout), work in back loops only, dc in first st, *dc in next 3 sc, [dc2tog in next 2 sts] twice, dc in next 3 sts**, 2 dc in next 2 sts; rep from * across ending at **, 2 dc in last st. Turn—3 ripples made.
Repeat row 3 until piece measures 89” [226cm].
Last 2 rows: Ch 1, work in back loops only, sc in ea st across. Turn. Fasten off
FINISHING
Weave in all ends.

materials: RED HEART® Shimmer™: 1 ball 1403 Pewter A.
RED HEART® Boutique Ribbons™: 1 ball 1938 City B.
Yarn needle, sewing thread and sewing needle.
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 4” x 58”.
gauge: 10 hdc and 8 rows in hdc = 4 inches. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCARF
With A, ch 121.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd chain from hook and in each chain across – 120 sc.
Row 2: Ch 2, turn, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next st; repeat from * across – 180 sts.
Row 3: Ch 2, turn, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next st; repeat from * to across – 270 sts.
Row 4: Ch 2, turn, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next st; repeat from * across to last st, hdc in last st. – 405 sts. Fasten off.
Row 5: Change to B and smaller hook (using the thread of the Ribbons yarn) sc in each hdc across.
Row 6: Turn, sc into each sc to the end.
FINISHING
Weave in ends of A. Using sewing thread, tack down B on both ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 312 Black A and 254 Pumpkin B.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Scarf measures 5” x 60”.
gauge: 18 sts = 5” in stitch pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With A, ch 20.
Row 1: Sc in 3rd ch from hook, [ch 1, skip 1, sc in next st] across – 18 sts.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as ch-space here and throughout), turn, [sc in next ch-space, ch 1] across, sc in last ch-space – 18 sts.
Row 3: Change to B, ch 2, turn, [sc in next ch-space, ch 1] across, sc in last ch-space.
Repeat Rows 2-3, alternating colors every 2 rows until piece measures 60” from beginning, end with 2 rows of A. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Sassy Fabric™: 1 hank 9947 Red Leopard
Yarn needle, locking stitch marker or safety pin
measurements: Scarf measures 4” x 42” (10 x 106.5 cm)
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions: Brighten your look with this ruffled scarf in a chic print! It’s easy to crochet through the evenly spaced holes in the scalloped fabric strip. trim fabric to ¼” (6.4 mm) under last 2 holes, then continue cutting on a curve ending at the bottom edge under the 3rd hole. Remove stitch holder and place loop back on hook. Last Row: Ch 1, working in front loops only, slip st in each st; insert hook in last hole and pull end tail through loop on hook. Tighten end tail until knot forms. FINISHING Weave in end. Special Stitches Ch = insert hook from front to back through next hole, draw top edge through loop on hook. Slip st = insert hook in front loop of indicated chain or stitch and in next hole, draw top edge through chain or stitch and loop on hook. Notes 1. Work into the holes at the top edge of the fabric strip. Always insert hook in hole from front to back of fabric. 2. If you prefer to work from the center of the hank rather than the outer edge, slide the paper band to one end, remove the cardboard, and gently pull out the fabric. 3. Prepare the fabric for stitching by trimming the cut edge in a curve. Begin cutting at the top edge before the first hole and end at the bottom edge below the 2nd hole. 4. Always turn piece clockwise so that working fabric is behind stitches just made. SCARF Fold fabric so first hole is placed over 2nd hole, insert hook in hole through both thicknesses, insert hook in next hole and draw top edge through loop on hook (slip knot made), ch 4. Row 1: Turn, working in front loops only, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—3 slip sts. Row 2: Ch 1, working in front loops only, slip st in each st, turn. Repeat Row 2 until at least 5 (but no more than 8) holes remain. Place last stitch on locking stitch marker or safety pin so stitch doesn’t unravel as you prepare fabric for last row. Trim fabric so that only 5 holes remain. Cutting from outer edge.

abbreviations: A, B, C, etc. = Color A, Color B, Color C etc
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Scarf measures about 6½" [16.5 cm] wide and 72" [183 cm] long, not including fringe.
gauge: One Granny Square measures about 6½ x 6½" [16.5 x 16.5 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
GRANNY SQUARE I (make 2)
With A, ch 5; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), work 11 dc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—12 dc.
Fasten off.
Round 2: With right side facing, draw up a loop of E in any space between sts, ch 3, dc in same space, *ch 1, 2 dc in next space between sts; repeat from * around, ch 1; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—24 dc and 12 ch-1 spaces.
Fasten off.
Round 3: With right side facing, draw up a loop of F in any ch-1 space, ch 3, 2 dc in same ch-1 space, *ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around, ch 1; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—36 dc and 12 ch-1 spaces.
Fasten off.
Round 4: With right side facing, draw up a loop of C in any ch-1 space, ch 3, 2 dc in same ch-1 space, *ch 2, 3 dc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around, ch 2; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—36 dc and 12 ch-2 spaces.
Fasten off.
Round 5: With right side facing, draw up a loop of B in any ch-2 space, ch 3, 3 dc in same ch-2 space, ch 1, 4 dc in next ch-2 space, *ch 1, (2 dc, 2 tr, ch 2, 2 tr, 2 dc) in next ch-2 space (corner made), [ch 1, 4 dc in next ch-2 space] twice; repeat from * 2 more times, ch 1, (2 dc, 2 tr, ch 2, 2 tr, 2 dc) in next ch-2 space, ch 1; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—4 corners with two 4-dc groups along each of 4 sides between corners.
Fasten off.
Round 6: With right side facing, join A with slip st in any corner ch-2 space, *[skip next st, sc in next 3 sts, sc in next ch-1 space] 3 times, skip next st, sc in next 3 sts, 3 sc in corner ch-2 space; repeat from * 3 more times; join with slip st in first sc—72 sc (15 sc along each of 4 sides between 3-sc corners).
Do not fasten off.
Round 7: Continuing with A, ch 1, *sc in each st to next 3-sc corner, 2 sc in each of next 3 sc; repeat from * 3 more times; join with slip st in first sc—84 sc.
Fasten off.
GRANNY SQUARE II (make 2)
Make same as Granny Square I using B for Round 1, F for Round 2, A for Round 3, E for Round 4, C for Round 5, and A for Rounds 6 and 7.
GRANNY SQUARE III (make 2)
Make same as Granny Square I using C for Round 1, D for Round 2, E for Round 3, F for Round 4, B for Round 5, and A for Rounds 6 and 7.
GRANNY SQUARE IV (make 2)
Make same as Granny Square I using D for Round 1, A for Round 2, B for Round 3, C for Round 4, F for Round 5, and A for Rounds 6 and 7.
GRANNY SQUARE V (make 2)
Make same as Granny Square I using E for Round 1, B for Round 2, F for Round 3, A for Round 4, D for Round 5, and A for Rounds 6 and 7.
GRANNY SQUARE VI (make 1)
Make same as Granny Square I using F for Round 1, C for Round 2, B for Round 3, D for Round 4, E for Round 5, and A for Rounds 6 and 7.
FINISHING
Arrange the Granny Squares into a strip, in any order desired. With A, sew the squares together.
Fringe
Cut lengths of A, B, C, D, E, and F, each about 24" [61 cm] long. Holding 1 strand of each color together, fold lengths in half. Using crochet hook, pull fold through any stitch of one short edge of scarf, forming a loop. Thread ends through loop and pull to tighten. Attach a total of 7 fringes evenly spaced along both short ends of scarf. Trim fringe to even.
Weave in ends.

materials: Patons® Metallic™ Variegates (2.5 oz/70 g; 197 yds/180 m) Black Marble (97003) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: Approx 7” [18 cm] wide x 30” [76 cm] long.
gauge: 13 sc and 15 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 23.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook.  
1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 22 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each 
of next 2 sc. *Skip next 2 sc. 5 dc in next 
sc. Ch 2. Skip next 3 sc.* 1 dc in each of 
next 4 sc. Rep from * to * once more. 1 dc 
in each of last 3 sc. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each 
of next 2 dc. *Skip next ch-2 sp. 5 dc in 
next dc. Ch 2. Skip next 4 dc.* 1 dc in each 
of next 4 dc. Rep from * to * once more.  
1 dc in each of last 3 dc. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 
26” [66 cm], ending on a WS row.
Loop: Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of 
next 3 dc. 2 sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each 
of next 9 dc. 2 sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in 
each of next 8 dc. Turn. 24 sc.
Fold Scarf in half, working through both 
thicknesses, ch 1. Work 1 sc in each of 
next 12 sc. Turn. Place marker on last row. 
Next row: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc).  
1 hdc in each sc across. Turn. 
Next row: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc).  
1 hdc in each hdc across. Turn.
Rep last row until Loop from marked row 
measures 8” [20.5 cm]. Fasten off.
Fold last row of Loop to meet marked 
row. Sew Loop into position.
Bottom edging: Join yarn with sl st to 
first rem loop of foundation ch.
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each rem loop of 
foundation ch. Turn. 22 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 4 dc in first 
sc. Sl st in next sc. *5 dc in next sc. Sl st in 
next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten 
off.

materials: Caron® Cakes™ (7.1 oz/200 g; 383 yds/350 m) Bumbleberry (17016) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx. 8¾" [22 cm] wide x 53" [134.5 cm] around
gauge: 18 sts and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat
instructions:
Ch 42.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. 41 sts. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp and sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc.
Rep last 2 rows for pat until work from beg measures approx 53" [134.5 cm]. Fasten off, leaving a long end.
FINISHING
Sew short ends tog for Loop.

materials: STITCH NATION by Debbie Stoller™ 'Bamboo Ewe™': 3 balls 5830 Periwinkle
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
measurements: Scarf measures 6½” wide x 60” long.
gauge: 6 pattern repeats = 4” as worked in Round 1; Rounds 1–3 measure 3” across at widest point. Note: One pattern repeat consists of one sc and the following ch-space. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 174; sc in 2nd ch from hook, *ch 1, skip next ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * across to last 2 ch, ch 1, skip next ch, (sc, ch 2, sc) in last ch; rotate piece to work across opposite side of foundation ch, **ch 1, skip next ch, sc in next ch (at base of sc on opposite side of foundation ch); repeat from ** across to last 2 ch, ch 1, skip next ch, (sc, ch 2) in last ch (same ch as first sc); join with slip st in first sc—174 ch-spaces (consisting of 86 ch-1 spaces on each side of foundation chain and 1 ch-2 space at each end). Place a marker in the ch-2 spaces at each end of the piece. In following rounds, move markers up to the new ch-2 space at end of piece, as you come to them. Round 2: (Slip st, ch 1, sc) in first ch-1 space, [*ch 2, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across to next marked ch-2 space, ch 2, (sc, ch 2, sc) in marked ch-2 space] twice, ch 2; join with slip st in first sc—176 ch-spaces. Round 3: (Slip st, ch 1, sc) in first ch-2 space, *ch 2, hdc in next ch-2 space, ch 2, ([dc, ch 2] twice, dc) in next ch-2 space, ch 2, hdc in next ch-2 space, [ch 2, sc in next ch-2 space] twice *; repeat from * to * across to first marked ch-2 space, ch 2, (sc, ch 2, sc) in marked ch-2 space, [ch 2, sc in next ch-2 space] twice, repeat from * to * across to next marked ch-2 space, ch 2, (sc, ch 2, sc) in marked ch-2 space, ch 2, sc in next ch-2 space, ch 2; join with slip st in first sc—246 ch-spaces. Round 4: (Slip st, ch 1, sc) in first ch-2 space, [*ch 2, sc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * across to next marked ch-2 space, ch 2, (sc, ch 2, sc) in marked ch-2 space] twice, [ch 2, sc in next ch-2 space] twice; join with hdc in first sc (counts as ch-2 space)—248 ch-spaces. Remove markers as Round 5 is worked. Round 5: Ch 1, sc in first ch-2 space (formed by the joining hdc), *[Large-shell in next ch-2 space, sc in next ch-2 space] 3 times, Small-shell in next sc, sc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * across to one ch-2 space before next marked ch-2 space, Large-shell in next ch-2 space, sc in next sc, Small-shell in marked ch-2 space, sc in next sc, Large-shell in next ch-2 space, sc in next ch-2 space, Small-shell in next sc, **[sc in next ch-2 space, Large-shell in next ch-2 space] 3 times, sc in next ch-2 space, Small-shell in next sc, sc in next ch-2 space; repeat from ** across to ch-2 space before next marked ch-2 space, Large-shell in next ch-2 space, sc in next sc, Small-shell in marked ch-2 space, sc in next sc, Large-shell in next ch-2 space, sc in next ch-2 space, Small-shell in next sc; join with slip st in first sc. Round 6: Ch 4 (counts as first dc, ch 1), dc in next st, *ch 1, dc in next st; repeat from * around; ch 1; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-4. Fasten off. Finishing: Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® x Pantone™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 127 yds/116 m) Peacock Blue (01018)  6 balls
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.

instructions:
Notes: 
• Each color link will be 
referenced by its Pantone 
color number (see label).
• Designate each different 
shade of the 5 separate yarn 
balls as Contrast A, B, C, D and 
E as noted in Materials section 
(or as desired).
• Due to finite amount of yarn 
in each shade, pattern gauge 
must be matched to ensure 
successful results
• To join new color, work to last 
2 loops on hook. Draw new 
color through last 2 loops 
then proceed in new color.
MOTIF 1 (make 15).
(See Diagram on page 3).
With A, ch 4.
1st rnd: 11 dc in 4th ch from hook. 
Join B with sl st to top of ch 3.  
12 dc.
Approx = Approximately

Rep = Repeat 
Rnd(s) = Round(s)
RS = Right side
Sc = Single crochet
Sl st = Slip stitch
St(s) = Stitch(es)
Tog = Together
Tr = Treble crochet
WS = Wrong side
2nd rnd:  With B, ch 3 (counts as 
dc). *(2 dc. 1 tr) in next dc. (1 tr.  
2 dc) in next dc.** 1 dc in next dc. 
Rep from * twice more, then from 
* to ** once. Join with sl st to top of 
ch 3. Fasten off.
3rd rnd: Skip next 2 dc and next 
tr. Join C with sl st in next tr.  
[Ch 4 (counts as tr). 2 dc] in same sp.  
1 dc in each of next 5 dc. (2 dc.1 tr) 
in next tr. (1 tr. 2 dc) in next tr. 1 dc 
in each of next 5 dc. (2 dc. 1 tr) in 
next tr, joining A at end of tr. With 
A, (1 tr. 2 dc) in next tr. 1 dc in each 
of next 5 dc. (2 dc. 1 tr) in next tr. 
(1 tr. 2 dc) in next tr. 1 dc in each of 
next 5 dc. (2 dc. 1 tr) in last tr. Join 
D with sl st to top of ch 4.
4th rnd: With D, ch 4 (counts as tr). 
2 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in 
each of next 9 dc. (2 dc. 1 tr) in next 
tr. (1 tr. 2 dc) in next tr. 1 dc in each 
of next 9 dc. (2 dc. 1 tr) in next tr, 
joining B at end of tr. With B, (1 tr.  
2 dc) in next tr. 1 dc in each of next 
9 dc. (2 dc. 1 tr) in next tr. (1 tr. 2 dc) 
in next tr. 1 dc in each of next 9 dc. 
(2 dc. 1 tr) in last tr. Join with sl st to 
top of ch 4. Fasten off.
MOTIF 2 (make 15).
With B, ch 4.
1st rnd: 11 dc in 4th ch from hook. 
Join A with sl st to top of ch 3.  
12 dc.
2nd rnd:  With A, ch 3 (counts as 
dc). *(2 dc. 1 tr) in next dc. (1 tr.  
2 dc) in next dc.** 1 dc in next dc. 
Rep from * twice more, then from 
* to ** once. Join with sl st to top of 
ch 3. Fasten off.
3rd rnd: Skip next 2 dc and next 
tr. Join D with sl st in next tr.  
[Ch 4 (counts as tr). 2 dc] in same sp.  
1 dc in each of next 5 dc. (2 dc. 1 tr) 
in next tr. (1 tr. 2 dc) in next tr. 1 dc 
in each of next 5 dc. (2 dc. 1 tr) in 
next tr, joining B at end of tr. With 
B, (1 tr. 2 dc) in next tr. 1 dc in each 
of next 5 dc. (2 dc. 1 tr) in next tr. 
(1 tr. 2 dc) in next tr. 1 dc in each of 
next 5 dc. (2 dc. 1 tr) in last tr. Join 
C with sl st to top of ch 4.
4th rnd: With C, ch 4 (counts as tr). 
2 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in 
each of next 9 dc. (2 dc. 1 tr) in next 
tr. (1 tr. 2 dc) in next tr. 1 dc in each 
of next 9 dc. (2 dc. 1 tr) in next tr, 
joining A at end of tr. With A, (1 tr. 
2 dc) in next tr. 1 dc in each of next 
9 dc. (2 dc. 1 tr) in next tr. (1 tr. 2 dc) 
in next tr. 1 dc in each of next 9 dc.  
(2 dc. 1 tr) in last tr. Join with sl st to 
top of ch 4. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With appropriate color, crochet 
Motifs tog as shown in assembly 
diagram.
Border
1st rnd: (RS). Join E with sl st to any 
corner. Ch 1. 3 sc in same sp. Work 
sc evenly around outer edge of 
Scarf, working 3 sc in each corner. 
Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working from left 
to right instead of from right to 
left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in 
each sc around. Join with sl st to 
first sc. Fasten off.

abbreviations: A, B, C, etc. = Color A, Color B, Color C etc
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures about 6½" [16.5 cm] wide and 74" [188 cm] long, not including fringe.
gauge: One Granny Square measures about 6½ x 6½" [16.5 x 16.5 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: redheart.com
©2016 Coats & Clark Page 1 of 2

Notes
1. Scarf is made from 11 Granny Squares, arranged into a strip and sewn together.
2. Each Granny Square is worked in joined rounds with right side always facing. The yarn color is changed every round (except the last round) by fastening off the old color and joining the new color.

GRANNY SQUARE I (make 2)
With A, ch 5; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), work 11 dc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—12 dc.
Fasten off.
Round 2: With right side facing, draw up a loop of E in any space between sts, ch 3, dc in same space, *ch 1, 2 dc in next space between sts; repeat from * around, ch 1; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—24 dc and 12 ch-1 spaces.
Fasten off.
Round 3: With right side facing, draw up a loop of F in any ch-1 space, ch 3, 2 dc in same ch-1 space, *ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around, ch 1; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—36 dc and 12 ch-1 spaces.
Fasten off.
Round 4: With right side facing, draw up a loop of C in any ch-1 space, ch 3, 2 dc in same ch-1 space, *ch 2, 3 dc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around, ch 2; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—36 dc and 12 ch-2 spaces.
Fasten off.
Round 5: With right side facing, draw up a loop of B in any ch-2 space, ch 3, 3 dc in same ch-2 space, ch 1, 4 dc in next ch-2 space, *ch 1, (2 dc, 2 tr, ch 2, 2 tr, 2 dc) in next ch-2 space (corner made), [ch 1, 4 dc in next ch-2 space] twice; repeat from * 2 more times, ch 1, (2 dc, 2 tr, ch 2, 2 tr, 2 dc) in next ch-2 space, ch 1; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—4 corners with two 4-dc groups along each of 4 sides between corners.
Fasten off.
Round 6: With right side facing, join A with slip st in any corner ch-2 space, *[skip next st, sc in next 3 sts, sc in next ch-1 space] 3 times, skip next st, sc in next 3 sts, 3 sc in corner ch-2 space; repeat from * 3 more times; join with slip st in first sc—72 sc (15 sc along each of 4 sides between 3-sc corners).
Do not fasten off.
Round 7: Continuing with A, ch 1, *sc in each st to next 3-sc corner, 2 sc in each of next 3 sc; repeat from * 3 more times; join with slip st in first sc—84 sc.
Fasten off.

GRANNY SQUARE II (make 2)
Make same as Granny Square I using B for Round 1, F for Round 2, A for Round 3, E for Round 4, C for Round 5, and A for Rounds 6 and 7.

GRANNY SQUARE III (make 2)
Make same as Granny Square I using C for Round 1, D for Round 2, E for Round 3, F for Round 4, B for Round 5, and A for Rounds 6 and 7.

GRANNY SQUARE IV (make 2)
Make same as Granny Square I using D for Round 1, A for Round 2, B for Round 3, C for Round 4, F for Round 5, and A for Rounds 6 and 7.

GRANNY SQUARE V (make 2)
Make same as Granny Square I using E for Round 1, B for Round 2, F for Round 3, A for Round 4, D for Round 5, and A for Rounds 6 and 7.

GRANNY SQUARE VI (make 1)
Make same as Granny Square I using F for Round 1, C for Round 2, B for Round 3, D for Round 4, E for Round 5, and A for Rounds 6 and 7.

FINISHING
Arrange the Granny Squares into a strip, in any order desired. With A, sew the squares together.

Fringe
Cut lengths of A, B, C, D, E, and F, each about 24" [61 cm] long. Holding 1 strand of each color together, fold lengths in half. Using crochet hook, pull fold through any stitch of one short edge of scarf, forming a loop. Thread ends through loop and pull to tighten. Attach a total of 7 fringes evenly spaced along both short ends of scarf. Trim fringe to even.
Weave in ends.
RHC0125-017170M | LAST UPDATED: AUGUST 1, 2019

materials: RED HEART® With Love Stripes™: 2 skeins 1976 Passion Stripe
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6 mm [US J-10]
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses in same st
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Scarf measures 7½" x 80" [19 x 203 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 9 dc = 3" (7.5 cm); 8 rows = 4¼" (11 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCARF
Ch 24.
Row 1 (right side): Hdc in 3rd ch from hook (beginning skipped ch do not count as a st), hdc in each ch across, turn—22 hdc.
Row 2: Ch 1, (sc, 2 dc) in first hdc, *skip next 2 hdc, (sc, 2 dc) in next st; repeat from * 5 times, skip next 2 hdc, sc in last hdc; leave beginning ch unworked, turn—8 sc and 14 dc.
Row 3: Ch 2 (does not count as a st), hdc in each st across, turn—22 hdc.
Rows 4–149: Repeat last 2 rows 73 times.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Cut 88 strands, each 10" (25.5 cm) long. For each fringe, hold 2 strands together and fold in half to form a loop. Insert hook from right side in first stitch of Row 1. Place fold on hook and draw fold through, forming a loop. Thread ends of strands through loop and pull to tighten. Repeat to attach fringe in every stitch across both short edges of scarf. Trim ends evenly.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique™ Midnight™: 1 skein 1933 Aura
measurements: Scarf measures 65” long.
instructions:
First Flower
Ch 6, slip st in 6th ch from hook, ch 7, slip st in same ch, ch 9, slip st in same ch, ch 7, slip st in same ch, ch 5, slip st in same ch.
Second Flower
Ch 10, slip st in 6th ch from hook, ch 7, slip st in same ch, ch 9, slip st in same ch, ch 7, slip st in same ch, ch 5, slip st in same ch.
Repeat Second Flower until scarf measures 65” or to desired length. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

abbreviations: ( ) = work all directions in parentheses in the indicated stitch or space
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 7" wide x 55" long (18 cm x 139.5 cm) without fringe.
gauge: 5 rounds in pattern = 7" (18 cm); 8 rows in pattern = 5" (12.5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Center Granny Square
Ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring. 
Round 1 (Right side): Ch 5 (counts as dct, ch-2 now and throughout), [shell, ch 2] 3 times in ring, 2 dc in ring (counts as remainder of first shell); join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-5—4 shells, 4 ch-2 spaces.
Round 2: Slip st in first ch-2 space, ch 5, shell in same ch-2 space, *ch 1, (shell, ch 2, shell) in next ch-2 space; repeat from * twice, ch 1, 2 dc in first ch-2 space; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-5—8 shells, 4 ch-2 spaces, 4 ch-1 spaces.
Round 3: Slip st in first ch-2 space, ch 5, shell in same ch-2 space, *ch 1, shell in next ch-1 space, ch 1,** (shell, ch 2, shell) in next ch-2 space; repeat from * twice, then from * to ** once, 2 dc in first ch-2 space; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-5—12 shells, 4 ch-2 spaces, 8 ch-1 spaces.
Round 4: Slip st in first ch-2 space, ch 5, shell in same ch-2 space, *[ch 1, shell in next ch-1 space] twice, ch 1,** (shell, ch 2, shell) in next ch-2 space; repeat from * twice, then from * to ** once, 2 dc in first ch-2 space; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-5—16 shells, 4 ch-2 spaces, 12 ch-1 spaces.
Round 5: Slip st in first ch-2 space, ch 5, shell in same ch-2 space, *[ch 1, shell in next ch-1 space] 3 times, ch 1,** (shell, ch 2, shell) in next ch-2 space; repeat from * twice, then from * to ** once, 2 dc in first ch-2 space; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-5—20 shells, 4 ch-2 spaces, 16 ch-1 spaces. Fasten off and weave in ends.
End Square with Extension (Make 2)
Work same as Center Granny Square, but do not fasten off.
Row 1 (Right side): Slip st in next ch-2 space, (ch 3, 2 dc) in same ch-2 space, [ch 1, shell in next ch-1 space], 4 times, ch 1, shell in last ch-2 space; turn—6 shells, 5 ch-1 spaces.
Row 2 (Wrong side): Ch 4 (counts as dct, ch-1), skip 2 dc, [shell in next ch-1 space, ch 1] 5 times, skip 2 dc, dc in top of beginning ch-3; turn—5 shells, 2 dc, 6 ch-1 spaces.
Row 3: Ch 3, 2 dc in first ch-1 space, [ch 1, shell in next ch-1 space] 5 times—6 shells, 5 ch-1 spaces.
Rows 4-27: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 twelve times. Do not fasten off but continue with Finishing.
FINISHING
Referring to photo for placement, hold Right sides together and match 23 stitches from last Row of first Extension with 23 stitches from side of Round 5 of Center Granny Square; working through outside loops of both pieces, slip st pieces together (the unworked inside loops form a ridge on the Right side); fasten off and weave in ends. Repeat with second Extension.
Fringe
Cut sixty, 22" (56 cm) long strands of yarn. Holding 5 strands of yarn together for each fringe. Insert crochet hook in one corner of scarf. Place fold on hook and draw fold through, forming a loop. Thread ends of strands through loop and pull to tighten. Repeat to attach fringe in each space across finishing at opposite corner. – 6 fringe on each end of scarf. Trim ends evenly.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein 1803 Blue Hawaii
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 7” x 58” (18 x 147.5 cm)
gauge: 12 sts = 4” (10 cm); 7 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Ch 25.
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch counts as first dc) and in each ch across, turn—23 dc.
Row 2 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in next st, *skip next st, FPtr around next st, working in front of st just made, FPtr around skipped st, dc in next 3 sts, skip next st, FPtr around next st, working in front of st just made, FPtr around skipped st,** dc in next 5 sts; repeat from * to ** once, dc in last 2 sts, turn.
Row 3: Ch 2, dc in next st, *BPdc around next 2 sts, dc in next 3 sts, BPdc around next 2 sts,** dc in next 5 sts; repeat from * to ** once, dc in last 2 sts, turn.
Row 4: Ch 2, dc in next st, FPdc around next 2 sts, dc in next 2 sts, *skip next st, FPdc around
next st, working behind st just made, dc in skipped st, dc in next 2 sts, skip next st, dc in next st, working in front of st just made, FPdc around skipped st; repeat from * once, dc in next st, FPdc around next 2 sts, dc in last 2 sts, turn.
Row 5: Ch 2, dc in next st, BPdc around next 2 sts, dc in next 2 sts, *BPdc around next st, dc in next 2 sts, BPdc around next st,** dc in next 3 sts; repeat from * to ** once, dc in next 2 sts, BPdc around next 2 sts, dc in last 2 sts, turn.
Row 6: Ch 2, skip first dc, dc in next st, skip next st, FPtr around next st, working in front of st just made, FPtr around skipped st, *dc in next st, skip next st, FPdc around next st, working behind st just made, dc in skipped st, dc in next 2 sts, skip next st, dc in next st, working in front of st just made, FPdc around skipped st; repeat from * once, dc in next st, skip next st, FPtr around next st, working in front of st just made, FPtr around skipped st, dc in last 2 sts, turn.
Row 7: Ch 2, dc in next st, BPdc around next 2 sts, *dc in next st, BPdc around next st, dc in next 4 sts, BPdc around next st; repeat from * once, dc in next st, BPdc around next 2 sts, dc in last 2 sts, turn.
Row 8: Ch 2, dc in next st, FPdc around next 2 sts, *dc in next st, skip next st, dc in next st, working in front of st just made, FPdc around skipped st, dc in next 2 sts, skip next st, FPdc around next st, working behind st just made, dc in skipped st; repeat from * once, dc in next st, FPdc around next 2 sts, dc in last 2 sts, turn.
Row 9: Ch 2, dc in next st, BPdc around next 2 sts, dc in next 2 sts, *BPdc around next st, dc in next 2 sts, BPdc around next st,** dc in next 3 sts; repeat from * to ** once, dc in next 2 sts, BPdc around next 2 sts, dc in last 2 sts, turn.
Row 10: Ch 2, dc in next st, skip next st, FPtr around next st, working in front of st just made, FPtr around skipped st, dc in next 2 sts, *skip next st, dc in next st, working in front of st just made, FPdc around skipped st, skip next st, FPdc around next st, working behind st just made, dc in skipped st,** dc in next 3 sts; repeat from * to ** once, dc in next 2 sts, skip next st, FPtr around next st, working in front of st just made, FPtr around skipped st, dc in last 2 sts, turn.
Row 11: Repeat Row 3.
Row 12: Ch 2, dc in next st, FPdc around next 2 sts, dc in next 3 sts, *skip next st, FPtr around next st, working in front of st just made, FPtr around skipped st,** dc in next 5 sts; repeat from * to ** once, dc in next 3 sts, FPdc around next 2 sts, dc in last 2 sts, turn.
Row 13: Repeat Row 3.
Row 14: Ch 2, dc in next st, skip next st, FPtr around next st, working in front of st just made, FPtr around skipped st, dc in next 2 sts, *skip next st, FPdc around next st, working behind st just made, dc in skipped st, skip next st, dc in next st, working in front of st just made, FPdc in skipped st,** dc in next 3 sts; repeat from * to ** once, dc in next 2 sts, skip next st, FPtr around next st, working in front of st just made, FPtr in skipped st, dc in last 2 sts, turn.
Row 15: Repeat Row 5.
Row 16: Ch 2, dc in next st, FPdc around next 2 sts, *dc in next st, skip next st, FPdc around next st, working behind st just made, dc in skipped st, dc in next 2 sts, skip next st, dc in next st, working in front of st just made, FPdc around skipped st; repeat from * once, dc in next st, FPdc around next 2 sts, dc in last 2 sts, turn.
Row 17: Repeat Row 7.
Row 18: Ch 2, dc in next st, skip next st, FPtr around next st, working in front of st just made, FPtr around skipped st, *dc in next st, skip next st, dc in next st, working in front of st just made, FPdc around skipped st, dc in next 2 sts, skip next st, FPdc around next st, working behind st just made, dc in skipped st; repeat from * once, dc in next st, skip next st, FPtr around next st, working in front of st just made, FPtr around skipped st, dc in last 2 sts, turn.
Row 19: Repeat Row 9.
Row 20: Ch 2, skip first st, dc in next st, FPdc around next 2 sts, dc in next 2 sts, *skip next st, dc in next st, working in front of st just made, FPdc around skipped st, skip next st, FPdc around next st, working behind st just made, dc in skipped st,** dc in next 3 sts; repeat from * to ** once, dc in next 2 sts, FPdc around next 2 sts, dc in last 2 sts, turn.
Row 21: Repeat Row 3.
Repeat Rows 2–21 until scarf measures 57½” (146 cm), ending on Row 21.
Last Row: Ch 2, dc in each st. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

Contrast A Aran (0313) 1 ball or 130 yds/119 m
Contrast B Gold (0321) 1 ball or 155 yds/142 m
Contrast C Coral (0726) 1 ball or 120 yds/110 m

Contrast F Orchid (0530) 1 ball or 165 yds/151 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: Approx 10" x 90" [25 x 228.5 cm] excluding fringe.
gauge: 14 hdc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm]. 14 dc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Square Motif = Approx 3¾" [9.5 cm] square.
instructions:
Square 1 (make 8): Contrast A as Color 1, Contrast C as Color 2, and Contrast F as Color 3.
Square 2 (make 8): Contrast D as Color 1, Contrast B as Color 2, and Contrast E as Color 3.
Square 3 (make 8): Contrast E as Color 1, Contrast A as Color 2, and Contrast B as Color 3.
Square 4 (make 8): Contrast B as Color 1, Contrast D as Color 2, and Contrast C as Color 3.
Square 5 (make 8): Contrast F as Color 1, Contrast E as Color 2, and Contrast D as Color 3.
Square 6 (make 8): Contrast C as Color 1, Contrast F as Color 2, and Contrast A as Color 3.
SQUARE
See Diagram on page 2.
With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in ring. (Ch 2. 3 dc) 3 times in ring. Ch 2. Join with sl st to top of beg ch-3. Fasten off.
2nd rnd: Join Color 2 with sl st to any ch-2 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as sl st. [Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp] 3 times. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of beg ch-3. Fasten off.
3rd rnd: Join Color 3 with sl st to any ch-2 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as sl st. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. [(3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1] 3 times. Join with sl st to top of beg ch-3. Fasten off.
Sew Squares tog with whipstitch (see Diagram below) as shown in Assembly Diagram.
Right Side Edge
Stripe Pat:
With F, 1 row.
With A, 1 row.
With D, 1 row.
With B, 1 row.
With C, 1 row.
With E, 1 row.
With RS facing, join F with sl st to bottom right corner of Scarf.
1st row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each dc, ch-1 sp, or corner to end of edge. Break F. Join A. Turn.
2nd row: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Break A. Join D. First 2 rows of Stripe Pat are complete.
Rep 2nd row until all 6 rows of Stripe Pat are complete.
Left Side Edge
With RS facing, join E with sl st to top left corner of Scarf.
1st row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each dc, ch-1 sp, or corner to end of row. Fasten off.
Fringe: Cut lengths of yarn 16" [41 cm] in all shades. Taking 5 strands tog, fold in half and knot into fringe across both ends of Scarf, having 1 fringe of each shade along both ends. Trim fringe evenly.
