Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 7" x 70" [18 x 178 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 7 Star Clusters and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Star St Pat.
instructions:
Notes: To join new color, work to last loops on hook of first color. Yoh with new color, draw through loops and proceed with new color. Always change color at beg of RS rows. Mark RS of Scarf with safety pin for easy recognition.
With color of choice, ch 27.
1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 26 sc.
2nd row: Ch 3. Draw up a loop in each of the following sps: 2nd and 3rd chs from hook, each of first 3 sc. Yoh and draw through all 6 loops on hook – Beg Star Cluster made. Ch 1. *Draw up a loop in each of the following sps: Top of previous Star cluster, under 2 vertical strands of last st of previous Star Cluster, in same st as last loop drawn up of previous Star Cluster, each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 6 loops on hook – Star Cluster made. Ch 1. Rep from * to last st. 1 dc in last st. 12 Star Clusters. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in loop which closed next Star Cluster. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in loop which closed next Star Cluster. Rep from * to beg ch-3. 2 sc in beg ch-3 sp. 26 sc. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows for Star St Pat.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 520 Minty A, 706 Perfect Pink B, and 369 Mushroom C
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 8” (20 cm) wide and 74” (188 cm) long, excluding fringe.
gauge: 14 sts = 4” [10 cm]; 6 rows = 4” [10 cm] in Double Crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
SCARF
With A, ch 255.
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook, 1 dc in next ch, * ch 2, skip 2 ch, 1 dc in each of next 3 ch; repeat from * to end of row –152 dc, 50 ch-2 groups.
Row 2: With B, ch 5 (counts as 1 dc and ch 2 here and throughout), skip 2 dc, 3 dc in next ch-2 space, * ch 2, 3 dc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * to last 3 dc, ch 2, 1 dc in last st – 51 ch-2 groups, 50 3-dc groups, 2 dc.
Row 3: With C, ch 3 (counts as 1 dc here and throughout), 2 dc in ch-2 space, *ch 2, 3 dc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * to end of row.
Row 4: With C, ch 5, skip 2 dc, 3 dc in next ch-2 space, * ch 2, 3 dc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * to last 3 dc, ch 2, 1 dc in top of beginning ch-3.
Row 5: With B, ch 3, 2 dc in ch-2 space, *ch 2, 3 dc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * to end of row.
Row 6: With A, ch 5, skip 2 dc, 3 dc in next ch-2 space, * ch 2, 3 dc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * to last 3 dc, ch 2, 1 dc in top of beginning ch-3.
Row 7: With A, ch 3, 2 dc in ch-2 space, *ch 2, 3 dc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * to end of row.
Row 8: With B, ch 5, skip 2 dc, 3 dc in next ch-2 space, * ch 2, 3 dc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * to last 3 dc, ch 2, 1 dc in top of beginning ch-3.
Row 9: With C, ch 3, 2 dc in ch-2 space, *ch 2, 3 dc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * to end of row.
Row 10: With C, ch 5, skip 2 dc, 3 dc in next ch-2 space, * ch 2, 3 dc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * to last 3 dc, ch 2, 1 dc in top of beginning ch-3.
Row 11: With B, ch 3, 2 dc in ch-2 space, *ch 2, 3 dc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * to end of row.
Row 12: With A, ch 5, skip 2 dc, 3 dc in next ch-2 space, * ch 2, 3 dc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * to last 3 dc, ch 2, 1 dc in top of beginning ch-3.
FINISHING
Fringe
Cut sixteen 11” (28 cm) lengths of each color yarn for fringe. Hold two strands of yarn together, fold in half and put loop at beginning and end of rows. Pull ends of fringe through loop. You should have a total of 12 fringe bundles at each side. Add additional fringe bundles as desired.
With yarn needle, weave in all loose ends.

SCARF
Ch 20.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® Ombre™ (10 oz/283 g; 482 yds/440 m) Navy (4988)  1 ball or 482 yds/440 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Tunisian crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 9¾" x 70" [25 x 178 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 13 sts (4.5 Clusters) and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Tunisian Crochet Pat. Note: 1 row of Tunisian Crochet Pat = Forward and Return Pass.
instructions:
Notes:
• Work into horizontal bumps at back of foundation chain for 1st row. 
• To maintain consistent color changes, join new ball of yarn to match last color change of previous ball. This will help to ensure stripe repeat will match as closely as possible.
• Before beg Scarf, reserve yarn for Beg Fringe (to match shade at beg of Scarf): Cut 60 lengths, 20" [51 cm] long. Set aside for Fringe.

SCARF
With Tunisian hook, ch 32 (multiple of 3 ch + 2) loosely.
1st row: Forward pass:  ( Right to left). Draw up a loop in 2nd ch from hook. Draw up a loop in each rem ch to end of chain, leaving all loops on hook. 32 sts on hook. Do not turn.
Return pass:  ( Left to right after working Forward pass of each row). Yoh and draw through last loop (for edge st). *Ch 1. Yoh and draw through 4 loops. Ch 1. Rep from * until 2 loops rem on hook. Yoh and draw through 2 loops. Do not turn.

2nd row: Forward pass:  ( Right to left). *Draw up a loop in top horizontal bar of ch-1. Draw up a loop in top of closing cluster. Draw up a loop in top horizontal bar of ch-1. Rep from * to last st. Tss in both vertical bars of last st. Do not turn. Return pass.

Rep last row for Tunisian Crochet Pat until work from beg measures approx 70" [178 cm], ending with a Return pass.
Finishing Row: (Right to left). *Sl st in top horizontal bar of ch-1. Sl st in top of closing cluster. Sl st in top horizontal bar of ch-1. Rep from * to last st. Sl st in both vertical bars of last st. Fasten off.

FRINGE
End Fringe:  Cut 60 lengths, 20" [51 cm] long. Taking 2 strands, knot into fringe into each st at Finishing Row of Scarf.
Beg Fringe:  Rep using reserved lengths, knotting into fringe into each st at foundation ch of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly.

instructions:
Ch 3.
Row 1: Slip st in second ch from hook and each chain across.
Ch 1 and turn.
Repeat Row 1 until you have 3 to 4 inches remaining.
FINISHING
Turn under remaining end of yarn. Sew with needle and thread to secure, Repeat for beginning yarn end.

abbreviations: *= repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Scarf measures 6” x 60”.
gauge: 18 sts = 6”; 10 rows = 4” in pattern stitch using larger hook.  CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCARF
With larger hook, ch 19.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across – 18 sc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), turn, dc in each sc across – 18 dc. 
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 2 dc, *skip next dc, Fpdc around sc 2 rows below next dc, Fpdc around sc below skipped sc, sc in next 2 dc; repeat from * across.
Row 4: Ch 3, turn, dc in each st across. 
Row 5: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 2 dc, *skip next st, Fpdc around Fpdc below next st, Fpdc around Fpdc below skipped st, sc in next 2 dc; repeat from * across.
Repeat Rows 4-5 until piece measures 60” from beginning. 
Fasten off. 
FINISHING 
With smaller hook, join yarn in any st with sc, sc evenly around edges of Scarf, working 3 sc in each corner, join with a slip st to first st. 
Fasten off. 
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Soft: 1 ball 9440 Light Grey Heather A.
RED HEART® Boutique™ Sashay™: 1 ball 1946 Ballet B.
2 yds grosgrain ribbon, 1½” wide, yarn needle.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
measurements: Scarf measures 60” long.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions: With 2 strands of A held together and leaving a long tail, sew a line of running stitches down the center of ribbon length. Each stitch should be ½” on right side of ribbon and ¼” on wrong side. Cut A, leaving a long tail. Pull open ribbon width of B in order to work into center of yarn. With right side facing and working into center of yarn, join B in first ½” loop of A and work 3 sc in loop, work 3 sc in each loop across. Fasten off. FINISHING Pull ends of A to gather grosgrain ribbon and adjust gathers evenly along length. Trim ends of ribbon and yarn, leaving 5” of yarn at each end.

materials: 1 ball RED HEART® Boutique™ Changes™ 9675 Jade for Hat
1 ball RED HEART® Boutique™ Changes™ 9675 Jade for Scarf
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Hat Circumference: 20” Scarf measures 5” x 54”
gauge: Gauge: 12 dc = 4”; 7 rows = 4” using smaller hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
With smaller hook, ch 60, slip st in first ch to join, taking care not to twist sts.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in each ch around, slip st in first sc to join – 60 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in next 2 sc, *ch 5, skip next 2 sc, sc in next 3 sc; repeat from * to last 3 sts, ch 5, skip next 2 sc, sc in last st, slip st to first sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, skip next sc, *work 5 sc in ch-5 space, skip next sc; sc in next sc, skip next sc; repeat from * around, slip st in first sc.
Round 4: Slip st to second sc of 5 sc in ch-5 space, *sc in center 3 sc, ch 5, skip next 3 sc; repeat from * around, slip st in first sc.
Round 5: Ch 3, (counts as dc here and throughout), *dc in each sc, work 5 dc in ch-5 space; repeat from * around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 96 dc.
Rounds 6-7: Ch 3, dc in each dc around, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 8: Ch 3, dc in next 6 dc, skip next dc, *dc in next 7 dc, skip next dc; repeat from * around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 84 dc.
Round 9: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), hdc in next 4 dc, skip next dc, *hdc in next 5 dc, skip next dc; repeat from * around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 70 hdc.
Round 10: Ch 2, hdc in next 3 hdc, skip next hdc, *hdc in next 4 hdc, skip next hdc; repeat from * around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 56 hdc.
Round 11: Ch 2, hdc in each hdc around, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 12: Ch 2, hdc in next 5 hdc, skip next hdc, *hdc in next 6 hdc, skip next hdc; repeat from * around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 48 hdc.
Round 13: Ch 2, hdc in each hdc around, slip in top of beginning ch.
Round 14: Ch 2, hdc in next 4 hdc, skip next hdc, *hdc in next 5 hdc, skip next hdc; repeat from * around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 40 hdc.
Round 15: Ch 2, hdc in each hdc around, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 16: Ch 2, hdc in next 3 hdc, skip next hdc, *hdc in next 4 hdc, skip next hdc; repeat from * around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 32 hdc.
Round 17: Working in continuous rounds, *sc in next st, skip next st; repeat from * around until no sts remain. Fasten off.
SCARF
With larger hook, ch 122.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across – 121 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 2 sc, *ch 5, skip 2 sc, sc in next 3 sc; repeat from * across to last 4 sc, ch 5, skip 2 sc, sc in last 2 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in first sc, *skip next sc, work 5 sc in ch-5 space, skip next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * across.
Row 4: Ch 6 (counts as tr and ch 2), turn, skip 2 sc, sc in next 3 sc, *ch 5, skip next 3 sc, sc in next 3 sc; repeat from * to last 2 sc, ch 2, skip next sc, tr in last sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, turn, sc in first tr, 2 sc in ch-2 space, *skip next sc, sc in next sc, skip next sc, work 5 sc in next ch-5 space; repeat from * to last 3 sc, skip next sc, sc in next sc, skip next sc, 2 sc in ch-2 space, sc in 4th ch of beginning ch.
Row 6: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 2 sc, skip next 3 sc, *ch 5, skip next 3 sc, sc in next 3 sc; repeat from * to last 5 sc, ch 5, skip next 3 sc, sc in last 2 sc.
Repeat Rows 3-6 once more, then Rows 3-5 once. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 6” wide x 60” long
gauge: 13 sts = 4”; 8 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
Ch 197.
Row 1 (right side): Dc in 4th and 5th ch from hook, * ch 5, 
sk 5 chs, dc in next 3 chs; Repeat from * across, turn  – 24 
ch-5 spaces.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in 
next 2 dc, *ch 2, sc in 3rd ch of next ch-5 space, ch 2, dc 
in next 3 dc; repeat from * across, turn – 48 ch-2 spaces.
Row 3: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, *ch 2, sc in next sc, ch 2, dc 
in next 3 dc; repeat from * across, turn.
Row 4: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, *ch 5, skip next 2 ch-2 
spaces, dc in next 3 dc; repeat from * across, turn – 24 
ch-5 spaces.
Rows 5-10: Repeat rows 2-4 twice. Do not fasten off.
FINISHING 
Edging: Ch 1, working across top edge of scarf, *sc in 
each st and ch across, work 3 sc in corner, sc evenly down 
side edge of scarf, 3 sc in corner; repeat from * around; 
join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Caron® Jumbo Ombre™ (12 oz/340 g; 595 yds/544 m) Color of your choice 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: Approx 9½" x 80" [24 x 203 cm]
gauge: 13 sts and 6 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rows counts as dc. Ch 32 (multiple of 6 ch + 2). See diagram on page 2.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 31 sc.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in next sc. Skip next sc. *(1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) all in next sc. Skip next 2 sc. (2 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) all in next sc. Skip next 2 sc. Rep from * to last 4 sts. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) all in next sc. Skip next sc. 1 dc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *(2 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) all in next ch-2 sp. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) all in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last ch-2 sp. (2 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) all in next ch-2 sp. Skip next dc. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *(1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) all in next ch-1 sp. (2 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) all in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) all in next ch-1 sp. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Turn.
Rep 3rd and 4th rows until work from beg measures 79¾" [202.5 cm], ending on a 4th row.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 dc. *Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. Skip next ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of last 3 dc. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Soft™: 1 ball each 4608 Wine A, 9440 Light Grey Heather B, and 4604 Navy C.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 4” x 53”.
gauge: 11 sts = 4”; 12 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size needles to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCARF  
With A, ch 145.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, *dc in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * across ending with a dc in the last stitch; turn – 144 sts.
Rows 2-4: Ch 1, *sc in next dc, dc in next sc; repeat from * across ending with dc in the last stitch and changing to B in last st; turn – 144 sts.
Rows 5-8: Repeat Row 2, changing to C in final st of row 8.
Rows 9-12: Repeat Row 2. Fasten off after Row 12.
Weave in ends.
RED HEART® Soft™, Art.E728 available in solid color 5 oz (140 g), 256 yd (234 m) and heathers 4 oz (113 g), 212 yd (194 m) skeins.

materials: Caron® Cakes™ (7.1 oz/200 g; 383 yds/350 m) Jellyroll (17012) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 60" [152.5 cm] wide x 15" [38 cm] deep.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Shawl is worked side to side. Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc.
Ch 4.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3. 2 dc in next dc. Turn. 3 dc.
3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn. 4 dc.
4th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in last dc. Turn. 5 dc.
5th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc each dc to end of row. Turn. 6 dc.
6th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to last dc. 2 dc in last dc. Turn. 7 dc.
Rep last 2 rows, inc 1 dc every row at same edge, until work measures approx 30" [76 cm] along straight side edge, ending on 5th row.
Beg dec: 1st row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each dc to last 2 dc. Dc2tog. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice – beg dc2tog made. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows, dec 1 st every row at same edge until there are 2 dc.
Next row: Beg dc2tog. Fasten off.
Tassels (make 2)
Cut a piece of cardboard 8" [20.5 cm] wide. Wind yarn around cardboard 30 times. Break yarn, leaving a long end, and thread end through needle. Slip needle through all loops and tie tightly. Remove cardboard and wind yarn tightly around loops ¾" [2 cm] below fold. Fasten securely. Cut through rem loops and trim end evenly.
Sew 1 Tassel to each point of Kerchief.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream (Solids 2.5 oz/70.9 g/Ombres 2 oz/56.7 g)
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: 8 x 50 ins [20.5 x 127 cm] without fringe.
gauge: Motif = 3½ ins [9 cm] square.
instructions:
Motif I (make 14)
With MC, ch 4. Join with sl st to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in ring. (Ch 1.
3 dc ) 3 times in ring. Ch 1. Sl st to top of ch-3.
Fasten off.
2nd rnd: Join B with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 3
(counts as dc). (2 dc. Ch 1. 3 dc) in same ch-1 sp
as last sl st. [(3 dc. Ch 1. 3 dc) in next ch-1 sp]
3 times. Sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off.
3rd rnd: Join A with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 3
(counts as dc). (2 dc. Ch 1. 3 dc) in same sp as
last sl st. *3 dc in next ch-1 sp. (3 dc. Ch 1. 3 dc)
in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * twice more. 3 dc
in next ch-1 sp. Sl st in top of ch-3. Fasten off.
Motif ll (make 14)
Work as given for Motif I, substituting A for MC
in 1st rnd and MC for A in 3rd rnd, joining
motifs with sl st to corner ch and ch 1 sp in
previous motif when working 3rd rnd. 
Join motifs in 2 strips with 14 motifs per strip,
alternating colors as illustrated.
Finishing: With B, sl st to any corner of Scarf.
Ch 1. Work 1 sc in each dc around, working 3 sc
in corners. Sl st into first sc. Fasten off.
Fringe: Cut 14 ins [35.5 cm] lengths of yarn
and taking 2 strands of each color tog, knot
into fringe evenly spaced across top and
bottom of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly.

pattern_name: TWIST 'N' SHOUT CROCHET HAT AND COWL
materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz /170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and insert hook from back to front around post of next stitch. Yoh and draw up a loop. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and insert hook from front to back around post of next stitch. Yoh and draw up a loop. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
measurements: Hat: One size to fit average woman. Cowl: Approx 14" [35.5 cm] deep x 28" [71 cm] around.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
HAT 
Ribbing: Ch 13.
1st row: (RS). Working in back loops only, 1 sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sl st in each ch across. Turn. 12 sts.
2nd row: Working in back loops only, 1 sl st in each of next 12 sl st. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 18" [45.5 cm], ending on a WS row.
Do not fasten off.

Join back seam: Working in back loops only, sl st last row and rem loops of foundation ch tog. Do not fasten off. Turn work and proceed as follows:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd does not count as st.

Beg working in rnds: 1st rnd: Ch 3. Work 70 dc evenly around. Join with sl st to first dc. 70 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around next dc. 1 dcbp around each of next 9 dc) 7 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 8 sts) 7 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
4th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 7 sts) 7 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
5th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 4 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 6 sts) 7 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
6th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 5 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts) 7 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
7th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dcbp around first st. (1 dcfp around each of next 5 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts) 6 times. 1 dcfp around each of next 5 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 4 sts. Join with sl st to first dcbp.
8th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. (1 dcfp around each of next 5 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts) 6 times. 1 dcfp around each of next 5 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. Join with sl st to first dcbp.
9th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. (1 dcfp around each of next 5 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts) 6 times. 1 dcfp around each of next 5 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. Join with sl st to first dcbp.
10th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dcbp around each of next 4 sts. (1 dcfp around each of next 5 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts) 6 times. 1 dcfp around each of next 5 sts. 1 dcbp around next st. Join with sl st to first dcbp.
11th rnd: As 6th rnd.
12th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around next dc. Skip next st. 1 dcbp around each of next 8 dc) 7 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 63 sts.
13th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. Skip next st. 1 dcbp around each of next 6 sts) 7 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 56 sts.
14th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. Skip next st. 1 dcbp around each of next 4 sts) 7 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 49 sts.
15th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 4 sts. Skip next st. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts) 7 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 42 sts.
16th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 4 sts. Skip next st. 1 dcbp around next st) 7 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 35 sts.
17th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dcbp around first st. (1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. Skip next st. 1 dcbp around next st) 6 times. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. Skip next st. Join with sl st to first dcbp. 28 sts.
18th rnd: Ch 3. Skip first st. (1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. Skip next st. 1 dcbp around next st) 6 times. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcbp around next st. Join with sl st to first dcbp. 21 sts.
Fasten off leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten securely.

POMPOM
Wind yarn around 4 fingers 80 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round shape. Sew Pompom to top of Hat.

COWL
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd does not count as dc.
Ch 90. Join in ring with sl st into first ch, taking care to not twist chain.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 90 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around next sc. 1 dcbp around each of next 9 sc) 9 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 8 sts) 9 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp.

4th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 7 sts) 9 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
5th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 4 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 6 sts) 9 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
6th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 5 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts) 9 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
7th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 6 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 4 sts) 9 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
8th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 7 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts) 9 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
9th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 8 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts) 9 times. Join with sl st to first dcbp.
10th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 9 sts. 1 dcbp around next st) 9 times. Join with sl st to first dcbp.
11th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dcbp around each st around. Join with sl st to first dcbp.
12th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcbp around next st. 1 dcfp around each of next 9 sts) 9 times. Join with sl st to first dcbp.
13th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 8 sts) 9 times. Join with sl st to first dcbp.
14th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 7 sts) 9 times. Join with sl st to first dcbp.
15th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcbp around each of next 4 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 6 sts) 9 times. Join with sl st to first dcbp.
16th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 5 sts) 9 times. Join with sl st to first dcbp.
17th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcbp around each of next 6 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 4 sts) 9 times. Join with sl st to first dcbp.
18th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcbp around each of next 7 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts) 9 times. Join with sl st to first dcbp.
19th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcbp around each of next 8 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts) 9 times. Join with sl st to first dcbp.
20th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcbp around each of next 9 sts. 1 dcfp around next st) 9 times. Join with sl st to first dcbp.
21st rnd: Ch 3. 1 dcbp around each st around. Join with sl st to first dcbp.
Rep 2nd to 21st rnds once more.
Fasten off.

abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 40” long x 2” wide without loops.
gauge: 6 sts = 2”; 3 rows = 2” in dc using a double strand of yarn. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With 2 strands of yarn held together as one, ch 8.
Row 1: Skip first 3 ch from hook (counts as dc), dc in 4th ch from hook, dc in next 4 ch; turn – 6 dc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc), skip first dc, dc in next 4 dc, dc in top of ch-3; turn – 6 dc.
Repeat Row 2 for pattern until 40” from beginning. Do not fasten off, but continue with edging.
Loop Edging
Ch 10, slip st in first dc, slip st in next dc, * work (slip st, ch 10, slip st) all in next st, slip st in next st; repeat from * around all 4 sides: into sts across the narrow top edge, in row ends down long edge, in remaining loops of beginning ch across lower narrow edge and in row ends up last long edge. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Scarf measures 7” x 70”.
gauge: Rows 1-5 = 6” wide x 3” long. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: Ch 24. First Half Row 1 (Wrong Side): Working in back nubs of ch, dc in 5th ch from hook, ch 1, skip 2 ch, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch, ch 2, skip 5 ch, ([dc, ch 2] 3 times, dc) in next ch, ch 2, skip 5 ch, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch, ch 1, skip 2 ch, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch, leave last ch unworked. Row 2: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1 here and throughout), turn, dc in first ch-1 space, ch 1, skip next ch-1 space, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch-1 space, skip next ch-2 space, Shell in next 3 ch-2 spaces, skip next ch-2 space, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch-1 space, ch 1, skip next ch-1 space, (dc, ch 1, dc) in last ch-1 space. Row 3: Ch 4, turn, dc in first ch-1 space, ch 1, skip next ch-1 space, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch-1 space, ch 2, ([dc, ch 2] 3 times, dc] in first dc of center Shell, ch 2, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch-1 space, ch 1, skip next ch-1 space, (dc, ch 1, dc) in last ch-1 space. Rows 4-45: Repeat Rows 2-3. Row 46: Repeat Row 2. Fasten off. Second Half Row 1: With wrong side facing, draw up a loop in first ch of foundation ch, ch 4, dc in same ch, ch 1, skip 2 ch, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch, ch 2, skip 5 ch, ([dc, ch 2] 3 times, dc) in next ch, ch 2, skip 5 ch, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch, ch 1, skip 2 ch, (dc, ch 1, dc) in last ch. Repeat Rows 2-46 as for First Half. Do Not Fasten Off. Border Round 1: Turn to work along long edge, ch 1, *(sc, ch 2, sc) in every row along long edge to opposite last row of First Half, turn to work along last row of First Half, [sc, ch 2, sc] twice in beginning ch-1 space, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next 2 ch-1 space, ch 1, skip next hdc, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next dc, ch 1, skip next dc, sc in next hdc, ch 1, skip next hdc, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next dc, ch 1, skip next dc, sc in next hdc, ch 1, skip next hdc, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next dc, ch 1, skip next dc and hdc, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next 2 ch-1 space, [sc, ch 2, sc] twice in last ch-1 space, ch 1; turn to work along opposite long edge and repeat from * once more, slip st to first st to join. Fasten off. FINISHING Weave in ends.

abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 6” x 55”.
gauge: Gauge is not important for this project.
instructions:
Using only the thin sections of the yarn, make a slip knot, ch 1 in same thin section, * let the thick section fold on itself, forming a loop, ch 2 with the next thin section; repeat from * until 85 loops are formed.
Row 1: Using only the thin section of the yarn and letting the thick sections form loops as before, sc in each loop across; turn.
Rows 2-5: Do NOT ch at the beginning of the row; using only the thin section of the yarn, sc in each sc across; turn.
Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® Camo™ (4 oz / 113 g; 204 yds / 186 m)
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Tr2tog = [(Yoh) twice and draw up a loop in next st. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice] twice. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 8” x 65” [24 x 165 cm].
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
With A, ch 34.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 33 sc.   
2nd row: Ch 4 (counts as tr). 1 tr in first sc. 1 tr in each sc to last 2 sc. Tr2tog. Turn. 33 sts. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.  
Rep last 2 rows until work along side edge from beg measures 32" [81.5 cm], ending on a WS row. Break A. 
With B, rep last 2 rows until work along side edge from beg measures 65” [165 cm], ending on a RS row. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 315 yds/288 m) Mushroom (32003) 4 balls
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Trfp = (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times.
measurements: Approx 24" [61 cm] wide x 64" [162.5 cm] long.
gauge: 12 hdc and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Hdc Trinity St pat
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st. 
SHAWL (make 2 pieces alike)
Ch 75. See diagram on page 3.
1st row: (WS) 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 73 sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first st. *1 dcbp around next st. 1 dcfp around next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 dcbp around first st. *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows once more. 
Beg working in pat as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 3 sts. Skip next 3 sts. (1 trfp around next st) 3 times. Working in front of sts just worked, 1 trfp around each of 3 skipped sts. 1 hdc in next st. Yoh and draw up a loop in same sp as last st worked. (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st/ch) twice. Yoh and draw through all 7 loops on hook – Hdc Trinity St made. *Ch 1. Hdc Trinity St. Rep from * to last 9 sts. 1 hdc in same sp as last st worked. Skip next 3 sts. (1 trfp around next st) 3 times. Working behind sts just worked, 1 trfp around each of 3 skipped sts. 1 hdc in each of last 3 sts. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 3 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 6 sts. 1 hdc in next st. Hdc Trinity St. *Ch 1. Hdc Trinity St. Rep from * to last 9 sts. 1 hdc in same sp as st last worked. 1 dcbp around each of next 6 sts. 1 hdc in each of last 3 sts. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 3 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 6 sts. 1 hdc in next st. Hdc Trinity St. *Ch 1. Hdc Trinity St. Rep from * to last 9 sts. 1 hdc in same sp as last st worked. 1 dcfp around each of next 6 sts. 1 hdc in each of last 3 sts. Turn.
4th row: As 2nd row. 
Rep these 4 rows for pat until work from beg measures 32" [81.5 cm], ending on a WS row. 
Fasten off . 
Patch Pockets (make 2)
Ch 33. See diagram on page 3.
1st row: (WS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 31 sts.
2nd row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in first st. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. Skip next 3 sts. (1 trfp around next st) 3 times. Working in front of sts just worked, 1 trfp around each of 3 skipped sts. 1 hdc in next st. Hdc Trinity St. *Ch 1. Hdc Trinity St. Rep from * to last 11 sts. 1 hdc in same sp as last st worked. Skip next 3 sts. (1 trfp around next st) 3 times. Working behind sts just worked, 1 trfp around each of 3 skipped sts. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in last st. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first st. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 6 sts. 1 hdc in next st. Hdc Trinity St. *Ch 1. Hdc Trinity St. Rep from * to last 11 sts. 1 hdc in same sp as last st worked. 1 dcbp around each of next 6 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in last st. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first st. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 6 sts. 1 hdc in next st. Hdc Trinity St. *Ch 1. Hdc Trinity St. Rep from * to last 11 sts. 1 hdc in same sp as st last worked. 1 dcfp around each of next 6 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in last st. Turn.
5th row: As 3rd row. 
Rep 2nd to 5th rows until work from beg measures approx 9" [23 cm], ending on an 3rd row. 
Next row: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around next st. Rep from * to last st. 1 dcfp around last st. Turn.
Next row: Ch 2. *1 dcbp around next st. 1 dcfp around next st. Rep from * to last st. 1 dcbp around last st. Fasten off . 
Join Shawl Pieces: With RS facing each other, align final rows of Shawl Pieces (center back). With WS facing, join yarn with sl st and work 1 row of sc through both thicknesses to join. Fasten off .
Sew Pockets to each end as shown in photo, aligning base of Pocket with last row of Shawl ribbing.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Sassy Fabric™: 1 hank 9942 Snow Leopard
locking stitch marker or safety pin
measurements: Scarf measures 4” x 42” (10 x 106.5 cm)
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com
©2014 Coats & Clark
RedHeart.com
Page 1 of 1
Elevate Your 
Ruffles 
Go a little wild with this ruffled scarf in a 
chic snow leopard print! It’s easy to crochet 
through the evenly spaced holes in the 
scalloped fabric strip.
then continue cutting on a curve ending at 
the bottom edge under the 3rd hole. Remove 
stitch holder and place loop back on hook.
Last Row: Ch 1, working in front loops only, 
slip st in each st; insert hook in last hole and 
pull end tail through loop on hook. Tighten end 
tail until knot forms.
FINISHING
Weave in end.
ABBREVIATIONS
ch = chain; st(s) = stitch(es).
Special Stitches
Ch = insert hook from front to back through 
next hole, draw top edge through loop on 
hook.
Slip st = insert hook in front loop of indicated 
chain or stitch and in next hole, draw top edge 
through chain or stitch and loop on hook.
Notes 
1. Work into the holes at the top edge of the
fabric strip. Always insert hook in hole from 
front to back of fabric.
2. If you prefer to work from the center of
the hank rather than the outer edge, slide
the paper band to one end, remove the
cardboard, and gently pull out the fabric.
3. Prepare the fabric for stitching by trimming
the cut edge in a curve. Begin cutting at the
top edge before the first hole and end at
the bottom edge below the 2nd hole.
4. Always turn piece clockwise so that
working fabric is behind stitches just made.
SCARF
Fold fabric so first hole is placed over 
2nd hole, insert hook in hole through both 
thicknesses, insert hook in next hole and 
draw top edge through loop on hook (slip knot 
 made), ch 4. 
Row 1: Turn, working in front loops only, slip 
st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, 
turn—3 slip sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, working in front loops only, slip 
st in each st, turn.
Repeat Row 2 until at least 5 (but no more 
than 8) holes remain.
Place last stitch on locking stitch marker or 
safety pin so stitch doesn’t unravel as you 
prepare fabric for last row. Trim fabric so that 
only 5 holes remain. Cutting from outer edge, 
trim fabric to ¼” (6.4 mm) under last 2 holes.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft™ (170 g/6. oz;288 m/315 yds)
Size US K-10.5 (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
One size 6 (1.8mm) steel crochet hook (or hook small enough to fit through hole of beads).
abbreviations: Bsc = Bead single crochet—With larger hook, insert hook in indicated stitch, yarn over and draw up a loop (2 loops hook), remove drawn up loop from hook (leave other loop on hook); place bead on steel hook, with steel hook pick up dropped loop and draw through bead; transfer loop back to larger hook, yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook.
Picot = Ch 4, sl st in 4th ch from hook. Note: When working into a picot, work into the ch-4 sp formed by the picot.
measurements: 7" [18cm] wide x 60" [152.5cm] long
gauge: One motif = 6½" x 6½" [16.5 x 16.5cm]
instructions:
Note:  Motifs are worked with RS facing throughout. Do not turn at end of rounds. Always join yarn, as instructed, with RS facing.
MOTIF 
Make 9. With larger hook and A, ch 4; join with sl st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (RS): Ch 1, [sc in ring, Bsc in ring] 4 times; join with sl st in front loop of first sc. 4 sc and 4 Bsc.
Round 2:  Working in front loops only, [ch 3, sl st in next sc] 7 times, ch 3; join with sl st in st at base of first ch-3. 8 ch-3 sps. Fasten off A.
Round 3:  Working behind the ch-3 sps of Round 2, join B with sl st in any unworked back loop of a Round 1 sc, [ch 3, sl st in back loop of next Round 1 sc] 7 times, ch 3; join with sl st in first ch-3 sp. 8 ch-3 sps.
Round 4:  Ch 2, (dc, tr, picot, tr, dc, hdc) in same ch-3 sp (same ch-3 sp as join of previous round), (hdc, dc, tr, picot, tr, dc, hdc) in each remaining ch-3 sp around; join with sl st in top of beginning ch-2. 8 petals. Fasten off B.
Round 5:  Working behind petals, join C with sl st into back (near bottom of st) of either center 2 tr of any petal, [ch 3, sl st into back (near bottom of st) of either center 2 tr of next petal] 7 times, ch 3; join with sl st in first ch-3 sp. 8 ch-3 sps.
Round 6:  Ch 2, (dc, 2 tr, picot, 2 tr, dc, hdc) in same ch-3 sp (same ch-3 sp as join of previous round), (hdc, dc, 2 tr, picot, 2 tr, dc, hdc) in each remaining ch-3 sp around; join with sl st in top of beginning ch-2. 8 leaves. Fasten off C.
Round 7: Join A with sl st in picot of any leaf (of Round 6), ch 1, sc in same picot, ch 3, tr in picot of next petal (of Round 4), ch 3, sc in picot of next leaf, ch 3, dc in picot of next petal, ch 3, *sc in picot of next leaf, ch 3, tr in picot of next petal, ch 3, sc in picot of next leaf, ch 3, dc in picot of next petal; repeat from * around; join with sl st in first sc.
Round 8: (Sl st, ch 2, 2 hdc) in first ch-3 sp, (2 dc, tr, 2 dc) in next tr (corner made), 3 hdc in next ch-3 sp, 3 sc in next ch-3 sp, sc in next dc, 3 sc in next ch-3 sp, *3 hdc in next ch-3 sp, (2 dc, tr, 2 dc) in next tr (corner made), 3 hdc in next ch-3 sp, 3 sc in next ch-3 sp, sc in next dc, 3 sc in next ch-3 sp; repeat from * around; join with sl st in top of beginning ch-2. Fasten off A.
FINISHING
Arrange motifs, side by side, into a strip. Sew edges of motifs together.
Edging: Join B with sl st in center tr of any outer corner to work across long side edge, ch 1, (sc, ch 1, sc) in same tr, [ch 1, sk next st, sc in next st] across current motif working last sc in next corner tr, *ch 1, sc in corner tr of next motif, [ch 1, sk next st, sc in next st] across motif working last sc in next corner tr; repeat from * all the way around scarf, working (sc, ch 1, sc) in each corner.

materials: Caron® Colorama™ O’Go™ (6.4 oz/180 g; 228 yds/208 m) Color 1 Baja (68013) 1 O’Go
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
6" [15 cm] piece of cardboard for tassels
abbreviations: Trfp = (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left.
measurements: Approx 10" [25.5 cm] wide x 70" [178 cm] long.
gauge: 9 sc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull tie to remove.
• Start crocheting!

FIRST HALF OF SCARF (make with Color 1 O’Go)
See diagram on page 3.
Beg with A, ch 4.
1st row: (RS). 2 dc in 4th ch from hook. 3 dc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2 (does not count as st here and throughout). 1 hdc in first dc. Skip next dc. 1 hdc in last dc. Turn. 2 hdc.
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout). 1 hdc in first hdc. 2 trfp around next dc 2 rows below. PM on each of last 2 sts. (1 hdc. 1 dc) in last hdc. Turn. 6 sts.
4th row: Ch 3. 1 hdc in first st. 2 hdc in next hdc. Skip marked 2 sts. 2 hdc in next hdc. (1 hdc. 1 dc) in last st. Turn. 8 sts.
5th row: Ch 3. 1 hdc in first st. 1 hdc in next hdc. 1 trfp around each of next 2 trfp 2 rows below. PM on each of last 2 sts. Skip next 4 hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. (1 hdc. 1 dc) in last st. Turn. 8 sts.
6th row: Ch 3. 1 hdc in first st. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Skip marked 2 sts. 1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. (1 hdc. 1 dc) in last st. Turn. 10 sts.
7th row: Ch 3. 1 hdc in first st. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 1 trfp around each of next 2 trfp 2 rows below. PM on each of last 2 sts. Skip next 4 hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last dc. (1 hdc. 1 dc) in last st. Turn. 10 sts.
8th row: Ch 3. 1 hdc in first st. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to marked 2 sts. PM on last st. Skip marked 2 sts. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 sts. 2 hdc in next hdc. (1 hdc. 1 dc) in last st. Turn.
9th row: Ch 3. 1 hdc in first st. 1 hdc in each hdc to 2 hdc before marked st. 1 trfp around each of next 2 trfp 2 rows below. PM on each of last 2 sts. Skip next 4 hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last st. (1 hdc. 1 dc) in last st. Turn.
Rep 8th and 9th rows, noting incs, until work across horizontal measurement measures approx 10" [25.5 cm], ending on an 8th row.
Next row: (RS). Ch 2. 2 hdc in first st. 1 hdc in each hdc to 2 hdc before marked st. 1 trfp around each of next 2 trfp 2 rows below. PM on each of last 2 sts. Skip next 4 hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last st. 2 hdc in last st. Turn.
Next row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first st. 1 hdc in each hdc to marked 2 sts. PM on last st. Skip marked 2 sts. 1 hdc in each hdc to last st. 2 hdc in last st. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows, until work along Trfp line measures approx 35" [89 cm], ending on a WS row.
Proceed as follows:
1st row: (RS). Sl st in first st. 1 sc in next st. 1 hdc in each hdc to 2 hdc before marked st. 1 trfp around each of next 2 trfp 2 rows below. PM on each of last 2 sts. Skip next 4 hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 sts. 1 sc in next st. Turn. Leave rem st unworked.
2nd row: Sl st in first st. 1 sc in next st. 1 hdc in each hdc to marked 2 sts. PM on last st. Skip marked 2 sts. 1 hdc in each st to last 2 sts. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. Leave rem st unworked.
Rep last 2 rows until there are no sts left to work. Fasten off.
SECOND HALF OF SCARF (make with Color 2 O’Go)
Beg with F, work as given for First Half.
Sew 2 Halves tog, using flat seam.
TASSELS: Wrap rem yarn around a 6" [15 cm] piece of cardboard 30 times. Tie securely at one end. Cut across other end. Wrap yarn 6 times around tassel 1½" [4 cm] from tied end and fasten securely. Attach 1 Tassel at each end of Scarf.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170 g; 315 yds/288 m)
measurements: Approximately 7” x 80” [18 x 203 cm], excluding pompoms.
instructions:
Note: Wind MC into 6 equal balls for ease of working.
Holding 6 strands of MC together and using finger crochet technique, 
chain 8.
1st row: 1 single crochet in second chain from hook. 1 single crochet in each chain to 
end of chain. Turn. 7 single crochet.
2nd row: Chain 1. 1 single crochet in each single crochet to end of row. Turn. 
Repeat 2nd row until work measures approximately 80” [203 cm] or desired length. 
Fasten off.
Pompom (make 2): Wind A around 4 fingers approximately 150 times. Remove from 
fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round 
shape. Sew one pompom to each end of Scarf.

materials: Caron® Latte Cakes™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 530 yds/485 m) Night Storm (97001) 2 balls or 550 yds/500 m
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume™ crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: Approx 15" [38 cm] wide x 70" [178 cm] long, excluding fringe.
gauge: 11 hdc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• Ch 2 at beginning (beg) of row does not count as half double crochet (hdc).
• To maintain self-striping pattern of yarn, begin 2nd ball at same point of color-change as where 1st ball ends.
Chain (Ch) 46.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 44 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Scarf measures 70" [178 cm]
Fasten off. 
FRINGE
Cut lengths of yarn 20" [51 cm] long. Taking 3 strands together, fold in half and knot into fringe evenly along each end. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Iced Bamboo Crochet Thread Size 3™, 3 balls 3501 Aqua Ice
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Scarf measures 4½” (11 cm) wide x 66” (168 cm) long
gauge: In pattern, 7 dc = 1 ¼” (3 cm); 11 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size needles/hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
First Half
Ch 22.
Row 1 (Right Side): Working in bumps on back of ch, sc in 2nd ch from hook, *sc in next ch, ch 3, skip next 3 chs, (dc, ch 3, dc) in next ch, ch 3, skip next 3 chs, sc in each of next 2 chs; repeat from * across, turn—(7 sc, 4 dc, 6 ch-3 spaces).
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, 7 dc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, skip next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—(3 sc, 14 dc, 4 ch-3 spaces).
Row 3: Ch 6, sc in next 7 dc, ch 5, sc in next 7 dc, (ch 2, tr) in last sc, turn—(14 sc, 2 tr, 1 ch-5 space, 2 ch-2 spaces).
Row 4: Ch 4, dc in first tr, *ch 3, skip next 2 sc, sc in next 3 sc, ch 3, (dc, ch 3, dc) in 3rd ch of ch-5; repeat from * across, ending last repeat with (dc, ch 1, dc) in 4th ch of beginning ch, turn—(6 sc, 6 dc, 5 ch-3 spaces, 2 ch-1 spaces).
Row 5: Ch 3, 3 dc in ch-1 space, *ch 3, skip next sc, sc in next sc, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, 7 dc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * across, ending last repeat with 3 dc in beginning ch-1 space, dc in 3rd ch of beginning ch, turn—(15 dc, 2 sc, 4 ch-3 spaces).
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in first 4 dc, *ch 5, sc in next 7 dc, ch 5, sc in next 3 dc, sc in top of beginning ch, turn—(15 sc, 2 ch-5 spaces).
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, *ch 3, (dc, ch 3, dc) in 3rd ch of next ch-5, ch 3, skip next 2 sc, sc in next 3 sc; repeat from * across, ending with sc in last 2 sc, turn—(7 sc, 4 dc, 6 ch-3 spaces).
Rows 8–89: [Repeat Rows 2–7] 14 times, ending last repeat with Row 5.
Second Half
Row 1: With right side facing and working in opposite side of foundation ch, join yarn with sc in last ch, *sc in next ch, ch 3, skip next 3 chs, (dc, ch 3, dc) in next ch, ch 3, skip next 3 chs, sc in next 2 chs; repeat from * across, turn—(7 sc, 4 dc, 6 ch-3 spaces).
Rows 2–89: Work as for First Half.
Edging
Row 1: Ch 1, with right side facing rotate scarf so long edge is at the top, sc evenly spaced across first long edge. Fasten off. Weave in yarn ends. Join yarn with sc in end of Row 89 and repeat for remaining long edge.

materials: Red Heart® Boutique Unforgettable®: 2 balls 3945 Parrot
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Scarf measures 7 ½” wide x 56” long (19 x 142 cm), without border
gauge: 9 sc = 2 ½” (6.5 cm) in single crochet; 17 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
First Strip
Ch 10.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—9 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 56” (142 cm) from beginning; end with a wrong side row. Fasten off.

Second Strip
Note Ensure that right side of previously made strip is facing when joining current strip.
Ch 10.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 7 ch, work connector sc in last ch and in first sc of Row 1 of previously made strip—8 sc and 1 connector sc.
Row 2: With right side facing, slip st in last sc of Row 2 of previously made strip, turn; with wrong side facing, sc in each sc, turn—9 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first 8 sc, work connector sc in last sc of current row and in first sc of corresponding row of previously made strip—8 sc and 1 connector sc.
Row 4: With right side facing, slip st in last sc of next row of previously made strip, turn; with wrong side facing, sc in each sc, turn—9 sc.
Repeat Rows 3 and 4 until this strip is same length as previously made strip. Fasten off.

Third Strip
Work same as second strip.

Border
With right side facing, join yarn with sc in any sc.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc evenly spaced around, working (sc, ch 2, sc) in each corner; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, turn, *sc in each sc to next ch-2 space, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-2 space; repeat from * 3 times, sc in remaining sc; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, turn, *sc in each sc to next ch-2 space, 3 sc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * 3 times, sc in remaining sc; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.

Finishing
Weave in ends. Lightly steam block, if necessary.

Special Stitch
connector sc = Insert hook in indicated stitch or chain, yo, draw up loop, insert hook into first sc of corresponding row of previously made strip, yo, pull through sc of previously made strip and through both loops on hook.

Special Technique
join with sc = Place a slip knot on hook, insert hook in indicated stitch, yarn over and draw up a loop, yarn over and draw through both loops on hook.

Notes
1. Scarf is worked in 3 strips.
2. Strips are joined together using a join-as-you-go technique.
3. In the second and third strips, the word “turn” appears twice in Rows 2 and 4 and not at all in Rows 1 and 3. Follow these turning directions carefully so the stitching is worked correctly: in Rows 2 and 4, the slip st must be stitched first, then the fabric is turned, then the single crochets are worked across, and the fabric is turned again to begin the next row. The slip st at the beginning of the row is not only a joining stitch; it replaces the customary “ch 1” before the first single crochet.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Holiday Sassy Fabric™: 1 hank 9940 Snowmen
Locking stitch marker or safety pin
measurements: Scarf measures 4” x 42” (10 x 106.5 cm)
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Fold fabric so first hole is placed over 2nd hole, insert hook in hole through both thicknesses, insert hook in next hole and draw top edge through loop on hook (slip knot made), ch 4.
Row 1: Turn, working in front loops only, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—3 slip sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, working in front loops only, slip st in each st, turn.
Repeat Row 2 until at least 5 (but no more than 8) holes remain.
Place last stitch on locking stitch marker or safety pin so stitch doesn’t unravel as you prepare fabric for last row. Trim fabric so that only 5 holes remain. Cutting from outer edge, trim fabric to ¼” (6.4 mm) under last 2 holes, then continue cutting on a curve ending at the bottom edge under the 3rd hole. Remove stitch holder and place loop back on hook.
Last Row: Ch 1, working in front loops only, slip st in each st; insert hook in last hole and pull end tail through loop on hook. Tighten end tail until knot forms.
FINISHING: Weave in end.
SPECIAL STITCHES:
Ch = insert hook from front to back through next hole, draw top edge through loop on hook.
Slip st = insert hook in front loop of indicated chain or stitch and in next hole, draw top edge through chain or stitch and loop on hook.
NOTES:
1. Work into the holes at the top edge of the fabric strip. Always insert hook in hole from front to back of fabric.
2. If you prefer to work from the center of the hank rather than the outer edge, slide the paper band to one end, remove the cardboard, and gently pull out the fabric.
3. Prepare the fabric for stitching by trimming the cut edge in a curve. Begin cutting at the top edge before the first hole and end at the bottom edge below the 2nd hole.
4. Always turn piece clockwise so that working fabric is behind stitches just made.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Pretty in Pink (0722) 1 ball or 185 yds/169 m
Contrast B Dusty Gray (0340) 1 ball or 160 yds/146 m
Contrast C Charcoal (3950) 1 ball or 155 yds/142 m
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: Approx 11 x 96" [28 x 244 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 10 dc and 5 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Stripe Pat 
With A, work 2 rows. With B, work 
2 rows.
With C, work 2 rows. 
These 6 rows form stripe pat
 
SCARF
With A, ch 50.
See diagram on page 2.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from 
hook. 1 dc in next ch. (Ch 3. Sl st 
in next ch. Skip next 3 ch. 1 dc in 
each of next 2 ch) twice. Skip next 
2 ch. Sl st in next ch. Ch 3. 1 dc in 
each of next 2 ch. Skip next 2 ch. 
Sl st in next ch. Ch 3. 1 dc in each of 
next 2 ch. Ch 3. Sl st in next ch. Skip 
next 3 ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. 
Ch 3. Sl st in next ch. Skip next 3 ch. 
(1 dc in each of next 2 ch. Skip next 
2 ch. Sl st in next ch. Ch 3) twice. 
1 dc in each of last 3 ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 
2 dc. *(Ch 3. Sl st in top of next ch 3 
from prev row. 1 dc in each of next 
2 dc) twice. (Sl st in top of next ch 3 
from prev row. Ch 3. 1 dc in each of 
next 2 dc) twice. Rep from * once 
more. 1 dc in top of next ch 3 from 
prev row. Turn.
First 2 rows of Stripe Pat are now 
in place.
Keeping cont of stripe pat, 
rep last row until Scarf measures 
approx 96" [244 cm]., ending after 
2nd row of stripe pat. Fasten off.
Fringe: Cut lengths of A 20" [51 cm] long. 
Taking 2 strands tog, knot into fringe into each st 
at both ends of Scarf. Trim fringe 
evenly.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Sashay Sequins™: 1 ball 1505 Fiji or 1938 Cabernet
measurements: Scarf measures 4½” wide x 36” long (11.4 x 91.4 cm)
gauge: 5 sts = 4.5” (11.4 cm). Gauge is not important to this project.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2013 Coats & Clark
RedHeart.com
Page 1 of 1
Perfect for evening or anytime you want to add a bit of sparkle to your style, this Sashay yarn is dusted with beautiful sequins. It can be crocheted in little time with just one ball. If the instructions seem strange, see our video for a demonstration.

NOTES
Stretch one end of the Sashay open for several inches and lay it flat; place the edge with the sequins along the bottom. Notice that the Sashay yarn is a mesh of holes. You will be working with the top of the mesh (railroad track) and leaving the sequin edge loose to form the ruffle.
Hook a stitch marker under both top loops of the first sc in each row, moving the markers up each side of the scarf as it progresses.
Always turn the work in the same direction at the end of each row.

SCARF
Beginning 6” (15.2 cm) from the raw edge, insert hook through the top of the mesh and pick up a loop. Chain 1, insert and close a stitch marker under both top loops of the ch st, marking the first st.  Ch 5 going into every other hole in the mesh. Turn.

Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, marking the sc with a stitch pin. Sc in next 4 ch, removing the stitch marker at the end of the row. Ch 1, turn.

Row 2: Sc in each sc across, marking 1st sc in row. Ch 1, turn.

Repeat Row 2 to desired length.

FINISHING
At each end of the scarf, trim the yarn to 6” (15.2 cm) and tuck the loose end between the nearest two ruffle layers. Using sewing needle and matching thread, tack the end firmly in place.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 Skein each 929 Bikini A, 722 Pretty n’ Pink B, 256 Carrot C.
RED HEART® “Sport”: 1 Skein each 1 White and 12 Black for eyes.
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Scarf measures 4¾” x 62” including puppets.
gauge: Scarf: 14 sts = 4”; 9 rows = 4” in hdc with larger hook. Puppets: 4 sts = 1”; 5 rows = 1” in sc with larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGES. Use any size hook to obtain the gauges.
instructions:
SCARF
With larger hook and A, ch 9.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 8 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each sc to last sc; 2 sc in last sc; turn – 10 sc.
Rows 4 and 5: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 – 12 sc.
Row 6: Ch 2, 2 hdc in first sc, hdc in each sc to last sc; 2 hdc in last sc; turn – 14 hdc.
Row 7: Ch 2, hdc in each hdc across; turn.
Repeat Row 7 until 46” from beginning.
Next Row: Ch 2, skip first hdc, hdc in next 11 hdc; [yo and draw up a loop in next hdc] twice, yo and draw through all 5 loops on hook – hdc2tog made; turn – 12 hdc.
Next Row: Ch 1, skip first hdc, sc in next 9 hdc; [draw up a loop in next hdc] twice, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook – sc2tog made; turn – 10 sc.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. 
Next Row: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in each sc to last 2 sc; sc2tog – 8 sc. Fasten off.
Edging Rnd: With right side facing and larger hook, join C in any st; ch 1, work sc evenly around entire scarf. Fasten off.

PUPPETS
** Neck and Upper Head/Jaw: With larger hook and B, ch 24; join with a slip st in first ch to form a ring, being careful that ch is not twisted.
Rnd 1: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc), hdc in next 23 ch; join with a slip st in top of ch-2 – 24 sts.
Rnds 2-6: Ch 2, hdc in each hdc around; join.
Head Shaping-Rnd 7: Turn to work on the wrong side; ch 1, sc in first 12 hdc, ch 12, skip next 12 hdc; join with a slip st in first sc to form ring on which to crochet upper head/jaw. Now work in continuous rnds without joining, marking first st as beginning of rnd and moving marker up on each rnd.
Rnd 8: 2 Sc in first sc, sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 5 sc, [2 sc in next ch, sc in next 5 ch] twice – 28 sc.
Rnd 9: [2 Sc in next sc, sc in next 6 sc] 4 times – 32 sc.
Rnd 10: [2 Sc in next sc, sc in next 7 sc] 4 times – 36 sc.
Rnds 11-14: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 15: * [Sc2tog] twice, sc in next 14 sc; repeat from * once more – 32 sc.
Rnd 16: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 17: * [Sc2tog] twice, sc in next 12 sts; repeat from * once more – 28 sc.
Rnd 18: * [Sc2tog] twice, sc in next 10 sc; repeat from * once more – 24 sc.
Rnd 19: [Sc2tog, sc in next 10 sc] twice – 22 sc.
Rnd 20: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 21: [Sc2tog, sc in next 9 sc] twice – 20 sc.
Rnds 22-24: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 25: [Sc2tog, sc in next 8 sc] twice – 18 sc.
Rnd 26: * [Sc2tog] twice, sc in next 5 sc; repeat from * once more – 14 sc.
Shape Nose-Rnd 27: * [Sc2tog] twice, sc in next 3 sc; repeat from * once more changing to C in last sc – 10 sc.
Rnd 28: With C, [sc2tog, sc in next 3 sc] twice – 8 sc.
Rnd 29: [2 Sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc] twice – 10 sc.
Rnd 30: [Sc2tog, sc in next 3 sc] twice – 8 sc. Cut yarn leaving a long tail. Weave yarn through remaining sts to close nose end. Bring needle through nose to point where nose rnds begin and wrap the yarn tightly around the base of the nose several times, fasten securely. Weave in end. This gives the nose definition and prevents the need for stuffing.
NOTE: When working the lower jaw, the “mouth corner” can be found by laying puppet with slit opening facing upwards. Attach yarn to the rightmost stitch and proceed working in continuous rnds as directed. 
Lower Jaw-Rnd 31: With wrong side facing and larger hook, join B in first ch of mouth corner to work in 12 remaining ch-loops of Rnd 7 and 12 remaining hdc of Rnd 6, place marker; sc in each st around – 24 sc.
Rnds 32 and 33: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 34: [Sc2tog, sc in next 10 sc] twice – 22 sc.
Rnds 35-37: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 38: [Sc2tog, sc in next 9 sc] twice – 20 sc.
Rnd 39: [Sc2tog, sc in next 8 sc] twice – 18 sc.
Rnd 40: [Sc2tog, sc in next 7 sc] twice – 16 sc.
Rnds 41-42: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 43: [Sc2tog, sc in next 6 sc] twice – 14 sc.
Rnd 44: [Sc2tog, sc in next 5 sc] twice – 12 sc.
Rnd 45: [Sc2tog, sc in next 4 sc] twice – 10 sc.
Rnd 46: [Sc2tog] 5 times – 5 sc. Fasten off. Weave yarn through remaining sts; draw up firmly; fasten securely. 
Ears (Make 2)-Rnd 1: With larger hook and B, ch 2; working over beginning yarn end work 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook; pull yarn end to close any gap at center.
Rnd 2: [2 Sc in next sc] 5 times – 10 sc.
Rnd 3: [2 Sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc] twice – 12 sc.
Rnd 4: [2 Sc in next sc, sc in next 5 sc] twice – 14 sc.
Rnd 5: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 6: [Sc2tog, sc in next 5 sc] twice – 12 sc.
Rnd 7: [Sc2tog, sc in next 4 sc] twice – 10 sc. Fasten off leaving a 10” tail. Sew ears in place. **
Repeat from ** to ** with C for second puppet, using B for nose.

Eyes (Make 4)-Rnd 1: With smaller hook and white yarn, ch 2; working over beginning yarn end work 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook; pull yarn end to close any gap at center.
Rnd 2: [2 sc in next sc] 4 times – 8 sc.
Rnd 3: [2 Sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc] twice – 10 sc.
Rnd 4: Sc in each sc around – 10 sc.
Rnd 5: [Sc2tog, sc in next 3 sc] twice; slip st in next sc – 8 sc. Fasten off leaving a 10” tail.
Embroider a French knot pupil with black yarn. Sew eyes in place.
Puppet Edging-Rnd 1: With right side facing and larger hook, join A in any st at cuff opening; ch 1, sc in each st around; join with a slip st in first sc – 24 sc.
Rnd 2: [Ch 3, slip st in next sc] 23 times, ch 3, slip st in first slip st. Fasten off.
FINISHING: Lay the scarf flat; place a puppet at either end of the scarf with the opening towards the tapered scarf end and the nose facing away. Insert tapered end of scarf into the puppet opening about 2”; pin scarf to the upper part of the puppet only, (in the “wrist” area if this were a mitten). Sew the top layer of puppet securely with matching yarn to the tapered scarf ends, being careful not to sew the opening closed.

RED HEART® “Super Saver®”, Art. E300, solids – 7oz (198g), 364yd (333m); multis or flecks – 5oz (141g), 244yd (223m)
RED HEART® “Sport”, Art. E289 2.5oz (70g), 165yd (150m)

pattern_name: CROCHET MARLED SLANTED SHELL SUPER SCARF
materials: Caron® Marble Cakes™ (8.5 oz/240 g; 404 yds/369 m) Almond Ginger (21001) 2 balls
Size  U.S. K/10½     [6.5 mm] crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
6" [15 cm] wide piece of cardboard for Tassels
measurements: Approx 9" x 75" [23 cm x 190.5 cm] excluding tassels.
gauge: 10 sc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm] with 2 strands of yarn tog.
instructions:
Note: Scarf is made with 2 strands held tog. To achieve marled effect, use 2 balls of yarn starting at different points of stripe sequence.
Ch 32.
1st row: (RS). (1 sc. Ch 3. 4 dc) in 2nd ch from hook. *Skip next 5 ch. (1 sc. Ch 3. 4 dc) in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 8 (counts as dc and ch-5). (Skip next 4 dc. 1 sc in top of next ch-3. Ch 5) 5 times. Skip next 4 dc. 1 sc in top of last ch 3. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 3. 4 dc) in first sc. [Skip next ch-5 sp. (1 sc. Ch 3. 4 dc) in next sc] 5 times. Skip next 5 ch. 1 sc in 3rd ch of ch 8. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows until work from beg measures 75" [190.5 cm]. Fasten off.
Tassels (make 1 for each corner of Scarf).
Cut a piece of cardboard 6" [15 cm] wide. Wind yarn around cardboard 60 times. Break yarn leaving a long end and thread end through needle. Slip needle through all loops and tie tightly. Remove cardboard and wind yarn tightly around loops 1" [2.5 cm] below fold. Fasten securely. Cut through rem loops and trim ends evenly.

materials: 2 skeins 3957 Neon Stripes Red Heart® Super Saver®
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6 mm [US J-10]
Extra hooks in neighboring sizes (see notes)
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Scarf measures 10 x 72" (25.5 x 183 cm).
gauge: 4 Vsts = 4" (10 cm); 5½ rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions: Beginning with black in the yarn color repeat, ch through at least one full color sequence, with the last loop on hook being the first loop of a new color (not black) just after a color change in the yarn. Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 5 with new color, dc in 6th ch from hook (counts as 1 Vst), [skip 3 ch, Vst in next ch] 9 times, leave remaining ch sts unworked, turn – 9 color Vsts, 1 black Vst, 10 Vsts total. Row 2: Ch 5, dc in ch-2 sp of first Vst (counts as 1 Vst now and throughout), Vst in each Vst across, turn – 8 black Vsts, 2 color Vsts, 10 Vsts total. Rows 3-99: Ch 5, dc in ch-2 sp of first Vst, Vst in each Vst across, turn. Fasten off. FINISHING: Unravel unused foundation ch sts and weave in all ends. Fringes: Attach 10 fringes at each short edge of scarf as follows: Cut 3 strands of yarn, 12" (30.5 cm) each. Fold strands at center. Use hook to pull center of strands through edge st, then pull ends of strands through the resulting loop and pull tight.

materials: Red Heart® Heat Wave™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 198 yds/181 m) Main Color (MC) Passport (0410) 4 balls
Size U.S. K/101/2 (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Fch = Foundation chain (underside of foundation double crochet row)
Fdc = (Foundation double crochet) - Ch 3 (counts as first st)
Trfp = (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work inserting hook from right to left
measurements: Approx 10” x 74” [25.5 x 188 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 11 sts and 10 rows = 4” [10 cm] in main st pat.
instructions:
Notes:
• Ch 3 at beg of rows counts as dc throughout. 
• Always skip sc above any dc that a trfp is worked around. 
• To join new color, work to last loops on hook of first color. Yoh with new color, draw through loops and proceed with new color.
1st row:  (RS).  With MC, fdc 27. Turn. 27 sts. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 3. *1 trfp around dc below next sc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 
4th row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each st across. Turn. 
5th row:  Ch 3. 1 dc in next sc. *1 trfp around dc below next sc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * until 1 st rem. 1 dc in last st. Turn. 
Rep 2nd to 5th rows for pat until work from beg measures approx 73” [185.5 cm], ending on a 5th row. Do not turn.
Edging
1st rnd: Ch 1. *Work in sc evenly along side of scarf to corner. Ch 2. 1 sc in first st of fch. **Ch 1. Skip next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from ** to corner. Ch 2. Rep from * once more. Ch 2. Join to first st of edging with sl st. Fasten off. 
Pockets (make 2)
1st row: (RS). With MC, fdc 23. Join A. Turn. 23 sts. 
2nd row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each st across. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 3. *1 trfp around dc below next sc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end. Join MC. Turn. 
4th row:  With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each st across. Turn. 
5th row:  Ch 3. 1 dc in next sc. *1 trfp around dc below next sc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * until 1 st rem. 1 dc in last st. Join A. Turn. 
Rep 2nd to 5th rows for pat until work from beg measures approx 8.5" [21.5 cm]. Do not turn. 
Pocket Edging 
1st rnd:  With MC, ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around square, working a ch-2 at each corner. Join to first st of edging with sl st. Fasten off. 
Assembly and Finishing:
Sew pockets to scarf using MC, at desired height or approximately 2" [5 cm] from the ends. 
Cut 90 pieces of MC, and 60 pieces of A, each measuring 12” [30.5 cm] long. Taking 3 strands of MC and 2 strands of A tog, fold in half and knot into fringe in each ch-1 and ch-2 sp at both ends of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique™ Unforgettable™: 1 ball each 3950 Petunia A, and 3960 Tidal B.
abbreviations: A, and B = color A and color B
measurements: Scarf measures 65” long and 7½” wide.
gauge: 18 sts = 4” in half double crochet (hdc). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCARF
With A, ch 35.
Row 1: Hdc in 3rd ch from hook (beginning ch counts as first hdc) and in each ch across, turn—34 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each hdc across; change to B in last sc, turn.
Row 3: With B, ch 2 (counts as first hdc), hdc in each sc across, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each hdc across; change to A in last sc, turn.
Repeat Rows 3 and 4, alternately working 2 rows with A and 2 rows with B, until piece measures about 62”; change to B in last st of last row.
Ruffle
Row 1: With B, *ch 3, skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * across, turn—17 ch-3 spaces.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), 5 dc in first ch-3 space, 6 dc in each remaining ch-3 space across; change to A in last sc, turn—102 sts.
Row 3: With A, ch 3, dc in each dc across, turn.
Row 4: *Ch 3, skip next dc, sc in next dc; repeat from * across. Fasten off.
Working across opposite side of foundation ch, draw up a loop of B in first ch, repeat Rows 1–4 to work ruffle across other end of scarf. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Side Edging: Draw up a loop of B at beginning of one side edge (not including side edge of ruffle), ch 1, work 2 sc in end of each hdc row, and 1 sc in end of each sc row across side edge. Fasten off. Repeat side edging across other side edge. Weave in ends. Block lightly, if desired.

materials: Bernat® Pop!™ (5 oz/140 g; 280 yds/256 m) Gold Rush River (84006) 2 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 60" [152.5 cm] long x 15" [38 cm] wide (at widest point).
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc.
Ch 4.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). Turn.
2nd row:  Ch 3. 2 dc in next dc. Turn. 3 dc.
3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn. 4 dc.
4th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in last dc. Turn. 5 dc.
5th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc each dc to end of row. Turn. 6 dc.
6th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to last dc. 2 dc in last dc. Turn. 7 dc.
Rep last 2 rows, inc 1 dc every row until work measures approx 30" [76 cm] along straight side edge.
Beg decs: 1st row:  Ch 3 (counts as dc) 1 dc in each dc to last 2 dc. Dc2tog. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. Yoh and draw up a loop in next hook. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice – beg dc2tog made. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows, dec 1 st every row to 2 dc.
Next row: Beg dc2tog. Fasten off.
Tassels (make 2)
Cut a piece of cardboard 8" [20.5 cm]. Wind yarn around cardboard 30 times. Break yarn leaving a long end and thread end through needle. Slip needle through all loops and tie tightly. Remove cardboard and wind yarn tightly around loops ¾" [2 cm] below fold. Fasten securely. Cut through rem loops and trim end evenly. Sew Tassels to either end of Kerchief.

materials: RED HEART® SOFT®: 1 ball 9870 Deep Sea
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.5mm [US K-10 ½]
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: 5” (12.7 cm) wide by 59¼” (150.5 cm) long.
gauge: 12 sts = 5” (12.5 cm); 9 rows = 8” (20.5 cm) in pattern.
instructions:
Ch 14.
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook and each ch across—12 dc.
Row 2: Work Row 1 for Broomstick Lace, slide all loops off hook—12 loops on needle.
Row 3: Work Row 2 for Broomstick lace inserting hook in first 2 loops, ch 3, dc in same set of loops, *2 dc in next set of 2 loops; repeat from * across—12 dc.
Row 4: Repeat Row 2.
Row 5: Work Row 2 for Broomstick lace inserting hook in first 3 loops, ch 3, 2 dc in same set of loops, *3 dc in next set of 3 loops; repeat from * across—12 dc.
Row 6: Repeat Row 2.
Row 7: Work Row 2 for Broomstick lace inserting hook in first 4 loops, ch 3, 3 dc in same set of loops, *4 dc in next set of loops; repeat from * across—12 dc.
Row 8: Repeat Row 2.
Row 9: Work Row 2 for Broomstick lace inserting hook in first 6 loops, ch 3, 5 dc in same set of loops, 6 dc in next set of loops—12 dc.
Rows 10–65: Repeat Rows 2–9 seven times.
Rows 66–67: Repeat Rows 2–3 once more.
FIRST SIDE EDGING
Row 1: Pivot to work across log edge of scarf, work 2 sc in each row end across, turn—134 dc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, loosely slip st in each st across. Fasten off.
SPECIAL TECHNIQUE
Broomstick Lace
Broomstick Lace is worked with the right side facing at all times. Do not turn work at the beginning of Broomstick Lace rows. Broomstick Lace is made in two passes. In the first pass, loops are picked up across a row of crochet and placed on the needle. In the second pass, the loops are grouped and worked off of the needle.
Row 1 (first pass – pick up loops): Holding needle in left hand, place last loop of last st on needle. Working from left to right, *insert hook in next st, pull up a loop, place on needle; rep from * across.
Row 2 (second pass – work off loops): Insert hook in number of loops indicated, holding loops together as one, yarn over and loosely pull up a loop, ch 3, (counts as first dc), work number of dc indicated in same set of loops; *inserting hook in next group of loops as indicated, work number of dc indicated in same set of loops; repeat from * across.
NOTE
Scarf is worked with right side facing at all times, do not turn between rows.
SECOND SIDE EDGING
Row 1: Working in row ends of opposite side, join yarn with sc in row-end st of Row 1, sc in same sp, 2 sc in each row-end st across, turn—134 dc.
Rows 2–3: Repeat Rows 2–3 of First Side Edging. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Lightly block if desired.

materials: Caron® x Pantone™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 127 yds/116 m)
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 8" x 80" [20.5 x 203.5 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 12 sts and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Notes: 
• Before working with Caron® 
x Pantone™ multi-shade yarn 
braid, separate each color link 
and wind into 5 separate balls 
for each braid. 
• Due to a finite amount of yarn 
in each shade, pattern gauge 
must be matched to ensure 
successful results.
• To join new color, work to last 
loops on hook of first color. 
Yoh with new color, draw 
through loops and proceed 
with new color.
With MC, ch 24.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from 
hook. *Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc 
in next ch. Rep from * to end of 
chain. Turn. 23 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc.  
1 sc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip 
next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep 
from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. 
Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. 
Skip next sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 
Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to 
last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for pat until MC 
section measures 4" [10 cm], 
ending on a WS row.
Join color of choice from Contrast 
A braid. Cont in pat until work 
from color change measures 12" 
[30.5 cm], ending on a WS row. 
Join MC.
Work from ** to ** 4 times more. 
Fasten off.
Fringe: Using rem yarn 
from Contrast A braid, 
cut strands of yarn 16"  
[40.5 cm] long. Taking 3 strands 
tog, fold in half and knot into 
fringe across ends of Scarf. Trim 
fringe evenly.
Fringe: Cut yarn 10 to 14 ins [25.5 to 35.5 cm] long. Taking 2 or 3 strands together for each 
fringe knot into fringe across cast on and cast oﬀ edges. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Red Heart® Hygge Fur™ (7 oz/200 g; 260 yds/238 m) Sangria (0913) 2 balls
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 7" [18 cm] wide x 50" [127 cm] long.
gauge: 12 hdc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Notes:
• Wear this modern tippet around your shoulders as is, or classically folded over and pinned with a chic brooch!
• Tippet is worked as a long tube for a double layer thickness. It is worked in a continuous round with right sides facing out.
TIPPET
Ch 23.
Round 1: Hdc in second ch from hook and in next 21 ch; rotate work, hdc in bottom of the same 22 ch – 44 hdc.
Round 2: Hdc in first hdc of previous round (working in a continuous round without joining) and in each hdc around – 44 hdc.
Repeat Round 2 until piece measures 50" (127 cm) or desired length. Slip st in last st of final round. 
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Lay tippet flat. With a 10"- (25.5 cm) length of yarn and yarn needle, whipstitch raw end together to close tube. Weave in all ends.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball 9251 Coral A
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Scarf measures 6” wide x 85” long (15 x 216 cm).
gauge: 12 sc = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With A, ch 256.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; change to B, turn—255 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across; change to C, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each st across; change to D, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each st across; change to A, turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each st across; change to B, turn.
Row 6: Ch 4 (counts as first tr here and throughout), skip first sc, tr in next sc, working in front of tr just made, tr in skipped sc, *skip next sc, tr in next sc, working in front of tr just made, tr in skipped sc; repeat from * across to last sc, tr in last st, turn.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in each st across to beginning ch, sc in top of beginning ch; change to C, turn.
Rows 8 and 9: Repeat Rows 6 and 7; change to D at end of Row 9.
Rows 10 and 11: Repeat Rows 6 and 7; change to A at end of Row 11.
Rows 12 and 13: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 14: Ch 1, sc in each st across; change to B, turn.
Rows 15 and 16: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Fringe
Cut as many 12” (30.5 cm) strands as needed for a total of 6 strands of fringe (including beginning and ending tails) in each color at each end. Fold strands in half to form a loop. Insert crochet hook from right side through same end of row as beginning or ending tail. Matching color of tail, place fold on hook and draw fold through, forming a loop. Thread ends of strands through loop and pull to tighten. Repeat to attach matching fringe in end of each row with beginning or ending tail. Trim ends evenly.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball 3720 Lavender A.
RED HEART® Boutique Sassy Fabric™: 1 ball 9957 Purple Panther B.
abbreviations: A and B = Color A, and Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Scarf measures about 5” (12.5cm) wide and 58” (147.5 cm) long
gauge: 4 sts = 4” (10 cm) in sassy-dc (sassy double crochet). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCARF
Row 1
1. Trim B as close to first hole as possible without cutting the hole.
